service.name: actors.granted

element.name: relationship
element.description: The relationship of the role. 'direct' means directly granted. 'indirect' means directly granted or granted via some other role. Defaults to 'direct'. 'indirect' searching is slower.

element.name: role

attribute.name: type

element.name: type
element.description: A filter for actor type, if any. If specified, will only return actors of this type.

service.name: adesktop.model.layout.get
service.description: Find the most appropriate layout for the given instance, device and activity.

element.name: activity
element.description: An optional activity name, if not specified the default layout or first available layout will be provided

element.name: device
element.description: An optional device name, if not specified the default layout or first available layout will be provided

element.name: entity
element.description: The model entity that the layout is for. Either :root true or a model entity must be specified.

element.name: for-create
element.description: Return the creation layout

element.name: model
element.description: The model that the layout is for.

element.name: name
element.description: The layout must have this name.

element.name: root
element.description: Return the root layout

element.name: where
element.description: A where clause, which together activity and device can be used to locate a layout. If multple matching layouts exist one will be returned.

service.name: application.licence.add
service.description: Creates/installs the given licence that was generated using the service 'application.licence.generate'.

element.name: licence
element.description: The licence generated by 'application.licence.generate'

service.name: application.licence.generate
service.description: Generate an application licence. An application licence can be installed into a server by an application, including a plugin package, using the service 'application.licence.create'. In order to use a licence, a matching licence key must also be provided using the service 'application.licence.key.install'.

element.name: app
element.description: The (unique) application name for this licence.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for this licence.

element.name: pass
element.description: A secret key for the licence. Choose a secure key to stop others generating licences for your application.

service.name: application.property.describe

element.name: name

attribute.name: ifexists
attribute.description: If true, then no error will be thrown if not found. Defaults to false.

service.name: application.property.exists

service.name: archive.content.list

element.description: The optional format of the archive. If not supplied an attempt will be made to derived the format from the file stream or file extension.

element.name: idx

element.name: size

service.name: asset.accumulator.compute
service.description: Compute the value of one or more accumulators for a given set of assets. This is used for testing accumulators.

element.name: accumulator
element.description: An accumulator to compute.

element.name: group-by
element.description: An arbitrary XPath to group the values by.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the accumulator. If not specified, defaults to the 'type'.

element.name: predicate
element.description: A boolean function to be applied to the asset in order for this accumulator to apply.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the accumulator.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The XPath for the values to be computed (for accumulators based on XPath).

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified namespace, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the namespace - it will simply walk down the namespace tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' for AQL and namespace()>='/' for FAQL - that is, all assets. If there is more than one where clause, then the second and subsequent clauses are evaluated (linearly) against the result set of the first where clause (a post filter).

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

service.name: asset.accumulator.type.describe
service.description: Describes the types accumulators.

element.name: type
element.description: If specified, then describe only these named accumulator types. If not specified, then all accumulator types are described.

service.name: asset.accumulator.type.list
service.description: Returns a list of the the types accumulators.

service.name: asset.acl.describe
service.description: Describes the access control on one or more assets.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.acl.grant
service.description: Grants the specified access one or more assets.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for an asset.

element.name: access
element.description: The type of access to grant to both metadata and content. If not specified, must specify one or both of 'metadata' and/or 'content'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: The type of access to grant to the asset itself.

element.name: content
element.description: The type of access to grant to content. Ignored if 'access' specified. Defaults to the asset namespace / asset collection default.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The type of access to grant to metadata. Ignored if 'access' specified. Defaults to the asset namespace / asset collection default.

element.name: propagate
element.description: Propagate this ACL to related assets when created? Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then specified inside 'acl'.

element.name: related
element.description: Indicates whether related assets should also have the same ACLs applied - if so, then only primary (non-inverse) relationships will be followed. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.acl.have
service.description: Test whether access is granted to the given asset.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to check for access. If not specified, then checks the caller's access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: content
element.description: The type of access to check for content. If unspecified, defaults to 'read'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The type of access to check for metadata. If unspecified, defaults to 'read'.

service.name: asset.acl.inherit.get
service.description: Retrieves the inherit ACL value for the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.acl.inherit.set
service.description: Sets whether ACLs for the specified asset/collection should inherit their parents ACLs when determining an actor's access. By default all assets/collections inherit ACLs from their parents.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: inherit-acls
element.description: Determines if the asset or collection asset inherits ACLs from its parent namespace or parent collection. If set to true actor's maximal access will be determined by merging asset's ACL with parent's ACL, i.e. if asset's ACL allows read, but parent's ACL allows modify, actor will have modify access.If set to only-if-no-acls parent's ACL will only be checked if the asset has no ACL.If set to false parent's ACL will never be checked.

service.name: asset.acl.invalid.remove
service.description: Removes access control list entries that refer to a non-existent actor.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.acl.private.add
service.description: Adds an ACL to make the asset private for the owner or caller.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.acl.private.remove
service.description: Removes an ACL that made the asset private for the owner or caller.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.acl.propagate.set
service.description: Change the propagation status of the ACLs on an asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: propagate
element.description: Indicates whether assets that are related will inherit the same ACLs.

service.name: asset.acl.remove
service.description: Removes the access control list from the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.acl.revoke
service.description: Revokes all access to one or more assets.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for an asset.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to revoke access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then specified inside 'acl'.

element.name: related
element.description: Indicates whether related assets should also have the same ACLs revoked - if so, then only primary (non-inverse) relationships will be followed. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.acl.set
service.description: Sets specified access on an asset and, optionally, related assets. If there are already ACL entries for the asset(s) then they will be overwritten with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the asset(s). Service can be used to remove all ACLs by not providing any 'acl' arguments.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for an asset.

element.name: access
element.description: The type of access to grant to both metadata and content. If not specified, must specify one or both of 'metadata' and/or 'content'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: The type of access to grant to the asset itself.

element.name: content
element.description: The type of access to grant to content. Ignored if 'access' specified. Defaults to the asset namespace / asset collection default.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The type of access to grant to metadata. Ignored if 'access' specified. Defaults to the asset namespace / asset collection default.

element.name: propagate
element.description: Propagate this ACL to related assets when created? Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then specified inside 'acl'.

element.name: related
element.description: Indicates whether related assets should also have the same ACLs applied - if so, then only primary (non-inverse) relationships will be followed. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-parents
element.description: Include parent assets. Defaults to 'false'.

service.name: asset.application.settings.remove
service.description: Removes associated application settings with the asset.

element.name: app
element.description: The application.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset holding the application settings.

service.name: asset.archive.asset.create
service.description: Creates assets from the contents of an archive. The asset content will be located in the archive. The creation of assets for the contents of an archive means the content is searchable. The namespace hierarchy within the archive will be created. The new assets can be updated as normal, including with new content. May be called many times - an asset will only be created if the path does not already exist.

element.name: analyze
element.description: Controls whether or not to examine the content and automatically extract metadata, provided there is an appropriate content analyzer. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.analyze.default' has been set.

element.name: destroy-existing
element.description: Should any existing children exploded for this source asset be destroyed prior to creating these children. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: expression
element.description: Create assets from files where their path matches the supplied regular expression. If not specified, assets created for all.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: An optional Mime Type to associate with assets created from this match.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate a check-sum. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.check.sum.default' has been set.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: index
element.description: The type of indexing to perform. The default is 'all'. Once indexed (or not), an asset is indexed (or not) for all versions.

element.name: inherit-licences
element.description: Specifies whether created assets inherit licence relationships of the parent asset. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace in which to create the assets. If not specified, then they go into a the same namespace as the archive asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the namespace? Defaults to false.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Controls automatic proxy generation. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.proxy.generation.default' has been set.

element.name: propagate-metadata
element.description: Controls how propagable metadata can be added to the newly created child assets. One of either 'exclude-metadata', 'exclude-metadata-tag', 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' must be supplied. Any resulting document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be able to be added.

element.name: exclude-metadata
element.description: If 'include-metadata' or 'include-metadata-tag' or is not supplied what documents should not be propagated to the newly created assets. Any other document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be added.

element.name: exclude-metadata-tag
element.description: If 'include-metadata' or 'include-metadata-tag' is not supplied document types with the supplied tag should not be propagated to the newly created assets. Any other document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be added.

element.name: include-metadata
element.description: If 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' is not supplied what document types shoud be propagated to the newly created assets. The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE'

element.name: include-metadata-tag
element.description: If 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' is not supplied document types with the supplied tag shoud be propagate to the newly created assets. The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE'

element.name: suffix
element.description: Create assets from files with the given extension. If not specified, assets created for all.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: An optional Mime Type to associate with assets created from this match.

element.name: template
element.description: Specifies trasform template for exploding assets which determines the namespace layout structure for exploded assets. Template will be ignored if its target mime type doesn't match archive's mime type

element.name: where
element.description: A query selecting archive assets to explode into asset.

service.name: asset.archive.asset.destroy
service.description: Destroys assets that were created from the content of this archive.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset id of the archive asset.

service.name: asset.archive.content.analysis
service.description: Generate and retrieve content analysis for a file in an archive.

element.name: detailed
element.description: Retrieve detailed metadata, if any? Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: idx
element.description: The start ordinal position.

element.name: summary
element.description: Retrieve summary metadata? Defaults to true.

service.name: asset.archive.content.checksum.md5.generate
service.description: Computes the MD5 checksum on the content for a given entry within the selected assets archive content.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: idx
element.description: The start ordinal position.

element.name: type
element.description: An optional mime type to configure the arhive format selection.

service.name: asset.archive.content.count
service.description: Returns the total number of files within the archive.

element.name: expression
element.description: An optional filter listing only entries that match the supplied regular expression. If supplied then you can not provide a suffix based filter

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: suffix
element.description: An optional filter listing only entries that match the supplied extension. If supplied then you can not provide an expression based filter.

service.name: asset.archive.content.extract
service.description: Extract one or more entries from an archive. The extracted data is returned as a new archive. If the source archive is an AAR (V3) archive, then the data is not decompressed - it is simply passed through.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: idx
element.description: The start ordinal position.

service.name: asset.archive.content.get
service.description: Return a single file/entry from within an archive.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: idx
element.description: The start ordinal position.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to receive the content for the asset. If the URL is specified, then no content may be passed with the request. The given URL must be accessible by the server. The only supported output URLS are file paths.

attribute.name: create-directories
attribute.description: If set to 'true' then the outpt files parent directories will be created if they don't already exist. Defaults to 'false'

service.name: asset.archive.content.list
service.description: Returns a listing of the contents of an asset archive - asset must be an archive.

element.name: eidx
element.description: The end ordinal position - that is, the position from the end (specify 1 for the last entry in the archive). Ignored if 'idx' specified.

element.name: expression
element.description: An optional filter listing only entries that match the supplied regular expression. If supplied then you can not provide a suffix based filter

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: idx
element.description: The start ordinal position. Defaults to 1.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to list. Defaults to 100.

element.name: suffix
element.description: An optional filter listing only entries that match the supplied extension. If supplied then you can not provide an expression based filter.

service.name: asset.archive.content.validate
service.description: Validates the contents of an archive, by attempting to extract the archive. If the archive supports storing a checksum of the original content (for example an AAR) this will also verify the checksums match.

element.name: id
element.description: The id(s) of the archive asset(s) to validate the contents of.

service.name: asset.archive.create
service.description: Creates an archive containing assets defined by the given query. The archive will contain all of the necessary information to be restored later in this, or another, server.

element.name: clevel
element.description: Level of compression. 0 is uncompressed, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: collection-assets
element.description: Configuration to determine which members of a collection asset (if any) are included by their RID in the Asset XML output for restoration on a destination server.

element.name: describe-queries
element.description: Should dynamic queries within the primary collection be described in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: Should dynamic members of a collection asset included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Any dynamic queries in the collection will be resolved and their resultant assets included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-static-members
element.description: Should static members of a collection asset be included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: Should members of any collection assets within the collection asset hierarchy be resolved and included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets listed in multiple collections are only returned once. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: missing-content-only
element.description: Should the collection only list members with missing remote reference content. This can be used to request content to fulfill assets with remote content references. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: uuid
element.description: If supplied only collection members with this server UUID will be included. Defaults to all members if no UUIDs included.

element.name: compatible-with
element.description: Determines the format version of the archive structure. Allows archives to be created that can be restored on older servers, by setting the compatibility to version '1'. Note that when set to a lower version some limitations are incurred on the data transfered. Defaults to '2', being the most recent version.

element.name: content-restrictions
element.description: Content restrictions allow for archives, including asset replication process, to use rules to selectively determine if the contents full data should be included or if it is included by remote reference. Restrictions only apply to content delivery modes that would result in content being included in the archive (by value, the default) or pulled upon restore (by rid).

element.name: exclude-path
element.description: Assets within this path will have content excluded from the archive

element.name: exclude-tag
element.description: Assets with this tag will have their content excluded within the archive.

element.name: exclude-type
element.description: Asset content with this MIME type will be excluded from the archive.

element.name: include-path
element.description: Only assets within this path will have content included within the archive

element.name: include-tag
element.description: Only Assets with this tag will have their content included within the archive.

element.name: include-type
element.description: Only asset content with this MIME type will be included in the archive

element.name: maximum-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes of content data that will to be included for an asset within the archive. Size may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB. If the assets content exceeds this limit the asset will be added with content by reference. Defaults to 'infinity' to allow content of any size.

element.name: creator
element.description: An arbitrary user/application defined creator information for the archive.

element.name: cref
element.description: If possible, will retrieve a reference to the content rather than the content. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: by
attribute.description: The method reference. If 'url', then the content must be in an external file-system. If 'rid', the restorer must have access to the originating server. If 'ref' a content reference stub is added to the asset and requests for the content by a user are referred to the originating server, the user must have access to the originating server. Defaults to 'url'.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary user/application defined description for the archive.

element.name: file-extension
element.description: If a directory 'url' is supplied, this value will be used as the extension of the filename(s) created. If not supplied, defaults to the extension for the supplied archive 'format'.

element.name: file-name
element.description: If a directory 'url' is supplied, this value will be used as the body of filename(s) created. If not supplied, defaults to 'archive'

element.name: for
element.description: A replication archive is the default format. It allows exchange/movement of assets between systems. However, a 'user' archive can be created that does not contain all the necessary information to replicate assets. Defaults to 'replication'. If set to 'user' then parts defaults to 'content' - metadata can be included by setting parts to 'all'.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of the container used to transmit the data. 'zip' is ZIP format (first implemented in PKZIP). 'tar' is TAR format (.tar) when no compression, or G-Zipped Tar (.tar.gz) when clevel>0. 'aar' is the latest Arcitecta archive format (.aar) with file size limit of 2^63 per file. There are two forms of 'aar': 'aarv2' (single threaded) and 'aarv3' (multi threaded). The default is 'aarv2'.

element.name: generate-statistics
element.description: If true, then the archive will generate statistics on the generated archive, as another output, or as result XML if outputting to a URL. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: An arbitrary user/application defined identifier for the archive.

element.name: include-components
element.description: Should the definitions of an assets components (Document Types, Models, Lables, etc) be archived. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Should assets which have been soft deleted be archived? Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-exploded-assets
element.description: Should assets be included when their content references an entry in another assets archive content. When the asset is restored the content will attempt to locate the source asset by replica id and reconnect the content to the archive entry. If the source asset can not be found, the asset is created with a content stub pointing to the source asset. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-external-content
element.description: Should external (URL) content be included. Defaults to 'true'. Should be set to 'false' if there are relative URLs.

element.name: include-licences
element.description: If set to true, visible licences covering this asset will be included in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-remote-content
element.description: Should remotely referenced content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-version-numbers
element.description: If the archive is for a user, should we include the assets version number in the filename. Defaults to false, unless 'versions' is set to 'all' in which case it defaults to true.

element.name: keep-acls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: locally-modified-only
element.description: By default all assets will be included in the archive. If only those assets that have been modified within this repository should be included, then set to true.

element.name: max-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes for the archive (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). If specified then the archive is guarenteed to be less than or equal to this size. If the assest metadata and optionally content excced this limit then multiple self-contained archives will be generated. This option is only valid where a directory-based 'url' is provided for output. If not specified there is no maximum size to the archive.

element.name: metadata-format
element.description: Specifies which format of the metadata generated in the archive entries. 'terse' output the XML metadata in its native format. 'extended' outputs the XML metadata in an extended self-describing formar. Defaults to 'extended'.

element.name: min-stime
element.description: Minimum server clock time (returned by previous call to archive) - assets modified after this time will be included. Defaults to zero.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to archive. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: post-script
element.description: A script to embed in the archive to be executed on restore after assets have been restored.

element.name: pre-script
element.description: A script to embed in the archive to be executed on restore before any assets restored.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be archived. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-path-prefix
element.description: If the archive is for a user, these prefix strings will be removed from the namespace path of the asset.

element.name: to-asset
element.description: If specified, then the output of the archive should be placed in an asset.

attribute.name: validate-archive
attribute.description: Whether or not to verify the created archive's content is valid. This check is performed by extracting the newly created archives content and then comparing the checksums of the original content and the content of the newly created archive. Defaults to false, don't validate the archive. This check is equivalent to running the created asset through asset.archive.content.validate.

element.name: name
element.description: The name for the asset. If unspecified, then the asset will not have a name.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace of the asset to be created.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to receive the archive output. The given URL must be accessible by the server. The only supported output URLS are file paths. If not url specified, the output returned to caller.

element.name: use-original-name
element.description: Should assets be archived with their original name or the name they currently have after auto-rename due to collection. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: versions
element.description: Archive all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query - all assets matching this query will be archived. If not specified, then all will be archived.

service.name: asset.archive.directory.get
service.description: Returns a hierarchical directory listing of the contents of an asset archive - asset must be an archive. Intermediate directories will be synthesized from the paths.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

service.name: asset.archive.restore
service.description: Restores an archive containing assets. The archive may be restored into the original namespace, or an alternate namespace.

element.name: allow-incomplete-metadata
element.description: Should incomplete metadata be allowed. Defaults to true.

element.name: allow-move
element.description: If set to true, allows a restored asset to be moved from its current namespace if the source namespace is different. Defaults to false.

element.name: analyze-content
element.description: Should content be analyzed to extract metadata. Defaults to false.

element.name: auto-name
element.description: If set to true, will auto-generate a new asset name if the same one already exists but the citeable id is different. Defaults to true.

element.name: check-for-replica
element.description: Indicates whether to check whether there are replicas of this asset on the server. Defaults to true. If true, then will try to match up asset identifiers. If not the same, then will create new assets, unless they have citeable id.

element.name: check-same-server
element.description: Indicates whether to check whether this is the same server based on the identity. Defaults to true. If true and is the same server, then will try to match up asset identifiers. If not the same, then will create new assets, unless they have citeable id.

element.name: comment
element.description: If not keeping the revision history, then this is the revision history comment. Defaults to 'Restoration from archive.'

element.name: create-roles
element.description: If set to true, will automatically create authorization roles that do not exist, but have been placed on an asset ACL. Defaults to true. If false and roles do not exist, then the restoration will fail.

element.name: dst
element.description: The destination namespace to restore into. If not specified, restores into the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If set to true and the namespace does not exist, it will be created. Defaults to false.

element.name: execute-scripts
element.description: Should embedded scripts be executed. Defaults to false.

element.name: file-extension
element.description: If a directory 'url' is supplied, this value must be supplied as part of a multi-part archive restoration. If supplied then 'file-name' must also be supplied. Examples: 'aar', 'zip', 'zear', 'aear'

element.name: file-name
element.description: If a directory 'url' is supplied, this value must be supplied as the basis of a multi-part archive restoration. If supplied then 'file-extension' must also be supplied.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: If the restored metadata does not contain a check-sum, should one be generated? Defaults to true.

element.name: ignore-invalid-acl
element.description: Indicates the behaviour when the specified actor in an ACL cannot be found. Defaults to true. If false and actor does not exist, then the restoration will fail.

element.name: ignore-unknown
element.description: If set to true, restore will ignore unknown archive entries. This offers a backward compatibility move for archives created on a newer version of the server and being restored on an older version which may not support all components. Defaults to false.

element.name: import-cids
element.description: Indicates whether any citeable identifiers should be imported into this name server. Defaults to false. If true, the identifier will be prepended with the root identifier in this server. Typically, set to true when restoring a failed or discontinued repository.

attribute.name: depth
attribute.description: The depth of the root identifier in the orgininating server. If larger than zero, then that prefix will be removed on import.

element.name: keep-acls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: keep-history
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original revision history. If false, will result in new revision history entry. Defaults to false. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to true.

element.name: keep-modtime
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original modification time. If false, the modification time will be set to the current time. Defaults to true.

element.name: keep-version
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original version number (except where the asset already exists, and 'overwrite=false'). If the version already exists, will overwrite. If false, will result in a new version of the asset. Defaults to false. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to true.

element.name: labels
element.description: A set of labels to match when restoring. If specified, then only asset versions with matching labels will be restored.

attribute.name: match
attribute.description: Indicates how the label matching is to occur. Defaults to all - that is, an asset must have all of the labels.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to match. The label type must exist within the server.

element.name: localize-content
element.description: If set to true any local asset with remotely referenced content will localize the content data found in the archive. If set to false the restore will not localize the content or add it to the content cache. This allows for an asset archive containing content to be restored in scenarios were the local server only wishes to participate in federated content retrieval. Defaults to true.

element.name: logging-enabled
element.description: Should archive restore operations be logged to the 'archive.restore' log. Extended logging for each asset restore requires 'debug' logging to be enabled. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: overwrite
element.description: If set to true, will overwrite an existing asset with the same namespace and name. When false and an asset with a different identifier, but with the same path exists, will generate an error. Defaults to false.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should a proxy be generated automatically. Defaults to 'true', unless the server property 'asset.proxy.generation.default' has been set.

element.name: preserve-rid
element.description: Indicates whether to set the replica ID (rid), which indicates the object is a replica. If the version already has a replica ID (from another system) then this is retained, otherwise it is set to the asset id of the source system. Defaults to true. Setting to false will exclude the replica id. Use false if restoring deleted assets from a replica system, that should become the primary asset.

element.name: remove-missing-relationships
element.description: If the destination asset exists and has existing relationships, should any that are missing from the source asset be removed. This includes the removal of all relationships is the source asset being restored has no relationships. This option defaults to 'false' which results in the replication of relationships being cumulative only and preserves any relationships added by the destination server and other sources. This option can be enabled in environments were synchronisation of relationships is required.

element.name: restore-destroyed-asset
element.description: If true, and this is the same server then restore to the same asset (provided that asset does not already exist). Defaults to false.

element.name: restore-from-same-peer
element.description: If the archive is being restored through a chain of peer service executions, and this server originated the request, should the restore be allowed. Defaults to 'false' to stop distributed archive restores from propagating back to the caller.

element.name: restore-mismatched-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is invalid and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: If true, then re-validate the data at the receiving end. If false, the defaut then only compare the incoming length and checksum with the stored checksum.

element.name: restore-missing-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is missing and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: src
element.description: The source namespace to restore. If not specified, all namespaces are restored.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, the target store for restored asset content. If not specified, default to the configured store for the destination.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: If specified, the store policy for restored asset content. If not specified, default to the configured store or policy for the destination.

element.name: txn-size
element.description: Specifies the number of objects restored per transaction. Defaults to 0 (no enclosing transaction). If greater than 1, may significantly improve performance but can cause signficiant transaction delays for other operations if the archive is reading large amounts of data over a network. Larger values improve performance for updates, but hold an update transaction longer, potentially locking out other update operations. Set to 'infinity' for completely atomic operation.

element.name: update-doc-types
element.description: If set to true any document types in the archive will update existing document types in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to the archive, or archives, to restore. The given URL must be accessible by the server. If not specified, the archive must be supplied with the request. If a directory is supplied then the service expects one or more multi-part archives and a 'file-name' and 'file-extension' argument must be supplied. For an multi-part archive restoration from a directory the file format is expected to be '<file-name>(.N).<file-extension>' e.g. 'my-archive.zear', 'my-archive.2.zear', etc

element.name: validate-meta
element.description: Should metadata be validated against current document definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: validate-model
element.description: Should assets be validated against current model definitions. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.attribute.atomic.decrement
service.description: Decrements the value of the specified attribute on an asset. If not set, then will be initialised with the specified value.

element.name: by
element.description: The amount to increment by. Defaults to 1.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: initial
element.description: The initial value, if not already set, to increment from. Defaults to zero.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the attribute

service.name: asset.attribute.atomic.increment
service.description: Increments the value of the specified attribute on an asset. If not set, then will be initialised with the specified value.

element.name: by
element.description: The amount to increment by. Defaults to 1.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: initial
element.description: The initial value, if not already set, to increment from. Defaults to zero.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the attribute

service.name: asset.attribute.describe
service.description: Describes attributes, if any, on the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: prefix
element.description: An optional prefix for filtering.

service.name: asset.attribute.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not the specified named attribute has been set on an asset

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the attribute

service.name: asset.attribute.list
service.description: Returns the list of attributes, if any, on the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: prefix
element.description: An optional prefix for filtering.

service.name: asset.attribute.remove
service.description: Removes a specified attribute(s) from the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the attribute

service.name: asset.attribute.value.get
service.description: Returns the value for the named attribute(s) on the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the attribute

service.name: asset.attribute.value.set
service.description: Sets the value for the named attribute(s) on the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

element.name: value
element.description: The value for the attribute

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the attribute.

service.name: asset.audio.waveform.cache.clear
service.description: Discards all existing waveform images. They will be then regenerated on demand.

service.name: asset.audio.waveform.generate
service.description: Forces the generation of a waveform summary containing the audio waveform for this asset. Waveform images etc. are subsequently generated from this waveforms.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: content-id
element.description: Specific content to retrieve for this asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.audio.waveform.image.generate
service.description: Forces the generation of an image containing the audio waveform for this asset.

element.name: channel
element.description: The channel to render. If not specified, all channels are super-imposed. More than one channel can be specified, in which case individual waveforns for each channel will be generated.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: content-id
element.description: Specific content to retrieve for this asset.

element.name: end
element.description: The end time (in milliseconds) for the waveform. Defaults to infinity (the length of the audio).

element.name: height
element.description: The height in pixels to generate.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: start
element.description: The start time (in milliseconds) for the waveform. Defaults to 0.

element.name: width
element.description: The width in pixels to generate.

service.name: asset.audio.waveform.image.get
service.description: Retrieves an image containing the audio waveform for this asset.

element.name: channel
element.description: The channel to render. If not specified, all channels are super-imposed.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: content-id
element.description: Specific content to retrieve for this asset.

element.name: end
element.description: The end time (in milliseconds) for the waveform. Defaults to infinity (the length of the audio).

element.name: height
element.description: The height in pixels to generate.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: ignore-if-errors
element.description: If true, don't gnerate an error if the audio does not support waveform generation. Defaults to false.

element.name: start
element.description: The start time (in milliseconds) for the waveform. Defaults to 0.

element.name: width
element.description: The width in pixels to generate.

service.name: asset.cache.status
service.description: Returns information about the current state of the asset content cache.

service.name: asset.cached.collection.create
service.description: Creates a named precomputed/cached asset collection. Administer permission is required to create a public collection.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description.

element.name: ifexists
element.description: The behaviour if the collection already exists. Defaults to 'error'. If set to 'ignore' then the query must match, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the collection. Must be unique within the given scope.

element.name: query
element.description: (deprecated - now using 'where' for consistency with other services). If specified, the collection is dynamically populated according to the given asset query.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope of collections to list. Private scopes belong to the user. Defaults to 'private'

element.name: where
element.description: If specified, the collection is dynamically populated according to the given asset query.

service.name: asset.cached.collection.describe
service.description: Describes the names of all collections within a specified scope to which the caller has access.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope of collections to list. Defaults to 'all'.

service.name: asset.cached.collection.destroy
service.description: Destroys an asset collection. Administer permission on the collection is required to destroy a public collection.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the collection. Must be unique within the given scope.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope of collections to list. Private scopes belong to the user. Defaults to 'private'.

service.name: asset.cached.collection.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not the named collection exists in the specified scope.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope of the collection. If not specified, defaults to 'private'.

service.name: asset.cached.collection.list
service.description: Lists the names of all collections within a specified scope.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope of collections to list. Defaults to 'all'.

service.name: asset.cached.collection.remove
service.description: Removes an asset to the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the collection.

element.name: mid
element.description: The asset to add.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the collection. Must be unique within the given scope.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope of collections to list. Private scopes belong to the user. Defaults to 'private'.

service.name: asset.check.sum.generate
service.description: Returns the check sum of the specified asset. If the asset does not exist, then there will be no checksum returned. If the asset does not exist, or does exists but does not have content, then an 'exists' response will be returned. If the asset does not have a checksum then it will be generated and stored with the asset. Returns the checksum.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, displays the status of the latest version.

element.name: if-zero
element.description: If checksum is zero, then force regeneration.

element.name: length
element.description: If specified, then generate and return a checksum only on the given length of data.

element.name: regenerate
element.description: If true, the force the regeneration of the checksum. This should only be used with great care to remedy known checksum issues. This can only be performed by a system administrator.

attribute.name: all
attribute.description: If true, then generate checksums for all versions (ignoring any version or label specification). Defaults to false.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, use this data store for the source content, if available.

service.name: asset.check.sum.get
service.description: Returns the check sum of the specified asset. If the asset does not exist, then there will be no checksum returned. If the asset does not exist, or does exists but does not have a checksum, then an 'exists' response will be returned.

element.name: id
element.description: An asset to retrieve the checksum.

service.name: asset.cid.parent.set
service.description: Allocates a new citeable identifier within the scope of the specified parent identifier for the given asset. If the asset already has a citeable parent, it can be optionally reallocated to this new parent (and the old identifier abandoned). If the asset is already a child of the parent, then this service will no have no effect.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: pcid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the new parent.

element.name: reallocate
element.description: Determines whether or not to reallocate if there is already a cid parent. If false, will generate an error. If true, will remove the existing identifier (if any) and replace with a new identifier allocated by the parent. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.cid.set
service.description: Sets or modifies the citeable identifier for an asset. Use with caution: if an asset already has a parent citeable identifier, the automatic cid allocation system might not function as expected and result in an errors during allocation. Do not use this service unless you fully understand the consequences.

element.name: cid
element.description: The (new) citeable identifier of the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.class.add
service.description: Adds the specified asset to one or more classifications. An asset will only be added if not already added to the classification.

element.name: class

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the class.

element.name: id

element.name: language
element.description: The default language for the scheme and class.

element.name: scheme

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the scheme.

service.name: asset.class.binding.add

element.name: binding
element.description: The alternate language binding for the classification.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the binding.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the binding.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the class.

element.name: class
element.description: The path of a classification.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the class.

element.name: language
element.description: The default language for the scheme and class.

element.name: scheme
element.description: The name of the scheme.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the scheme.

service.name: asset.class.binding.remove
service.description: Removes an alternative language name for a specified class.

element.name: binding
element.description: The alternate language binding for the classification.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the binding.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the class.

element.name: class
element.description: The path of a classification.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The language for the class.

element.name: language

element.description: The path to the collection asset.

element.name: ignore-if-exists
element.description: If, false (the default), then generate an exception if the named accumulator already exists. If true, then ignore.

service.description: Set or replace enqueuing of asset to a processing queue for this collection and all sub-collections.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: enqueue
element.description: A request to enqueue assets based on events to an asset processing queue.

element.name: app-data
element.description: Optional application data that will be passed to the processing service.

element.name: app-key
element.description: An optional correlation key to some configuration that will be passed to the processing service. Where possible, an 'app-key' is preferred to 'app-data' because it is more efficient to store.

element.name: event
element.description: One or more events that will cause the enqueing of the asset. If not specified, defaults to all.

element.name: name
element.description: A unqiue name for the request.

element.name: queue
element.description: The name of an asset processing queue (must exist).

element.name: where
element.description: An optional arbitrary query to determine whether the asset should be enqueued.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

service.name: asset.collection.hierarchy.describe
service.description: Returns an ordered list of entries for each node in the hierarchy for the specified namespace or collection asset from the shallowest node (the root) to the deepest (the specified namespace or asset).

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset to get the hierarchy of.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to get the hierarchy of.

element.name: namespace-id
element.description: The unique identifier for the namespace.

service.name: asset.collection.list
service.description: Returns a list of collections (both namespaces and collection assets) within the given namespace or collection asset (or the root namespace if neither is specified). Can also return assets contained in the collection.

element.name: action
element.description: Indicates the action for the assets, if any. Defaults to 'get-meta'.

element.name: app-settings
element.description: Controls whether to list application properties as well. Default is false.

element.name: assets
element.description: Controls whether non-collection assets should be included in the result. Default is false.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset to list content. If specified, then 'namespace' is ignored.

element.name: idx
element.description: Indicates the cursor position to retrieve. Defaults to 1.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: Whether or not member assets that are resolved dynamically should be included in the result. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-mime-type
element.description: Whether or not the MIME type of collection assets (if they have one) should be included in the results. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to list the contents.

element.name: namespace-collections-only
element.description: If true, then collection assets will not be returned as collections. Defaults to false.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, return only namespaces that start with the provided prefix.

element.name: show-hidden
element.description: Show hidden collections, if any. Defaults to false.

element.name: size
element.description: Indicates the maximum number of results to list. Defaults to 100.

element.name: sort
element.description: The sort order for returned results. The default is 'alpha-asc' - alphanumeric sort, ascending order.

element.name: sort-collection-assets
element.description: Whether or not collection assets should be sorted by name. Setting to 'false' will improve performance when retrieving a large set of collection assets. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: unique-name-index-only
element.description: Whether or not only collection assets with unique name indexes should be included when listing the child collection assets of a namesapce or a collection asset. Defaults to 'false'.

service.name: asset.collection.member.access.time.record.disable
service.description: Disable, if not already, recording of content access time to any member of this collection. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection on which to disable member access time recording.

service.name: asset.collection.member.access.time.record.enable
service.description: Enables, if not already, recording of content access time to any member of this collection to any depth. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection on which to enable member access time recording.

service.name: asset.collection.member.acl.describe
service.description: Describes any configured access controls for the given collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

service.name: asset.collection.member.acl.grant
service.description: Grants access to members within an collection. If there is already a member ACL entry for the actor then it will be updated with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

element.name: member-acl
element.description: Access control list for the assets contained within this collection..

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: Access permissions for non-collection assets within the collection. 'administer' allows the actor to grant/revoke permissions on non-collection members. 'create allows the actor to create non-collection assets. 'access' allows the actor to access (read) a non-collection member asset. 'modify' allows the actor to modify (write) the metadata for a non-collection member. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy non-collection assets (destroy also requires permission to modify the non-collection asset's metadata and content). 'licence' allows the actor to change the licence associated with a non-collection member. One of 'collection' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.name: asset-content
element.description: Content specific access for assets within the collection. This is a refinement of the general asset access. If 'access', then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

element.name: collection
element.description: Access permissions for collection assets within the collection. 'access' means read access (ability to retrieve metadata, etc.) for sub-collections. 'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of any members. 'add-member' allows the actor to add assets to this collection. 'remove-member' allows the actor to remove assets from this collection. 'create' allows the actor to create collections. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy collections (destroy also requires permission to modify the collection asset's metadata and content). 'execute' allows the actor to descend into (POSIX) sub-collections. 'modify' enables the actor to modify the state of a sub-collection. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

service.name: asset.collection.member.acl.override.disable
service.description: Indicates that the ACLs on this collection should not override all ACLs for member assets.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection on which to disable member ACL override.

service.name: asset.collection.member.acl.override.enable
service.description: Indicates that the ACLs on this collection override all ACLs for member assets.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection on which to enable member ACL override.

service.name: asset.collection.member.acl.revoke
service.description: Revoke access to a specified collection for the given actor. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the collection.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

service.name: asset.collection.member.acl.set
service.description: Sets access to the specified collection. If there are already ACL entries for the collection then they will be overwritten with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the collection. Service can be used to remove all ACLs from collection by not providing any 'member-acl' arguments.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

element.name: inherit
element.description: Specifies if the specified collection should inherit ACLs from it's parent. This argument allows the user to change the inheritance at the same time they apply the ACLs, because it may not be possible to do it at a later time if the new ACLs prohibit the user to do so.

element.name: member-acl
element.description: Access control list for the assets contained within this collection..

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: Access permissions for non-collection assets within the collection. 'administer' allows the actor to grant/revoke permissions on non-collection members. 'create allows the actor to create non-collection assets. 'access' allows the actor to access (read) a non-collection member asset. 'modify' allows the actor to modify (write) the metadata for a non-collection member. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy non-collection assets (destroy also requires permission to modify the non-collection asset's metadata and content). 'licence' allows the actor to change the licence associated with a non-collection member. One of 'collection' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.name: asset-content
element.description: Content specific access for assets within the collection. This is a refinement of the general asset access. If 'access', then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

element.name: collection
element.description: Access permissions for collection assets within the collection. 'access' means read access (ability to retrieve metadata, etc.) for sub-collections. 'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of any members. 'add-member' allows the actor to add assets to this collection. 'remove-member' allows the actor to remove assets from this collection. 'create' allows the actor to create collections. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy collections (destroy also requires permission to modify the collection asset's metadata and content). 'execute' allows the actor to descend into (POSIX) sub-collections. 'modify' enables the actor to modify the state of a sub-collection. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: override-member-acls
element.description: If set to true, then override all member ACLs. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.collection.member.asset.meta.add
service.description: Adds a metadata fragment to the collection that will be applied to assets created within the collection. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: member-asset-meta
element.description: For collections specifies metadata to be automatically inherited by or propagated to member assets. Inheritance or propagation are controlled by the documents ability to be in inherted or propagated.

attribute.name: inherit
attribute.description: Document types tagged as INHERITABLE will propagate by default. Inheritable fragments will not exist on the asset themselves and cannot be edited within the asset, but will be combined with any metadata the asset has when viewed. Inherited metadata fragments as marked as being 'inherited'. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable inheritance for these fragments for each supplied document type.

attribute.name: propagate
attribute.description: Document types tagged as PROPAGABLE will propagate by default. Propagable fragments will be added to the metadata of any asset created within this namespace. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable propagation for these fragments for each supplied document type.

service.name: asset.collection.member.asset.meta.all.remove
service.description: Removes all metadata framgments from the collection. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.description: The asset.

element.description: The asset.

service.description: Sets whether the collection should inherit member asset metadata from its parent collection or namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: inherit
element.description: Whether the collection should inherit member asset metadata from its parent collection or namespace.

service.name: asset.collection.member.asset.meta.remove
