element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: inherit-member-asset-meta
element.description: Inherit asset metadata from parent collection asset(s) and namespace(s). Setting to 'false' will stop an asset witin the collection hierarchy from obtaining any inherited or propagated asset metadata from collections or namespaces above this.

element.name: member-asset-meta
element.description: For collections specifies metadata to be automatically inherited by or propagated to member assets. Inheritance or propagation are controlled by the documents ability to be in inherted or propagated.

attribute.name: inherit
attribute.description: Document types tagged as INHERITABLE will propagate by default. Inheritable fragments will not exist on the asset themselves and cannot be edited within the asset, but will be combined with any metadata the asset has when viewed. Inherited metadata fragments as marked as being 'inherited'. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable inheritance for these fragments for each supplied document type.

attribute.name: propagate
attribute.description: Document types tagged as PROPAGABLE will propagate by default. Propagable fragments will be added to the metadata of any asset created within this namespace. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable propagation for these fragments for each supplied document type.

service.name: asset.collection.member.id
service.description: Returns the identity of the named asset within the specified collection (id) if the named asset exists. If not found, returns nothing.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a member.

service.name: asset.collection.member.meta.acl.check
service.description: Checks access to metadata documents while within the specified collection or its parents.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: type
element.description: The metadata document to check.

service.name: asset.collection.member.meta.acl.script.create
service.description: Produces a Tcl script documenting metadata access controls for the given collection asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: recursive
element.description: Should descendant collections be documented. Defaults to 'false'.

service.name: asset.collection.member.meta.acl.set
service.description: Sets access to metadata documents for members of the specified collection asset. If there are already ACL entries for Metadata on the collection then they will be overwritten with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: member-meta-acl
element.description: For collections specifies access control list for metadata on member assets.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the document type.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: document
element.description: The type of access to grant to the metadata document. The absence of any access denotes no access. 'create' plus 'modify' is equivalent to 'publish'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: type
element.description: The fully qualified document type the ACL applies to.

service.name: asset.collection.member.name.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not the given asset contains the named member.

element.name: case-sensitive
element.description: If true, then the name must match precisely. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If true, then include destroyed assets. Defaults to false.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the member.

service.name: asset.collection.member.names
service.description: Returns a list of names for asset that are members of this collection. Does not include assets without a name.

element.name: after
element.description: Return members with an asset identifier after this identifier. Defaults to zero.

element.name: count
element.description: If true, count the number of matching entries. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If true, then find all of the names and assets that have ever existed in this collection. Defaults to false.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: If specified, then export assets as they were at the specified point in time. Default to 'now'.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, only list names starting with the given prefix.

element.name: show-modifier
element.description: If true, then display information in who changed and by what vector. Defaults to false.

element.name: show-name-history
element.description: If true, then display the name history for each member. Defaults to false.

element.name: show-version-changes
element.description: If true, then display the version numbers for each member along with the time they were created. Defaults to false.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number to return. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.collection.member.names.diff
service.description: Lists members that exist in the supplied set of names and not in the asset collection and visa versa.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a member.

service.name: asset.collection.member.template.add
service.description: Adds a metadata template to apply to collection members. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

element.name: member-template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? This collection only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

service.name: asset.collection.member.template.inherit.set
service.description: Sets whether the collection should inherit member templates from its parent collection or namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset.

element.name: inherit
element.description: Whether the collection should inherit member templates from its parent collection or namespace.

service.name: asset.collection.member.template.metadata.generate
service.description: Generates metadata templates, if any, for assets to be created in collection.

element.name: for
element.description: The target of the templates. If 'asset', then will generate templates for assets that are members of this collection. If 'collection', then will generate templates for all metadata attached to this collection. Defaults to 'asset'.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the asset.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type to generate. If not specified, generates all.

service.name: asset.collection.member.template.remove
service.description: Removes all metadata templates to apply to collection members. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

service.name: asset.collection.member.template.set
service.description: Sets the metadata template to the apply to the members of the collection, overriding any exitsing templates. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

element.name: inherit-templates
element.description: Inherit templates from parent collectons(s) and namespace(s).

element.name: member-template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? This collection only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

service.name: asset.collection.members
service.description: Lists members of a Collection Asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: count
element.description: If set, returns the number of matches in the set.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: idx
element.description: Absolute cursor position in list of ids. If used, the cursor will be positioned starting at 'idx'. Defaults to 1.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If set, includes members that have been destroyed. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: If set, includes members of dynamic queries within the collections. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: If set, includes members of collection members. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: size
element.description: Number of ids to return. Defaults to 100

service.name: asset.collection.members.count
service.description: Returns the count of members within a Collection Asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If true, then find all of the names and assets that have ever existed in this collection. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: If set, includes members of dynamic queries within the collections. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: If set, includes members of collection members. Defaults to 'false'

service.name: asset.collection.members.destroy
service.description: Destroys the members of this collection. The destruction will be hard or soft depending on the current default for asset destruction (a server property).

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: imc
element.description: Ignore missing content? Defaults to false - an error will be thrown if the content cannot be accessed and destroyed.

service.name: asset.collection.members.diff
service.description: Lists members that exist in the first Collection Asset but not in the second.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: sid
element.description: The identity of an collection asset to compare against.

service.name: asset.collection.members.hard.destroy
service.description: Hard destroys the members of this collection.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: imc
element.description: Ignore missing content? Defaults to false - an error will be thrown if the content cannot be accessed and destroyed.

service.name: asset.collection.members.soft.destroy
service.description: Marks the members as soft-destroyed.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

service.name: asset.collection.metadata.inheritance.remove
service.description: Removes the metadata inheretance rules of this collection asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

service.name: asset.collection.metadata.inheritance.set
service.description: Defines the rules by which children of this collection asset may inherit metadata.

element.name: collection-metadata-inheritance
element.description: For collection asset, these rules define how any child assets within the collection asset may inherit metadata from their parents within the hierarchy. When a child asset is accessed through services like asset.get, an asset with a primary parent locate these rules and apply them by inheriting the selected metadata fragments from its parental hierarchy. Child assets will use the first set of rule found in its parental hierarchy.

element.name: asset
element.description: A query selecting members for this asset collection. The default behaviour will see the query evaluated each time the asset collection members are resolved. If the 'static' attribute is enabled the query is resolved immediately and the resulting assets added as static members.

attribute.name: method
attribute.description: The MIME type defining which assets the rules relate to. 'match' requires an exact match to the mime type, 'prefix' requires on a match to the beginning of the mime type and 'all' matches all mime types. Defaults to 'match'

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The MIME type defining which assets the rules relate to.

element.name: parent
element.description: A query selecting members for this asset collection. The default behaviour will see the query evaluated each time the asset collection members are resolved. If the 'static' attribute is enabled the query is resolved immediately and the resulting assets added as static members.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The MIME type defining which assets the metadata fragment should be inherited from.

element.name: document
element.description: The name of the metadata document to inherit from parent assets with this type..

element.name: reset
element.description: Removes all inherited metadata rules. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

service.name: asset.collection.name.index.create
service.description: Enables, if not already, a unique name index for this collection. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection on which to create the name index.

service.name: asset.collection.name.index.destroy
service.description: Disables, if not already, a unique name index for this collection. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection on which to destroy the name index.

service.name: asset.collection.named.member.get
service.description: Returns the named member from within a specified collection.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a member to resolve.

service.name: asset.collection.named.member.identifier.get
service.description: Returns a list of names for asset that are members of this collection. Does not include assets without a name.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: ignore-not-found
element.description: If true, then don't throw an error if not found.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the member(s).

service.name: asset.collection.named.members.soft.destroy
service.description: Soft destroys members by name. If no members are specified, then all sub-members are soft-destroyed. If 'include' is specified, then only those members are destroyed. If 'exclude' is specified, then all members except those specified are soft-destroyed.

element.name: exclude
element.description: The name of a member explicitly exclude from destruction.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an collection asset.

element.name: include
element.description: The name of a member to explicity include for destruction.

service.name: asset.collection.queries.add
service.description: Adds a dynamic query to the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: create
element.description: If the asset is not already a collection then should one be created. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: name
element.description: A name to identify the query to human users.

element.name: query
element.description: A query to be added to the collection. This will be dynamically evaluated when selecting the members of the collection.

service.name: asset.collection.queries.remove
service.description: Removes a dynamic collection member query from the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: qid
element.description: The id of the query to remove from this collection.

service.name: asset.collection.queries.remove.all
service.description: Removes all dynamic collection member queries on the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: qid
element.description: The id of the query to remove from this collection.

service.name: asset.collection.queries.set
service.description: Adds a dynamic query to the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: name
element.description: A name to identify the query to human users.

element.name: qid
element.description: The id of the query to update.

element.name: query
element.description: The query to be used. This will be dynamically evaluated when selecting the members of the collection.

service.name: asset.collection.quota.allocation.set
service.description: Change the allocation for an existing quota. Caller must have administrative rights on the collection to change a quota.

element.name: allocation
element.description: The quota in bytes (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). (If not specified the quota defaults to 9223372036854775807.)

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

service.name: asset.collection.quota.remove
service.description: Remove a storage quota from a collection assset. Caller must have administrative rights on collection to change a quota.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

service.name: asset.collection.quota.set
service.description: Add or replace a storage quota on a collection. Caller must have administrative rights on collection to change a quota.

element.name: batchsize
element.description: The transaction batchsize (defaults to 1000). This only applies if the quota needs to created.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of an asset.

element.name: quota
element.description: A space quota to add to the collection. The quota applies to all content in the collection (irrespective of backing store) all descendent collections.

element.name: allocation
element.description: The quota in bytes (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). (If not specified the quota defaults to 9223372036854775807.)

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for quota.

element.name: on-overflow
element.description: What should occur if use exceeds the quota? Defaults to fail

element.name: owner
element.description: User that manages/owns this quota. Can be contacted changes to the quota

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: trigger
element.description: Describes a relative use threshold an action that should occur when the threshold is crossed.

element.name: direction
element.description: Determines whether the action is triggered when use increases past the threshold or when use drop belose the threshold (default is increase)

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute then the event is triggered. This is an inline script that will be passed the following arguments: collection,allocation,used,threshold,direction=above|below.

element.name: threshold
element.description: The relative use of the quota (0=empty, 0.5=50%, 1=full)

element.name: replace
element.description: Replace an existing quota. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.collection.remove
service.description: Removes an asset to the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: destroy-member-if-no-parent
element.description: If true and the member has no parent (not in a collection), then it will be destroyed. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: ignore-errors
element.description: Should the service raise exceptions if asset is not a collection, member assets don't exist or are not members. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: member
element.description: The member asset(s) to remove.

element.name: where
element.description: A query selecting assets to remove.

attribute.name: txn-size
attribute.description: The size of each batch update to the collection asset membership. Defaults to '1000'.

service.name: asset.collection.remove.all
service.description: Removes all assets from the specified collection. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: destroy-member-if-no-parent
element.description: If true and the member has no parent (not in a collection), then it will be destroyed. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset.

element.name: ignore-errors
element.description: Ignore any errors if the asset is not already a collection. Defaults to 'false'.

service.name: asset.collection.root.index.validate
service.description: Checks the contents of the root collection asset index and optionally repair.

element.name: repair
element.description: Should anomolies be repaired? Defaults to 'false'

service.name: asset.collection.store.name
service.description: Returns the data store that would be used by the specified collection asset(s) if an asset was created at the time of the service call. This will either be the configured store, or if configured to use a store policy, then will return a store determined by the policy.

element.name: id
element.description: A collection asset identifier. IDs for regular assets or collection assets without unique name index will be ignored.

element.name: traverse
element.description: If IDs were supplied in 'path=<asset_path>' format and any do not exist, should the path hierarchy be traversed until an existing parent collection or namespace is found. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.collection.store.set
service.description: Changes the data store (for new content) for the specified collection asset. This can only be used on collections with unique name index. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: An identifier of a collection that the store or policy will be assigned to.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of a data store to be used for the collection.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of a data store policy to be used for the collection.

service.name: asset.collection.store.unset
service.description: Removes the definition of a data store or store policy for the specified collection asset. The collection asset will then inherit its store or policy from the parent collection or parent namespace. This can only be used on collections with unique name index. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: An identifier of a collection which a statically defined store or policy will be removed from.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.describe
service.description: Returns the triggers (including the script) on one or more collection assets.

element.name: descend
element.description: Recurse down the collection tree looking for all triggers. Defaults to false - just describe triggers on the specified collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the collection asset.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.destroy
service.description: Removes one or more specified triggers from a collection asset.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the collection asset with the trigger.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger to remove. If not specified and a trigger id is not be supplied, then all triggers will be removed.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identifier of the trigger.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.disable
service.description: Disables one or more specified triggers on a collection asset.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The owning collection asset of the trigger. If not specified and a trigger name is not be supplied, then all triggers will be modified.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger to control. If not specified and a trigger id is not be supplied, then all triggers will be modified.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identifier of the trigger.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.enable
service.description: Enables one or more specified triggers on a collection asset.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The owning collection asset of the trigger. If not specified and a trigger name is not be supplied, then all triggers will be modified.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger to control. If not specified and a trigger id is not be supplied, then all triggers will be modified.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identifier of the trigger.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.list
service.description: Returns the triggers (including the script) on one or more collection assets.

element.name: descend
element.description: Recurse down the collection tree looking for all triggers. Defaults to false - just describe triggers on the specified collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the collection asset.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.post.create
service.description: Adds a postcondition for the given event to the given collection asset. The given script will be executed after the given event happens. In order for a trigger to fire collections must have a unique name index.

element.name: async
element.description: If set to true, the trigger will execute outside of a transaction. Asynchronous triggers may give faster response when accessing an asset, but if the system crashes before the trigger completes, it will be lost. Defaults to false - the trigger is executed inside the transaction that generated the event.

element.name: descend
element.description: Should the trigger apply to all collections below this one? Defaults to true.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection asset that will own the trigger.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger.

element.name: oneoff
element.description: If set to true, the trigger will be destroyed after execution. Defaults to false.

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute. The script will be passed the variables namespace, id and version.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the script value. 'value' means the script element contains the script. A value of 'ref' indicates it is a reference to an asset (an asset path). Defaults to 'value'

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this trigger will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

service.name: asset.collection.trigger.pre.create
service.description: Adds a precondition for the given event to the given collection asset. The given script will be executed prior to the given event happening. In order for a trigger to fire collections must have a unique name index.

element.name: descend
element.description: Should the trigger apply to all collections below this one? Defaults to true.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection asset that will own the trigger.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger.

element.name: oneoff
element.description: If set to true, the trigger will be destroyed after execution. Defaults to false.

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute. The script will be passed the variables namespace, id and version.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the script value. 'value' means the script element contains the script. A value of 'ref' indicates it is a reference to an asset (an asset path). Defaults to 'value'

service.name: asset.collection.worm.policy.remove
service.description: Removes any existing WORM policy on a collection. Caller must have administration rights to the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

service.name: asset.collection.worm.policy.set
service.description: Sets or updates the WORM policy associated with an asset collection. Caller must have administration rights to the collection.

element.name: id
element.description: The collection.

element.name: worm
element.description: Write-once, read-many properties, if any.

element.name: applies-to
element.description: Indicates what parts of the asset the WORM state applies to. Defaults to 'all'

element.name: apply-to-collections
element.description: If true, then include collection assets in the WORM policy. By default is set to 'true' - apply to both collections and non-collection assets.

element.name: can-add-versions
element.description: Indicates whether new versions of metadata and content are allowed when in the WORM state. Defaults to false.

element.name: can-alter-if
element.description: Indicates when/who can modify the WORM state. Defaults to 'system-manager'

element.name: can-move
element.description: Indicates whether the collection, or asset(s) can be moved. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: destroy-on-expiry
element.description: Indicates whether assets are destroyed once the WORM state ceases (retention period expires). Defaults to false.

element.name: lock-path
element.description: If true, then disallow collection rename, move or destroy for this and any sub-collection that contains a member in the WORM state. Defaults to false, allowing collection rename/move. If true, will enter this state immediately any asset therein enters the WORM state, and will exit when there are no sub-members in the WORM state.

element.name: min-number-content-copies
element.description: If true, then disallow collection rename or move for this and any sub-collection that contains a member in the WORM state. Defaults to false, allowing collection rename/move. If true, will enter this state immediately any asset therein enters the WORM state, and will exit when there are no sub-members in the WORM state. If this flag is retrospectively changed it will not look for existing assets in the WORM state - it will only trigger when assets newly enter the WORM state.

element.name: must-have-content
element.description: Indicates whether or not the asset must have content to enter the WORM state. By default is set to 'true'

element.name: retention
element.description: The default period (in days) for the WORM expiry time for assets created in this collection. The expiry time will be set to current time plus this period. If not specified, must be specified at asset create time.

element.name: trigger
element.description: The trigger that puts assets in this namespace into the WORM state. Defaults to 'create'

service.name: asset.container.list
service.description: Returns the container, if any, of an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: version
element.description: The version. If not specified, defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.access.time.index.describe
service.description: Describes the index for asset content access time, if it exists.

service.name: asset.content.access.time.index.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or no an index for asset content access time has been created.

service.name: asset.content.analyzer.describe
service.description: Retrieves information on content analyzers for an asset, MIME types, extensions or all analyzers.

element.name: ext
element.description: A file extension for which an analyzer is associated. Ignored if type is specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: type
element.description: A MIME type for which an analyzer is associated. Ignored if asset id is specified.

service.name: asset.content.annotation.add
service.description: Annotates the content. The annotation may specify a sub-location on/within the asset content.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: colour
element.description: A rendering hint for the colour of the annotation

attribute.name: type

element.name: a
element.description: Alpha

element.name: b
element.description: Blue

element.name: g
element.description: Green

element.name: r
element.description: Red

attribute.name: dictionary

element.name: location
element.description: The location on/within the asset content expressed using XML. If not specified, then refers to entire content. The form of the location depends entirely on the type of content.

attribute.name: type

element.name: meta
element.description: Arbitrary metadata. If supplied, then the metadata will be validated.

element.name: note

element.name: type
element.description: The type of annotation if specified as a 'note'. 'rfc' is a 'request for change'

element.name: note

service.name: asset.content.annotation.remove
service.description: Removes an annotation and/or entry within an annotation from the content.

element.name: aid
element.description: The annotation identifier.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

service.name: asset.content.annotations.copy.from.previous
service.description: Copies the content annotations on the latest version of the content from the previous version of the content. This enables annotations to be copied through (e.g. when content is re-edited). No attempt is made to ensure previous annotations are within the dimensional bounds of the new content.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified.

service.name: asset.content.as.string
service.description: Retrieves the content for an asset as a string. This should only be used for (small) content that can be represented as a string, as it returns the content within the XML response.

element.name: encoding
element.description: The encoding for the resultant content string.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.byte.search
service.description: Performs a byte-by-byte search of content for a given byte sequence. Returns the offset at which the bytes were found.

element.name: bytes
element.description: A hexidecimal byte string.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of sequences to count. Defaults to one.

service.name: asset.content.checksum.crc.generate
service.description: Computes the checksum on the content for a given asset using a CRC32 algorithm as per RFC-1952.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: length
element.description: The maximim number of bytes to feed into the the checksum generation. If not specified, then generated from all bytes.

service.name: asset.content.checksum.digest.generate
service.description: Computes the digest checksum on the content for a given asset using a digest algorith (e.g. MD5, SHA-1, etc.)

element.name: algorithm
element.description: The digest algorithm to use.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.checksum.md5.generate
service.description: Computes the MD5 checksum on the content for a given asset.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.convert.to.zero
service.description: If the specified asset has zero length content and that content has a reference to external data then convert to a zero sized content (without a reference). If there are multiple copies due to legacy operations, those will be reduced to a single copy.

element.name: all-versions
element.description: If true, convert all content. Defaults to false, which means to convert the target version only.

element.name: delete-referent
element.description: If true, then delete the source / referenent data, if that exists. If false, convert to zero without deleting. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.copy.attach
service.description: Attaches an external copy to an existing asset. This must be executed with care to ensure that the copy that is attached matches content copies that are already on the asset

element.name: add-copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to add to the created content copy.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: If true, then generate a checksum on copy. If the content does not have a checksum, then add. If it does, then compare and if there is a mismatch then fail. Defaults to default policy for assets (server property: asset.checksum.generate.on.copy)

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of a store where the attached copy should go to. Store must be capable of doing this operation. If not specified content will be attached as external copy.

element.name: url
element.description: A URI path relative to the server where an externally referenced copy of the content already exists.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.description: Identifies this input as a 'resource' which may then be used for clustered I/O and queue management.

service.name: asset.content.copy.create
service.description: Creates a duplicate copy of existing content for an asset in a specified location (e.g. data store).

element.name: add-copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to add to the created content copy.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to duplicate. If unspecified, then system will choose an existing copy.

element.name: fail-if-executing-policy
element.description: If true, and there is already an active operation (based on a store or policy) for this asset, then fails with an exception. That avoids the thread locking until the other operation has completed.

element.name: fail-if-staging
element.description: If true (the default), then generate an exception if in the staging state. If false, then the operation will not do anything and simply return without failure.

element.name: from-copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to copy content from. If multiple tags are specified, then all must match. If no match, then no copy will be made. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: from-store
element.description: The name of a store to copy from. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: from-store-tag
element.description: The name of a store tag to copy content from. The first copy found in any of the stores grouped by this tag will be used as the source to copy from. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: If true, then generate a checksum on copy. If the content does not have a checksum, then add. If it does, then compare and if there is a mismatch then fail. Defaults to default policy for assets (server property: asset.checksum.generate.on.copy)

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of a store to create the copy in.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of the data store policy to employ which will automatically select a data store for the content.

element.name: url
element.description: A file URI path relative to the server where an externally referenced copy of the content should be created.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Should we attempt to create parent directories if they do not exist. Defaults to 'false', where an exception will be raised if the directory being written too does not exist.

attribute.name: ifexists
attribute.description: If a file exists at the target URL, what action should be taken. 'error' causes an Exception to be thrown, 'ignore' returns without creating a the external file or content copy and 'replace' attempts to overwrite the file. Defaults to 'error'.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.description: Identifies this input as a 'resource' which may then be used for clustered I/O and queue management.

attribute.name: symlink
attribute.description: If allowed by the operating system will create a symlink to another file system content copy if available.

element.name: versions
element.description: Version selection, if any.

element.name: after
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created after this time.

element.name: all
element.description: Include all versions. Defaults to false.

element.name: before
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created before this time.

element.name: exclude
element.description: Exclude this specific version from the list of all versions. Ignored if 'all' not specified as true.

element.name: include
element.description: Include this specific version.

element.name: max-idx
element.description: The maximum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to infinity (the oldest).

element.name: min-idx
element.description: The minimum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to 0 (the latest).

service.name: asset.content.copy.describe
service.description: Retrieves information on the status of the content for the asset. That is, whether the content is on or offline, etc.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: detailed
element.description: Should the response be extended to show store type and all states per store copy. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: get-url
element.description: Should the URL be returned, on some store types this may incur a performance hit. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are described.

element.name: state
element.description: Return copies with the following status. If unspecified, then copies of all states are returned.

service.name: asset.content.copy.move
service.description: Moves the specified copy of asset content into a specified data store.

element.name: add-copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to add to the created content copy.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to move. If unspecified, then system will move the first copy.

element.name: delete-if-exists
element.description: If set to true and a copy of the content already exists at the destination then the source copy will be deleted. Defaults to true.

element.name: fail-if-executing-policy
element.description: If true, and there is already an active operation (based on a store or policy) for this asset, then fails with an exception. That avoids the thread locking until the other operation has completed.

element.name: fail-if-staging
element.description: If true (the default), then generate an exception if in the staging state. If false, then the operation will not do anything and simply return without failure.

element.name: from-copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to copy content from. If multiple tags are specified, then all must match. If no match, then no copy will be made. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: from-store
element.description: The name of a store to move from. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: from-store-tag
element.description: The name of a store tag to move content from. Any copies that exist on any stores grouped by this tag will be moved. If multiple exist, the first will be moved and the remaineder deleted unless delete-if-exists is set to 'false'. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: If true, then generate a checksum on move. If the content does not have a checksum, then add. If it does, then compare and if there is a mismatch then fail. Defaults to default policy for assets (server property: asset.checksum.generate.on.copy)

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.description: The name of a store to create the copy in.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of the data store policy to employ which will automatically select a data store for the content.

element.name: versions
element.description: Version selection, if any.

element.name: after
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created after this time.

element.name: all
element.description: Include all versions. Defaults to false.

element.name: before
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created before this time.

element.name: exclude
element.description: Exclude this specific version from the list of all versions. Ignored if 'all' not specified as true.

element.name: include
element.description: Include this specific version.

element.name: max-idx
element.description: The maximum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to infinity (the oldest).

element.name: min-idx
element.description: The minimum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to 0 (the latest).

service.name: asset.content.copy.policy.describe
service.description: Describes selected content copy policies

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of a content copy policy to describe. If no policies are listed all will be described.

service.name: asset.content.copy.policy.exists
service.description: Tests for the existence of the named content copy policy

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of a content copy policy.

service.name: asset.content.copy.policy.list
service.description: Lists all defined content copy policies

service.name: asset.content.diff
service.description: Performs a byte-by-byte comparison of the content for the given asset(s) to identify whether they are different.

element.name: extract
element.description: The number of bytes to extract. Defaults to zero.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: rid
element.description: Reference asset. Other asset compared to this one.

service.name: asset.content.external.manage
service.description: Mark selected external asset content as being managed by the server (will be deleted, marked as read-only)

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to manage. If unspecified, then all external copies are managed.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: set-referent-read-only
element.description: Should the referent be set to read-only so it cannot be modified. Defaults to true. Set to false to improve performance where it is known the referent will not be altered.

element.name: url-prefix
element.description: If specified, then match external references that start with this prefix.

service.name: asset.content.external.status
service.description: Retrieves information on the status of external content (content by reference) for the asset. Can be used to determine whether the referent has been modified.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to obtain status information. If unspecified, then returns status for all copies that have external references.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

service.name: asset.content.external.unmanage
service.description: Mark selected external asset content as not being managed by the server.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to unmanage. If unspecified, then all external copies are unmanaged.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: url-prefix
element.description: If specified, then match external references that start with this prefix.

service.name: asset.content.external.url.change
service.description: Service will change the URL of asset's external copy, managed or unmanaged. Service will only change the URL, and leave all other attributes for the external copy as they were. Service arguments allow user to compare file lengths, modification times as well as checksums, before changing the URL.

element.name: check-csum
element.description: Indicates that the content checksum has to be compared and checked before URL is replaced. Setting this option to 'true' will require that the content is read from new source in order to calculate the checksum. If the content checksums differ, URL will not be changed. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: check-length
element.description: Indicates that the content length has to be compared and checked before URL is replaced. If the content lengths differ URL will not be changed. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: check-mtime
element.description: Indicates that the modification time has to be compared and checked before URL is replaced. If the modification times differ URL will not be changed. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy for which service will change the URL. If not provided, first external content copy will be modified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: new-url-prefix
element.description: URL prefix of the new URL for the content that will replace the specified old URL prefix. Can be whole URL including the filename.

attribute.name: must-exist
attribute.description: If set to true, it will check if the URL exists (if possible) and fail if the URL does not exist. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: old-url-prefix
element.description: URL prefix of the old URL for the content that will be replaced by the specified new URL prefix. Can be whole URL including the filename.

element.name: onerror
element.description: Specifies the behaviour if error is encountered. 'ignore' will print out the status indicating that the operation was not successfull. 'exception' will throw exception indicating the cause of failure. Defaults to 'exception'.

element.name: replace-mtime-if-content-identical
element.description: Indicates that the modification time will be replaced with the modification time value of the new URL. This will force content length and checksum comparisons. Modification time will only be replaced if both length and checksums are identical. Defaults to 'false'

service.name: asset.content.external.url.generate
service.description: If supported by the data store(s) in which the asset content is stored, will generate an externally accessible URL to the data allowing by-pass for read. If not supported, will return nothing.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system. This is ignored 'stime' is specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: timeout
element.description: For stores that create a secure token, this is the maximum time (in seconds) that the token will remain valid.

service.name: asset.content.geometry.get
service.description: Retrieves detailed geometry from the assets content. Requires a content analyzer that extracts detailed geometry.

element.name: clip
element.description: Clipping rectangle. If specified, then shapes will be clipped to this rectangle.

element.name: east
element.description: Eastern longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: north
element.description: Northern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: south
element.description: Southern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: west
element.description: Western longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: resolution
element.description: Display resolution for generating shapes. If unspecified, no sub-sampling occurs.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 20 points.

service.name: asset.content.get
service.description: Retrieves all data for an asset or a specified range of bytes of data for an asset.

element.name: content-id
element.description: Specific content to retrieve for this asset.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: length
element.description: The number of bytes to return. If offset+length is past the end, then will only return the number of available bytes.

element.name: offset
element.description: The offset within the content. The offset is zero based, and must not point past the end of the content. If negative, then relative to the end - that is, the last N bytes.

element.name: range
element.description: When there is more than a single range (single offset/length pair), they can be specified using 'range' elements. If specified, then offset/length ignored.

element.name: length
element.description: The number of bytes to return. If offset+length is past the end, then will only return the number of available bytes.

element.name: offset
element.description: The offset within the content. The offset is zero based, and must not point past the end of the content. If negative, then relative to the end - that is, the last N bytes.

element.name: stime
element.description: The server clock time of the content.

attribute.name: server
attribute.description: The server that generated the content.

service.name: asset.content.hexdump
service.description: Displays a portion of asset content in hexadecimal notation.

element.name: content-id
element.description: Specific content to retrieve for this asset.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: length
element.description: The number of bytes to return. If offset+length is past the end, then will only return the number of available bytes. Defaults to 100.

element.name: offset
element.description: The offset within the content. The offset is zero based, and must not point past the end of the content. If negative, then relative to the end - that is, the last N bytes.

service.name: asset.content.licence.add
service.description: Adds licence assets to the specified asset content. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The id of the content. Defaults to current content instance.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

element.name: licence
element.description: The licence asset(s) to add.

element.name: where
element.description: A query selecting licence assets to add.

service.name: asset.content.licence.count
service.description: Returns the number of licences on a specific assets content.

element.name: cid
element.description: The id of the content. Defaults to current content instance.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.content.licence.list
service.description: Returns the licences on a specific assets content.

element.name: cid
element.description: The id of the content. Defaults to current content instance.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.content.licence.remove
service.description: Removes a licence asset from the specified asset content. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The id of the content. Defaults to current content instance.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

element.name: licence
element.description: The licence asset(s) to remove.

element.name: where
element.description: A query selecting licence assets to remove.

service.name: asset.content.licence.remove.all
service.description: Removes all licence assets from the specified asset content. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The id of the content. Defaults to current content instance.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.content.meta.get
service.description: Retrieves detailed metadata that is not extracted when the asset is created. Requires a content analyzer that extracts detailed metadata.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of metadata to retrieve. Defaults to 'detailed'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.migrate
service.label: Migrate Content
service.description: Migrate content for an asset to a tier in the data store. Only supported for stores with more than one tier. Can migrate content for all versions, or a specified version.

element.name: action
element.description: The migration action. 'copy' makes a another copy at the destination tier. 'move' ensures only one copy exists and at the destination tier (note that some stores will only copy when migrating to a lower - e.g. 'online' - tier and will ignore the 'move' parameter unless the tier is greater than 1). Defaults to 'move'.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to migrate. If unspecified, and no 'store' is specified, then all copies are migrated (where possible).

element.name: destination
element.description: The destination to migrate for the data. 'offline' moves the data off local storage to archive storage. 'online' copies data onto local storage.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If unspecified, then defaults to the latest version.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: If requesting the asset by path, then the path can be qualified by a specific point in time. Default to 'now'.

element.name: priority
element.description: The priority of the operation. 1 the lowest priority, 100 is the highest. If unspecified, defaults to store preference.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, migrate copies in the specified store(s).

element.name: store-tag
element.description: If specified, migrate copies for stores with all of the specified tags.

service.name: asset.content.missing.find.and.recover
service.description: This is utility service to search for missing and/or corrupted content in another file system, and if found to reconnect with that (missing) content.

element.name: directory
element.description: A directory to search for copies of the missing content.

element.name: include
element.description: The content to search for. Defaults to 'missing'.

element.name: name-must-match
element.description: If true, then the name must match to be considered as a match. Defaults to false - compare all files.

element.name: recover
element.description: If true, then perform the recovery. If false, simply report the number that would be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: where
element.description: The assets to include in the search. The query will be augmented to find assets with missing content.

service.name: asset.content.move.to.namespace.store
service.description: Ensures that at least one (nearest) copy of the assets content resides in the specified content store for the parent namespace. If 'coalesce' is selected then copies that are not moved to the target store are deleted.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identify of an asset.

element.name: coalesce
element.description: Should remaining copies be coalesced, removing copies that are not in the target store. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.content.pin
service.label: Pin Content
service.description: Requests the content for the asset be optimised for frequent access. This is an advisory request. The content should be unpinned when no longer required.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If unspecified, then all versions migrated.

service.name: asset.content.recovery.mapping.describe
service.description: Generates a content recovery mapping for the content (copies) of the specified asset.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.remove
service.description: Removes the content associated with the asset (version), without removing the asset. There are several reasons why content may be removed.

element.name: action
element.description: The action to perform on the content. 'destroy' will remove the content completely, whereas truncate will set the length to zero leaving the entry as a placeholder. Defaults to 'destroy'.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to remove. If unspecified, then all copies are removed.

element.name: copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type used to select content. If multiple tags are specified, then all must match. If no match, then no copy will be made. If specified, then the 'copy' argument is ignored.

element.name: delete-external-files
element.description: If true, then externally referenced files should be deleted. This should be set to false if all copies are to be removed including external files if you want to retain one copy. Defaults to true for managed copies and false for unmanaged.

element.name: external-store-types
element.description: If true, then externally referenced files in any (external) store should be removed. Defaults to false. Ignored if one or more 'store' or 'copy' are specified.

element.name: external-url-prefix
element.description: If specified, then match external references that start with this prefix. If specified, then 'external-store-types' is automatically defaulted to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: imc
element.description: If true, the don't throw an exception if there is missing content for this asset. Defaults to false. Set to true if 'missing-only' is set to true.

element.name: missing-only
element.description: If true, the only remove content with missing data. Defaults to false.

element.name: reason
element.description: An explainatory note indicating why the content was removed. This will only be added if all copies for the content have been removed. Defaults to 'destroy'

element.name: remove-completely
element.description: If true and the action is 'destroy', then remove the content and all references to completely. If false (the default), then leaves a marker indicating the content was removed (marker is only added if all copies are removed).

element.name: remove-last-copy
element.description: If true, then enable the removal of the last copy. If false, then don't allow removal of the last copy. Defaults to the setting of the server property 'asset.remove.last.content.copy'.

element.name: remove-symbolic
element.description: If true (the default) any external symbolic content copies which target the selected content copies will also be removed. If false symbolic external content copies will remain but the links target may then be missing.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of the store. If specified, then copies in this store are removed. Ignored if one or more 'copy' are specified.

element.name: store-tag
element.description: The name of a data store tag. If specified, then copies in any store that holds this tag are removed. Ignored if one or more 'copy' are specified.

element.name: store-type
element.description: The type of store (see asset.store.type.list). If specified, then copies in this store type are removed. Ignored if one or more 'store' or 'copy' are specified.

element.name: versions
element.description: Version selection, if any.

element.name: after
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created after this time.

element.name: all
element.description: Include all versions. Defaults to false.

element.name: before
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created before this time.

element.name: exclude
element.description: Exclude this specific version from the list of all versions. Ignored if 'all' not specified as true.

element.name: include
element.description: Include this specific version.

element.name: max-idx
element.description: The maximum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to infinity (the oldest).

element.name: min-idx
element.description: The minimum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to 0 (the latest).

service.name: asset.content.size
service.description: Returns information about the size of content for a set of assets.

element.name: all-versions
element.description: Display information about all asset versions. Defaults to false.

element.name: display
element.description: Display information about each asset (including the total), or just the total only. Defaults to 'total' only.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
