attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.size.distribution
service.description: Finds the distribution of content sizes in the system.

element.name: base
element.description: The base for buckets. Defaults to base 2.

element.name: block-size
element.description: If set, then calculate the wasted space if the storage block size is the specified value.

element.name: max-size
element.description: Maximum content size to include.

element.name: min-size
element.description: Minimum content size to include.

element.name: where
element.description: A subset of assets to determine the content size distribution.

service.name: asset.content.staging.begin
service.description: Adds content to the specified asset that can be subsequently updated / staged, until staging is ended.

element.name: ctype
element.description: Encapsulation MIME type of the content, if there is content. If not specified, then auto-typed from the content extension, and/or analyzers. If no 'lctype' is specified, then this is also the logical/interpreted type of for the content.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: size
element.description: The expected (total) length of the content, if known.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of a store to create the content in.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of the data store policy to employ which will automatically select a data store for the content.

service.name: asset.content.staging.commit
service.description: Commits the asset staging content in instances when there are currently no open references to that asset's staging content.

element.name: analyze
element.description: Indicates if the content analysis should be performed on commit? In unspecified it will default to the value of server property 'asset.analyze.default'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Indicates whether or not to generate a proxy on commit? In unspecified it will default to the value of server property 'asset.proxy.generate.default'.

service.name: asset.content.staging.end
service.description: Finalizes the update / staging of asset content and sets the (indexed) length, checksum, etc.

element.name: commit
element.description: If true, then commit the changes to a version of the asset. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: delay
attribute.description: The time in milliseconds after which commit to a content version should occur. If zero, the commit immediately. If greater than zero, then commit after that time unless there is a new request to begin update. Defaults to zero.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.content.state
service.description: Returns the link definition or check sum of the specified asset content. If the asset does not exist, then there will be no checksum returned. If the asset does not exist, or does exists but does not have a checksum, then an 'exists' response will be returned.

element.name: id
element.description: An asset to retrieve the state (link or checksum).

service.name: asset.content.status
service.description: Retrieves information on the status of the content for the asset. That is, whether the content is on or offline, etc.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, displays the status of the latest version.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to check. If unspecified, then all copies are checked.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, displays the status of the latest version.

element.name: must-match
element.description: Indicates whether or not any selector ('copy', 'store', 'store-tag') must match or not. Defaults to false.

element.name: show-errors
element.description: Should exceptions associated with a content status be displayed. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, then only check copies in this store.

element.name: store-tag
element.description: If specified, then only check copies for stores with all of the specified tags.

service.name: asset.content.status.statistics
service.description: Generates statistics on the status of asset content for an arbitrary query.

element.name: check-any-online-first
element.description: Set to true if only interested if the content has any copy with an 'online' or 'reachable' status. Copies are sorted by cost order prior to check. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, displays the status of the latest version.

element.name: must-match
element.description: Indicates whether or not any selector ('copy', 'store', 'store-tag') must match or not. Defaults to false.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: The point in time for the query.

element.name: store
element.description: Limit the statistics to this store.

element.name: store-tag
element.description: If specified, then only check copies for stores with all of the specified tags.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query.

service.name: asset.content.store.recovery.mapping.describe
service.description: Retrieves information on the mapping from content identifier to store information for the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, then only show copies from this store.

service.name: asset.content.text.extract
service.description: Extracts text from the content of the asset. Will only extract text if there is a text extraction analyzer associated with the content type.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.unpin
service.label: Unpin Content
service.description: Requests the content for the asset be de-optimised for frequent access.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If unspecified, then all versions migrated.

service.name: asset.content.validate
service.description: Checks that the content for the asset (if the asset has content) is accessible and that value is consistent with the recorded check sum.

element.name: all-versions
element.description: If true, then validate the content for all versions. If false, then only validate the selected version. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: check-sum
element.description: When validating content, should the current check-sum be recomputed for comparison? Defaults to true.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to check. If unspecified, then all copies are checked.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: mark-if-issue
element.description: If true, then record with the asset the fact there was a validation issue, including the time of validation. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: must-match
element.description: Indicates whether or not any selector ('copy', 'store', 'store-tag') must match or not. Defaults to false.

element.name: pdist
element.description: If specified, and recovery cannot be performed from a local copy, then attempt to find a replica in any reachable federation (up to the specified peer distance 'pdist') and recover from there. Defaults to 0, unless 'ptag' is specified in which case defaults to 1.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed query. If unspecified, will distributed to all known peers.

element.name: recover
element.description: If invalid data is found, should it be recovered from valid copies. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: force-to-stored-length
attribute.description: If true, then force a length update where the lengths are mismatched. Defaults to false. Use with extreme care - when the stored content length is known to be correct, but the recorded content length is not. Requires adminstrator permission to use.

attribute.name: if-no-copy
attribute.description: The behaviour if there is no recoverable copy available. Defaults to 'exception' - throw an exception. 'status' will return the recovery status, and 'notify' will generate an error event on the notification object type 'asset' with name 'validate'

attribute.name: notify-on-recover
attribute.description: If true and recovery occurred, generate warning notification object type 'asset' with name 'validate'. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: pdist
attribute.description: If specified, and recovery cannot be performed from a local copy, then attempt to find a replica in any reachable federation (up to the specified peer distance 'pdist') and recover from there. Defaults to 0.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, validate only content in this specified store(s).

element.name: store-tag
element.description: If specified, then only check copies for stores with all of the specified tags.

service.name: asset.content.virus.scan
service.description: Perform virus scanning on the given asset and return the virus scanning result.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.content.write.append
service.description: Appends data to the content for the given asset. The content must have been "opened" with asset.content.staging.begin

element.name: asset
element.description: The path to the asset to obtain the content from.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset the content will be appended to.

element.name: url
element.description: Input source for the data. If not supplied, then supplied from another asset.

service.name: asset.content.write.at
service.description: Appends data to the content for the given asset. The content must have been "opened" with asset.content.write.begin

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset the content will be appended to.

element.name: offset
element.description: The offset where data should be written. If unspecified, defaults to zero.

element.name: url
element.description: Input source for the data. If not supplied, then supplied by input.

service.name: asset.content.write.test.append
service.description: Appends test data to the content for the given asset. The content must have been "opened" with asset.content.staging.begin

element.name: byte
element.description: One or more bytes in sequence to append.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset the content will be appended to.

element.name: nb
element.description: The number of times to repeat the byte sequence. Defaults to 1.

element.name: repeat
element.description: The number of times to repeat writing the bytes. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: byte-increment
attribute.description: An amount to increment each byte for each repeat. Defaults to zero.

attribute.name: wait
attribute.description: The time to wait (in milliseconds) between repeats. Defaults to zero.

service.name: asset.content.write.truncate
service.description: Truncate the modifiable content to some specified length. If truncated to zero, the content will no longer be a derivative of the previous content.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: length
element.description: The resultant length of the file. Defaults to zero.

service.name: asset.control.profile.execute
service.description: Executes a named Asset Control Profile (ACP) against the results of a query.

element.name: abort-on-error
element.description: Specifies whether or not the export should be aborted in case of a transfer error. Defaults to 'true' indicating that export should be aborted

element.name: function-variables
element.description: A collection of one or more FAQL variables that will be added to the ECP and will be available to use within functions.

element.name: variable
element.description: A variable to be added to the FAQL variables.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The data type of the variable. If not supplied defaults to 'string'.

element.name: iterator-page-size
element.description: Specifies an the iterator page size when processed by the asset control profile. If not specified then page size defaults to '500'.

element.name: mode
element.description: The mode to process the assets in. 'test' mode outputs the assets processed and the construct that they are processed with, while 'live' invokes the operations on the target assets. Defaults to 'live'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The source asset namespace to process. If not supplied then a 'where' query must be specified.

element.name: profile
element.description: The Asset Control Profile to apply to the selected assets. Profiles are assets of type 'application/arc-acp' with the specified name.

element.name: where
element.description: Specifies an AQL query to process through the asset control profile. If not specified then 'namespace' must be is specified

service.name: asset.count
service.description: Counts the number of assets satisfying the specified query, if any.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If true, then include destroyed. If false, then don't include destroyed. Defaults to false.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query.

service.name: asset.create
service.description: Creates an asset. If required, the asset is created within a namespace. Optionally, asset data may be supplied at the time of creation.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for an asset. Only checked in views that require asset level access control.

element.name: access
element.description: The type of access to grant to both metadata and content. If not specified, must specify one or both of 'metadata' and/or 'content'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: The type of access to grant to the asset itself.

element.name: content
element.description: The type of access to grant to content. Ignored if 'access' specified.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The type of access to grant to metadata. Ignored if 'access' specified.

element.name: propagate
element.description: Should this ACL be propagated to related assets. Defaults to false.

element.name: action
element.description: Data to return for the created asset. Defaults to 'get-id'.

element.name: allow-incomplete-meta
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-invalid-meta
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if invalid? Defaults to false. Use with caution.

element.name: alternate-id-type
element.description: The type of an alternate ID to allocate to this asset.

element.name: analyze
element.description: Controls whether or not to examine the content and automatically extract metadata, provided there is an appropriate content analyzer. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.analyze.default' has been set.

element.name: application-settings
element.description: An application defined associated document.

attribute.name: app
attribute.description: The application.

element.name: settings
element.description: The application specific settings.

element.name: archive
element.description: Provides options for the treatment of content which is ingested as an archive.

element.name: expand
element.description: If true and the created asset has an archive as its content the archive will be expanded into assets who's content references individual filess in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: filter-expression
element.description: If the archive is to be expanded on creation an entry will be extracted if its path within the archive matches the supplied regular-expression.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: An optional Mime Type to associate with assets created from this match.

element.name: filter-suffix
element.description: If the archive is to be expanded on creation an entry will be extracted if its suffix matches the supplied value. The matching is case-insensitive.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: An optional Mime Type to associate with assets created from this match.

element.name: inherit-licences
element.description: Specifies whether created assets inherit licence relationships of the parent asset. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: Which namespace should the expanded assets be created in. Defaults to a namespace with the assets name.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the namespace if it doesn't exist? Defaults to false.

element.name: propagate-metadata
element.description: Controls how propagable metadata can be added to the newly created child assets. One of either 'exclude-metadata', 'exclude-metadata-tag', 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' must be supplied. Any resulting document types must be tagged as The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be able to be added.

element.name: exclude-metadata
element.description: If 'include-metadata' or 'include-metadata-tag' or is not supplied what documents should not be propagated to the newly created assets. Any other document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be added.

element.name: exclude-metadata-tag
element.description: If 'include-metadata' or 'include-metadata-tag' is not supplied document types with the supplied tag should not be propagated to the newly created assets. Any other document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be added.

element.name: include-metadata
element.description: If 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' is not supplied what document types shoud be propagate to the newly created assets. The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE'

element.name: include-metadata-tag
element.description: If 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' is not supplied document types with the supplied tag shoud be propagate to the newly created assets. The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE'

element.name: template
element.description: Specifies trasform template for exploding assets which determines the namespace layout structure for exploded assets. Template will be ignored if its target mime type doesn't match archive's mime type.

element.name: begin-content-staging
element.description: If true, then automatically start content staging. Defaults to false.

element.name: caetime
element.description: End time of the content acquisition

element.name: castime
element.description: Start time of the content acquisition

element.name: cext
element.description: The content extension for the content. If supplied, may be used to ascertain content MIME type.

element.name: cid
element.description: Optional (global) citeable identifier.

element.name: clone
element.description: The asset may be created from another asset as a template.

attribute.name: acl
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the Asset's ACLs. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone content. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: meta
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone metadata. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the asset model. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: related
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone related. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: templates
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone associated templates. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: clone-from-cid
element.description: The asset may be created from another asset as a template.

attribute.name: acl
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the Asset's ACLs. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone content. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: meta
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone metadata. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the asset model. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: related
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone related. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: templates
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone associated templates. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: collection
element.description: Indicates whether this asset is, or represents, a collection of assets.

attribute.name: anonymous
attribute.description: Is this an anonymous collection where the child assets have no reference to their parents. Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: cascade-contained-asset-index
attribute.description: If true, then also create contained assets indexes for any sub-collections. If not specified, will inherit from parent if parent is cascading.

attribute.name: contained-asset-index
attribute.description: If true, then the assets contained within sub-collections will be indexed for fast search. If not specified, will inherit from parent if parent is cascading.

attribute.name: record-member-access-time
attribute.description: If true, keep track of the latest member access time. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: unique-name-index
attribute.description: If true, then the assets within the collection must be uniquely named, and they will be indexed for lookup. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: collection-metadata-inheritance
element.description: For collection asset, these rules define how any child assets within the collection asset may inherit metadata from their parents within the hierarchy. When a child asset is accessed through services like asset.get, an asset with a primary parent locate these rules and apply them by inheriting the selected metadata fragments from its parental hierarchy. Child assets will use the first set of rule found in its parental hierarchy.

element.name: asset
element.description: A query selecting members for this asset collection. The default behaviour will see the query evaluated each time the asset collection members are resolved. If the 'static' attribute is enabled the query is resolved immediately and the resulting assets added as static members.

attribute.name: method
attribute.description: The MIME type defining which assets the rules relate to. 'match' requires an exact match to the mime type, 'prefix' requires on a match to the beginning of the mime type and 'all' matches all mime types. Defaults to 'match'

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The MIME type defining which assets the rules relate to.

element.name: parent
element.description: A query selecting members for this asset collection. The default behaviour will see the query evaluated each time the asset collection members are resolved. If the 'static' attribute is enabled the query is resolved immediately and the resulting assets added as static members.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The MIME type defining which assets the metadata fragment should be inherited from.

element.name: document
element.description: The name of the metadata document to inherit from parent assets with this type..

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to add to the created content copy, if any.

element.name: ctype
element.description: Encapsulation MIME type of the content, if there is content. If not specified, then auto-typed from the content extension, and/or analyzers. If no 'lctype' is specified, then this is also the logical/interpreted type of for the content.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the asset.

element.name: determine-length
element.description: Controls whether or not to determine the length of the asset. Defaults to true.

element.name: enqueue
element.description: A request to enqueue assets based on events to an asset processing queue.

element.name: app-data
element.description: Optional application data that will be passed to the processing service.

element.name: app-key
element.description: An optional correlation key to some configuration that will be passed to the processing service. Where possible, an 'app-key' is preferred to 'app-data' because it is more efficient to store.

element.name: event
element.description: One or more events that will cause the enqueing of the asset. If not specified, defaults to all.

element.name: name
element.description: A unqiue name for the request.

element.name: queue
element.description: The name of an asset processing queue (must exist).

element.name: where
element.description: An optional arbitrary query to determine whether the asset should be enqueued.

element.name: force-content-to-storage
element.description: If true, then any content associated with the asset will be forced to backing storage. This is slower, but guarnatees the content is saved in the event of a (power) failure. Defaults to false.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate a check-sum by re-reading data. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.check.sum.default' has been set. Even though 'gen-csum' is set to false, a check sum may still be generated inline.

element.name: geoshape
element.description: An optional geographic shape for the asset. If there are multiple shapes, the shape of the asset is deemed to be compound.

attribute.name: datum
attribute.description: The mathematical model for the points. Defaults to WGS84.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Should the geomtery be considered the default. Defaults to 'false'. If default, this geometry will be placed at the head of the list of geometries - the head is always the default.

attribute.name: generated-by
attribute.description: What generated the geometry. Defaults to 'user'.

attribute.name: geoid
attribute.description: If the elevation is measured with respect to a geoid rather than the datum, then the geiod name must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: An abitrarry label for this geometry

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of the shape. Defaults to 'point'. If the number of points is one, then the shape will be automatically coerced to type 'point'. A 'compound' shape can contain other shapes.

element.name: holes
element.description: Zero or more geohape elements that are holes within the outer shape. Only rectangle and polygon geoshape types support holes.

element.name: point
element.description: One or more points in the shape. Compound geo shapes must contain other geoshape elements, not points.

element.name: elevation
element.description: The elevation specified in metres.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The latitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: longitude
element.description: The longitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: wkt
element.description: A geometry in WGS84 Well-Known-Text (WKT) format, e.g. 'POINT(10.2 30.5)', 'POLYGON Z((-77.04 38.89 10,-77.03 38.9 12,-77.03 38.89 12,-77.03 38.89 10,-77.04 38.89 10))'. If supplied all points are ignored and the geometry is derived from the WKT geometry definition.

element.name: get-related-meta
element.description: If set and there are related assets, then the metadata for the related assets will also be returned.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve inverse relationship types. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: Specifies the number of levels out to go retrieving related metadata. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: primary
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve primary relationship types. Defaults to true.

element.name: get-user-meta
element.description: If set and there is a 'user' (created with the service 'user.create') for the given revision history, the user metadata will also be returned.

element.name: index
element.description: The type of indexing to perform. The default is 'all'. Once indexed (or not), an asset is indexed (or not) for all versions.

element.name: inherit-acls
element.description: Determines if the asset or collection asset inherits ACLs from its parent namespace or parent collection. If set to true actor's maximal access will be determined by merging asset's ACL with parent's ACL, i.e. if asset's ACL allows read, but parent's ACL allows modify, actor will have modify access.If set to only-if-no-acls parent's ACL will only be checked if the asset has no ACL.If set to false parent's ACL will never be checked. Defaults to: only-if-no-acls

element.name: inherit-member-asset-meta
element.description: Inherit asset metadata from parent collection asset(s) and namespace(s). Setting to 'false' will stop an asset witin the collection hierarchy from obtaining any inherited or propagated asset metadata from collections or namespaces above this. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: inherit-templates
element.description: Inherit templates from parent collectons(s) and namespace(s). Defaults to true.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: lctype
element.description: Logical MIME type of the content, if there is content. If not specified, then auto-typed from the content extension/analyzers. The logical can be different from the encapulation type, and determines how the content is interpreted. For instance, a logical 'application/abc' type may be encapsulated in an 'application/zip' format.

element.name: licence
element.description: If true, then this asset is a licence that can control the use and dissemination of other assets. Defaults to false.

element.name: licences
element.description: If licence assets exist which cover this asset they can be associated here. Non-existent licences and non-licences will be ignored.

element.name: licence
element.description: A licence asset which covers to this asset. If the licence can not be found or the asset is not a licence it will be ignored.

element.name: link
element.description: The asset is a link to something

element.name: posix-symlink
element.description: Indicates the asset is a POSIX symlink and this is the value for the link.

element.name: lock
element.description: If set to true, creates a write lock on the asset. By default, is false.

attribute.name: timeout
attribute.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds the lock should be held before automatic release. If not specified, defaults to infinite.

element.name: lock-comment
element.description: Reason for acquiring the lock.

element.name: member-acl
element.description: Access control list for the assets contained within this collection..

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: Access permissions for non-collection assets within the collection. 'administer' allows the actor to grant/revoke permissions on non-collection members. 'create allows the actor to create non-collection assets. 'access' allows the actor to access (read) a non-collection member asset. 'modify' allows the actor to modify (write) the metadata for a non-collection member. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy non-collection assets (destroy also requires permission to modify the non-collection asset's metadata and content). 'licence' allows the actor to change the licence associated with a non-collection member. One of 'collection' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.name: asset-content
element.description: Content specific access for assets within the collection. This is a refinement of the general asset access. If 'access', then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

element.name: collection
element.description: Access permissions for collection assets within the collection. 'access' means read access (ability to retrieve metadata, etc.) for sub-collections. 'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of any members. 'add-member' allows the actor to add assets to this collection. 'remove-member' allows the actor to remove assets from this collection. 'create' allows the actor to create collections. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy collections (destroy also requires permission to modify the collection asset's metadata and content). 'execute' allows the actor to descend into (POSIX) sub-collections. 'modify' enables the actor to modify the state of a sub-collection. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: member-asset-meta
element.description: For collections specifies metadata to be automatically inherited by or propagated to member assets. Inheritance or propagation are controlled by the documents ability to be in inherted or propagated.

attribute.name: inherit
attribute.description: Document types tagged as INHERITABLE will propagate by default. Inheritable fragments will not exist on the asset themselves and cannot be edited within the asset, but will be combined with any metadata the asset has when viewed. Inherited metadata fragments as marked as being 'inherited'. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable inheritance for these fragments for each supplied document type.

attribute.name: propagate
attribute.description: Document types tagged as PROPAGABLE will propagate by default. Propagable fragments will be added to the metadata of any asset created within this namespace. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable propagation for these fragments for each supplied document type.

element.name: member-meta-acl
element.description: For collections specifies access control list for metadata on member assets.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the document type.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: document
element.description: The type of access to grant to the metadata document. The absence of any access denotes no access. 'create' plus 'modify' is equivalent to 'publish'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: type
element.description: The fully qualified document type the ACL applies to.

element.name: member-template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? This collection only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: members
element.description: Collection members. Members can be added using a static or dynamic (the default) query resulting in a set of asset ids. If configured, the asset will automatically be marked as a collection.

element.name: filter
element.description: Arbitrary filter names.

element.name: query
element.description: A query selecting members for this asset collection. The default behaviour will see the query evaluated each time the asset collection members are resolved. If the 'static' attribute is enabled the query is resolved immediately and the resulting assets added as static members.

attribute.name: static
attribute.description: If enabled results from the query will be added as static members to the asset collection.

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing meta information documents for the asset. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

element.name: model
element.description: A model for the structure and capabilities of this asset. If specified, and the model is a root object then the model will allocate a root identifier. For any other object, either the pid or pcid must be supplied, depending on the model hierarchy type.

element.name: model-root
element.description: If true, then this asset is the root for an instance of a model. Defaults to false.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace or collection) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset is not named.

attribute.name: auto-rename-if-clash
attribute.description: If true, then automatically rename the asset to avoid name collisions. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace of the asset. [default is the root namespace]

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: owner
element.description: Options

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The identity of the user.

element.name: pcid
element.description: Optional parent (global) citeable identifier - if supplied, then the asset will be allocated a citeable identifier within the scope of this parent identifier.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Controls automatic proxy generation. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.proxy.generation.default' has been set.

element.name: pid
element.description: Optional parent collection identifier. If specified, the parent must be a collection.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true, and the pid is specified as path=<path>, then create all parent paths. Defaults to false.

element.name: private
element.description: If true, then an ACL will be added to the asset for the caller, that indicates the asset is visiable and modifiable only by the 'owner' if set, or the caller.

element.name: propagate-acls
element.description: If set to true, the asset will propagate to related assets any ACLs on this asset. Defaults to false.

element.name: quota
element.description: A space quota to add to the collection (ignored if not a collection). The quota applies to all content in the collection (irrespective of backing store) and all descendent collections.

element.name: allocation
element.description: The quota in bytes (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). (If not specified the quota defaults to 9223372036854775807.)

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for quota.

element.name: on-overflow
element.description: What should occur if use exceeds the quota? Defaults to fail

element.name: owner
element.description: User that manages/owns this quota. Can be contacted changes to the quota

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: trigger
element.description: Describes a relative use threshold an action that should occur when the threshold is crossed.

element.name: direction
element.description: Determines whether the action is triggered when use increases past the threshold or when use drop belose the threshold (default is increase)

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute then the event is triggered. This is an inline script that will be passed the following arguments: collection,allocation,used,threshold,direction=above|below.

element.name: threshold
element.description: The relative use of the quota (0=empty, 0.5=50%, 1=full)

element.name: readonly
element.description: If set to true, the asset cannot be modified once created. Defaults to false.

element.name: related
element.description: An asset relationship.

element.name: from
element.description: Related asset identifier. A relationship will be established from this specified asset to the new asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: from-cid
element.description: Related asset citeable identifier. A relationship will be established from this specified asset to the new asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: to
element.description: Related asset identifier. A relationship will be established from this new asset to this specified asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: to-cid
element.description: Related asset citeable identifier. A relationship will be established from this new asset to this specified asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: related-type
element.description: If specified and 'get-related-meta' is specified, then only relationships of this type will be returned. If not specified, then all relationships are returned.

element.name: set-owner
element.description: If true, the owner of the asset will also be set. Defaults to false. The owner can change permissions with actor.grant and actor.revoke. If the 'owner' argument is specified, then owner is set independently of set-owner.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of the store. If set, this will override the default namespace store. Ignored if there is no content.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of the data store policy to employ which will automatically select a data store for the content. If set, this will override the default namespace store. Ignored if there is no content.

element.name: sub-asset-content
element.description: Indicates the content for this asset is contained withing another asset.

element.name: end
element.description: The end (byte) offset. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the referenced asset

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: The version of the asset. Defaults to zero (latest).

element.name: start
element.description: The start (byte) offset. Defaults to zero.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag on an asset.

element.name: description
element.description: An optional description to associate with this tag.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a term from a dictionary. The tag must exist as a term in the dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: The dictionary containing the term. If unspecified, then uses the default dictionary.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: type
element.description: MIME type of the asset. If not specified, then typed from the content.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to the content for the asset. If the URL is specified, then no content may be passed with the request. Of course, the given URL must be accessible by the server. The URL may specify the location of a file or directory. If a directory, then the directory will be automatically compressed with compress-level set to 0.

attribute.name: by
attribute.description: Whether the content is stored by value (that is, a copy within the server - either copied or moved) or by reference (that is, a link to external content). 'value' is means 'copy', but exists for backwards compatibility. 'move' will delete the source if possible (must be a file). 'move' is only possible on the same file systems, if not possible then 'move' is converted to 'copy-and-delete'. 'managed-reference' means leave the data in place, but take over (if possible), so that deleting the asset will also delete the referenced (file). Defaults to 'value'.

attribute.name: compress-level
attribute.description: If by 'value', then the data may be compressed by specifying a compression level. The archive format will be AAR. By default no compression applied.

attribute.name: include-root-dir
attribute.description: If URL points to a directory, this specifies whether or not that directory should be included in the archive file system. Defaults to 'true' indicating that the root directory must be included.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.description: Identifies this input as a 'resource' which may then be used for clustered I/O and queue management.

element.name: versioned
element.description: Controls whether multiple versions of the asset maintained. Set to false to automatically destroy previous versions on update. Defaults to true.

element.name: xml-content
element.description: Content set as XML. This will be stored in the content for the asset.

service.name: asset.data.transmit.send.to
service.description: Transmit data from the given URL to the specified destination.

element.name: check-sum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate checksums on network packets. If not set, controlled by overall session.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the transmission.

element.name: destination
element.description: The end-point for the transmission.

element.name: address
element.description: A server.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: An arbitrary name for the address

element.name: allow-untrusted
element.description: Set to false if encryption is enabled, and the server need not be trusted. Defaults to true.

element.name: encrypt
element.description: Set to true if the specified port expects encrypted communications.

element.name: host
element.description: The FQDN or IP address of the destination server.

element.name: ip-version
element.description: IP version. Defaults to 'any'.

element.name: port
element.description: The port number.

element.name: protocol
element.description: The communication protocol. Defaults to 'http'.

element.name: as
element.description: The credentials to use. If not specified, uses default credentials for this server.

attribute.name: uuid
attribute.description: The unique identifier of the server for the credentials.

element.name: check-sum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate checksums on network packets. Defaults to true.

element.name: dst
element.description: A destination end-point of the form: protocol:path

element.name: force-to-stable-storage
element.description: Can be set to override outer setting on a per-destination basis.

element.name: local-bind-address
element.description: The IP address to bind to locally. If unspecified, system chooses an interface.

element.name: local-bind-port
element.description: A port number to bind to. If unspecified, system chooses a port.

element.name: max-nb-connections
element.description: The number of network connections to this destination. Defaults to 4.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a predefined server configuration.

element.name: send-buffer-size
element.description: The size in bytes of the network receive buffer size (value of SO_SNDBUF). If unset, defaults to operating system and TCP/IP value which is typically 64KB.

element.name: token
element.description: A secure token for use with the destination server.

attribute.name: app
attribute.description: The application that generated the token, if any.

element.name: user
element.description: User credentials.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: password
element.description: The authentication password.

element.name: user
element.description: The authentication user.

element.name: force-to-stable-storage
element.description: Controls whether or not to force data to stable storage at the receiving end. If not set, controlled by overall session.

element.name: name
element.description: Arbitrary name for the transmission.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified namespace, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the namespace - it will simply walk down the namespace tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: object-processing-threads
element.description: The number of object processing threads (open, read, transmit). Defaults to 1.

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' for AQL and namespace()>='/' for FAQL - that is, all assets. If there is more than one where clause, then the second and subsequent clauses are evaluated (linearly) against the result set of the first where clause (a post filter).

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

service.name: asset.derived.create
service.description: Creates a derived asset. If required, the asset is created within a namespace. The type of the asset must correspond to one of the valid asset processor types.

element.name: args
element.description: Arguments for the processor. The exact form of the arguments is determined by the processor type.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset is not named.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace of the asset. [default is the root namespace]

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: type
element.description: The processor type of the asset.

service.name: asset.derived.get
service.description: Returns the settings (value) for the derived asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.derived.set
service.description: Modifies a derived asset's parameters.

element.name: args
element.description: Arguments for the processor. The exact form of the arguments is determined by the processor type.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset is not named.

element.name: type
element.description: The processor type of the asset.

element.name: unlock
element.description: If set to true, removes any lock on the asset after updating. By default, is false.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Controls whether locks should also be released for all descendants. The default is set to true.

service.name: asset.derived.type.describe
service.description: Describes the available derived asset (processor) types. Includes the definition of the arguments.

element.name: type
element.description: The processor type of the asset. If not specified, describes all types.

service.name: asset.derived.type.list
service.description: Returns the available derived asset (processor) types.

service.name: asset.destroy
service.description: Destroys all or a specified version of an asset.

element.name: alternate-id
element.description: An alternate identifier of the asset.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The alternate identifier type

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: atomic
element.description: Should destroying the asset (and related assets) be an atomic operation? Defaults to false for CIDs and false for non-CID asset identifiers.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: imc
element.description: Ignore missing content? Defaults to false - an error will be thrown if the content cannot be accessed and destroyed.

element.name: members
element.description: When an asset has a citeable identifier or is a collection, should (static) members of that collection also be destroyed if all versions of the asset are destroyed? Defaults to true for citeable assets and false for non-citeable assets.

element.name: node
element.description: The path to the node

service.name: asset.doc.reset
service.description: Resets the (system) document definitions to their default values. Creates a new version.

element.name: schema
element.description: The schema to apply the reset. If not specified, defaults to 'all'

element.name: type
element.description: Document type. If not specified, all reset.

service.name: asset.doc.template.as.xml
service.description: Returns simple XML populated from the given template definition. The resultant XML will contain constant and default values.

element.name: include-default
element.description: Include elements with default values. By default will only include constant values

element.name: template
element.description: A template to overlay on the document definition for a specific purpose. Templates should only be used when describing a single document type.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The document type name to which this template applies.

element.name: document
element.description: Existing values, if any, that should be feed into the template. For example, extracted from a populated asset.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition defined by the template.

service.name: asset.doc.type.create
service.description: Creates a new document type.

element.name: allow-incomplete
element.description: Determines whether or not this document definition is explicity allowed (or not) to be incomplete. If 'maybe' (the default), then policy is controlled by caller.

element.name: definition
element.description: The definition of the document type.

element.name: element
element.description: Document element.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: Set to false if the element is no longer in active use.

attribute.name: case-sensitive
attribute.description: For enumeration types, indicates whether case is important. Default is case insensitive.

attribute.name: comparable
attribute.description: Set to true if type is a string and it is intended to perform comparisons or sorting on that string. If not set, a string is tokenized during indexing (if set), but two values cannot be compared. The first 128 characters (at most) will be comparable.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the element.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary-auto
attribute.description: For strings, if set, uses this dictionary to store (automatically populated) values found in the string.

attribute.name: display-length
attribute.description: For strings, a suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

attribute.name: encrypt
attribute.description: Set to true if the element value should be stored in encrypted form. If not set, defaults to no encryption. Encrypted elements cannot be indexed.

attribute.name: enumerated-values
attribute.description: For enumeration types, is a comma separated list of valid values. Mandatory for enumeration types if 'dictionary' is not specified.

attribute.name: ignore-descendants
attribute.description: Should any arbitrary descendants of this node be ignored when validating? If 'true' then don't include sub-elements. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set to true if the element should be indexed for searching. If not set, defaults to no indexing.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the element.

attribute.name: label-plural
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for plural form of the the element.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: For strings, is the maximum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to max. integer.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the maximum value. If not specified, defaults to max. integer or float.

attribute.name: max-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the minimum value. If not specified, defaults to min. integer or float.

attribute.name: min-length
attribute.description: For strings, is the minimum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to 1.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines minimum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the element.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: For strings, defines a regular expression that the string must conform. If not specified, an arbitrary pattern is used, equivalent to: '[^]+?'.

attribute.name: recurse
attribute.description: Can this element be a sub-element of self? Defaults to false.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Data type of the value.

attribute.name: case-sensitive

attribute.name: comparable
attribute.description: Set to true if type is a string and it is intended to perform comparisons or sorting on that string. If not set, a string is tokenized during indexing (if set), but two values cannot be compared. The first 128 characters (at most) will be comparable.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the element.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: enumerated-values

attribute.name: length

attribute.name: name

element.name: time-include-milliseconds
element.description: If including time, should it exclude the milliseconds part, i.e., in the form HH:MM:SS, or include milliseconds in the form HH:MM:SS.sss. Defaults to false.

element.name: time-include-seconds
element.description: If including time, should it exclude the seconds part, i.e., in the form HH:MM, or include seconds. Defaults to true.

element.name: time-zone-offset
element.description: The timezone to interpret date and time. If unspecified, defaults to the zone for the session or system.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Double precision point number restriction.

element.name: maximum
element.description: The maximum value. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: minimum
element.description: The minimum value. Defaults to -infinity.

element.description: A symbolic definition.

element.name: range
element.description: The symbol may represent a range of values

attribute.name: inc
attribute.description: Is value inclusive of the maximum. Defaults to true.

element.description: Forces the string to upper, lower or title case - not for validation, but for coersion. Use a pattern for validation.

attribute.description: If set to true, then this dictionary will be populated with indexed values. Defaults to false.

element.name: display-length
element.description: A suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

element.name: lines
element.description: The number of lines. A value greater than one indicates multi-line text. Defaults to 1. This is typically a hint for presentation.

element.description: The maximum length of the string. By default unbounded.

element.name: min-length
element.description: The minimum length of the string. By default has a value of 1.

element.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

element.description: A regular expression with which the value must comply.

attribute.description: An optional (human friendly) explanation or example of the pattern.

element.description: A string that is deemed to be 'text' is likely to contain words, and should be indexed as such. If not text, then not expected to contain words. Defaults to true.
