element.name: max-length
element.description: The maximum length of the string. By default unbounded.

element.name: min-length
element.description: The minimum length of the string. By default has a value of 1.

element.name: password
element.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

element.name: pattern
element.description: A regular expression with which the value must comply.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: An optional (human friendly) explanation or example of the pattern.

element.name: text
element.description: A string that is deemed to be 'text' is likely to contain words, and should be indexed as such. If not text, then not expected to contain words. Defaults to true.

element.name: restriction
element.description: URL restriction.

element.name: protocol
element.description: Supported protocol.

element.name: special-value
element.description: The definition of a special (out of band) value.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the special value.

element.name: value
element.description: The special value (e.g. "missing")

element.name: value
element.description: Specified value for the attribute

attribute.name: as
attribute.description: Binding. Defaults to 'default'. Constants cannot be changed.

element.name: reference
element.description: Reference to another element or attribute. Specifies the relative or absolute path for an 'element' or a document name.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the element.

attribute.name: label-plural
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for plural form of the the element.

attribute.name: max-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines minimum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the reference element.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of reference. An element must occur within this definition.

element.name: description
element.description: Description of the element.

element.name: instructions
element.description: End user instructions for the element.

element.name: value
element.description: XPath to element within document or document name. The referent must exist at the time this reference is made.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the document.

element.name: dictionary-auto
element.description: For nodes where the data type will use a dictionary when indexed (e.g. strings), this is the default dictionary to use. Can be overridden for each node.

element.name: for
element.description: Which object type is the document relevant for. If the document type relates to collections then it can not also be used for assets. If the document type relates to assets then it can not also be used for collections. Applied only on create if document type does not exist. Defaults to 'asset'.

element.name: generated-by
element.description: Is this metadata generated by a (plugin) 'application', by a content 'analyzer' or by the 'user'. Defaults to 'user' generated.

element.name: index
element.description: Sets the default indexing for all nodes. If set to 'all', then all nodes will be indexed by default, unless there is an explicity 'index=false' for a particular node. If 'none' then no nodes will be indexed, unless there is an explicit 'index=true' for a given node. The default is 'index=none'.

element.name: instructions
element.description: Instructions for people filling in this document.

element.name: label
element.description: An alternate name (from type) for the document.

element.name: mimetype
element.description: A MIME type to associate with this document. The type may be a super-type. If not specified, associated with all types. If specified, overrides all other type associations for this document.

element.name: source-of-truth
element.description: This document type definition is a source of truth and will not be overwritten during any replication event or archive restoration. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: tag
element.description: An arbitrary tag for the document type. Types can be filtered by tags.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type.

service.name: asset.doc.type.usage
service.description: Returns an indication of whether or not this document (type) has been used or not.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type.

service.name: asset.doc.type.validate
service.description: Validates an XML fragment against a specified document definition. Generates an exception if invalid.

element.name: allow-incomplete
element.description: Should the document be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: context
element.description: Arbitrary XPath for validation context.

element.name: document
element.description: Contains one or more document fragments to validate against a document definition.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type.

service.name: asset.doc.xml.template.merge
service.description: Processes an XML template from an asset or from xml provided. Merge the 'xelement' and 'xattribute' with the definitions for those values.

element.name: id
element.description: The id or path to an asset containing XML content for the template.

element.name: xml
element.description: Optional xml template containing tokens to be replaced. Either id ot xml must be supplied

service.name: asset.doi.endpoint.get
service.description: Returns the host that will contain/resolve objects when minting digital object identifiers.

service.name: asset.doi.mint
service.description: Create a digital object identifier for this asset (and optionally version).

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier or an alterate identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.doi.object.describe
service.description: Describe a specific DOI instance.

element.name: id
element.description: The Mediaflux allocated identfier for a DOI object.

service.name: asset.doi.provider.describe
service.description: Describes the digital object identifier (DOI) provider that has been configured, if any.

element.name: check-availability
element.description: Check whether the service is available. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.duplicate.count
service.description: Analyzes the database to find assets with duplicate content and returns the number of duplicates (and sized), if any.

element.name: collection
element.description: A specific collection asset to check for member duplicates.

element.name: compare-to
element.description: Specifies what the selected set should be compared to. If 'duplicate-collection' or 'duplicate-where' is set, then defaults to 'other' (that set). Otherwise, defaults to 'other' (comparing to all assets). If set to 'self' and no other set is specified, the looks for duplicates in the set defined by 'collection' and/or 'where'. Defaults to 'other'

element.name: dsize
element.description: The maximum number of bytes to perform difference checking. Defaults to 0. Set to zero to disable byte-by-byte comparison.

element.name: duplicate-collection
element.description: If specified, then the duplicates must exist in this collection.

element.name: duplicate-where
element.description: If specified, then the duplicates must exist in this set.

element.name: where
element.description: If specified, defines the subset (query) on which to find duplicates.

service.name: asset.duplicate.find
service.description: Analyzes the database to find assets with duplicate content and returns a report of duplicates, if any. Will return the top (size) duplicates sorted from least to most wasted space.

element.name: as
element.description: Indicates how the results should be returned. The default it 'results'. If 'iterator', then return as a handle to an iterator to be accessed using the service 'asset.duplicate.iterate'.

element.name: collection
element.description: A specific collection asset to check for member duplicates.

element.name: compare-to
element.description: Specifies what the selected set should be compared to. If 'duplicate-collection' or 'duplicate-where' is set, then defaults to 'other' (that set). Otherwise, defaults to 'other' (comparing to all assets). If set to 'self' and no other set is specified, the looks for duplicates in the set defined by 'collection' and/or 'where'. Defaults to 'other'

element.name: dsize
element.description: The maximum number of bytes to perform difference checking. Defaults to 0. Set to zero to disable byte-by-byte comparison.

element.name: duplicate-collection
element.description: If specified, then the duplicates must exist in this collection.

element.name: duplicate-where
element.description: If specified, then the duplicates must exist in this set.

element.name: id
element.description: A specific asset to check for duplicates.

element.name: max-nb-groups
element.description: The maximum number of duplicate (groups) to return. Defaults to 1000.

element.name: max-nb-per-group
element.description: The maximum number of duplicates per group to return. Defaults to 10.

element.name: output-format
element.description: If the query is to generate the output to a data output, then controls the format of the output.

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: Character encoding. Must be one of the encodings returned by the service 'system.character.encoding.list'.

attribute.name: separator
attribute.description: For CSV exports with multivalued cells this is the value separator (defaults to <LF><CR>).

element.name: where
element.description: If specified, defines the subset (query) of assets to search for duplicates. If not specified, then searches for duplicates in all assets.

service.name: asset.duplicate.iterate
service.description: Iterate over more results in a duplicates iterator generated by the service asset.duplicate.find. When completed, or if it throws an exception, the iterator can no longer be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the iterator.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 100 for actions returning results.

service.name: asset.exists
service.description: Returns true if the asset exists, and false if not.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset. If not specified, then 'cid' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: rid
element.description: The remote identifier of the asset.

service.name: asset.explode.transform.template.describe
service.description: Describes Exploded Assets Transform Templates.

element.name: template
element.description: The name of a specifc namespace template

element.name: type
element.description: The archive asset mime type that this profile applies to. If not specified it can be used for all mime types.

service.name: asset.explode.transform.template.list
service.description: List Transform Templates for exploding assets.

element.name: type
element.description: The archive asset mime type that this profile applies to. If not specified it can be used for all mime types.

service.name: asset.export
service.description: Exports assets to a specified URL / destination (e.g. a file system). If an output is provided, a log of the export will be returned.

element.name: collisions
element.description: Hows should existing files be treated when found during export. 'rename' finds the next suitable name for the file with a unique number suffix. Defaults to 'skip'.

element.name: export-file-system-meta
element.description: Export any file system metadata for the file(s). Defaults to false.

element.name: export-root-collection
element.description: If exporting a collection ('id'), then should the collection itself be exported. Defaults to true.

element.name: export-zero-length
element.description: Export asset that has no content. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The path of a (collection) asset to export. All accessible assets contained within the collection will be exported. If not specified, then a where clause must be provided.

element.name: identity
element.description: Configuration for mapping of actors and roles to file system owner and group.

element.name: gid
element.description: A default group GID to apply where no group is known. By default the GID is not explicitly set if the group is not known allowing the operating system to derive it.

element.name: map
element.description: A named identity map to employ when applying file permissions. If an identity map is not provided file permissions can not be applied.

element.name: uid
element.description: A default owner UID to apply where no owner is found. Defaults to the current actor.

element.name: include-asset-name
element.description: When decompressing an archive should we include the assets name in the directory path. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-content
element.description: Should we export each assets content. If set to 'false' then a metadata profile must be provided. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-licences
element.description: If 'true' any licence assets assigned to the assets being exported will be output to a '__licences' path at the end of the asset export process. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-namespaces
element.description: Should we create a folder for each level of the assets parent namespaces in the output directory. Defaults to 'true'.

attribute.name: parents
attribute.description: The number of parent namespaces to include as parent directories. Defaults to all of them.

element.name: include-parents
element.description: Should we create a folder for each level of the assets parents in the output directory. Defaults to 'true'.

attribute.name: count
attribute.description: The number of parents to include as parent directories. Defaults to all of them.

element.name: layout-template
element.description: Configuration for custom directory layout template with each directory derived from the assets metadata. Only one of 'include-namespaces' or 'layout-template' can be included.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The XPath to assets metadata that will define a directory in the export path,.

element.name: licence
element.description: The asset identifier of a licence to export. Licence files will be output to a '__licences' path at the end of the asset export process

element.name: link
element.description: Should a link to the content be created instead of creating a copy for all content. Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: soft
attribute.description: Should the link by a soft symbolic link. Defaults to a hard link, if supported

element.name: manifest-csv
element.description: Should we generate a CSV manifest of the data exported. Requires a template name to be supplied. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: manifest-csv-template
element.description: The name of an 'application/arc-csv-template' asset containing 'mf-csv-template' metadata defining a CSV template.

element.name: manifest-xml
element.description: Should we generate an XML manifest of the data exported. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: max-nb-failures-to-report
element.description: The maximum number of failures to report. Defaults to 10

element.name: metadata
element.description: Should a sidecar metadata file be created. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: profile
attribute.description: The name of a registered transformation profile.

attribute.name: provider
attribute.description: The name of a registered transformation provider. Defaults to 'XSLT'.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The mime type the transformation provider should generate. Defaults to 'text/xml'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace. All accessible assets contained within the namespace will be exported. If not specified, then a where clause must be provided. If a where clause is provided in addition to the namespace, the namespace path will be removed from the assets namespaces when creating the namespace folders on export.

element.name: order-by-content-create-time
element.description: If true, then export in the order of content creation time ascending. Defaults to false.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: If specified, then export assets as they were at the specified point in time. Default to 'now'.

element.name: store
element.description: The store to attempt to select a copy from. If unspecified or there is no copy in the suggested store, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: url
element.description: The file url to export assets. Supports a file: protocol url.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true the directory will be created if it does not already exists. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: decompress
attribute.description: If true, and any asset is an archive, then the archive will be decompressed. Defaults to false.

element.name: versions
element.description: Should we export all versions of an asset and it's content. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: where
element.description: A selection query. All accessible assets matching this query will be export. If not specified, then a collection or namespace must be provided.

service.name: asset.export.ecp
service.description: Allows the server-side export of one or more assets to a given URL using a Export Control Profile (ECP)

element.name: abort-on-error
element.description: Specifies whether or not the export should be aborted in case of a transfer error. Defaults to 'true' indicating that export should be aborted

element.name: export-empty-namespaces
element.description: Specifies whether or not to export empty namespaces. If set to true, folders will be created for empty namespaces. This only works in conjunction with :namespace argument. It will be ignored if either of :profile or :where arguments are provided. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: filename-collisions
element.description: Specifies how to handle filename collisions. Ignored if :profile is provided. Defaults to 'rename'

element.name: folder-layout
element.description: Specifies the folder layout for exported files. Ignored if :profile is provided. Defaults to 'collection'

attribute.name: parent-count
attribute.description: If folder layout is set to 'collection' this specifies the number of collection parents to include. Ignored otherwise. Defaults to infinity, i.e. all parents

element.name: function-variables
element.description: A collection of one or more FAQL variables that will be added to the ECP and will be available to use within functions.

element.name: variable
element.description: A variable to be added to the FAQL variables.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The data type of the variable. If not supplied defaults to 'string'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The source namespace to export to. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' or citeable 'cid' or 'where' query must be specified.

element.name: posix-mode
element.description: Specifies an octal representation of posix permission mode that will be set to any directory created by services that export data to server side file system. Defaults to '770'.

element.name: profile
element.description: The Export Compilation Profile to apply - that is, any asset of type 'application/arc-ecp' and the specified name. If not supplied then all assets will be exported.

element.name: task-batch-size
element.description: When used task that monitors the progress of the export will update the progress after 'task-batch-size' of work units were completed. Defaults to '100' work units.

element.name: task-count-assets
element.description: Specifies if the assets should be counted before the export begins. This is used by task that tracks the progress of the export so that it can know total number of work units (file transfers). Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: task-name
element.description: Specifies the custom name for the task that monitors the progress of the export. User may track the progress of the task by using server.task.named.describe :name <task name>

element.name: task-remove-after
element.description: Used to specify how many hours after the export is complete do we want the monitoring task to be removed from the system. Defaults to '0' hours, i.e. now.

element.name: task-report-bytes
element.description: Specifies if the task should include bytes transferred as well when updating progress, not just assets transferred. If set to true, bytes transferred will be reported once every second. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: url
element.description: The location to export to.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true the directory will be created if it does not already exists. Defaults to false.

element.name: where
element.description: Specifies the AQL. Assets matching the AQL will be considered for export. If not specified then a non-citeable 'id' or citeable 'cid' or 'namespace' must be is specified

service.name: asset.export.record
service.description: Records an export event for the selected assets. The assets exported are referenced anonymously as children of this asset. If a parent asset is supplied (collection asset) then it's metadata is added to the record and a relationship is created between the asset and the export record created.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of a collection asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: collection-type
element.description: The type of collection asset export

element.name: description
element.description: A description for this asset

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a collection asset being exported. Collection must contain child assets.

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing additional metadata for the asset. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

element.name: model
element.description: The name of a model entity to use for this export record

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to store the export record asset. If not supplied defaults to '/system/export/records'

element.name: note
element.description: A note to apply to the export record

element.name: stime
element.description: The maximum stime of assets in an exported collection asset.

element.name: usage
element.description: The destination for this export action.

element.name: where
element.description: The query selecting the assets to attach to the export record

service.name: asset.filter.create
service.description: Creates a named asset filter that can be used in asset queries to sub-set the result set. Filters are useful for creating pre-defined query sets without need to construct a query every time.

element.name: arg
element.description: An argument that will be used as a variable in the query expression.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description, if any, for the argument.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the argument. The data type of the argument will depend on it's usage context.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the filter.

element.name: expr
element.description: The definition (expression) for the filter. Refer to information on the structure of filter XML queries for more information on the required structure.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the filter.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The filter namespace in which to create this filter. If unspecified, then a personal filter.

service.name: asset.filter.describe
service.description: Returns the known filters in a personal, or other namespace.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the filter. If unspecified, then describes all filters in the specified namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The filter namespace in which to list filters. If unspecified, then lists personal filters.

service.name: asset.filter.destroy
service.description: Destroys the specified filter in a personal, or other namespace.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the filter. If unspecified, then describes all filters in the specified namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The filter namespace in which to list filters. If unspecified, then lists personal filters.

service.name: asset.filter.list
service.description: Returns the known filters in a personal, or other namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The filter namespace in which to list filters. If unspecified, then lists personal filters.

service.name: asset.function.execute
service.description: Returns the result of the supplied expression. Accepts an optional XML Input File to operate on using the xelement() Function

element.name: debug
element.description: Generate debug information. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: expression
element.description: The expression to execute. Example: add(2,4)

element.name: id
element.description: The id of an asset to use as the context for xml functions.

element.name: variable
element.description: A named variable to add to the scope

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable

service.name: asset.geo.all.remove
service.description: Removes all geoshapes from an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.geo.bounding.box
service.description: For assets that have geometry, returns the bounding box (rectangle). Must specify either an asset or a where clause.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: where
element.description: A query for to select assets. The bounding box will be computed from all.

service.name: asset.geo.compound.create
service.description: For assets that have geometry, returns a composite compound geoshape containing all geometry from all assets. The resulting compound geometry is either returned as XML or a new asset can be created containing the compound shape.

element.name: asset
element.description: Should an asset be created from the compound geoshape generated. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of a geospatial asset to combine into an single compound shape

element.name: name
element.description: If an asset should be created with the compound geoshape, what name should be applied. Defaults to no name.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If an asset should be created with the compound geoshape, which namespace should it be created in. Defaults to the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: type
element.description: If an asset should be created with the compound geoshape, what mime type should be assigned. Defaults to 'content/unknown'

element.name: where
element.description: An AQL query selecting geospatial assets to combine into an single compound shape.

service.name: asset.geo.default.set
service.description: Configures the default geoshape for assets with more than one geometry. Provides the ability to specify the new default by named label or oridinal index.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: The label of the shape. If multiple geoshapes exist with the same label then the first ordinally will be used.

element.name: sid
element.description: The identity of the shape.

service.name: asset.geo.image.create
service.description: Returns a transparent PNG image containing rendered geoshape footprints for a specific geospatial extent. Layers of assets can be added with their own formatting.

element.name: extent
element.description: The bounding extent of the geospatial region.

element.name: east
element.description: The maximum longitude of the extent.

element.name: north
element.description: The maximum latitude of the extent.

element.name: south
element.description: The minimum latitude of the extent.

element.name: west
element.description: The minimum longitude of the extent.

element.name: height
element.description: The height of the image to generate. If only the height is supplied the image will be generated to fit within a box of this size. If neither a height or width are supplied a default box of '2048' will be applied.

element.name: layer
element.description: A layer of assets to add to the image. Layers are added to the image in order resulting in the last being top most layer.

element.name: anti-alias
element.description: Should the rendering of the geometry use antialiasing. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: fill
element.description: The format of the rendered geometry fill

element.name: color
element.description: The hexadecimal colour value. Defaults to '#0000ff'

element.name: transparency
element.description: The transparency value from 0 (transparent) to (1) opaque. Defaults to '0.15'

element.name: line
element.description: The format for the rendered geometry outline

element.name: color
element.description: The hexadecimal colour value. Defaults to '#0000ff'

element.name: transparency
element.description: The transparency value from 0 (transparent) to (1) opaque. Defaults to '0.8'

element.name: width
element.description: The border width. Defaults to '1'.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the layer.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified namespace, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the namespace - it will simply walk down the namespace tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: point
element.description: The format of the rendered point.

element.name: radius
element.description: The radius of a point. Defaults to '5'.

element.name: resolution
element.description: The resolution of a degree per pixel. If not supplied the point resolution is computed from the supplied extents and the image dimensions.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The resolution of a point in latitude.

element.name: longitude
element.description: The resolution of a point in latitude.

element.name: min-points
element.description: The number of geometry points after which simplification is performed. Defaults to '20'.

element.name: where
element.description: An AQL query selecting assets to add to the image.

element.name: url
element.description: A server accessible URL where the image will be output.

element.name: width
element.description: The width of the image to generate. If only the width is supplied the image will be generated to fit within a box of this size. If neither a height or width are supplied a default box of '2048' will be applied.

service.name: asset.geo.rectangle.unwrap
service.description: For assets that are spatially a rectangle, will flip (unrwap) the north/south latitude if north<south or the east/west longitude if east<west.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.geo.rectangle.wrapped
service.description: For assets that are spatially a rectangle, tests if the north/south latitude or the east/west longitude are flipped (wrapped).

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.geo.remove
service.description: Removes geoshapes from an asset.

element.name: generated-by
element.description: Remove geometry added by specific types of generator. This may be user, by analyzer or by time series.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: The label of the new default geoshape. If multiple geoshapes exist with the same label then the first ordinally will be used.

attribute.name: prefix
attribute.description: Is the supplied label a prefix. Defailts to false

element.name: sid
element.description: The identity of the shape.

service.name: asset.geo.resolution.all.remove
service.description: Removes all pre-computed geoshapes from an asset.

element.name: generated-by
element.description: Filter by source of generation.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: label
element.description: Filter by label.

attribute.name: prefix
attribute.description: Is the supplied label a prefix. Defailts to false

element.name: sid
element.description: The identity of the shape.

service.name: asset.geo.resolution.generate
service.description: Returns the set of pre-computed shape resolutions for an asset.

element.name: generated-by
element.description: Filter by source of generation.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: label
element.description: Filter by label.

attribute.name: prefix
attribute.description: Is the supplied label a prefix. Defailts to false

element.name: range
element.description: Generate a range of resolutions. Must be specified if no 'resolution' is specified.

element.name: max
element.description: The maximum display resolution for generating shapes. If not specified will be set to longitude=0.8983156581 (100,000 metres per pixel)

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude. Defaults to longitude.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of the resolution per pixel. Defaults to 'metre'.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of the resolution per pixel. Defaults to 'metre'.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 1.

element.name: min
element.description: The maximum display resolution for generating shapes. If not specified will be set to longitude=0.0000044916 (0.5 metres per pixel)

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude. Defaults to longitude.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of the resolution per pixel. Defaults to 'metre'.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of the resolution per pixel. Defaults to 'metre'.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 1.

element.name: steps
element.description: The number of steps to generate between 'min' and 'max' resolution.

element.name: resolution
element.description: Display resolution for generating shapes.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude. Defaults to longitude.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of the resolution per pixel. Defaults to 'metre'.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of the resolution per pixel. Defaults to 'metre'.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 1.

element.name: sid
element.description: The identity of the shape.

service.name: asset.geo.resolution.list
service.description: Returns the set of pre-computed geoshape resolutions for an asset.

element.name: generated-by
element.description: Filter by source of generation.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: label
element.description: Filter by label.

attribute.name: prefix
attribute.description: Is the supplied label a prefix. Defailts to false

element.name: sid
element.description: The identity of the shape.

service.name: asset.get
service.description: Retrieves asset meta data and/or asset data for the specified asset.

element.name: alternate-id
element.description: An alternate identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' or a citeable identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The alternate identifier type

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: check-if-image
element.description: If set, then check to see whether the asset is an image that can be read by the server.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' or an alterate identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: content-as-xml
element.description: Retrieve the content as XML for the asset. This option only applies for assets that have text/xml content.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: format
element.description: If set to extended, then the meta information is returned in a format that describes the elements and attributes. If the mode is 'template', then the full document definition is utilized, with values taken from the asset. Default is 'terse'.

element.name: geo-shape
element.description: The the action is get-geo-shape, then shape parameters may be specified.

element.name: clip
element.description: Clipping rectangle. If specified, then shapes will be clipped to this rectangle.

element.name: east
element.description: Eastern longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: north
element.description: Northern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: south
element.description: Southern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: west
element.description: Western longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of any geometry returned. 'detailed' returns a full xml response with decimal latitude an longitude and the coordinates in degrees, minutes and seconds. 'simple' returns a simplified xml response with only decimal latitude and longitude. 'geojson' returns the geometry in geojson format. 'esrijson' returns the geometry in esri json format. 'esrijsonwm' returns the geometry in esri json web mercator format. 'wkt' returns the geometry in Well-Known-Text geomoetry format. If not supplied defaults to 'detailed'

element.name: resolution
element.description: Display resolution for generating shapes. If unspecified, no sub-sampling occurs.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 20 points.

element.name: get-attributes
element.description: If set will display any configured attributes.

element.name: get-content-status
element.description: If set will determine the status of the content as well.

attribute.name: show-errors
attribute.description: Should any content status exceptions be displayed as well. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: get-content-store-information
element.description: If true, then get additional / extended content information. The extended information depends on the data store type. For some stores, this may be relatively costly. Defaults to false.

element.name: get-full-geo-shape
element.description: If set to true, then the full geo shape information will be returned. If false (the default), then only the bounding box will be returned for non-point shapes.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The format of the geometry to be returned. 'detailed' returns fully populated xml response with decimal latitude an longitude in addition to the coordinates in degrees, minutes and seconds. 'simple' returns the coordinates in a simplified xml response that includes only decimal latitude and longitude. 'geojson' returns the geometryin geojson format. 'esrijson' returns the geometryin esri json format. 'esrijsonwm' returns the geometry in esri json web mercator format. 'wkt' returns the geometry in Well-Known-Text geomoetry format. Any supplied value is overridden if a format is supplied in 'geo-shape'. If not supplied defaults to 'detailed'

element.name: get-name-history
element.description: If set will display any previous names if the name changed.

element.name: get-related-meta
element.description: If set and there are related assets, then the metadata for the related assets will also be returned.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve inverse relationship types. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: Specifies the number of levels out to go retrieving related metadata. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: primary
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve primary relationship types. Defaults to true.

element.name: get-user-meta
element.description: If set and there is a 'user' (created with the service 'user.create') for the given revision history, the user metadata will also be returned.

element.name: get-versions
element.description: If set to true, returns information about the versions of this asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier or an alterate identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: only-if-exists
attribute.description: If true, then only get the asset if it exists (and don't throw an exception). Defaults to false.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: licence
element.description: Controls for licence acceptance information.

element.name: action
element.description: Specifies the action that will be applied to assets.

element.name: usage
element.description: The specific destination, or usage for the licenced assets.

element.name: lock
element.description: If set to true, creates a write lock on the asset before retrieving. By default, is false. If set, the version must be 0 or not set.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Controls whether locks should also be acquired for all descendants. The default is set to true.

attribute.name: timeout
attribute.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds the lock should be held before automatic release. If not specified, defaults to infinite.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Indicates the type of lock to acquire. 'persistent' locks are associated with the user and last beyond server restarts. 'transient' locks are associated with the session and are released by session termination. The default is set to 'persistent'.

element.name: lock-comment
element.description: Reason for acquiring the lock.

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only), except where specifying a cid (for a non-local asset) or the id is of the form <server>.<id> in which case defaults to 'infinity'. Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: If requesting the asset by path, then the path can be qualified by a specific point in time. Default to 'now'.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed search (citeable identifier or server for identifier is not a direct peer). If unspecified, all availalbe peers will be used.

element.name: related-type
element.description: If specified and 'get-related-meta' is specified, then only relationships of this type will be returned. If not specified, then all relationships are returned.

element.name: service-format
element.description: Controls the display of services associated with this asset. Defaults to 'none'. The equivalent of using 'asset.service.list' or 'asset.service.describe'.

element.name: service-usage
element.description: A service usage context.

element.name: sink
element.description: Indicates the the data (requested) should be sent to a data sink.

element.name: arg
element.description: An optional argument for the sink when it consumes data. Arguments are sink type dependent. These values may augment or override default parameters already configured for the named sink.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument - depends on the sink type

element.name: mtype
element.description: The application MIME type - defaults to the content type.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the sink.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: template-exclude
element.description: Document type names to exclude from templated formating. These documents will tersely formatted.

element.name: template-if-generated-by
element.description: Controls which metadata is converted to a template when the specified format is 'template'. Defaults to 'user'.

element.name: template-if-namespace
element.description: Restrict templating to only those templates in this namespace.

element.name: template-include
element.description: Document type names to include for templated formating. If specified, then only those documents will be templated.

element.name: template-language
element.description: If format template is specified, attempt to translate document decorations into this language. This option can be specified multiple times in which case translations are sought in the order specified. If not translation is found, the document definition text decorations are used.

element.name: transcode
element.description: Indicates the the data (requested) should be transcoded on the fly to some other format.

element.name: from
element.description: The MIME type of this asset - to trigger the transcode. If not specified, defaults to the type of the content, and then the asset if no transcode for the content.

element.name: param
element.description: Optional parameters for the transcoder. The actual parameters depend on the transcoder itself.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.

element.name: to
element.description: The MIME type of the required format.

element.name: transform
element.description: If specified, then transform profile must be specified and will define how metadata is transformed

element.name: parameter
element.description: Optional name parameters which will be supplied to the transform process.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter to be supplied.

element.name: profile
element.description: The transform profile to employ to transform the asset metadata

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to receive the content for the asset. If the URL is specified, then no content may be passed with the request. The given URL must be accessible by the server. The only supported output URLS are file paths.

attribute.name: base
attribute.description: If true, indicates the URL is a base path for the retrieved data. The URL may specify a directory into which the asset's will be placed using their asset identifiers. If not a directory, may specify a base path for the asset(s). The outputs will be generated with the scheme (i) for a path: <base>_<asset id>.<ext>, or (ii) for a directory: <base>/<asset id>.<ext>. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: decompress
attribute.description: If true, and the asset is an archive, then the archive will be decompressed to this directory. Defaults to false.

element.name: variable
element.description: Variables to supply to derived asset.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

element.name: xml-template
element.description: An XML template to be merged with values from the asset. If the format is 'xml-template-merge' then one of 'xml-template' or 'xml-template-id' must be specified.

element.name: xml-template-id
element.description: The identity of an asset containg the template to be merged.

element.name: xpath
element.description: If specified, then only the specified XPath participates in the action.

attribute.name: ekey
attribute.description: Arbitrary, application defined key. If defined, this key will be added to the element as an attribute.

attribute.name: ename
attribute.description: Element name for result. If not specified, defaults to 'value'.

attribute.name: result
attribute.description: Optional FAQL expression that to format the result / value. The result is supplied in a variable named 'result'. For instance to format data sizes, set result to 'data.size.format(result)'.

service.name: asset.hard.destroy
service.description: Destroys all or a specified version of an asset. This is a hard destruction - the asset will be fully removed.

element.name: alternate-id
element.description: An alternate identifier of the asset.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The alternate identifier type

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: atomic
element.description: Should destroying the asset (and related assets) be an atomic operation? Defaults to false for CIDs and false for non-CID asset identifiers.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: imc
element.description: Ignore missing content? Defaults to false - an error will be thrown if the content cannot be accessed and destroyed.

element.name: members
element.description: When an asset has a citeable identifier or is a collection, should (static) members of that collection also be destroyed if all versions of the asset are destroyed? Defaults to true for citeable assets and false for non-citeable assets.

service.name: asset.icon.can.generate
service.description: Returns is an icon representing the asset can be generated. If not a default icon would be returned.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only), except where the id is of the form <server>.<id> in which case defaults to 'infinity'. Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed search (citeable identifier or server for identifier is not a direct peer). If unspecified, all availalbe peers will be used.

service.name: asset.icon.get
service.description: Retrieves an icon to represent the asset. Lossless encoding uses PNG format images. Lossy encoding generally uses JPEG compression.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: height
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the the target width. If not specified, then 'size' will be used. If 'width' or 'height' are specified, then both should be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: lossless
element.description: If set to true, will generate a lossless encoded image. If set to false (the default), will use lossy compression, a function of the quality.

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only), except where the id is of the form <server>.<id> in which case defaults to 'infinity'. Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed search (citeable identifier or server for identifier is not a direct peer). If unspecified, all availalbe peers will be used.

element.name: quality
element.description: The quality of the image generation. This will affect interpolation and compression (if any). The interpolation is as follows: [quality<0.5 -> nearest neighbour, 0.5<=quality<1.0 -> bilinear, quality=1.0 -> bicubic]. Zero is the lowest quality. Defaults to 0.8

element.name: render-hint
element.description: A option / hint to be passed to the underlying image renderer when generating the icon. The hints are renderer specific.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: scale
element.description: Scaling factor. Ignored if 'size' specified.

element.name: size
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the largest dimension (width or height). The icon will only be resized if it is larger than this size. If not specified, size defaults to 32.

element.name: stime
element.description: The server clock time of the content.

attribute.name: server
attribute.description: The server that generated the content.

element.name: variable
element.description: Variables to supply to a customer icon generator/transform.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

element.name: width
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the the target width. If not specified, then 'size' will be used. If 'width' or 'height' are specified, then both should be specified.

service.name: asset.icon.processing.queue.describe
service.description: Display information about icon generation / processing.

service.name: asset.icon.regenerate
service.description: Regenerates the (reference image) icon for the specified asset (and version). The system normally generates an icon automatically. The reference icon size is a server property.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

element.name: render-hint
element.description: A option / hint to be passed to the underlying image renderer when generating the icon. The hints are renderer specific.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: version
element.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.icon.set
service.description: Explicitly sets the icon for an asset (rather than generating one). The supplied image will be converted to an PNG image at setting for the server property icon.reference.size, unless overridden by the argument "size"

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum size of the generated icon. If not specified, defaults to the setting of the server property icon.reference.size

element.name: source-id
element.description: A path to an asset with content which will be applied as the icon.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to the icon for the asset.

service.name: asset.icon.store.default.get
service.description: Returns the name of the default data store for icons, if set.

service.name: asset.icon.unset
service.description: Removes an explicitly applied icon from an asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.identifier.get
service.description: Returns the asset identifier for some other form of identifier.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the asset.

element.name: path
element.description: The path for an asset.

attribute.name: relative-to
attribute.description: If the path is relative, then relative to the given asset.

service.name: asset.identifier.max
service.description: Returns the maximum asset identifier value.

service.name: asset.identifier.min
service.description: Returns the minimum asset identifier value.

service.name: asset.image.describe
service.description: Describes the given image asset (e.g. width and height). If not an image, then an exception will be generated.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only), except where the id is of the form <server>.<id> in which case defaults to 'infinity'. Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed search (citeable identifier or server for identifier is not a direct peer). If unspecified, all availalbe peers will be used.

service.name: asset.image.pyramid.can.generate
service.description: Indicates whetehr or not a pyramid generation is supported for the given asset.

element.name: cid

attribute.name: label

element.name: id

attribute.name: label

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.image.pyramid.clear
service.description: Removes any cached image pyramid for an (image) asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.
