service.description: Describes an image pyramid for an image.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.image.pyramid.generate
service.description: Forces the complete generation and caching of an image pyramid for an (image) asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.image.pyramid.query
service.description: Queries the image pyramid and returns the tiles that intersect a specified region of the image at a specified zoom level.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: region
element.description: The region within the zoom level to be returned. The region dimensions are specified for the given zoom level.

element.name: height
element.description: The height (in pixels) of the region.

element.name: width
element.description: The width (in pixels) of the region.

element.name: x
element.description: The offset (in pixels) from the left of the image.

element.name: y
element.description: The offset (in pixels) from the top of the image.

element.name: zoom
element.description: The zoom level to query. The zoom level must satisfy min-zoom <= zoom <= max-zoom.

service.name: asset.image.pyramid.tile.get
service.description: Returns the underlying image for the specified tile within the (image) asset for the given zoom level.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: x
element.description: The offset (in pixels) from the left of the image.

element.name: y
element.description: The offset (in pixels) from the top of the image.

element.name: zoom
element.description: The zoom level to query. The zoom level must satisfy min-zoom <= zoom <= max-zoom.

service.name: asset.image.readable
service.description: Indicates whether the asset can be read as an image.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only), except where the id is of the form <server>.<id> in which case defaults to 'infinity'. Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed search (citeable identifier or server for identifier is not a direct peer). If unspecified, all availalbe peers will be used.

service.name: asset.import
service.description: Allows the (local) importation of one or more assets from a supplied archive (input), or a given URL. The URL may point to an archive (AAR,JAR,ZIP,TAR, etc.) file containing assets, a directory of assets or a web-site. If a directory, will recurse through all sub-directories. Returns an optional log file of warnings and errors.

element.name: allow-incomplete-meta
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-invalid-meta
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if invalid? Defaults to false. Use with caution.

element.name: analyze
element.description: Should imported assets be analyzed for metadata. Defaults to true.

element.name: atime
element.description: If true, then import access time if available. Defaults to false.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment. If not specified, defaults to 'import'.

element.name: copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to add to the created content copy, if any.

element.name: explode-if-archive
element.description: If true and the source is a recognised archive, then import the contents of that archive. Defaults to false if importing by reference (url) and true if the service is supplied with an input.

element.name: extended-attribute-mapping
element.description: If 'import-extended-attributes' is enabled these arguments provide control over which are imported and how they are mapped to metadata. By default. if 'import-extended-attributes' is enabled all visible extended attributes are imported into an 'arc.extended.attributes' metadata document.

element.name: exclude-prefix
element.description: If an extended attribute exist with this prefix it will not be imported

element.name: include-prefix
element.description: If an extended attribute exist with this prefix it will be imported

element.name: mapping
element.description: If supplied then an extended attribute with this key will be mapped to the supplied metadata node.

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: The extended attribute key to map the value for.

element.name: filter
element.description: A file filter in the form of a regular expression pattern. If any filter is supplied, then all possible filters should be specified. If no filter is supplied, then defaults to .* Filter priority is the order of supply. That is, more explicit filters should be specified before more generalized ones. Only applies when importing files from a directory.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Controls whether these file names/types are included or excluded. Defaults to 'include'.

attribute.name: for
attribute.description: Controls whether the pattern applies the name of the file or the path. Defaults to 'name'.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: Should check sums be generated. Defaults to true.

element.name: generate-directory-name-hash
element.description: if true and importing into a collection. Then store a hash of directory names for improved performance when looking for missing files. Defaults to false.

element.name: geoshape
element.description: An optional geographic shape for the asset. If there are multiple shapes, the shape of the asset is deemed to be compound.

attribute.name: datum
attribute.description: The mathematical model for the points. Defaults to WGS84.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Should the geomtery be considered the default. Defaults to 'false'. If default, this geometry will be placed at the head of the list of geometries - the head is always the default.

attribute.name: generated-by
attribute.description: What generated the geometry. Defaults to 'user'.

attribute.name: geoid
attribute.description: If the elevation is measured with respect to a geoid rather than the datum, then the geiod name must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: An abitrarry label for this geometry

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of the shape. Defaults to 'point'. If the number of points is one, then the shape will be automatically coerced to type 'point'. A 'compound' shape can contain other shapes.

element.name: holes
element.description: Zero or more geohape elements that are holes within the outer shape. Only rectangle and polygon geoshape types support holes.

element.name: point
element.description: One or more points in the shape. Compound geo shapes must contain other geoshape elements, not points.

element.name: elevation
element.description: The elevation specified in metres.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The latitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: longitude
element.description: The longitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: identity-map
element.description: If an identity map is provided the import process attempts to map POSIX permissions and file ownership to users and ACL's within the server.

element.name: import-extended-attributes
element.description: If true, then any extended attributes are imported. This may be user defined metadata on the objects being imported. Defaults to false.

element.name: import-file-permissions
element.description: If true, then import file system identity and permissions (gid, uid and permission bits). Defaults to false.

element.name: import-file-system-meta
element.description: If true, then import POSIX or other file system metadata to be attached to the imported assets. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: ctime
attribute.description: Import creation time. Defaults to true.

element.name: index
element.description: The type of indexing to perform. The default is 'all'. Once indexed (or not), an asset is indexed (or not) for all versions.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: log
element.description: If true, import logging will be generated to the server log. Defaults to false.

element.name: log-member-change
element.description: If true, then log changes in the content of directories. This is set to true, if 'log' is set to true.

element.name: log-unreadable
element.description: If true, then log files that are unreadable. This is set to true, if 'log' is set to true.

element.name: max-size
element.description: Only include files less than this size. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing meta information documents for the asset. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

element.name: min-size
element.description: Only include files of this size or larger. Defaults to zero.

element.name: mode
element.description: A test import will indicate / count what will be imported, whereas 'live' will perform the import. Defaults to 'live'.

element.name: mtime
element.description: Indicates what modification time is set on the asset. If 'file' then the modification time of the external file will be used (requires ADMINISTER permission). If 'now' (the default) then the import time will be used. Only applies when importing files. Does not apply whem importing files from a container such as a zip.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination namespace to import to. If not specified, imports into root namespace. Ignored if the parent asset is specified.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: onerror
element.description: The behaviour to exhibit when encountering an error while importing a file. If set to 'continue' then number of errors encountered will be displayed, however details of any errors will only be logged if 'log' is set to true. Defaults to 'continue'.

element.name: parent
element.description: The destination collection asset to import to.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true, and the pid is specified as path=<path>, then create all parent paths. Defaults to false.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should proxies be automatically generated. Defaults to true.

element.name: recheck-if-exists-before-remove
element.description: If true, the recheck to see of a named file exists before performing any remove. This may add overhead to transactions. Defaults to false.

element.name: remove-missing
element.description: If the source is a file system directory, then the importer can be asked to check and remove assets that no longer appear in the file system, keeping the two in synch.

attribute.name: method
attribute.description: If soft (the default), then mark the assets as destroyed. If 'hard' then actually destroy.

element.name: scan-threads
element.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use for the scanner. Defaults to 1.

element.name: since
element.description: Include files modified since this time. Defaults to the epoch.

element.name: source-as-keywords
element.description: To allow searching on the names of the source path, the importer can tokenize the source and store as keywords on the asset.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified and importing by value, then import asset (content) into this store.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: If specified and importing by value, then import asset (content) using this store policy to select a store.

element.name: symbolic-links
element.description: If true, symbolic links are traversed when walking through the file system. Defaults to false.

element.name: threads
element.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use for asset processing. Defaults to 1.

element.name: trace-queue-wait
element.description: If true, then print out information when importers are waiting on entries in the import queue. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: timeout
attribute.description: The threshold (in milliseconds) for logging queue waits. Defaults to 500

element.name: type
element.description: If importing files, this explicitly specifies the MIME type of the files. The system will attempt to identify if not set.

element.name: update
element.description: Update existing assets? Defaults to true. If set to true, will compare the assets to see if they are different. If they are, then updated.

element.name: url
element.description: The location(s) to import. Either an input or url must be supplied.

attribute.name: by
attribute.description: Asset creation by reference or by value. Defaults to 'value' - the asset will be fully ingested.

attribute.name: ignore-if-missing
attribute.description: If true, then don't generate an error if this referent does not exist. Defaults to 'false' - an error will be generated.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.description: Identifies this input as a 'resource' which may then be used for clustered I/O and queue management.

service.name: asset.import.fcp
service.description: Allows the server-side importation of one or more assets from a given URL using a File Compilation Profile (FCP)

element.name: analyze
element.description: Should imported assets be analyzed for metadata. Defaults to true.

element.name: collection
element.description: A destination/root collection asset to import to. If not specified a namespace will be used - see the 'namespace' parameter for further information.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true, and the pid is specified as path=<path>, then create all parent paths. Defaults to false.

element.name: create-parent
element.description: Should a parent collection asset be created as a record of the ingest with references to all assets imported. If 'true' then any parent asset supplied will be ignored. Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: namespace
attribute.description: An alternate namespace to create the parent collection asset in. Defaults to the same namespace the import is occuring in.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: Should check sums be generated. Defaults to true.

element.name: import-empty-folders
element.description: Specifies whether or not should empty folders be imported. If set to true, namespaces will be created for empty folders. Defaults to false.

element.name: index-content
element.description: Should content be indexed if possible. Defaults to true.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination/root namespace to import to. If not specified, imports into root namespace (or parent-namespace, if specified). Ignored if 'parent' or 'collection' is specified.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: parent
element.description: A collection asset to act as an import record containing references to all of the files imported. This does not affect how the files and directories are created based on the 'namespace' or 'collection' parameter. Ignored if 'create-parent' is true or 'collection' is provided.

element.name: parent-namespace
element.description: The destination namespace for all assets. If specified, the import will be flattened (all assets in the same namespace). If 'namespace' is specified without specifying 'parent-namespace', then the hierarchy is preserved.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should proxies be automatically generated. Defaults to true.

element.name: profile
element.description: The File Compilation Profile to apply - that is, any asset of type 'application/arc-fcp' and the specified name. If not supplied then all assets will be imported.

element.name: task
element.description: Configuration of a named task used to monitor the import. The number of consumed constructs and size of consumed data reported is relative to the FCP used.

element.name: batch-size
element.description: As files in the file system are processed, progress is report. This argument controls how many constructs are processed between progress reports. For an import of a large file-system a low number can impact performance. Defaults to reporting every '100' FCP constructs met.

element.name: count-files
element.description: Should the total number of files in the file system be counted prior to processing. This provides improved progress reportinf but impacts on the total time to import. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name of the task.

element.name: remove-after
element.description: The number of hours to retain the results of the task. Defaults to '0'.

element.name: report-bytes
element.description: Should the total size of files in the file system be counted prior to processing and then monitored during import. This provides improved progress reportinf but impacts on the total time to import. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: threads
element.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use. Defaults to 1.

element.name: update
element.description: Update existing assets? Defaults to true. If set to true, will compare the assets to see if they are different. If they are, then updated.

element.name: url
element.description: The location(s) to import.

service.name: asset.import.metadata.csv
service.description: Imports metadata for one or more assets from a CSV file containing metadata. There may be one or more assets represented in the file.

element.name: asset-cid
element.description: Column number containing the asset citeable id.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function that can be used to generate the asset cid.

element.name: asset-id
element.description: Column number containing the asset id.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function that can be used to generate the asset id.

element.name: crs
element.description: The coordinate reference system for the latitude and longitude. Defaults to GEOGRAPHIC

element.name: crs-utm
element.description: The coordinate reference system is UTM. The zone and hemisphere may be specified, rather than retrieved from a column.

element.name: hemisphere
element.description: The UTM hemisphere: North or South. One of hemisphere or hemisphere-column must be specified.

element.name: zone
element.description: The UTM zone. One of zone or zone-column must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then the data must be supplied.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: identity
element.description: The definition of identity for the asset. If specified, the data may update existing assets (found using the specified identity key), otherwise new assets will be created.

attribute.name: match
attribute.description: Look for any of the given paths, or all of the paths, to establish identity.

element.name: path
element.description: The XPath within the 'asset' to an identity field.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Column number containing latitude.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Column number containing longitude.

element.name: map
element.description: The column to metadata mapping(s). Specifies a metadata document path.

attribute.name: column
attribute.description: The zero-based index of the column number to map to this metadata. The first column in the CSV is 0.

attribute.name: entity
attribute.description: An entity name to which this fragment belongs. The parent must exist or be created during the import.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: Some data types may allow input formatting (e.g. a date). If so, this format is type specific.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function that is to be applied to the value of the metadata field. Commonly used for formatting custom dates and mapping data values.

attribute.name: identity
attribute.description: Is this column used for identity? If it is, then a row will be mapped to an asset that has the same value for the metadata at this column. Defaults to false. This is another way of specifying the 'identity' - in this case the column must match.

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing additional meta information documents for the asset. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

element.name: model
element.description: A model for the structure and capabilities of assets created during this import. Entity names are specified on the column mapping.

element.name: model-root
element.description: The asset id of the model root if more than one exists in the target namespace.

element.name: name
element.description: Column number containing the name of the asset. If supplied, the values in the column must be unique and must not match an existing assets name in the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination namespace. If not specified, will import into the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true, then create the namespace if it does not exist. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace-map
element.description: Column number containing a namespace mapping. If specified and the resulting namespace start with '/', the namespace argument is ignored, otherwise the namespace will be relative to the namespace generated by the namespace argument and any asset model namespace convention.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function that can be used to generate the namespace name.

element.name: nb
element.description: The maximum number of rows to import. Defaults to all.

element.name: nb-header-rows
element.description: The number of header rows to ignore. Defaults to zero.

element.name: related
element.description: An asset relationship.

element.name: from
element.description: Related asset identifier. A relationship will be established from this specified asset to the new asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: from-cid
element.description: Related asset citeable identifier. A relationship will be established from this specified asset to the new asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: to
element.description: Related asset identifier. A relationship will be established from this new asset to this specified asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: to-cid
element.description: Related asset citeable identifier. A relationship will be established from this new asset to this specified asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: skip
element.description: The number of leading rows to ignore. Defaults to nb-header-rows. If supplied, then total number of rows skipped will be nb-header-rows + skip.

element.name: txn-size
element.description: The number of assets to create in each batched transaction. Defaults to 1.

element.name: type
element.description: An optional mime type to apply to the assets created.

element.name: update-multiple
element.description: If true, updates are only applied to all assets matching the identity criteria, updates are only applied to the first asset found. (Defaults to false)

element.name: update-only
element.description: If true, updates are only applied to existing assets, new assets are not created. (Defaults to false)

element.name: url
element.description: A path to the CSV to import.

element.name: utm-hemisphere
element.description: If the coordinate system is UTM, then the column number containing hemisphere, if any.

element.name: utm-zone
element.description: If the coordinate system us UTM, then the column number containing the UTM zone, if any.

element.name: validate-templates
element.description: Should templates be validated? Defaults to true.

service.name: asset.import.metadata.xml
service.description: Imports metadata for one or more assets from an XML file containing metadata. There may be one or more assets represented in the file.

element.name: apath
element.description: The XPath of the entry for each asset. Required if there is multiple asset metadata in the same file. Defaults to '.' meaning single asset per file.

element.name: batch-size
element.description: The number of imports per transaction. A larger number increases performance, but may reduce concurrency. Defaults to 100.

element.name: elevation-path
element.description: The XPath (relative to the asset path) for the elevation (if a point). The elevation will be in metres above sea-level.

element.name: encoding
element.description: The character encoding of the input metadata. Defaults to 'utf8'

element.name: geo-path
element.description: The XPath (relative to the asset path) for the geographic shape. The shape XML element must have an attribute 'type', which specifies the shape type, and contain 'point' elements, each of which contains elements 'latitude' and 'longitude' in decimal degrees. If not specified, defaults to '.'

element.name: id
element.description: The definition of identity for the asset. If specified, the data may update existing assets (found using the specified identity key), otherwise new assets will be created.

attribute.name: match
attribute.description: Look for any of the given paths, or all of the paths, to establish identity.

element.name: path
element.description: The XPath within the 'asset' to an identity field.

attribute.name: as
attribute.description: Map this path to the specified xpath in the target asset. If not specified, then the same as 'path'

element.name: latitude-path
element.description: The XPath (relative to the asset path) for the latitude (if a point). The latitude will be in decimal degrees.

element.name: longitude-path
element.description: The XPath (relative to the asset path) for the longitude (if a point). The latitude will be in decimal degrees.

element.name: mpath
element.description: The XPath (relative to the asset path) for metadata fragments. If not specified, defaults to '.' in which case the asset and metadata are the same.

attribute.name: as
attribute.description: Map this path to the specified document name.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination namespace. If not specified, will import into the root namespace.

element.name: transform
element.description: A specification of any data transformation function that should be applied

element.name: map
element.description: A function defining the transformation to be applied

attribute.name: document
attribute.description: The name of the document the XPath is in. If not supplied that the transformation will be applied to any document with this XPath

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: An XPath to the element being transformed

service.name: asset.index.describe
service.description: Describes both the known non-document and document (type=xpath) indexes.

element.name: rebuilding
element.description: If true, only list indexes that are rebuilding. Defaults to false.

element.name: type
element.description: A non- element or attribute index to describe.

element.name: xpath
element.description: An XPath for an index.

service.name: asset.index.exists
service.description: Indicates whether the specified (non-document) index exists or not.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-element/attribute item.

service.name: asset.index.key.count
service.description: Returns the number of unique keys for a specified index.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-element/attribute item.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The name of a document index. Ignored if type specified.

service.name: asset.index.key.describe
service.description: Returns the unique keys and information about those keys for a specified index.

element.name: key
element.description: An index key to describe. If not specified, all keys described.

element.name: nval
element.description: The number of asset id's to display per key. Defaults to zero.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-element/attribute item.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The name of a document index. Ignored if type specified.

service.name: asset.index.key.list
service.description: Returns the unique keys for a specified index.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-element/attribute item.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The name of a document index. Ignored if type specified.

service.name: asset.index.list
service.description: Returns the known non-document and document (type=xpath) indexes.

element.name: rebuilding
element.description: If true, only list indexes that are rebuilding. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.index.spell
service.description: Spell checker that uses the data within one or more indexes to create a candidate set.

element.name: distance
element.description: The maximum computed difference of the alternate (e.g. Levenshtein distance). Defaults to 4.

element.name: suggest
element.description: The number of suggestions (at most) to make. Defaults to 10.

element.name: text
element.description: Text to check against the indexes.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-element/attribute item.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The name of a document index - an xpath may specify a root node, which matches all indexes below that node.

service.name: asset.index.suggest
service.description: Dynamic suggestions for completing words based on the available text in the specified indexes.

element.name: count
element.description: Should the total number of possible matches be counted. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: each
attribute.description: Total the number of matches for each suggestion. Defaults to true.

element.name: idx
element.description: The cursor position for paging.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of suggestions (at most) to make. Defaults to 10.

element.name: text
element.description: A sequence of words, where last work may or may not be partially complete.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-document indexes to use. If not specified, and no document index specified, then defaults to all of the allowable types.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The name of a document index - an xpath may specify a root node, which matches all indexes below that node.

service.name: asset.index.type.describe
service.description: Provides a description of the purpose of specified types of asset indexes.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-element/attribute item.

service.name: asset.index.type.list
service.description: Returns a list of the possible index types.

service.name: asset.internalize
service.description: If the asset has external content, then that content will be converted to a local copy managed 'internally' by the server.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identify of an asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are internalized.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are internalized.

element.name: method
element.description: The method of acquiring the content. 'copy' takes a copy, leaving the orgininal. 'move' will move the content (if an accessible file) into the file-system data store (if there is one). If the file sytems are different and moving is not possible, 'move' will be converted to 'copy-and-delete'. Defaults to 'copy'.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of the store. If set, this will override the default namespace store. Ignored if there is no content.

service.name: asset.label.add
service.label: Label
service.description: Applies the specified label to the asset. If the asset is already labelled with this label, then the label is moved.

element.name: cid
element.description: Citeable asset identifier. Ignored if 'id' specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: A specific version defined by the specied label. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: A specific version defined by the specied label. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

attribute.name: retain
attribute.description: The number of other instances of this label to retain. A value of zero means retain the number defined by the label. A value of one means retain only the added label. Defaults to zero. Can be greater than zero only if the maximum number of labels is greater than zero. If labels need to be removed, the oldest (version) is removed first. Defaults to zero.

service.name: asset.label.exists
service.description: Returns true if the label(s) exist on the asset and false if not.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier for the asset. Ignored if 'id' specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.label.list
service.description: Returns the set of labels that have been applied to the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: sort
element.description: Determines the sort order of the returned versions. Defaults to (desc)ending.

service.name: asset.label.remove
service.description: Removes the specified label from the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then removed from all versions.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.label.swap
service.description: Applies the specified (new) label to the asset version with the (old) label and removes the old label.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: new
element.description: The name of the label.

element.name: old
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.label.type.create
service.description: Creates an asset label type.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the label, if any.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

element.name: maxcount
element.description: The maximum number of occurences per asset. If set to 1, then only once instance per asset. If greater than 1, then multiple instances per asset (on different versions). If the maximum number is exceeded then the oldest versions will be removed first. Defaults to 1.

service.name: asset.label.type.describe
service.description: Returns a information about one or more asset label types.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label. If not supplied, describes all labels.

service.name: asset.label.type.destroy
service.description: Destroys an asset label type.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.label.type.exists
service.description: Returns true if the label exists and false if not.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.label.type.list
service.description: Returns a list of the available asset label types.

service.name: asset.label.type.lock
service.description: Makes the label unavailable for adding to an asset.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.label.type.unlock
service.description: Makes the label available. Locked labels cannot be applied.

element.name: label
element.description: The name of the label.

service.name: asset.licence.accept
service.description: Accepts a licence with an optional usage statement.

element.name: action
element.description: Specifies the action that will be applied to assets.

element.name: actor
element.description: An actor that accepts the licence (for debugging only).

element.name: date
element.description: A specific date on which to accept the licence (for debugging only).

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a licence asset.

element.name: usage
element.description: The specific destination, or usage for the licenced assets.

service.name: asset.licence.active
service.description: Tests to see if a given asset is active, currently or at a specific date.

element.name: date
element.description: A specific date to test for.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a licence asset.

service.name: asset.licence.add
service.description: Adds licence assets to the specified asset. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

element.name: licence

element.name: where
element.description: A query selecting licence assets to add.

service.name: asset.licence.can.override
service.description: Indicates if the caller can override licences, i.e. ignore licence restrictions

service.name: asset.licence.count
service.description: Returns the number of licences on a specific asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.licence.list
service.description: Returns the licences on a specific asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.description: Removes a licence asset from the specified asset. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: id

element.name: licence

element.name: where
element.description: A query selecting licence assets to remove.

service.name: asset.licence.remove.all
service.description: Removes all licence assets from the specified asset. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.licence.requires.acceptance
service.description: Tests to see if a given asset requires acceptance, currently or at a specific date.

element.name: action
element.description: Specifies the action that will be applied to assets.

element.name: actor
element.description: An actor that requires the acceptance.

element.name: date
element.description: A specific date to test for.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a licence asset.

element.name: usage
element.description: The specific destination, or usage for the licenced assets.

service.name: asset.licence.set
service.description: Configures the asset to be a licence. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.licence.unset
service.description: Changes a licence asset to be a non-licence asset. Requires MODIFY permission on the asset.

element.name: force
element.description: If true and the licence is currently is use then the licence will be removed from all assets it is assigned to. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an asset.

service.name: asset.licence.usage.valid
service.description: Tests to see if the provided usages are valid for a given asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a licence asset.

element.name: usage
element.description: The destination for this usage action.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The action defined for this usage.

service.name: asset.lock
service.description: Locks an asset unless it is locked by another user. Returns the universally unique identifier (UUID) lock for the asset. If this asset was previously locked by this user, then the same lock identifier is returned. To change the lock type or expiry, use the service 'asset.relock'.

element.name: comment
element.description: Reason for acquiring lock.

element.name: descend
element.description: Controls whether locks should be acquired for all descendants. The default is set to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: timeout
element.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds the lock should be held before automatic release. If not specified, defaults to infinite.

service.name: asset.lock.describe
service.description: Describes a given lock, if UUID is specified. Describes locks held by the given user if specified. If neither are specified, then describes all locks in the system.

element.name: id
element.description: An asset to retrieve locks for.

element.name: user
element.description: A user that might have locks.

element.name: domain
element.description: A user domain, that might contain have locks.

element.name: user
element.description: A user that might have locks. If specified, then the domain must be specified.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The univerally unique identifier for the lock.

service.name: asset.merge
service.description: Merges metadata (and content) from the specified asset into another asset. If 'merging' content, the content will be moved from the source asset to the destination asset. The source will then be updated with an internal content reference to the destination asset. The way metadata is merged can be controlled using metadata merging rules.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the source asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: merge
element.description: The components to merge. If not specified, all components are merged.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the destination asset.

service.name: asset.meta.diff
service.description: Returns the differences between two versions of an asset.

element.name: all
element.description: Compare will all previous versions in increments of version between the specified asset version and this version. Defaults to false.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: identify
element.description: Identify who an when a change was made. Defaults to false.

element.name: version
element.description: The version to compare with. Negative versions are from the latest, so -1 is the latest less one. Positive versions are specific versions. Defaults to -1 (compare with previous version).

service.name: asset.meta.get
service.description: Retrieves asset metadata from an external data source. Uses the inbuilt content analyzers to extract information.

element.name: url
element.description: URL to location of data.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: MIME type for interpretation of the data. If not supplied, then type inferred from the extension against the registered types.

service.name: asset.meta.node.remove
service.description: Remove one or more nodes (element or attribute) within an asset metadata. If the node being targetted doesnt exist it is then a no-op.

element.name: allow-incomplete
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-invalid
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if invalid? Defaults to false. Use with caution.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: remove-empty-ancester
element.description: Should empty ancesters also be removed as a result. Default to true

element.name: xpath
element.description: The xpath to the node being operated on.

service.name: asset.meta.rewrite
service.description: Rewrite the asset into the database.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.meta.transform
service.description: Returns the transformed output of an asset's metadata. The format of the output is dependent on the output mime type and the profile employed.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: output-type
element.description: The output mime type. Used to select the relevant transform engine. Defaults to 'text/xml'.

element.name: param
element.description: A transform parameter value. Parameter name/value pairs are passed to the transform profile.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.

element.name: profile
element.description: The name of XSLT Profile within the server. Must be supplied if an XSLT file is not provided as input

element.name: provider
element.description: The name of the Metadata Transform provider to use. If not supplied the provider is derived from the output-type.

element.name: xml
element.description: The xml to transform. Must be supplied if an asset id is not provided as input

service.name: asset.meta.transform.profile.cache.clear
service.description: Clears any cached transform profiles. These profiles change rarely and are used frequently. After uploading a revised profile the cache should be cleared before it will be used.

service.name: asset.meta.transform.profile.describe
service.description: Adds the provided input to the Profiles

element.name: id
element.description: If supplied only profiles which can be executed against this asset id will be returned.

element.name: profile
element.description: The name of XSLT Profile

element.name: tag
element.description: If supplied only profiles which have been marked with this tag will be returned.

service.name: asset.meta.transform.profile.exists
service.description: Checks for the existance of a named profile

element.name: profile
element.description: The name of XSLT Profile within the server.

element.name: provider
element.description: The name of metadata transform provider

service.name: asset.meta.transform.profile.list
service.description: Lists the available XSLT Metadata Transform Profiles

service.name: asset.meta.transform.profile.supported
service.description: Adds the provided input to the Profiles

element.name: id
element.description: If supplied only profiles which can be executed against this asset id will be returned.

element.name: profile
element.description: The name of XSLT Profile

service.name: asset.meta.transform.provider.describe
service.description: Describes metadata transform providers

element.name: provider
element.description: The name of metadata transform provider

service.name: asset.meta.transform.provider.list
service.description: Lists available metadata tramsform providers

service.name: asset.meta.validate
service.description: Validates the metadata on an asset against the current definitions. Returns nothing if valid. Returns an 'invalid' status and the reason if there is a problem.

element.name: allow-incomplete
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to zero.

service.name: asset.meta.value.set
service.description: Sets one or more nodes (element or attribute) values within an asset metadata. The operation can apply literal values to the metadata nodes or can be supplied with a function which is evaluated against all of the assets metadata. Using this approach it is possible to perform complex programmatic rules based value application. If the node being targetted doesnt exist it is possible to create the node if required.

element.name: allow-incomplete
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-invalid
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if invalid? Defaults to false. Use with caution.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: value
element.description: A value to apply to a node within the assets metadata. If the value definition is 'literal' then the value is simply applied to the node. If the value definition is a 'function' this is evaluated and applied to the node. When using functions other node values within the assets metadata can be accessed using the xvalue(xpath) function. The target nodes current value can be accessed using a shortcut variable variable.get('current').

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Should the node be created if it doesn't exist. Defaults to 'false'

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of value defintion. 'function' will parse the value definition as a functional representation of the action. 'literal' means that the supplied value will be applied without modification. Defaults to 'literal'.

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: The xpath to the node being operated on.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the activity.

element.name: role
element.description: A role associated with the activity.

element.name: cid-root
element.description: If containment hierarchy is by citeable identifer, then the cid root specifies the name of the citeable identifier root. If not specified, then will default to 'asset.model.<name>', where <name> is the name of the model.

element.name: collection
element.description: Default settings for collection assets.

element.name: unique-name-index
element.description: If true, then all collections will be created with a unique name index. Defaults to false.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary application defined description.

element.name: entity
element.description: An entity within the model.

attribute.name: root
attribute.description: Is this a root entity within the model? Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: system
attribute.description: System entities are created/interpreted by some system. They are not created by end-users. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: A unique type name for the entity.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list entry.

element.name: access
element.description: Type of access permitted by the given role.

element.name: role
element.description: One of the model roles.

element.name: alternate-id
element.description: An alternate ID type to assign to this type of entity on creation

element.name: collection
element.description: Indicates whether or not this entity is a collection. This is independent of the hierarchy type for the model. A collection can contain other objects. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: anonymous
attribute.description: If it is a collection, is the collection annonymous. That is, the member does not know this is the parent. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: unique-name-index
attribute.description: If true, then the assets within the collection must be uniquely named, and they will be indexed for lookup. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: create-label
element.description: An asset label to add to this type of entity on creation

element.name: create-service
element.description: Call this service instead of asset.create. The arguments passed as the same as those passed to asset.create

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the entity.

element.name: destroy-service
element.description: Call this service instead of asset.destroy. The arguments passed as the same as those passed to asset.destroy

element.name: entity-tag
element.description: An asset tag to add to this type of entity on creation

element.name: icon
element.description: The id or path to an asset containing the icon for this model entity.

element.name: identity
element.description: The XPath of a metadata element (in the template) that forms part of the identity for this object.

element.name: label-plural
element.description: A display label for this entity (plural form).

element.name: label-singular
element.description: A display label for this entity (singular form).

element.name: macl
element.description: Access control list entry for a metadata document type.

element.name: access
element.description: Type of access permitted by the given role.

element.name: role
element.description: One of the model roles.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type.

element.name: member
element.description: The name of another entity type (within this model) that can be hierarchically added to this entity

element.name: mimetype
element.description: The mime type of the asset.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace for entities of this type. If the namespce starts with '/' the path is absolute otherise it is relative to the model root

element.name: query
element.description: A pre-defined/favourite search query for this entity. This may be rendered by a user interface.

element.name: description
element.description: A description for the query.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to display for the search.

element.name: where
element.description: The query where clause

element.name: relationship
element.description: The definition of an allowed set of relationships for a known entity and/or mime type. If an entity name is not provided a mime type of allowed assets must be provided. If a mime type is not provided then an entity name must be. If both an entity name and mime type are both provided then the asset being related must match both.

attribute.name: entity
attribute.description: The name of an entity that is allowed to be related to this entity.

attribute.name: mime-type
attribute.description: The mime-type of an asset that is allowed to be related to this entity.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of relationship to allow.

element.name: report
element.description: An optional report that can be run on the entity. Arguments 'entity-id' and 'entity-cid' will be presented to the report generation.

element.name: description
element.description: A description for the query.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to display for the report.

element.name: name
element.description: The name/location of the report to run.

element.name: role
element.description: A role with access to this report. If no roles are defined all defined reports are presented to the user.

element.name: search
element.description: The XPath of a metadata element (in the template) that might typically be used for searching. May be applied by user interfaces.

element.name: service
element.description: An optional service definition to be registered as a possible action for this entity. The creation or modification of an asset model will create this definition as a declared service within the system. If the service name is not prefixed with 'model.' it will be prepended. If the name of this declared service already exists it will be replaced with this definitions.

element.name: access
element.description: The access required to execute this service.

element.name: definition
element.description: The argument definition for this service, if any.

element.name: element
element.description: Document element.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: Set to false if the element is no longer in active use.

attribute.name: case-sensitive
attribute.description: For enumeration types, indicates whether case is important. Default is case insensitive.

attribute.name: comparable
attribute.description: Set to true if type is a string and it is intended to perform comparisons or sorting on that string. If not set, a string is tokenized during indexing (if set), but two values cannot be compared. The first 128 characters (at most) will be comparable.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the element.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary-auto
attribute.description: For strings, if set, uses this dictionary to store (automatically populated) values found in the string.

attribute.name: display-length
attribute.description: For strings, a suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

attribute.name: encrypt
attribute.description: Set to true if the element value should be stored in encrypted form. If not set, defaults to no encryption. Encrypted elements cannot be indexed.

attribute.name: enumerated-values
attribute.description: For enumeration types, is a comma separated list of valid values. Mandatory for enumeration types if 'dictionary' is not specified.

attribute.name: ignore-descendants
attribute.description: Should any arbitrary descendants of this node be ignored when validating? If 'true' then don't include sub-elements. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set to true if the element should be indexed for searching. If not set, defaults to no indexing.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the element.

attribute.name: label-plural
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for plural form of the the element.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: For strings, is the maximum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to max. integer.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the maximum value. If not specified, defaults to max. integer or float.

attribute.name: max-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the minimum value. If not specified, defaults to min. integer or float.

attribute.name: min-length
attribute.description: For strings, is the minimum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to 1.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines minimum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the element.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: For strings, defines a regular expression that the string must conform. If not specified, an arbitrary pattern is used, equivalent to: '[^]+?'.

attribute.name: recurse
attribute.description: Can this element be a sub-element of self? Defaults to false.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Data type of the value.

element.name: attribute
element.description: Element attribute.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: Set to false if the attribute is no longer in active use.

attribute.name: case-sensitive
attribute.description: For enumeration types, indicates whether case is important. Default is case insensitive.

attribute.name: comparable
attribute.description: Set to true if type is a string and it is intended to perform comparisons or sorting on that string. If not set, a string is tokenized during indexing (if set), but two values cannot be compared. The first 128 characters (at most) will be comparable.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the element.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary-auto
attribute.description: For strings, if set, uses this dictionary to store (automatically populated) values found in the string.

attribute.name: display-length
attribute.description: For strings, a suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

attribute.name: encrypt
attribute.description: Set to true if the attribute value should be stored in encrypted form. If not set, defaults to no encryption. Encrypted attributes cannot be indexed.

attribute.name: enumerated-values
attribute.description: For enumeration types, is a comma separated list of valid values. Mandatory for enumeration types if 'dictionary' is not specified.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set to true if the attribute should be indexed for searching. If not set, defaults to no indexing.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the attribute.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: For strings, is the maximum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to max. integer.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the maximum value. If not specified, defaults to max. integer or float.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the minimum value. If not specified, defaults to min. integer or float.

attribute.name: min-length
attribute.description: For strings, is the minimum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to 1.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the minimum number of occurences of the attribute (max is always 1). If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the attribute.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: For strings, defines a regular expression that the string must conform. If not specified, an arbitrary pattern is used, equivalent to: '[^]+?'.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Data type of the value.

element.name: description
element.description: Description of the attribute.

element.name: instructions
element.description: End user instructions for populating this attribute.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Boolean restriction.

element.name: false
element.description: Possible boolean value indicating true. Defaults to [0,no,false]

element.name: true
element.description: Possible boolean value indicating true. Defaults to [1,yes,true]

element.name: restriction
element.description: Constant restriction.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of the constant.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Date restriction.

element.name: human-age
element.description: If true, 2 digit years will converted to 4 digit years between now and (now-99years).

element.name: time
element.description: Should the date include time in the form HH:MM:SS/HH:MM. Defaults to true.

element.name: time-include-milliseconds
element.description: If including time, should it exclude the milliseconds part, i.e., in the form HH:MM:SS, or include milliseconds in the form HH:MM:SS.sss. Defaults to false.

element.name: time-include-seconds
element.description: If including time, should it exclude the seconds part, i.e., in the form HH:MM, or include seconds. Defaults to true.

element.name: time-zone-offset
element.description: The timezone to interpret date and time. If unspecified, defaults to the zone for the session or system.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Double precision point number restriction.

element.name: maximum
element.description: The maximum value. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: minimum
element.description: The minimum value. Defaults to -infinity.

element.name: symbol
element.description: A symbolic definition.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the symbol.

element.name: range
element.description: The symbol may represent a range of values

element.name: max
element.description: The maximum value

attribute.name: inc
attribute.description: Is value inclusive of the maximum. Defaults to true.

element.name: min
element.description: The minimum value

attribute.name: inc
attribute.description: Is value inclusive of the minimum. Defaults to true.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of the symbol.

element.description: Indicates whether comparisons are case sensitive or not. Defaults to false.

element.description: The name of a dictionary in which to resolve values.

element.description: The name of a service used to values.

element.description: The maximum length of the identifier. By default unbounded.

element.description: The minimum length of the identifier. By default has a value of 1.

element.name: maximum

element.name: radix

element.name: lines
element.description: The number of lines. A value greater than one indicates multi-line text. Defaults to 1. This is typically a hint for presentation.

element.description: A string that is deemed to be 'text' is likely to contain words, and should be indexed as such. If not text, then not expected to contain words. Defaults to true.

element.name: reference
