element.name: description
element.description: Description of the element.

element.name: instructions
element.description: End user instructions for the element.

element.name: value
element.description: XPath to element within document or document name. The referent must exist at the time this reference is made.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description.

element.name: execute
element.description: An inline script that executes the service. The script will be passed the XML arguments via an argument $args that can be accessed using services such as 'xvalue', 'xelement', etc.

element.name: execute-as
element.description: A user that will be used to run this service.

element.name: domain
element.description: An authentication domain.

element.name: user
element.description: An authentication user within the domain

element.name: instructions
element.description: Instructions for using this service.

element.name: label
element.description: Arbitrary label that may be used to represent this service

element.name: max-nb-inputs
element.description: The maximum number of inputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: max-nb-outputs
element.description: The maximum number of outputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: min-nb-inputs
element.description: The minimum number of inputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: min-nb-outputs
element.description: The minimum number of outputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name of the service

element.name: object-data-access
element.description: The access required to the object data in order to execute this service. If unspecified, will not be checked.

element.name: object-meta-access
element.description: The access required to the object metadata in order to execute this service. If unspecified, will not be checked.

element.name: object-type
element.description: A type of object for which this service can be used. If not specified, then any object type.

element.name: origin
element.description: The origin of the service. e.g. if the service is declared within an asset model the model name should be provided

element.name: precondition
element.description: An inline script that executes to determine whether the service has the necessary conditions to execute. The script will be passed contextual arguments. The script must use the 'return' function to return [1, true] where '1' is equivalent to 'true' in order to pass. Any other return value is considered as 'false'.

element.name: replace-if-exists
element.description: If already exists, then will replace the existing service without error. Defaults to false

element.name: require
element.description: A set of requirements for this service to be available.

element.name: service
element.description: A service that must be available for this service to be available.

element.name: usage
element.description: An arbitrary, application defined, usage tag (can be used for filtering).

element.name: visible-to
element.description: Limit visibility of this service to this actor.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of actor (domain, role, user, etc).

element.name: summary
element.description: The XPath of a metadata element (in the template) that might form part of summary information for the entity. May be applied by user interfaces.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: An option label for the column rather than the last part of the XPath.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: trigger
element.description: An inline script that executes the service. The script will be passed the arguments for the asset 'id' and if applicable 'cid' which are then accessible as variables.

attribute.name: async
attribute.description: Should the trigger be executed asynchronously? Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: on
attribute.description: What stage of the entity lifecycle should the trigger execute on. 'create' and 'update' are executed after the event either synchronously or asynchronously. A synchronous 'delete' trigger is executed prior to the entity being delete, while an asynchronously 'delete' trigger is by its nature executed after the deletion has completed.

element.name: update-label
element.description: An asset label to add to this type of entity on update

element.name: update-service
element.description: Call this service instead of asset.set. The arguments passed as the same as those passed to asset.set

element.name: hierarchy
element.description: Defines the containment method. By default, will be asset 'cid'.

element.name: icon
element.description: The id or path to an asset containing the icon for this model.

element.name: inherit-meta
element.description: The name of metadata to be inherited from a parent entity

attribute.name: from
attribute.description: Specifies the parent entity from which to inherit metadata. If not specified, then all occurences will be inherited.

element.name: label
element.description: An optional application dependant label. If specified, user interfaces may show the label instead of the name.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

element.name: role
element.description: A role that has some form of access within the model.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the role

element.name: maps-to
element.description: A system role heald by the user that maps to the model role. If the actor matches several roles, the most permissive will be used.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the role. The name must be unique within the model.

element.name: tag
element.description: An arbitrary tag for the asset model. Asset models can be filtered by tags.

service.name: asset.model.declare
service.description: Declares the existence of the asset model, but without specifying the definition. Will do nothing if the model already exists.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary application defined description.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

service.name: asset.model.describe
service.description: Returns information about registered asset models.

element.name: format
element.description: How should the metdata be displayed. Defaults to 'terse'

element.name: name
element.description: Filter the results by name.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter the results by tag.

service.name: asset.model.destroy
service.description: Destroys an existing asset model.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

service.name: asset.model.entity.instance.describe
service.description: Describes an existing model asset's relationship to related entities.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: idx
element.description: Absolute cursor position. If used, the cursor will be positioned starting at 'idx'.

element.name: parents
element.description: Do we get the parent entities. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of child entities to return. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.model.exists
service.description: Indicates whether a named model exists or not.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

service.name: asset.model.list
service.description: Returns the names of the known asset models.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter the results by tag.

element.name: using
element.description: If specified, lists models that use the specified model.

service.name: asset.model.metadata.describe
service.description: Returns information about registered asset metadata templates for an asset model.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

service.name: asset.model.roots.describe
service.description: Returns information about the root entities in a given model.

element.name: format
element.description: How should the metdata be displayed. Defaults to 'terse'

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

service.name: asset.model.script.create
service.description: Saves one or more Asset Models in shell format to allow recreation.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

service.name: asset.model.tag.add
service.description: Adds one or more tags to an asset model.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the asset model.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag to be added.

service.name: asset.model.tag.remove
service.description: Removes one or more tags from an asset model.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the asset model.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag to be removed.

service.name: asset.model.update
service.description: Updates an existing model of an asset.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the model itself.

element.name: access
element.description: The type of access to grant to the model itself.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: activity
element.description: An activity performed through the model. This declares possible activities and their associated roles.

element.name: description
element.description: An optional description for the activity.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the activity.

element.name: role
element.description: A role associated with the activity.

element.name: cid-root
element.description: If containment hierarchy is by citeable identifer, then the cid root specifies the name of the citeable identifier root. If not specified, then will default to 'asset.model.<name>', where <name> is the name of the model.

element.name: collection
element.description: Default settings for collection assets.

element.name: unique-name-index
element.description: If true, then all collections will be created with a unique name index. Defaults to false.

element.name: create
element.description: Create the model if not found? Defaults to false.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary application defined description.

element.name: entity
element.description: An entity within the model.

attribute.name: root
attribute.description: Is this a root entity within the model? Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: system
attribute.description: System entities are created/interpreted by some system. They are not created by end-users. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: A unique type name for the entity.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list entry.

element.name: access
element.description: Type of access permitted by the given role.

element.name: role
element.description: One of the model roles.

element.name: alternate-id
element.description: An alternate ID type to assign to this type of entity on creation

element.name: collection
element.description: Indicates whether or not this entity is a collection. This is independent of the hierarchy type for the model. A collection can contain other objects. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: anonymous
attribute.description: If it is a collection, is the collection annonymous. That is, the member does not know this is the parent. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: unique-name-index
attribute.description: If true, then the assets within the collection must be uniquely named, and they will be indexed for lookup. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: create-label
element.description: An asset label to add to this type of entity on creation

element.name: create-service
element.description: Call this service instead of asset.create. The arguments passed as the same as those passed to asset.create

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the entity.

element.name: destroy-service
element.description: Call this service instead of asset.destroy. The arguments passed as the same as those passed to asset.destroy

element.name: entity-tag
element.description: An asset tag to add to this type of entity on creation

element.name: icon
element.description: The id or path to an asset containing the icon for this model entity.

element.name: identity
element.description: The XPath of a metadata element (in the template) that forms part of the identity for this object.

element.name: label-plural
element.description: A display label for this entity (plural form).

element.name: label-singular
element.description: A display label for this entity (singular form).

element.name: macl
element.description: Access control list entry for a metadata document type.

element.name: access
element.description: Type of access permitted by the given role.

element.name: role
element.description: One of the model roles.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type.

element.name: member
element.description: The name of another entity type (within this model) that can be hierarchically added to this entity

element.name: mimetype
element.description: The mime type of the asset.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace for entities of this type. If the namespce starts with '/' the path is absolute otherise it is relative to the model root

element.name: query
element.description: A pre-defined/favourite search query for this entity. This may be rendered by a user interface.

element.name: description
element.description: A description for the query.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to display for the search.

element.name: where
element.description: The query where clause

element.name: relationship
element.description: The definition of an allowed set of relationships for a known entity and/or mime type. If an entity name is not provided a mime type of allowed assets must be provided. If a mime type is not provided then an entity name must be. If both an entity name and mime type are both provided then the asset being related must match both.

attribute.name: entity
attribute.description: The name of an entity that is allowed to be related to this entity.

attribute.name: mime-type
attribute.description: The mime-type of an asset that is allowed to be related to this entity.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of relationship to allow.

element.name: report
element.description: An optional report that can be run on the entity. Arguments 'entity-id' and 'entity-cid' will be presented to the report generation.

element.name: description
element.description: A description for the query.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to display for the report.

element.name: name
element.description: The name/location of the report to run.

element.name: role
element.description: A role with access to this report. If no roles are defined all defined reports are presented to the user.

element.name: search
element.description: The XPath of a metadata element (in the template) that might typically be used for searching. May be applied by user interfaces.

element.name: service
element.description: An optional service definition to be registered as a possible action for this entity. The creation or modification of an asset model will create this definition as a declared service within the system. If the service name is not prefixed with 'model.' it will be prepended. If the name of this declared service already exists it will be replaced with this definitions.

element.name: access
element.description: The access required to execute this service.

element.name: definition
element.description: The argument definition for this service, if any.

element.name: element
element.description: Document element.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: Set to false if the element is no longer in active use.

attribute.name: case-sensitive
attribute.description: For enumeration types, indicates whether case is important. Default is case insensitive.

attribute.name: comparable
attribute.description: Set to true if type is a string and it is intended to perform comparisons or sorting on that string. If not set, a string is tokenized during indexing (if set), but two values cannot be compared. The first 128 characters (at most) will be comparable.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the element.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary-auto
attribute.description: For strings, if set, uses this dictionary to store (automatically populated) values found in the string.

attribute.name: display-length
attribute.description: For strings, a suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

attribute.name: encrypt
attribute.description: Set to true if the element value should be stored in encrypted form. If not set, defaults to no encryption. Encrypted elements cannot be indexed.

attribute.name: enumerated-values
attribute.description: For enumeration types, is a comma separated list of valid values. Mandatory for enumeration types if 'dictionary' is not specified.

attribute.name: ignore-descendants
attribute.description: Should any arbitrary descendants of this node be ignored when validating? If 'true' then don't include sub-elements. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set to true if the element should be indexed for searching. If not set, defaults to no indexing.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the element.

attribute.name: label-plural
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for plural form of the the element.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: For strings, is the maximum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to max. integer.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the maximum value. If not specified, defaults to max. integer or float.

attribute.name: max-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the minimum value. If not specified, defaults to min. integer or float.

attribute.name: min-length
attribute.description: For strings, is the minimum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to 1.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines minimum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the element.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: For strings, defines a regular expression that the string must conform. If not specified, an arbitrary pattern is used, equivalent to: '[^]+?'.

attribute.name: recurse
attribute.description: Can this element be a sub-element of self? Defaults to false.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Data type of the value.

element.name: attribute
element.description: Element attribute.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: Set to false if the attribute is no longer in active use.

attribute.name: case-sensitive
attribute.description: For enumeration types, indicates whether case is important. Default is case insensitive.

attribute.name: comparable
attribute.description: Set to true if type is a string and it is intended to perform comparisons or sorting on that string. If not set, a string is tokenized during indexing (if set), but two values cannot be compared. The first 128 characters (at most) will be comparable.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the element.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary-auto
attribute.description: For strings, if set, uses this dictionary to store (automatically populated) values found in the string.

attribute.name: display-length
attribute.description: For strings, a suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

attribute.name: encrypt
attribute.description: Set to true if the attribute value should be stored in encrypted form. If not set, defaults to no encryption. Encrypted attributes cannot be indexed.

attribute.name: enumerated-values
attribute.description: For enumeration types, is a comma separated list of valid values. Mandatory for enumeration types if 'dictionary' is not specified.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set to true if the attribute should be indexed for searching. If not set, defaults to no indexing.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the attribute.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: For strings, is the maximum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to max. integer.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the maximum value. If not specified, defaults to max. integer or float.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the minimum value. If not specified, defaults to min. integer or float.

attribute.name: min-length
attribute.description: For strings, is the minimum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to 1.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the minimum number of occurences of the attribute (max is always 1). If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the attribute.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: For strings, defines a regular expression that the string must conform. If not specified, an arbitrary pattern is used, equivalent to: '[^]+?'.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Data type of the value.

element.description: Description of the attribute.

element.name: instructions

element.name: restriction

element.description: Possible boolean value indicating true. Defaults to [0,no,false]

element.name: true
element.description: Possible boolean value indicating true. Defaults to [1,yes,true]

element.description: Should the date include time in the form HH:MM:SS/HH:MM. Defaults to true.

element.name: time-include-milliseconds
element.description: If including time, should it exclude the milliseconds part, i.e., in the form HH:MM:SS, or include milliseconds in the form HH:MM:SS.sss. Defaults to false.

element.name: time-include-seconds
element.description: If including time, should it exclude the seconds part, i.e., in the form HH:MM, or include seconds. Defaults to true.

element.name: time-zone-offset
element.description: The timezone to interpret date and time. If unspecified, defaults to the zone for the session or system.

element.description: A specified value.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A description for the value

element.name: restriction
element.description: Floating point number restriction.

element.name: maximum
element.description: The maximum value. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: minimum
element.description: The minimum value. Defaults to -infinity.

element.name: restriction
element.description: String restriction.

element.name: max-length
element.description: The maximum length of the identifier. By default unbounded.

element.name: min-length
element.description: The minimum length of the identifier. By default has a value of 1.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Integer restriction.

element.name: maximum
element.description: The maximum value. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: minimum
element.description: The minimum value. Defaults to -infinity.

element.name: radix
element.description: The base/radix of the number. Defaults to 10.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Keyword restriction.

element.name: dictionary
element.description: The name of a dictionary in which to resolve values.

element.name: restriction
element.description: Long integer restriction.

element.name: maximum
element.description: The maximum value. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: minimum
element.description: The minimum value. Defaults to -infinity.

element.name: radix
element.description: The base/radix of the number. Defaults to 10.

element.name: restriction
element.description: String restriction.

element.name: case
element.description: Forces the string to upper, lower or title case - not for validation, but for coersion. Use a pattern for validation.

element.name: dictionary
element.description: The name of a dictionary in which to resolve values.

attribute.name: auto
attribute.description: If set to true, then this dictionary will be populated with indexed values. Defaults to false.

element.name: display-length
element.description: A suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

element.name: lines
element.description: The number of lines. A value greater than one indicates multi-line text. Defaults to 1. This is typically a hint for presentation.

element.name: max-length
element.description: The maximum length of the string. By default unbounded.

element.name: min-length
element.description: The minimum length of the string. By default has a value of 1.

element.name: password
element.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

element.name: pattern
element.description: A regular expression with which the value must comply.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: An optional (human friendly) explanation or example of the pattern.

element.name: text
element.description: A string that is deemed to be 'text' is likely to contain words, and should be indexed as such. If not text, then not expected to contain words. Defaults to true.

element.name: restriction
element.description: String restriction.

element.name: case
element.description: Forces the string to upper, lower or title case - not for validation, but for coersion. Use a pattern for validation.

element.name: dictionary
element.description: The name of a dictionary in which to resolve values.

attribute.name: auto
attribute.description: If set to true, then this dictionary will be populated with indexed values. Defaults to false.

element.name: display-length
element.description: A suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

element.name: lines
element.description: The number of lines. A value greater than one indicates multi-line text. Defaults to 1. This is typically a hint for presentation.

element.name: max-length
element.description: The maximum length of the string. By default unbounded.

element.name: min-length
element.description: The minimum length of the string. By default has a value of 1.

element.name: password
element.description: If true, treat this string as a password (filter from logs etc.) Defaults to false.

element.name: pattern
element.description: A regular expression with which the value must comply.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: An optional (human friendly) explanation or example of the pattern.

element.name: text
element.description: A string that is deemed to be 'text' is likely to contain words, and should be indexed as such. If not text, then not expected to contain words. Defaults to true.

element.name: restriction
element.description: URL restriction.

element.name: protocol
element.description: Supported protocol.

element.name: special-value
element.description: The definition of a special (out of band) value.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the special value.

element.name: value
element.description: The special value (e.g. "missing")

element.name: value
element.description: Specified value for the attribute

attribute.name: as
attribute.description: Binding. Defaults to 'default'. Constants cannot be changed.

element.name: reference
element.description: Reference to another element or attribute. Specifies the relative or absolute path for an 'element' or a document name.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the element.

attribute.name: label-plural
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for plural form of the the element.

attribute.name: max-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: min-occurs
attribute.description: Defines minimum number of occurences of the element. If not specified, defaults to one.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the reference element.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of reference. An element must occur within this definition.

element.name: description
element.description: Description of the element.

element.name: instructions
element.description: End user instructions for the element.

element.name: value
element.description: XPath to element within document or document name. The referent must exist at the time this reference is made.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description.

element.name: execute
element.description: An inline script that executes the service. The script will be passed the XML arguments via an argument $args that can be accessed using services such as 'xvalue', 'xelement', etc.

element.name: execute-as
element.description: A user that will be used to run this service.

element.name: domain
element.description: An authentication domain.

element.name: user
element.description: An authentication user within the domain

element.name: instructions
element.description: Instructions for using this service.

element.name: label
element.description: Arbitrary label that may be used to represent this service

element.name: max-nb-inputs
element.description: The maximum number of inputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: max-nb-outputs
element.description: The maximum number of outputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: min-nb-inputs
element.description: The minimum number of inputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: min-nb-outputs
element.description: The minimum number of outputs. Defaults to zero.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name of the service

element.name: object-data-access
element.description: The access required to the object data in order to execute this service. If unspecified, will not be checked.

element.name: object-meta-access
element.description: The access required to the object metadata in order to execute this service. If unspecified, will not be checked.

element.name: object-type
element.description: A type of object for which this service can be used. If not specified, then any object type.

element.name: origin
element.description: The origin of the service. e.g. if the service is declared within an asset model the model name should be provided

element.name: precondition
element.description: An inline script that executes to determine whether the service has the necessary conditions to execute. The script will be passed contextual arguments. The script must use the 'return' function to return [1, true] where '1' is equivalent to 'true' in order to pass. Any other return value is considered as 'false'.

element.name: replace-if-exists
element.description: If already exists, then will replace the existing service without error. Defaults to false

element.name: require
element.description: A set of requirements for this service to be available.

element.name: service
element.description: A service that must be available for this service to be available.

element.name: usage
element.description: An arbitrary, application defined, usage tag (can be used for filtering).

element.name: visible-to
element.description: Limit visibility of this service to this actor.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of actor (domain, role, user, etc).

element.name: summary
element.description: The XPath of a metadata element (in the template) that might form part of summary information for the entity. May be applied by user interfaces.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: An option label for the column rather than the last part of the XPath.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: trigger
element.description: An inline script that executes the service. The script will be passed the arguments for the asset 'id' and if applicable 'cid' which are then accessible as variables.

attribute.name: async
attribute.description: Should the trigger be executed asynchronously? Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: on
attribute.description: What stage of the entity lifecycle should the trigger execute on. 'create' and 'update' are executed after the event either synchronously or asynchronously. A synchronous 'delete' trigger is executed prior to the entity being delete, while an asynchronously 'delete' trigger is by its nature executed after the deletion has completed.

element.name: update-label
element.description: An asset label to add to this type of entity on update

element.name: update-service
element.description: Call this service instead of asset.set. The arguments passed as the same as those passed to asset.set

element.name: hierarchy
element.description: Defines the containment method. By default, will be asset 'cid'.

element.name: icon
element.description: The id or path to an asset containing the icon for this model.

element.name: inherit-meta
element.description: The name of metadata to be inherited from a parent entity

attribute.name: from
attribute.description: Specifies the parent entity from which to inherit metadata. If not specified, then all occurences will be inherited.

element.name: label
element.description: An optional application dependant label. If specified, user interfaces may show the label instead of the name.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the asset model.

element.name: role
element.description: A role that has some form of access within the model.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the role

element.name: maps-to
element.description: A system role heald by the user that maps to the model role. If the actor matches several roles, the most permissive will be used.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the role. The name must be unique within the model.

element.name: tag
element.description: An arbitrary tag for the asset model. Asset models can be filtered by tags.

service.name: asset.modify.time.set
service.description: Explicitly change / set the modify time of the asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: time
element.description: The date and time for the modification time.

element.name: time-in-millisec
element.description: The date and time for the modification time in milliseconds (Unix epoch). One of 'time' or 'time-in-millisec' must be specified

service.name: asset.move
service.description: Moves an asset from one namespace or asset (with a unique name index) to another namespace or asset (with a unique name index). This service does not remove assets from collection assets that don't have a unique name index. The intention is to change the parent (namespace or asset) that governs the unique name constraints. Consequently, this service will not allow moving to an asset that does not have a unique name index.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. One of 'id' or 'where' must be specified.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset name is not changed. Only valid if the number of assets to move is one.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination namespace. Only valid if 'to' not specified.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true, then create the namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: remove-from-parent
attribute.description: If true the asset will be removed as a member of its parent asset with a unique name index (if it has one) when it is moved to the namespace. Defaults to false.

element.name: retype
element.description: If true, then re-retype the asset if the name changes. Defaults to true.

element.name: to
element.description: The destination asset. Only valid if 'namespace' not specified.

element.name: where
element.description: A set of assets to move, selected by this query.

service.name: asset.name.history.prune
service.label: Prune (Name History)
service.description: Removes all but specified versions of an asset's name history.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: prior-to
element.description: Versions created after this date will be kept.

element.name: retain
element.description: Specifies the minimum number of recent versions to retain. Defaults to 1.

service.name: asset.name.set
service.description: Change the name of an asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace or collection) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset is not named.

attribute.name: auto-rename-if-clash
attribute.description: If true, then automatically rename the asset to avoid name collisions. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.name.unset
service.description: Remove / unset the name of an asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.access.add
service.description: Adds access permissions for the specified actor on a namespace. If there is already an ACL entry for the actor then it will have the supplied access permissions merged with the existing, and if no existing then has the equivalent effect of granting that permission. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the namespace.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: whether this is an inclusive ACL (permits the specified access) or exclusive ACL (prohibits the specified access). By default ACLs are inclusive.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: Asset specific access within the namespace. 'access' allows the actor to view assets within the namespace. 'create' allows the actor to create assets within the namespace. 'modify' allows the actor to edit assets within the namespace, this including renaming or moving the asset. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy assets within the namespace (permission to modify the asset and its content is also required to destroy). 'licence' allows the actor to apply licences to assets within the namespace. 'publish' indicates assets in this namespace can be published - e.g. generate an external object identifier. 'none' explicitly stops the actor from being able to view assets within the namespace. One of 'namespace' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.name: asset-content
element.description: Content specific access for assets within the namespace that needs to be set in order to access or modify asset content. 'access' allows the actor to access or download the assets content. 'modify' allows the actor to update an assets content. This requires that the matching 'asset' access is also set. That is, if 'access' is set, then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' is set then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The type of access to grant to the namespace itself. 'access' allows the actor visibility of the namespace. 'create' allows the actor to create sub-namespaces. 'modify' allows the actor to rename or move sub-namespaces. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy sub-namespaces. 'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of this namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'administer-children' allows the actor to administer child namespaces, but not this (parent) namespace. 'execute' allows file-system API (NFS,SFTP,SMB) access to the namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'none' means the actor is explicitly blocked from accessing the namespace. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.access.remove
service.description: Removes specified access permissions from any ACL for the specified actor on the namespace. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the namespace.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: whether this is an inclusive ACL (permits the specified access) or exclusive ACL (prohibits the specified access). By default ACLs are inclusive.

'modify' allows the actor to edit assets within the namespace, this including renaming or moving the asset. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy assets within the namespace (permission to modify the asset and its content is also required to destroy). 'licence' allows the actor to apply licences to assets within the namespace. 'publish' indicates assets in this namespace can be published - e.g. generate an external object identifier. 'none' explicitly stops the actor from being able to view assets within the namespace. One of 'namespace' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.description: Content specific access for assets within the namespace that needs to be set in order to access or modify asset content. 'access' allows the actor to access or download the assets content. 'modify' allows the actor to update an assets content. This requires that the matching 'asset' access is also set. That is, if 'access' is set, then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' is set then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of this namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'administer-children' allows the actor to administer child namespaces, but not this (parent) namespace. 'execute' allows file-system API (NFS,SFTP,SMB) access to the namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'none' means the actor is explicitly blocked from accessing the namespace. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.describe
service.description: Describes any configured access controls for the given namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.exists
service.description: Returns if the namespace has access controls configured. The test does not check for inherited access controls, only those specifically configured on the selected namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.grant
service.description: Grants access to a specified namespace. If there is already an inclusion ACL entry for the actor then it will be updated with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the namespace.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.revoke
service.description: Revoke access to a specified namespace for the given actor. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the namespace.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to revoke access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.script.create
service.description: Produces a script containing services to create access controls for a namespace. Can optionally recurse to include child namespaces.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

element.name: recursive
element.description: Should child namespaces generated. Defaults to 'false'.

service.name: asset.namespace.acl.set
service.description: Sets access to the specified namespace. If there are already ACL entries for the namespace then they will be overwritten with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the namespace.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: whether this is an inclusive ACL (permits the specified access) or exclusive ACL (prohibits the specified access). By default ACLs are inclusive.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type

element.name: inherit
element.description: Specifies if the specified namespace should inherit ACLs from it's parent. This argument allows the user to change the inheritance at the same time they apply the ACLs, because it may not possible to do it at a later time if the new ACLs will prohibit the user to do so.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.application.settings.get
service.description: Returns specified application settings associated with the namespace.

element.name: app
element.description: The application.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to create.

attribute.name: include-parents
attribute.description: Should the applications settings of all parent namespaces be displayed. Defaults to 'false',

service.name: asset.namespace.application.settings.remove
service.description: Removes associated application settings with the namespace. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace.

element.name: app
element.description: The application.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to create.

service.name: asset.namespace.application.settings.set
service.description: Associates application settings with the namespace. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace.

element.name: app
element.description: The application.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to create.

element.name: settings
element.description: An application defined associated document.

service.name: asset.namespace.archive.create
service.description: Creates an archive containing the whole namespace structure conatained by provided namespace argument(s). The archive will contain all of the necessary information to be restored later in this, or another, server.

element.name: clevel
element.description: Level of compression. 0 is uncompressed, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: collection-assets
element.description: Configuration to determine which members of a collection asset (if any) are included by their RID in the Asset XML output for restoration on a destination server.

element.name: describe-queries
element.description: Should dynamic queries within the primary collection be described in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: Should dynamic members of a collection asset included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Any dynamic queries in the collection will be resolved and their resultant assets included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-static-members
element.description: Should static members of a collection asset be included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: Should members of any collection assets within the collection asset hierarchy be resolved and included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets listed in multiple collections are only returned once. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: missing-content-only
element.description: Should the collection only list members with missing remote reference content. This can be used to request content to fulfill assets with remote content references. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: uuid
element.description: If supplied only collection members with this server UUID will be included. Defaults to all members if no UUIDs included.

element.name: compatible-with
element.description: Determines the format version of the archive structure. Allows archives to be created that can be restored on older servers, by setting the compatibility to version '1'. Note that when set to a lower version some limitations are incurred on the data transfered. Defaults to '2', being the most recent version.

element.name: content-restrictions
element.description: Content restrictions allow for archives, including asset replication process, to use rules to selectively determine if the contents full data should be included or if it is included by remote reference. Restrictions only apply to content delivery modes that would result in content being included in the archive (by value, the default) or pulled upon restore (by rid).

element.name: exclude-path
element.description: Assets within this path will have content excluded from the archive

element.name: exclude-tag
element.description: Assets with this tag will have their content excluded within the archive.

element.name: exclude-type
element.description: Asset content with this MIME type will be excluded from the archive.

element.name: include-path
element.description: Only assets within this path will have content included within the archive

element.name: include-tag
element.description: Only Assets with this tag will have their content included within the archive.

element.name: include-type
element.description: Only asset content with this MIME type will be included in the archive

element.name: maximum-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes of content data that will to be included for an asset within the archive. Size may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB. If the assets content exceeds this limit the asset will be added with content by reference. Defaults to 'infinity' to allow content of any size.

element.name: creator
element.description: An arbitrary user/application defined creator information for the archive.

element.name: cref
element.description: If possible, will retrieve a reference to the content rather than the content. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: by
attribute.description: The method reference. If 'url', then the content must be in an external file-system. If 'rid', the restorer must have access to the originating server. If 'ref' a content reference stub is added to the asset and requests for the content by a user are referred to the originating server, the user must have access to the originating server. Defaults to 'url'.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary user/application defined description for the archive.

element.name: file-extension
element.description: If a directory 'url' is supplied, this value will be used as the extension of the filename(s) created. If not supplied, defaults to the extension for the supplied archive 'format'.

element.name: file-name
element.description: If a directory 'url' is supplied, this value will be used as the body of filename(s) created. If not supplied, defaults to 'archive'

element.name: for
element.description: A replication archive is the default format. It allows exchange/movement of assets between systems. However, a 'user' archive can be created that does not contain all the necessary information to replicate assets. Defaults to 'replication'. If set to 'user' then parts defaults to 'content' - metadata can be included by setting parts to 'all'.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of the container used to transmit the data. 'zip' is ZIP format (first implemented in PKZIP). 'tar' is TAR format (.tar) when no compression, or G-Zipped Tar (.tar.gz) when clevel>0. 'aar' is the latest Arcitecta archive format (.aar) with file size limit of 2^63 per file. There are two forms of 'aar': 'aarv2' (single threaded) and 'aarv3' (multi threaded). The default is 'aarv2'.

element.name: generate-statistics
element.description: If true, then the archive will generate statistics on the generated archive, as another output, or as result XML if outputting to a URL. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: An arbitrary user/application defined identifier for the archive.

element.name: include-components
element.description: Should the definitions of an assets components (Document Types, Models, Lables, etc) be archived. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Should assets which have been soft deleted be archived? Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-exploded-assets
element.description: Should assets be included when their content references an entry in another assets archive content. When the asset is restored the content will attempt to locate the source asset by replica id and reconnect the content to the archive entry. If the source asset can not be found, the asset is created with a content stub pointing to the source asset. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-external-content
element.description: Should external (URL) content be included. Defaults to 'true'. Should be set to 'false' if there are relative URLs.

element.name: include-licences
element.description: If set to true, visible licences covering this asset will be included in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-remote-content
element.description: Should remotely referenced content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-version-numbers
element.description: If the archive is for a user, should we include the assets version number in the filename. Defaults to false, unless 'versions' is set to 'all' in which case it defaults to true.

element.name: keep-acls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: locally-modified-only
element.description: By default all assets will be included in the archive. If only those assets that have been modified within this repository should be included, then set to true.

element.name: max-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes for the archive (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). If specified then the archive is guarenteed to be less than or equal to this size. If the assest metadata and optionally content excced this limit then multiple self-contained archives will be generated. This option is only valid where a directory-based 'url' is provided for output. If not specified there is no maximum size to the archive.

element.name: metadata-format
element.description: Specifies which format of the metadata generated in the archive entries. 'terse' output the XML metadata in its native format. 'extended' outputs the XML metadata in an extended self-describing formar. Defaults to 'extended'.

element.name: min-stime
element.description: Minimum server clock time (returned by previous call to archive) - assets modified after this time will be included. Defaults to zero.

element.name: namespace
element.description: Namespace to be archived. At least one namespace must be specified.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to archive. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: post-script
element.description: A script to embed in the archive to be executed on restore after assets have been restored.

element.name: pre-script
element.description: A script to embed in the archive to be executed on restore before any assets restored.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be archived. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-path-prefix
element.description: If the archive is for a user, these prefix strings will be removed from the namespace path of the asset.

element.name: to-asset
element.description: If specified, then the output of the archive should be placed in an asset.

attribute.name: validate-archive
attribute.description: Whether or not to verify the created archive's content is valid. This check is performed by extracting the newly created archives content and then comparing the checksums of the original content and the content of the newly created archive. Defaults to false, don't validate the archive. This check is equivalent to running the created asset through asset.archive.content.validate.

element.name: name
element.description: The name for the asset. If unspecified, then the asset will not have a name.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace of the asset to be created.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to receive the archive output. The given URL must be accessible by the server. The only supported output URLS are file paths. If not url specified, the output returned to caller.

element.name: use-original-name
element.description: Should assets be archived with their original name or the name they currently have after auto-rename due to collection. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: versions
element.description: Archive all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

service.name: asset.namespace.asset.meta.add
service.description: Adds a metadata fragment to the namespace that will be applied to assets created within the namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: asset-meta
element.description: Metadata to be automatically inherited or propagated by assets within this namespace. Inheritance or propagation are controlled by the documents ability to be in inherted or propagated.

attribute.name: inherit
attribute.description: Document types tagged as INHERITABLE will propagate by default. Inheritable fragments will not exist on the asset themselves and cannot be edited within the asset, but will be combined with any metadata the asset has when viewed. Inherited metadata fragments as marked as being 'inherited'. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable inheritance for these fragments for each supplied document type.

attribute.name: propagate
attribute.description: Document types tagged as PROPAGABLE will propagate by default. Propagable fragments will be added to the metadata of any asset created within this namespace. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable propagation for these fragments for each supplied document type.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.asset.meta.generate
service.description: Displays asset metadata, if any, for this namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path to the namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.asset.meta.inherit.set
service.description: Sets whether the namespace should inherit member asset metadata from its parent namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: inherit
element.description: Whether the namespace should inherit member asset metadata from its parent namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.asset.meta.remove
service.description: Removes a framgment of asset metadata from the namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: mid
element.description: The unique identitifier for the fragement of metadata to remove

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.asset.meta.remove.all
service.description: Removes all metadata framgments from the namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.asset.meta.set
service.description: Sets the metadata fragments on a namespace with those supplied, any existing fragments will be overwritten. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: asset-meta
element.description: Metadata to be automatically inherited or propagated by assets within this namespace. Inheritance or propagation are controlled by the documents ability to be in inherted or propagated.

attribute.name: inherit
attribute.description: Document types tagged as INHERITABLE will propagate by default. Inheritable fragments will not exist on the asset themselves and cannot be edited within the asset, but will be combined with any metadata the asset has when viewed. Inherited metadata fragments as marked as being 'inherited'. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable inheritance for these fragments for each supplied document type.

attribute.name: propagate
attribute.description: Document types tagged as PROPAGABLE will propagate by default. Propagable fragments will be added to the metadata of any asset created within this namespace. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable propagation for these fragments for each supplied document type.

element.name: inherit-asset-meta
element.description: Inherit metadata from parent namespace(s). Setting to 'false' will stop an asset witin the namespace hierarchy from obtaining any inherited or propagated metadata from namespaces above this.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.assets.get
service.description: Returns the identifies for assets in this namespace.

element.name: count
element.description: If true, count the number of assets that are accessible by the caller. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the namespace. If not specified, then check is based on the specified 'namespace'.

element.name: idx
element.description: Absolute cursor position. If used, the cursor will be positioned starting at 'idx'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace. If not specified, then defaults to the root namespace '/'

element.name: size
element.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 100.

element.name: where
element.description: Optional query to be used to filter the assets.

service.name: asset.namespace.behaviour.add
service.description: Add a behaviour to namespace

element.name: behaviour
element.description: A string that is interpreted by applications to provide particular behaviours when accessing the namespace.

attribute.name: scope
attribute.description: Which namespaces shoul the behaviour apply to? The this namespace only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to modify.

service.name: asset.namespace.behaviour.describe
service.description: Describe behaviours for a namespace

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to modify.

service.name: asset.namespace.behaviour.exists
service.description: Determine if a behaviour exists on a namespace

element.name: behaviour
element.description: The behaviour to test for.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to modify.

service.name: asset.namespace.contained.asset.index.create
service.description: Enables, if not already, an index for sub-members of this namespace. This will significantly increase query performance if there are many sub-collections. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace. A sub-member index can be created just for the specified namespace, and/or an index can be specified for every sub-namespace below (up to some specified number of levels deep).

element.name: cascade
element.description: Indicates whether create an index on all sub-namespaces (and on any future sub-namespaces). Defaults to false.

element.name: depth
element.description: The number of sub-levels to apply the change. Defaults to 'infinity' if cascade is true, and '1' if cascade is false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace on which to create index, or the upper namespace to create indexes on if cascading.

service.name: asset.namespace.contained.asset.index.destroy
service.description: Remove, if exists, any index for sub-members of this namespace. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace.

element.name: depth
element.description: The number of sub-levels to cascade. Defaults to '1'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace for which to destroy the index.

service.name: asset.namespace.content.copy.policy.remove
service.description: Removes the content copy policy for the specified namespace. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to remove the policy from.

service.name: asset.namespace.content.copy.policy.set
service.description: Changes the content copy policy for the specified namespace which assists with the slection of the copy returned when content is requeste. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to create.

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of a content copy policy to be used for the namespace. If not specified any existing content copy policy is removed and the parent namespace's content copy policy is used.

service.name: asset.namespace.count
service.description: Returns the total number of namespaces contained (and accessible to the caller) in the given namespace.

element.name: acount
element.description: Count the number of assets are contained in the namespace (and descendants). Defaults to false.

element.name: levels
element.description: The number of levels to descend when counting namespaces. Defaults to infinity. Specify '1' to count immediate children. When set to infinity, count includes the specified namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to count. If not specified, count the namespaces below the root namespace.

element.name: vacount
element.description: Count the number of assets that are visible to the caller. Defaults to false.

element.name: view
element.description: An optional view to use to qualify the namespace. If none specified, then callers view if any is used. Caller must have ACCESS permission to this view.

service.name: asset.namespace.create
service.description: Creates the given namespace. The parent path must exist.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: whether this is an inclusive ACL (permits the specified access) or exclusive ACL (prohibits the specified access). By default ACLs are inclusive.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: Asset specific access within the namespace. 'access' allows the actor to view assets within the namespace. 'create' allows the actor to create assets within the namespace. 'modify' allows the actor to edit assets within the namespace, this including renaming or moving the asset. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy assets within the namespace (permission to modify the asset and its content is also required to destroy). 'licence' allows the actor to apply licences to assets within the namespace. 'publish' indicates assets in this namespace can be published - e.g. generate an external object identifier. 'none' explicitly stops the actor from being able to view assets within the namespace. One of 'namespace' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.name: asset-content
element.description: Content specific access for assets within the namespace that needs to be set in order to access or modify asset content. 'access' allows the actor to access or download the assets content. 'modify' allows the actor to update an assets content. This requires that the matching 'asset' access is also set. That is, if 'access' is set, then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' is set then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The type of access to grant to the namespace itself. 'access' allows the actor visibility of the namespace. 'create' allows the actor to create sub-namespaces. 'modify' allows the actor to rename or move sub-namespaces. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy sub-namespaces. 'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of this namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'administer-children' allows the actor to administer child namespaces, but not this (parent) namespace. 'execute' allows file-system API (NFS,SFTP,SMB) access to the namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'none' means the actor is explicitly blocked from accessing the namespace. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: allow-rename
element.description: Some namespaces should never be renamed once created (except by administrators). Defaults to true.

element.name: asset-meta
element.description: Metadata to be automatically inherited or propagated by assets within this namespace. Inheritance or propagation are controlled by the documents ability to be in inherted or propagated.

attribute.name: inherit
attribute.description: Document types tagged as INHERITABLE will propagate by default. Inheritable fragments will not exist on the asset themselves and cannot be edited within the asset, but will be combined with any metadata the asset has when viewed. Inherited metadata fragments as marked as being 'inherited'. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable inheritance for these fragments for each supplied document type.

attribute.name: propagate
attribute.description: Document types tagged as PROPAGABLE will propagate by default. Propagable fragments will be added to the metadata of any asset created within this namespace. Setting this flag to 'false' will disable propagation for these fragments for each supplied document type.

element.name: auditing
element.description: Explicityly controls the enablement of auditing event types for this namespace and its children. If not set then defaults to the parent namespace hierarchy.

element.name: all
element.description: Enables or disables all auditing events for the given namespace

element.name: type
element.description: The explicit auditability of the named audit event type

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the audit event type.

element.name: behaviour
element.description: A string that is interpreted by applications to provide particular behaviours when accessing the namespace.

attribute.name: scope
attribute.description: Which namespaces shoul the behaviour apply to? The this namespace only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: content-copy-policy
element.description: The name of a content copy policy to be used for the namespace. If not specified, the parent namespace's content copy policy is used.

element.name: describe
element.description: Describe the namespace when created?

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for this namespace.

element.name: inherit-asset-meta
element.description: Inherit metadata from parent namespace(s). Setting to 'false' will stop an asset witin the namespace hierarchy from obtaining any inherited or propagated metadata from namespaces above this. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: inherit-templates
element.description: Inherit templates from parent namespace(s). Defaults to true.

element.name: meta-acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: document
element.description: The type of access to grant to the metadata document. The absence of any access denotes no access. 'create' plus 'modify' is equivalent to 'publish'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: type
element.description: The fully qualified document type the ACL applies to.

element.name: meta-layout
element.description: A metadata layout to use to control the order (and what) is displayed for metadata.

element.name: match
element.description: A pattern used to match metadata. Can be a literal document name, or a wilcard match (e.g. mf-*, or mynamesapce:*)

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The action to perform on match.

element.name: visible-to
element.description: An actor to grant access to. If none specified, then visible only to the creator.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The actor type.

element.name: model
element.description: The asset model to be employed for this namespace, if any.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to create.

attribute.name: all
attribute.description: Create parent namespaces if not found. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: inherit-acls
attribute.description: Whether this namespace should inherit ACLs from it's parent. If set to true, when checking an Actor's access if there are no ACLs on the current namespace that apply to the current actor, the actor will be assigned the same access it has been granted in the parent namespace. If set to only-if-no-acls, when checking an Actor's access if there are no ACLs on the current namespace that apply to the current actor and the namespace has no other ACLs, the actor will be assigned the same access as it has been granted in the parent namespace.
