If set to false, when checking an Actor's access. The only ACLs that apply are one on the current namespace. Defaults to: only-if-no-acls

element.name: quota
element.description: A space quota to add to the namespace. The quota applies to all content in the namespace (irrespective of backing store) and all descendent namespaces.

element.name: allocation
element.description: The quota in bytes (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). (If not specified the quota defaults to 9223372036854775807.)

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for quota.

element.name: on-overflow
element.description: What should occur if use exceeds the quota? Defaults to fail

element.name: owner
element.description: User that manages/owns this quota. Can be contacted changes to the quota

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: trigger
element.description: Describes a relative use threshold an action that should occur when the threshold is crossed.

element.name: direction
element.description: Determines whether the action is triggered when use increases past the threshold or when use drop belose the threshold (default is increase)

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute then the event is triggered. This is an inline script that will be passed the following arguments: namespace,allocation,used,threshold,direction=above|below.

element.name: threshold
element.description: The relative use of the quota (0=empty, 0.5=50%, 1=full)

element.name: store
element.description: The name of a data store to be used for the namespace. If not specified, the parent namespace's store is used.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of a data store policy to be used for the namespace. If not specified, the parent namespace's store is used.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? The this namespace only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: visible-to
element.description: Limit visibility of the namespace to these actors.

element.name: actor
element.description: An actor that has visibility of this namespace. If specified, then will be deemed to be invisible to actors without this role.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of role

element.name: worm
element.description: Write-once, read-many properties, if any.

element.name: applies-to
element.description: Indicates what parts of the asset the WORM state applies to. Defaults to 'all'

element.name: apply-to-collections
element.description: If true, then include collection assets in the WORM policy. By default is set to 'true' - apply to both collections and non-collection assets.

element.name: can-add-versions
element.description: Indicates whether new versions of metadata and content are allowed when in the WORM state. Defaults to false.

element.name: can-alter-if
element.description: Indicates when/who can modify the WORM state. Defaults to 'system-manager'

element.name: can-move
element.description: Indicates whether the collection, or asset(s) can be moved. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: destroy-on-expiry
element.description: Indicates whether assets are destroyed once the WORM state ceases (retention period expires). Defaults to false.

element.name: lock-path
element.description: If true, then disallow collection rename, move or destroy for this and any sub-collection that contains a member in the WORM state. Defaults to false, allowing collection rename/move. If true, will enter this state immediately any asset therein enters the WORM state, and will exit when there are no sub-members in the WORM state.

element.name: min-number-content-copies
element.description: If true, then disallow collection rename or move for this and any sub-collection that contains a member in the WORM state. Defaults to false, allowing collection rename/move. If true, will enter this state immediately any asset therein enters the WORM state, and will exit when there are no sub-members in the WORM state. If this flag is retrospectively changed it will not look for existing assets in the WORM state - it will only trigger when assets newly enter the WORM state.

element.name: must-have-content
element.description: Indicates whether or not the asset must have content to enter the WORM state. By default is set to 'true'

element.name: retention
element.description: The default period (in days) for the WORM expiry time for assets created in this collection. The expiry time will be set to current time plus this period. If not specified, must be specified at asset create time.

element.name: trigger
element.description: The trigger that puts assets in this namespace into the WORM state. Defaults to 'create'

service.name: asset.namespace.describe
service.description: Returns details about the namespace and, if requested, descendant namespaces.

element.name: app
element.description: If set, will list any application settings for the specified application that are associated with the namespace. Specify '*' to show settings for all applications. If not specified, then no application setting shown.

element.name: app-prefix
element.description: If set, will list any application settings that start with this prefix.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the namespace.

element.name: levels
element.description: Specifies the number of levels to descend. Defaults to zero (the namespace itself).

element.name: list-contents
element.description: Indicates whether to list the contained namespaces. Defaults to true.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of one or more namespaces to describe (and list the contents). If not specified, describes the root namespace.

element.name: nscount
element.description: Indicates whether to count the number of descendent namespaces that are accessible to the caller. Defaults to false.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, return only namespaces that start with the provided prefix.

element.name: show-hidden
element.description: Show hidden namespaces, if any. Defaults to false.

element.name: vacount
element.description: Indicates whether to count the assets in the namespace that are visible to the caller. This can slow the request response. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.namespace.description.set
service.description: Updates the description for a namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for this namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.destroy
service.description: Destroys the specified namespace. Generates an error if not found, unless 'force' is set to true.

element.name: atomic
element.description: If set to true, then all assets contained within must be destroyed or none will be. Defaults to false.

element.name: force
element.description: If set to true, does not generate an error if not found. The default is false - to generate errors.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to destroy.

service.name: asset.namespace.empty.count
service.description: Returns the number of empty namespaces. By default only leaf nodes are tested, but this can be changed to show all empty nodes.

element.name: leaf-only
element.description: Should we return only lead namespaces with no sub-namespace. If not specified, defaults to 'true'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path to a namespace to check. If not specified, describes the root namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.empty.list
service.description: Returns a list of empty namespaces. By default only leaf nodes are tested, but this can be changed to show all empty nodes.

element.name: count
element.description: If set, returns the number of matches in the set. Will also be enabled if the action is 'count'

element.name: idx
element.description: Absolute cursor position. If used, the cursor will be positioned starting at 'idx'.

element.name: leaf-only
element.description: Should we return only lead namespaces with no sub-namespace. If not specified, defaults to 'true'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path to a namespace to check. If not specified, describes the root namespace.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 100 for actions returning results.

service.name: asset.namespace.enqueue.all.remove
service.description: Removes all enqueing requests on the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update.

service.name: asset.namespace.enqueue.namespace.find
service.description: Find all namespaces (below the specified namespace) that have enqueue triggers.

element.name: describe-enqueue
element.description: If true, then describe the enqueue configuration for the found namespace. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace search. Defaults to the root namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.enqueue.set
service.description: Set or replace enqueuing of asset to a processing queue for this namespace and all sub-namespaces.

element.name: enqueue
element.description: A request to enqueue assets based on events to an asset processing queue.

element.name: app-data
element.description: Optional application data that will be passed to the processing service.

element.name: app-key
element.description: An optional correlation key to some configuration that will be passed to the processing service. Where possible, an 'app-key' is preferred to 'app-data' because it is more efficient to store.

element.name: event
element.description: One or more events that will cause the enqueing of the asset. If not specified, defaults to all.

element.name: name
element.description: A unqiue name for the request.

element.name: queue
element.description: The name of an asset processing queue (must exist).

element.name: where
element.description: An optional arbitrary query to determine whether the asset should be enqueued.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update.

service.name: asset.namespace.exists
service.description: Returns a boolean value indicating the existence or otherwise of the specified namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.get
service.description: Returns the namespace of a specified asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The asset to get the namespace of. Ignored if 'id' specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset to get the namespace of.

service.name: asset.namespace.list
service.description: Returns a list of root namespaces (if no namespace supplied) or namespaces within the given namespace. Can also return assets contained in the namespace.

element.name: action
element.description: Indicates the action for the assets, if any. Defaults to 'get-meta'.

element.name: app-settings
element.description: Controls whether to list application properties as well. Default is false.

element.name: assets
element.description: Controls whether to list assets as well. Default is false.

element.name: id
element.description: The namespace 'ID' of a namespace to list the contents. If not specified and the 'namespace' argument is not specified, lists the root namespace.

element.name: idx
element.description: Indicates the cursor position to retrieve, when retrieving assets. Defaults to 1.

element.name: max-ctime
element.description: The maximum creation time (inclusive)

element.name: min-ctime
element.description: The minimum creation time (inclusive)

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to list the contents. If not specified and the 'id' argument is not specified, lists the root namespace. Takes precedence over 'id' argument.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, return only namespaces that start with the provided prefix.

element.name: show-hidden
element.description: Show hidden namespaces, if any. Defaults to false.

element.name: size
element.description: Indicates the maximum number of assets to list at a time. Defaults to 100.

element.name: sort
element.description: The sort order for returned results. The default is 'alpha-asc' - alphanumeric sort, ascending order.

element.name: view
element.description: An optional view to use to qualify the namespace. If no specified, then callers view if any is used. Caller must have ACCESS permission to this view.

service.name: asset.namespace.meta.acl.check
service.description: Checks access to metadata documents while within the specified namespace or parents there of.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

element.name: type
element.description: The metadata document to check.

service.name: asset.namespace.meta.acl.script.create
service.description: Produces a Tcl script documenting metadata access controls for the given namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to document.

element.name: recursive
element.description: Should child namespaces be documented. Defaults to 'false'.

service.name: asset.namespace.meta.acl.set
service.description: Sets access to metadata documents on the specified namespace. If there are already ACL entries for Metadata on the namespace then they will be overwritten with this new set. The caller must have ADMINISTER access to the namespace.

element.name: meta-acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: document
element.description: The type of access to grant to the metadata document. The absence of any access denotes no access. 'create' plus 'modify' is equivalent to 'publish'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: type
element.description: The fully qualified document type the ACL applies to.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.meta.layout.set
service.description: Set or replace the metadata layout associated with this namespace and all sub-namespaces (unless overridden).

element.name: meta-layout
element.description: A metadata layout to use to control the order (and what) is displayed for metadata.

element.name: match
element.description: A pattern used to match metadata. Can be a literal document name, or a wilcard match (e.g. mf-*, or mynamesapce:*)

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The action to perform on match.

element.name: visible-to
element.description: An actor to grant access to. If none specified, then visible only to the creator.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The actor type.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update

service.name: asset.namespace.meta.layout.unset
service.description: Remove the metadata layout associated with this namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update

service.name: asset.namespace.move
service.description: Moves the specified namespace to another parent namespace.

element.name: id
element.description: The namespace 'ID' of a namespace to move.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to move. Takes precedence over 'id' argument.

element.name: to
element.description: The new parent for a namespace. Takes precedence over 'to-id' argument.

element.name: to-id
element.description: The id of a new parent for the namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.quota.allocation.set
service.description: Change the allocation for an existing quota. Caller must have administrative rights on collection to change a quota.

element.name: allocation
element.description: The quota in bytes (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). (If not specified the quota defaults to 9223372036854775807.)

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update

service.name: asset.namespace.quota.remove
service.description: Remove a storage quota from a namespace. Caller must have administrative rights on collection to change a quota.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update

service.name: asset.namespace.quota.set
service.description: Add or replace a storage quota on a namespace. Caller must have administrative rights on collection to change a quota.

element.name: batchsize
element.description: The transaction batchsize (defaults to 1000). This only applies if the quota needs to created.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update

element.name: quota
element.description: A space quota to add to the namespace. The quota applies to all content in the namespace (irrespective of backing store) all descendent namespaces.

element.name: allocation
element.description: The quota in bytes (may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB). (If not specified the quota defaults to 9223372036854775807.)

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for quota.

element.name: on-overflow
element.description: What should occur if use exceeds the quota? Defaults to fail

element.name: owner
element.description: User that manages/owns this quota. Can be contacted changes to the quota

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: trigger
element.description: Describes a relative use threshold an action that should occur when the threshold is crossed.

element.name: direction
element.description: Determines whether the action is triggered when use increases past the threshold or when use drop belose the threshold (default is increase)

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute then the event is triggered. This is an inline script that will be passed the following arguments: namespace,allocation,used,threshold,direction=above|below.

element.name: threshold
element.description: The relative use of the quota (0=empty, 0.5=50%, 1=full)

element.name: replace
element.description: Replace an existing quota. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.namespace.rename
service.description: Changes the name of the given namespace.

element.name: id
element.description: The namespace 'ID' of the namespace.

element.name: name
element.description: The new name for the namespace to rename.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace to rename. Takes precedence over 'id' argument.

service.name: asset.namespace.rename.allow
service.description: Set whether the namespaces can only be renamed by system administrators (allow=false) or by anyone (allow=true). If set to false, then namespace administrators will not be able to rename.

element.name: allow
element.description: Set to true to allow and false to stop non-administrators renaming a namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.add
service.description: Add one or more service collections to a namespace.

element.name: collection
element.description: The names of collection(s) of services to add.

attribute.name: inheritance
attribute.description: The inheritance type to use. If set to inherit, this namespace service collection will be inherited by sub namespaces. Defaults to: inherited

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to add the service collection(s) to.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.describe
service.description: Describes the services collections for a namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.exists
service.description: Checks to see whether a namespace has an associated named service collection.

element.name: collection
element.description: The name(s) of the service collections, to check existance of.

element.name: inherit
element.description: Whether to inherit service collections from parent namespaces, or not. Defaults to true (include inherited service collections).

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.list
service.description: Lists the services collections for a namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for. Defaults to the root namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.remove
service.description: Removes service collections from a namespace.

element.name: collection
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.service.describe
service.description: Describes the services that a namespace service collection has, optionally excluding some services.

element.name: exclude
element.description: The prefix of service names to exclude

element.name: idx
element.description: If specified, the listed services will be start at the 'idx'th service. Defaults to 1.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of services to list. Defaults to 100.

element.name: sort-arguments
element.description: If set to true, service arguments are sorted aphabetically when described. Defaults to 'true'.

service.name: asset.namespace.service.collection.service.list
service.description: Returns the services that a namespace service collection has, optionally excluding some services.

element.name: exclude
element.description: The prefix of service names to exclude

element.name: idx
element.description: If specified, the listed services will be start at the 'idx'th service. Defaults to 1.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to get the service collection for.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of services to list. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.namespace.store.name
service.description: Returns the data store that would be used by the specified namespace if an asset was created at the time of the service call. This will either be the configured store, or if configured to use a store policy, then will return a store determined by the policy.

element.name: id
element.description: An asset identifier.

element.name: length
element.description: The length of the content being created, if known. If the namespace is backed by a policy content length may influence the store that is allocated.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of one or more namespaces to describe (and list the contents). If not specified, describes the root namespace.

element.name: traverse
element.description: If namespaces are supplied and any do not exist should the namespace hierarchy be traversed until an existing parent namespace is found. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.namespace.store.set
service.description: Changes the data store (for new content) for the specified namespace. The caller must have ADMINISTER rights for the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace the store or policy will be assigned to.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of a data store to be used for the namespace.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of a data store policy to be used for the namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.store.unset
service.description: Removes the definition of a data store or store policy for the specified namespace. The namespace will then inherit its store or policy from the parent namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace which a statically defined store or policy will be removed from.

service.name: asset.namespace.template.add
service.description: Adds a metadata template to the namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? The this namespace only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

service.name: asset.namespace.template.inherit.set
service.description: Sets whether the namespace should inherit templates from its parent namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: inherit
element.description: Whether the namespace should inherit templates from its parent namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.template.metadata.generate
service.description: Generates metadata templates, if any, for assets to be created in this namespace.

element.name: for
element.description: The target of the templates. If 'asset', then will generate templates for assets in this namespace. If 'namespace', then will generate templates for all metadata attached to this namespace. Defaults to 'asset'.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path to the namespace.

element.name: type
element.description: The document type to generate. If not specified, generates all.

service.name: asset.namespace.template.remove
service.description: Removes all metadata templates from a namespace. Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.template.set
service.description: Sets the metadata template to the namespace, overriding any exitsing templates Requires ADMINISTER permission for the namespace.

element.name: inherit-templates
element.description: Inherit templates from parent namespace(s).

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? The this namespace only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

service.name: asset.namespace.tmp.file.create
service.description: Returns the path to a temporary file in the cache of the store backing the namespaces.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of a namespace. If not specified, describes the root namespace.

element.name: size
element.description: The size of the content being written, if known. This aids in the selection of content stores is namespace is backed by a policy.

element.name: suffix
element.description: An optional suffix to apply the temporary file path.

service.name: asset.namespace.transform.template.describe
service.description: Describes Namespace Transform Templates.

element.name: template
element.description: The name of a specifc namespace template

service.name: asset.namespace.transform.template.list
service.description: Removes a Namespace Transform Template.

service.name: asset.namespace.transform.tree
service.description: Generates a tree representing the transformed namespace heirarchy for the assets in the result set.

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' (that is, all assets).

element.name: xpath
element.description: A component part of the mapping specification to map asset metadata into a custom namespace

service.name: asset.namespace.update
service.description: Updates the given namespace. This service will update all of the possible attributes. For example, if the description is not supplied, then it will be cleared. If ACLs are not supplied, then they will be cleared. This service is intended for applications that set all the attributes in the one call. Caller must have administration rights to the namespace.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for the namespace, and assets contained therein.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: whether this is an inclusive ACL (permits the specified access) or exclusive ACL (prohibits the specified access). By default ACLs are inclusive.

element.name: access
element.description: The access for the given actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: Asset specific access within the namespace. 'access' allows the actor to view assets within the namespace. 'create' allows the actor to create assets within the namespace. 'modify' allows the actor to edit assets within the namespace, this including renaming or moving the asset. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy assets within the namespace (permission to modify the asset and its content is also required to destroy). 'licence' allows the actor to apply licences to assets within the namespace. 'publish' indicates assets in this namespace can be published - e.g. generate an external object identifier. 'none' explicitly stops the actor from being able to view assets within the namespace. One of 'namespace' or 'asset' access must be specified.

element.name: asset-content
element.description: Content specific access for assets within the namespace that needs to be set in order to access or modify asset content. 'access' allows the actor to access or download the assets content. 'modify' allows the actor to update an assets content. This requires that the matching 'asset' access is also set. That is, if 'access' is set, then 'asset' must have 'access' set, and similarly if 'modify' is set then 'asset' must have 'modify' set.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The type of access to grant to the namespace itself. 'access' allows the actor visibility of the namespace. 'create' allows the actor to create sub-namespaces. 'modify' allows the actor to rename or move sub-namespaces. 'destroy' allows the actor to destroy sub-namespaces. 'administer' allows the actor the ability to manage the access control, metadata access controls, metadata templates, quotas and inherited asset metadata of this namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'administer-children' allows the actor to administer child namespaces, but not this (parent) namespace. 'execute' allows file-system API (NFS,SFTP,SMB) access to the namespace and its sub-namespaces. 'none' means the actor is explicitly blocked from accessing the namespace. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: app
element.description: If set, will list any application properties for the specified application that are associated with the namespace.

element.name: app-prefix
element.description: If set, will list any application settings that start with this prefix.

element.name: describe
element.description: Describe the namespace after update?

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for this namespace.

element.name: inherit-templates
element.description: Inherit templates from parent namespace(s). Defaults to true.

element.name: model
element.description: The asset model to be employed for this namespace, if any.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to update.

element.name: nscount
element.description: Indicates whether to count the number of descendent namespaces that are accessible to the caller. Defaults to false.

element.name: show-hidden
element.description: Show hidden namespaces, if any. Defaults to false. Only applicable if 'describe' is true.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: scope
element.description: How should this metadata be applied? The this namespace only (self), descendants only, or all?

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

element.name: vacount
element.description: Indicates whether to count the assets in the namespace that are visible to the caller. This can slow the request response. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.namespace.using
service.description: Returns details about namespaces using specific models or with templates containing specific document types or document namespaces.

element.name: doc-namespace
element.description: A document namespace to search for within the namespace templates.

element.name: doc-type
element.description: A document type to search for within the namespace templates.

element.name: model
element.description: An asset model to search for.

element.name: namespace
element.description: A namespace from which to commence the search. If not specified, deafults to the root namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.asset.path
service.description: Returns the path for a given asset, or all, virtual namespace hierarchies.

element.name: id
element.description: The id to the asset.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the virtual namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.create
service.description: Creates a virtual namespace hierarchy. The hierarchy must be uniquely named. It can be attached to an existing namespace path, or may be independent. Creating/destroying etc. sub-namespaces via a virtual namespace is not permitted - a virtual namespace is synthesized.

element.name: min-depth
element.description: The minimum number of levels of matched functions in the path for an asset to appear in the virtual namespaces. Defaults to all.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the virtual namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The root namespace, if any, onto which this virtual namespace is mounted.

element.name: path
element.description: The functional path to generate. A path may have many components.

element.name: function
element.description: A function that generates path

element.name: version
element.description: The labelled version (e.g. LATEST) for which this virtual namespace applies. If not set, then generated for all versions.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.describe
service.description: Describes the specififed, or all, virtual namespace hierarchies.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the virtual namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.destroy
service.description: Creates a virtual namespace hierarchy. The hierarchy must be uniquely named. It can be attached to an existing namespace path, or may be independent.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the virtual namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.exists
service.description: Test is a named virtual namespace hierarchy exists.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the virtual namespace.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.generate
service.description: Generates/re-generates the specified hierarchy, or all hierarchies. The set of evaluants can be restricted by the where clause.

element.name: commit
element.description: How often should updates be committed. Defaults to 1.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the virtual namespace. If not specified, then all namespaces are (re-)generated.

element.name: where
element.description: An arbitrary subset of assets.

service.name: asset.namespace.virtual.hierarchy.list
service.description: Returns a list of the known virtual namespace hierarchies.

service.name: asset.namespace.worm.remove
service.description: Removes any existing WORM policy on a namespace. Caller must have administration rights to the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of one or more namespaces to update WORM policy.

service.name: asset.namespace.worm.set
service.description: Sets or updates the WORM policy associated with a namespace. Caller must have administration rights to the namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path of one or more namespaces to update WORM policy.

element.name: worm
element.description: Write-once, read-many properties, if any.

element.name: applies-to
element.description: Indicates what parts of the asset the WORM state applies to. Defaults to 'all'

element.name: apply-to-collections
element.description: If true, then include collection assets in the WORM policy. By default is set to 'true' - apply to both collections and non-collection assets.

element.name: can-add-versions
element.description: Indicates whether new versions of metadata and content are allowed when in the WORM state. Defaults to false.

element.name: can-alter-if
element.description: Indicates when/who can modify the WORM state. Defaults to 'system-manager'

element.name: can-move
element.description: Indicates whether the collection, or asset(s) can be moved. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: destroy-on-expiry
element.description: Indicates whether assets are destroyed once the WORM state ceases (retention period expires). Defaults to false.

element.name: lock-path
element.description: If true, then disallow collection rename, move or destroy for this and any sub-collection that contains a member in the WORM state. Defaults to false, allowing collection rename/move. If true, will enter this state immediately any asset therein enters the WORM state, and will exit when there are no sub-members in the WORM state.

element.name: min-number-content-copies
element.description: If true, then disallow collection rename or move for this and any sub-collection that contains a member in the WORM state. Defaults to false, allowing collection rename/move. If true, will enter this state immediately any asset therein enters the WORM state, and will exit when there are no sub-members in the WORM state. If this flag is retrospectively changed it will not look for existing assets in the WORM state - it will only trigger when assets newly enter the WORM state.

element.name: must-have-content
element.description: Indicates whether or not the asset must have content to enter the WORM state. By default is set to 'true'

element.name: retention
element.description: The default period (in days) for the WORM expiry time for assets created in this collection. The expiry time will be set to current time plus this period. If not specified, must be specified at asset create time.

element.name: trigger
element.description: The trigger that puts assets in this namespace into the WORM state. Defaults to 'create'

service.name: asset.owner.clear
service.description: Removes the owner of an asset. Must be the owner, or have write permission to the asset to change.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.owner.set
service.description: Changes the owner of an asset. Must be the owner, or have write permission to the asset to change.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: user
element.description: The identity of the user.

service.name: asset.parent.count
service.description: Returns the number of parent asset (collections) for the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.parent.find
service.description: Given an asset (id), finds the parent (id) for the asset that matches a given query predicate.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: max-depth
element.description: The maximum depth from the parent.

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query for the parent.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

service.name: asset.part.add
service.description: Adds one or more assets to this (container) asset.

element.name: contents
element.description: The contents to add

element.name: id
element.description: The path to an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.part.list
service.description: Returns the content, if any, of an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

element.name: version
element.description: The version. If not specified, defaults to latest.

service.name: asset.part.remove
service.description: Removes one or more assets from this (container) asset.

element.name: contents
element.description: The contents to add

element.name: id
element.description: The path to an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.path.generate
service.description: Generates a (file) path from a specification of the path.

element.name: expr
element.description: The expression used to generate the path. The format of the expression is Asset Path Language (APL).

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: variable
element.description: Arbitrary named variable referred to in the expression.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable

service.name: asset.policy.soft.destroy.describe
service.description: Describe the current soft destroy policy, if any.

service.name: asset.policy.undo.soft.destroy.describe
service.description: Describe the current undo soft destroy policy, if any.

service.name: asset.preparation.request.create
service.description: Creates a request to prepare assets and then send a notification and/or execute a service when prepared.

element.name: asset-service
element.description: An optional (asset) service to execute for each asset once any migration has been done. The service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service. The service definition must include 'id' for the asset identifier. The service is considered to execute synchronously, unless there is an assets-completed-service specified.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: assets-complete-service
element.description: If specified, then a service to determine whether (all) assets have completed the specified asset-service operation. That is, this service is not per-asset, but rather for all assets.

attribute.name: expression
attribute.description: A FAQL expression against the result of the completion service which returns a boolean, where 'true' means complete and 'false' means incomplete.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: assets-service
element.description: An optional (asset) service to execute for all assets once any migration has been done. The service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service. The service is considered to execute synchronously, unless there is an assets-completed-service specified.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, prepare all assets in this collection.

element.name: completion-service
element.description: An optional service to execute on completion of preparation. The service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the request.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, prepare the specified assets.

element.name: max-time-in-failure
element.description: The maximum elapsed time for continous failures in minutes before giving up. Defaults to 1440 (24.0 hours).

element.name: migrate
element.description: A symbolic tier, where 'online' means tier 1, and 'offline' means tier 2.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The migration priority. If not set, defaults to session priority or the default value of 50

attribute.name: store
attribute.description: The store to migrate online. If not specified, then all stores migrated unless they are disabled.

element.name: name
element.description: An arbitrary name for the request.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, prepare all assets in this namespace.

element.name: notification-email-address
element.description: The email address to send notifications (if requested). If not specified, then user must have an e-mail address.

element.name: post-prepare-instructions
element.description: Arbitrary instructions on what to do after preparation.

element.name: processing-batch-size
element.description: By default all assets are processed at a time. The processing can be broken into batches by specifying a batch size. For example, this may be required if there are insufficient resources migrate all assets at the same time.

element.name: send-notification-email
element.description: If true, then send a notification e-mail on completion. The e-mail can be associated with the calling user, or supplied.

element.name: versions
element.description: Version selection, if any.

element.name: after
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created after this time.

element.name: all
element.description: Include all versions. Defaults to false.

element.name: before
element.description: If specified, then only copy content for versions created before this time.

element.name: exclude
element.description: Exclude this specific version from the list of all versions. Ignored if 'all' not specified as true.

element.name: include
element.description: Include this specific version.

element.name: max-idx
element.description: The maximum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to infinity (the oldest).

element.name: min-idx
element.description: The minimum ordinal index for the version to include. Defaults to 0 (the latest).

element.name: where
element.description: If specified, defines the subset (query) of assets to prepare.

service.name: asset.preparation.request.describe
service.description: Describes a request to prepare assets.

element.name: after
element.description: If specified, describe requests after this identifier. Ignored if 'id' is specified. Defaults to zero.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the preparation request to describe.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number to return. Ignored if 'id' specified. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.preparation.request.destroy
service.description: Destroy a request to prepare assets. Can only be destroyed if an administrator or the creator / owner of the request.

element.name: id
element.description: The identify of the preparation request to destroy.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.add
service.description: Add an asset to the queue.

element.name: app-data
element.description: Optional application data that will be passed to the processing service.

element.name: app-key
element.description: An optional correlation key to some configuration that will be passed to the processing service. Where possible, an 'app-key' is preferred to 'app-data' because it is more efficient to store.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: A specific version defined by the specied label. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: name
element.description: A queue name. One of 'id' or 'name' must be specified.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified namespace, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the namespace - it will simply walk down the namespace tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: qid
element.description: A queue identifier. One of 'id' or 'name' must be specified.

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' for AQL and namespace()>='/' for FAQL - that is, all assets. If there is more than one where clause, then the second and subsequent clauses are evaluated (linearly) against the result set of the first where clause (a post filter).

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.after.set
service.description: Sets the current position of the queue, i.e. its 'after' value. When set, only entries with IDs larger than this new value will be processed. This service will not affect queue statistics, i.e. existing statistics will be preserved.

element.name: after
element.description: Specifies the 'after' value for the processing queue. Only entries with IDs larger than this value will be processed. Defaults to '0'.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.create
service.description: Create a processing queue.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the queue.

element.name: failure-service
element.description: A service to execute on failure. The service must accept two arguments: 'queue' - the processing queue name, and 'entry-id' - the queue entry identifier.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the queue.

element.name: nb-processors
element.description: The number of threads to process entries in the queue. Defaults to one.

element.name: processing-delay
element.description: A delay in milliseconds before each entry is executed. That is, the entry must be in the queue for at least this time in order to execute. Defaults to zero.

element.name: processing-service
element.description: A service to perform processing. It must take an asset identifier with version attribute argument. It may optionally take an argument 'app-key' which will be a long integer in the range [1..N] or an optional argument 'app-data'. The app-key is only provided if there is a non-zero 'app-key' specified when an asset is inserted into the queue.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this job will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.delay.set
service.description: Changes the processing delay for a queue.

element.name: delay
element.description: A delay in milliseconds before each entry is executed. That is, the entry must be in the queue for at least this time in order to execute.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.describe
service.description: Returns a information on asset processing queues, if any.

element.name: display-full-stack-trace
element.description: If true and displaying failures, then display the full exception stack trace. Defaults to false - just the first part of the message will be shown.

element.name: max-nb-active
element.description: The number of active to show, if any. Defaults to zero.

element.name: max-nb-failures
element.description: The number of failures to show, if any. Defaults to zero. Will display in order of most recent to oldest.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a queue.

element.name: prefix
element.description: An optional prefix for the queue names.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.description.set
service.description: Updates the description for the queue.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.entry.count
service.description: Returns the number of assets in a processing queue.

element.name: after
element.description: Entry index to start at. Defaults to zero.

element.name: asset-id
element.description: The identity of one or more assets.

element.name: before
element.description: Entry index to stop at. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: before-current-after
element.description: If true, then count the number of oentries up to the current / active position.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.entry.describe
service.description: Returns a information on assets in a processing queue.

element.name: after
element.description: Entry index to start at. Defaults to zero.

element.name: asset-id
element.description: The identity of one or more assets.

element.name: before
element.description: Entry index to stop at. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: before-current-after
element.description: If true, then count the number of entries up to the current / active position.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a queue.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to retrieve. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.entry.reexecute
service.description: Re-execute (and wait to complete or error) one or more entries in the queue. This is only allowable for failed entries.

element.name: asset-id
element.description: The identity of one or more assets.

element.name: fail-on-error
element.description: If true, then fail if an error is encountered. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a queue entry.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.entry.remove
service.description: Remove one or more entries from the queue.

element.name: asset-id
element.description: The identity of one or more assets.

element.name: before-current-after
element.description: If true, then count the number of oentries up to the current / active position.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a queue entry.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not the named queue exists.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.list
service.description: Returns a list of asset processing queues, if any.

element.name: prefix
element.description: An optional prefix for the queue names.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.number.processors.set
service.description: Changes the number of processors for the queue.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the queue.

element.name: nb
element.description: The number of processors.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.rename
service.description: Create a processing queue.

element.name: new-name
element.description: A unique name for the queue.

element.name: old-name
element.description: The name of the queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.reset
service.description: Resets the queue. All jobs will be requeued including failed ones, and all current statistics on the queue will be reset.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the queue.

service.name: asset.processing.queue.service.set
service.description: Set the processing service for the queue. This change will only take effect after a backup processing queue is reset on server restart or by executing service 'asset.processing.queue.reset'.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the queue.

element.name: processing-service
element.description: A service to perform processing. It must take an asset identifier with version attribute argument.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

service.name: asset.project.describe
service.description: Describes the state of an existing project.

element.name: count-assets
element.description: Should the description include a count of all assets. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: count-namespaces
element.description: Should the description include a count of all sub-namespace. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-acls
element.description: Should the description include any ACL on the namespace. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-data-store
element.description: Should the description include the data store backing the project. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-dictionaries
element.description: Should the description include dictionaries defined for the project. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-documents
element.description: Should the description include documents defined for the project. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-quotas
element.description: Should the description include any quota on the namespace. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-roles
element.description: Should the description include roles defined for the project. Defaults to 'true'

attribute.name: actors
attribute.description: Should the description of the roles includ the actors they have been assigned to. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: describe-templates
element.description: Should the description include templates on the namespace. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the project to describe. Should only be used if the project collection was created as a namespace.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The path to a base namespace within which the project resides. If not supplied the default namespace for new projects will be used, this can be configured through the 'projects.namespace' application property.

element.name: total-content-size
element.description: Should the description include the total size of all asset content. Defaults to 'true'

service.name: asset.proxy.get
service.description: Retrieves a proxy to represent the asset using the given relationship type (or an icon if no relationship exists). See 'asset.icon.get' for information on the icon parameters.

element.name: icon
element.description: If no relationship is found, then an icon will be generated. These aruments pertain the the icon.

element.name: lossless
element.description: If set to true, will generate a lossless encoded image. If set to false (the default), will use lossy compression, a function of the quality.

element.name: quality
element.description: The quality of the image generation. This will affect interpolation and compression (if any). The interpolation is as follows: [quality<0.5 -> nearest neighbour, 0.5<=quality<1.0 -> bilinear, quality=1.0 -> bicubic]. Zero is the lowest quality. Defaults to 0.8

element.name: size
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the largest dimension (width or height). The icon will only be resized if it is larger than this size. If not specified, size defaults to 32.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: relationship
element.description: The relationship type. May be zero or more relationship types, that are searched for in the order they are supplied. The type may (or may not) be a proxy type relationship.

element.name: variable
element.description: Variables to supply to a custom icon generator/transform.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

service.name: asset.prune
service.label: Prune
service.description: Removes all but specified versions of an asset. May keep N versions, and/or only versions that have been labelled.

element.name: enomatch
element.description: Controls whether an error is generated if an asset does not have any matching versions. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: keep
element.description: A labelled version to keep. If no keep is specified, nor any literal version number is specified to be pruned, then applies the default 'keep' pruning rule which keeps all labelled versions. If there are multiple keep elements, then the results are AND'd together.

attribute.name: match
attribute.description: Specifies whether all or any (at least one) of the labels must match to be retained.

attribute.name: versions
attribute.description: Specifies the versions to keep. 'eq'uals specifies only versions matching the label predicate. 'gte' specifies versions greater than or equal the version matching the predicate and 'lte' is less than or equal.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to match.

element.name: keep-content
element.description: Controls whether the last asset versions with each content id is kept. This ensures that no content is lost during the pruning process. Defaults to false.

element.name: prior-to
element.description: Versions created after this date will be kept.

element.name: prune-labelled-versions
element.description: If true, then allow pruning of labelled versions that are not included in those to 'keep'. Defaults to false.

element.name: retain
element.description: Specifies the minimum number of recent versions to retain. Defaults to 1, retaining the LATEST asset version. If set to zero, then will only delete the LATEST version if there are other versions to be kept.

element.name: txn-size
element.description: The maximum number of versions to prune per version. Defaults to 1.

element.name: version
element.description: Specifies version number(s) to be pruned. A version number explicitly specified will be pruned regardless of whether it matches the label nor time based pruning rules. If version number is specified, then only one asset id is allowed to be specified for the service.

service.name: asset.query
service.description: Executes a query on assets. The query may operate on the resultant set, or return results according to the 'action'. The output may be supplied in two ways: i) as an XML document returned with the message, or ii) if the caller requests an 'output' then as an attached data file.

element.name: action
element.description: Action to apply to query. Defaults to 'get-id', unless 'text' is specified, in which case it defaults to 'get-text'.

element.name: as
element.description: Indicates how the results should be returned. The default is 'results'. If 'iterator', then return as a handle to an iterator to be accessed using the service 'asset.query.iterate'.

element.name: cache
element.description: Identifies whether the server should cache results (in larger chunks than the requested size) to avoid reexecuting the query every time against the database [cache=use], whether to reload the existing cache [cache=reload] or whether to disable caching [cache=none]. Using caching can increase query performance when iterating through a set of results. Defaults to 'reload' when 'idx' has a value of 1, 'use' if 'idx' has some other value and 'none' otherwise.

element.name: check-if-image
element.description: If set, then check to see whether the asset is an image that can be read by the server.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: content-as-xml
element.description: Retrieve the content as XML for the asset. This option is only valid when the action is 'get-meta' and only applies for assets that have text/xml content.

element.name: count
element.description: If set, returns the number of matches in the set. Will also be enabled if the action is 'count'

element.name: entity
element.description: When retrieving values, this is the name of the enclosing element. If not specified, defaults to 'asset'.

element.name: filter
element.description: One or more pre-defined filters.

element.name: arg
element.description: An argument for the filter. Some filters require arguments. The arguments required depends on the filter definition.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the filter. The name is of the form <namespace>:<filter>. The namespace is optional - if not specified, then a personal filter.

element.name: geo-histogram
element.description: If the action is get-geo-histogram, then histogram parameters may be specified

element.name: bounds
element.description: The bounds for the computed histogram. If not specified, then computed for entire world.

element.name: east
element.description: Eastern edge (includive) of histogram.

element.name: north
element.description: Northern edge (inclusive) of histogram.

element.name: south
element.description: Southern edge (includive) of histogram.

element.name: west
element.description: Western edge (inclusive) of histogram.

element.name: nb-lat
element.description: The number of latitudinal buckets

element.name: nb-lon
element.description: The number of longitudinal buckets

element.name: geo-shape
element.description: If the action is get-geo-shape, then shape parameters may be specified.

element.name: clip
element.description: Clipping rectangle. If specified, then shapes will be clipped to this rectangle.

element.name: east
element.description: Eastern longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: north
element.description: Northern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: south
element.description: Southern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: west
element.description: Western longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of any geometry returned. 'detailed' returns a full xml response with decimal latitude an longitude and the coordinates in degrees, minutes and seconds. 'simple' returns a simplified xml response with only decimal latitude and longitude. 'geojson' returns the geometry in geojson format. 'esrijson' returns the geometry in esri json format. 'esrijsonwm' returns the geometry in esri json web mercator format. 'wkt' returns the geometry in Well-Known-Text geomoetry format. If not supplied defaults to 'detailed'

element.name: resolution
element.description: Display resolution for generating shapes. If unspecified, no sub-sampling occurs.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 20 points.

element.name: get-content-status
element.description: If set will determine the status of the content as well.

attribute.name: show-errors
attribute.description: Should any content status exceptions be displayed as well. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: get-full-geo-shape
element.description: If set to true, then the full geo shape information will be returned. If false (the default), then only the bounding box will be returned for non-point shapes.

element.name: get-related-meta
element.description: If set and there are related assets, then the metadata for the related assets will also be returned.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve inverse relationship types. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: Specifies the number of levels out to go retrieving related metadata. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: primary
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve primary relationship types. Defaults to true.

element.name: get-user-meta
element.description: If set and there is a 'user' (created with the service 'user.create') for the given revision history, the user metadata will also be returned.

element.name: histogram
element.description: If the action is get-histogram, then histogram parameters may be specified.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the histogram.

element.name: max
element.description: The maximum value to be inclueded. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: min
element.description: The minimum value for the zero'th bucket. Anything below this will not be included. Defaults to zero.

element.name: nb-buckets
element.description: The number of buckets to use. The xpath must specify a function that returns a numeric value.

element.name: width
element.description: The width of each bucket.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The xpath / function that returns a numeric value.

element.name: idx
element.description: Absolute cursor position. If used, the cursor will be positioned starting at 'idx'.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Include assets that have been marked as destroyed? Defaults to false.

element.name: licence
element.description: Controls for licence acceptance information - only used when get-meta for licence assets.

element.name: action
element.description: Specifies the action that will be applied to assets.

element.name: usage
element.description: The specific destination, or usage for the licenced assets.

element.name: maxcachesize
element.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to cache. Defaults to infinity. If maxcachesize is set, then only that number of results (at most) will be cached for iteration.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified namespace, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the namespace - it will simply walk down the namespace tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: output-format
element.description: If the query is to generate the output to a data output, then controls the format of the output.

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: Character encoding. Must be one of the encodings returned by the service 'system.character.encoding.list'.

attribute.name: separator
attribute.description: For CSV exports with multivalued cells this is the value separator (defaults to <LF><CR>).

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only). Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: pipe-generate-result-xml
