element.description: If the action is 'pipe', then by default each service call will not generate a result. Set to true to return the result for each piped service call.

element.name: pipe-nb-threads
element.description: If the action is 'pipe', the number of asynchronous threads to use to iterate through the results. Defaults to 1. If txn-size > 0, then nb-threads will be ignored.

element.name: pipe-recheck-before-action
element.description: If true, then recheck the result just prior to issuing the piped action. This is required where internal caching may be out of date by the time the action is executed. Defaults to true, unless 'collection' is specified and then defaults to false.

element.name: pipe-report-total
element.description: If true, then report the number of assets for which the piped service was executed. Defaults to false.

element.name: pipe-report-total-size
element.description: If true, then report the total size of content for assets for which the piped service was executed. Defaults to false.

element.name: pipe-stop-after-if
element.description: A boolean function on the result of the piped service. If the result evaluates to true, then then the query will stop after the service executes.

element.name: pipe-stop-before-if
element.description: A boolean function executed before executing a piped service. If the result evaluates to true, then then the query will stop before the service executed.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: The point in time for the query.

element.name: pre-generate-results
element.description: If true, then pre-compute the result set. This option is used when sorting for a large set of data or sorting is required when specifying a namespace of collection. Defaults to 'false' It will automatically default to 'true' if the requested result size > the value of the server property asset.query.sort.memory.max.size

element.name: pstoponerror
element.description: If a peer error is encountered, then should an error be generated stopping the query, or simply ignored. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed query. If unspecified, will distributed to all known peers.

element.name: related-type
element.description: If specified and 'get-related-meta' is specified, then only relationships of this type will be returned. If not specified, then all relationships are returned.

element.name: seek-to
element.description: An asset to seek to from the given position. This is used for cursors to position to a page containing a specific asset. If using a cursor, specify either 'idx' or 'seek-to', but not both. 'seek-to' cannot be used in conjunction with sorting.

element.name: service
element.description: One or more services to execute if the action is 'pipe'. The service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service, except 'id' which will be automatically set.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: size
element.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 100 for actions returning results, unless returning an iterator in which case it will default to infinity.

element.name: sort
element.description: Sort keys

element.name: key
element.description: XPath of an document element or attribute to sort by. If not specified, the sort order applies to the asset modification times.

attribute.name: order
attribute.description: Sort ascending or descending. Default is the global order.

element.name: nulls
element.description: When sorting should paths with null values be included or excluded from the result set.

element.name: order
element.description: Sort ascending or descending. Default is ascending.

element.name: special-value-transform
element.description: A generic mapping for special values that were not otherwise transformed by the xpath.

attribute.name: ename
attribute.description: Only replace values that have this ename. Otherwise this special value transformation applies to all.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The value that should be mapped.

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: Only replace values that have this xpath. Otherwise this special value transformation applies to all.

element.name: stoponerror
element.description: Determines whether to stop and generate an exception on error, or ignore the erroneous asset and continue. Defaults to false. When errors are ignored, then the error is recorded in the server log.

element.name: template-if-generated-by
element.description: Controls which metadata is converted to a template when the specified format is 'template'. Defaults to 'user'.

element.name: template-if-namespace
element.description: Restrict templating to only those templates in this namespace.

element.name: text
element.description: Text based query with text match resultants. May be subsetted by a 'where' clause. Is the search equivalent of "text contains '<text>'". The results are returned indicating where the text was matched in the asset. The 'action' and 'sort' arguments are (and any argument that specifies the format of the output) ignored when specifying 'text'.

element.name: transform
element.description: If the action is get-transformed, then transform parameters must be specified and will define how the namespace and/or metadata is transformed

element.name: namespace
element.description: A specification to map asset metadata into a custom namespace schema..

element.name: matching
element.description: Return assets matching the following mapped namespace

element.name: path
element.description: A component part of the mapping specification to map asset metadata into a custom namespace

element.name: profile
element.description: The transform profile to employ to transform the asset metadata

element.name: txn-size
element.description: If the action is 'pipe' then specifies the number of service executions per transaction. Defaults to 0. Larger values improve performance for updates, but hold an update transaction longer.

attribute.name: recheck
attribute.description: If true, and txn-size > 0, then recheck each asset satisfies the query predicate before executing piped service. Defaults to true.

element.name: use-indexes
element.description: If true, then use available indexes. If false, then perform linear searching. Defaults to true.

element.name: validate-values
element.description: If true, and the action is 'get-value' or 'get-values', then valiate the metadata values that are returned.

element.name: version-select
element.description: Controls which versions are selected. Defaults to 'latest'

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' for AQL and namespace()>='/' for FAQL - that is, all assets. If there is more than one where clause, then the second and subsequent clauses are evaluated (linearly) against the result set of the first where clause (a post filter).

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

element.name: xpath
element.description: If specified, then only the specified XPath participates in the action.

attribute.name: ekey
attribute.description: Arbitrary, application defined key. If defined, this key will be added to the element as an attribute.

attribute.name: ename
attribute.description: Element name for result. If not specified, defaults to 'value'.

attribute.name: result
attribute.description: Optional FAQL expression that to format the result / value. The result is supplied in a variable named 'result'. For instance to format data sizes, set result to 'data.size.format(result)'.

element.name: xpath-group-by
element.description: If specified, then identify grouping for every xpath that is a child of this element.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the group. Defaults to the specified path.

element.name: xpmatch
element.description: A set of words (to be tokenized). If specified, the XPaths in each asset that matches any or all of these tokens will be identified. These words are typically passed to the 'where' argument of a query. Only valid if getting asset meta - ignored in all other cases.

attribute.name: match
attribute.description: Indicates how many of the words should match to satisfy a path. If not specified, defaults to 'all'

service.name: asset.query.difference
service.description: Returns the assets that are in one result set, but not another.

element.name: idx
element.description: Absolute cursor position. If used, the cursor will be positioned starting at 'idx'.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 100 for actions returning results, unless returning an iterator in which case it will default to infinity.

element.name: where
element.description: A qualifying query.

service.name: asset.query.iterate
service.description: Iterate over more results in an query iterator generated by the service asset.query. When completed, or if it throws an exception, the iterator can no longer be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the iterator.

element.name: size
element.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 100 for actions returning results.

service.name: asset.query.iterator.destroy
service.description: Destroy a query iterator associated with the caller's session.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the iterator.

element.name: ignore-missing
element.description: If true, then ignore missing iterator. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.query.paths
service.description: Finds all document paths which have been populated in asset meta with one or more of the given words.

element.name: match
element.description: Indicates how many of the words must match for a given path. Defaults to 'any'.

element.name: text
element.description: One or more words to use to find XPaths

service.name: asset.reanalyze
service.description: Reanalyzes the content for an asset to extract metadata. Will only re-analyze the latest version of the content, and if there is a change will create a new asset version.

element.name: copy
element.description: The copy to retrieve. If unspecified, then a copy will be selected by the system.

element.name: copy-store
element.description: The store to select a copy from. If unspecified, then some copy selected by the server will be used.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, all assets are reanalyzed.

service.name: asset.reindex
service.description: Reindexes metadata and/or content for a specified or all versions of an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, all assets are reindexed.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: The version to re-index. If not specified, all versions are indexed.

element.name: part
element.description: The parts to re-index. Defaults to 'all'

service.name: asset.relationship.add
service.description: Creates an asset relationship between 'id' (or 'cid') and 'to' using the relationship 'relationship'.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of the asset.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment, if any.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the related asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.can.add
service.description: Checks whether adding relationships from one asset to another is possible (permissions, constraints, etc.)

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the related asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.can.remove
service.description: Checks whether removing relationships from one asset and another is possible (permissions, constraints, etc.)

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the related asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.count
service.description: Returns the number of relationships, of the specified type if given.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

element.name: relationship
element.description: The relationship type. If not specified, all relationships are returned.

element.name: version
element.description: The version of the asset. Defaults to latest version.

service.name: asset.relationship.exists
service.description: Check whether the relationship(s) exist already between given assets

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the related asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.list
service.description: Returns the asset related to the given asset. A specific relationship may be returned.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' or an alterate identifier must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: label
element.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

element.name: relationship
element.description: The relationship type. If not specified, all relationships are returned.

element.name: version
element.description: The version of the asset. Defaults to latest version.

service.name: asset.relationship.missing.remove
service.description: Removes relationships that relate to a missing asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.relationship.remove
service.description: Removes the asset relationship, given by 'relationship', between 'id' and 'to'.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of the asset.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the related asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.remove.all
service.description: Removes all the asset relationships of a given type from the specified asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: relationship
element.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.replace
service.description: Swaps a relationship with another relationship in one atomic operation (and one version of the assets involved).

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment. If not specified, defaults to 'Added relationships'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: relationship
element.description: One or more related asset relationship replacements.

element.name: to
element.description: The path to the related asset.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

element.name: with

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship type.

service.name: asset.relationship.type.constraint.set
service.description: Update or remove a constraint from a relationship type

element.name: constrain
element.description: A constrain on the end-points for the relationship

element.name: from
element.description: A from end-point.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The constraint target type.

element.name: to
element.description: A to end-points.

attribute.description: The constraint target type.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the type.

service.name: asset.relationship.type.create
service.description: Creates an asset relationship type.

element.name: constrain
element.description: A constrain on the end-points for the relationship

element.name: from
element.description: A from end-point.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The constraint target type.

element.name: to
element.description: A to end-points.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The constraint target type.

element.name: inverse
element.description: The inverse relationship type, if any.

attribute.name: maximum
attribute.description: The maximum number of relationships of this type to other assets. Defaults to unlimited.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the type.

attribute.name: container
attribute.description: Indicates whether this is a containment relationship. If it is, then deleting the containing asset, will also delete the contained asset. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: maximum
attribute.description: The maximum number of relationships of this type to other assets. Defaults to unlimited.

attribute.name: ondestroy
attribute.description: Determines the behaviour when destroying an asset with this relationship. If propagated, the related asset will also be destroyed. If this is a container relationship, the destroy will automatically propagate. It is a requirement to specify an inverse relationship when propagate=true.

attribute.name: proxy
attribute.description: Indicates whether this is a proxy relationship. A 'proxy' is something that can represent another asset. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.relationship.type.describe
service.description: Returns a information about one or more asset relationship types.

element.name: constrain
element.description: A constrain on the end-points for the relationship

element.name: from

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The constraint target type.

service.description: Destroys an asset reslationhip type, including its inverse type if one exists.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the type.

service.name: asset.relationship.type.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not specified relationship type(s) exist.

element.description: The name of the type.

service.description: Returns a list of the available asset relationship types.

service.description: Removes relationships that refer to a non-existent relationship type.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.relock
service.description: Reacquires a lock (perhaps changing the lock type without releasing the existing lock) on one or more assets. Returns the universally unique identifier (UUID) lock for the asset.

element.name: comment
element.description: Reason for acquiring lock. If set, will override any previous comment.

element.name: descend
element.description: Controls whether locks should be acquired for all descendants. The default is set to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: timeout
element.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds the lock should be held before automatic release. If not specified, defaults to infinite.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The univerally unique identifier for the lock.

service.name: asset.replica.exists
service.description: Indicates whether the given asset replicant exists based on the given server clock times.

element.name: replica
element.description: Information about one or more replicants

element.name: cstime
element.description: Server clock time of the asset's content, if any

element.name: cvstime
element.description: Server clock time of an asset version.

element.name: rid
element.description: The replicant id

element.name: server
element.description: The source (server) for the data. If unspecified, defaults to the replica server identity.

element.name: stime
element.description: Server clock time of the asset

service.name: asset.replica.need.to.replicate
service.description: Indicates whether the given asset (and version) requires replication to the given peers. Will indicate replication is required if the asset is not already replicated, or there is an issue at the target(s).

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier or an alterate identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

service.name: asset.replica.soft.destroy
service.description: Marks a replica asset as destroyed.

element.name: rid
element.description: The identify of the asset to destroy.

service.name: asset.replica.soft.undestroy
service.description: Marks a replica asset as not destroyed.

element.name: rid
element.description: The identify of the asset to destroy.

service.name: asset.replica.validate
service.description: Validates the replicant's of a specified asset.

element.name: all-versions
element.description: If true, then evaluate all source versions. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: since
attribute.description: If specified, the only include versions at or after this time. Not set by default.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier or an alterate identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

service.name: asset.replicate.candidate.test
service.description: Evaluates the provided list of replica asset states to determine if the they require replication.

element.name: asset
element.description: An candidate asset to locate and test for replication.

element.name: content
element.description: Does the remote asset have content.

element.name: rid
element.description: The replicaton ID for an asset. Consistens of the UUID of the origin server and the ID of the asset on that server.

element.name: stime
element.description: The server time of the asset.

element.name: version
element.description: The state of any versions of the asset.

element.name: rid
element.description: The replicaton ID for the asset version. Consistens of the UUID of the origin server and the ID of the asset on that server.

element.name: stime
element.description: The server time of the asset version.

element.name: include-not-required
element.description: Should we include assets that are not required in the results. Defaults to 'false'

service.name: asset.replicate.destroy.to
service.label: Replicate
service.description: Replicates destruction of a local asset to another system.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset to be destroyed.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

service.name: asset.replicate.from
service.description: Immediately replicates assets from one or more peer servers.

element.name: allow-incomplete-metadata
element.description: Should incomplete metadata be allowed. Defaults to true.

element.name: allow-move
element.description: If set to true, allows an replicated asset to be moved from its current namespace if the source namespace is different. Defaults to false.

element.name: auto-name
element.description: If set to true, and there is a name conflict (see 'overwrite'), will generate a unique name for the asset. Defaults to true.

element.name: check-if-required
element.description: If true, check with the receiving server to see whether the selected asset and version needs to be replicated. If true, this may save transmitting data that is not required, at the cost of a message exchange with the destination. Defaults to false.

element.name: clevel
element.description: Level of compression. 0 is uncompressed, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: cmode
element.description: Defines the mode of content replication. If 'pull', then the receiver will request the content when processing the replication request - the receiver requires access to this replicating server. If set to 'push' the content is included in the same message, which has greater preparation cost at the sender. If set to 'ref' the existence of the content is recorded against the asset, with the content data being retrieved by a user on demand. Defaults to 'pull'.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then replicate assets in specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

attribute.name: include
attribute.description: If true, then include the collection itself for replication. If false, only replicate the members. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: collection-assets
element.description: Configuration to determine which members of a collection asset (if any) are included by their RID in the Asset XML output for restoration on a destination server.

element.name: describe-queries
element.description: Should dynamic queries within the primary collection be described in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: Should dynamic members of a collection asset included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Any dynamic queries in the collection will be resolved and their resultant assets included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-static-members
element.description: Should static members of a collection asset be included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: Should members of any collection assets within the collection asset hierarchy be resolved and included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets listed in multiple collections are only returned once. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: missing-content-only
element.description: Should the collection only list members with missing remote reference content. This can be used to request content to fulfill assets with remote content references. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: uuid
element.description: If supplied only collection members with this server UUID will be included. Defaults to all members if no UUIDs included.

element.name: compatible-with
element.description: Determines the format version of the archive structure. Allows archives to be created that can be restored on older servers, by setting the compatibility to version '1'. Note that when set to a lower version some limitations are incurred on the data transfered. Defaults to '2', being the most recent version.

element.name: content-must-have-checksum
element.description: If true, then assets with content will only be replicated if the content has a check sum. If they don't then those assets without checksums will be skipped. Defaults to false.

element.name: content-restrictions
element.description: Content restrictions allow for archives, including asset replication process, to use rules to selectively determine if the contents full data should be included or if it is included by remote reference. Restrictions only apply to content delivery modes that would result in content being included in the archive (by value, the default) or pulled upon restore (by rid).

element.name: exclude-path
element.description: Assets within this path will have content excluded from the archive

element.name: exclude-tag
element.description: Assets with this tag will have their content excluded within the archive.

element.name: exclude-type
element.description: Asset content with this MIME type will be excluded from the archive.

element.name: include-path
element.description: Only assets within this path will have content included within the archive

element.name: include-tag
element.description: Only Assets with this tag will have their content included within the archive.

element.name: include-type
element.description: Only asset content with this MIME type will be included in the archive

element.name: maximum-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes of content data that will to be included for an asset within the archive. Size may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB. If the assets content exceeds this limit the asset will be added with content by reference. Defaults to 'infinity' to allow content of any size.

element.name: create-roles
element.description: If set to true, will automatically create authorization roles that do not exist, but have been placed on an asset ACL. Defaults to true. If false and roles do not exist, then the restoration will fail.

element.name: dst
element.description: The destination namespace to restore into. If not specified, restores into the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If set to true and the namespace does not exist, it will be created. Defaults to false.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of the container used to transmit the data. 'zip' is ZIP format (first implemented in PKZIP). 'tar' is TAR format (.tar) when no compression, or G-Zipped Tar (.tar.gz) when clevel>0. 'aar' is the latest Arcitecta archive format (.aar) with file size limit of 2^63 per file. There are two forms of 'aar': 'aarv2' (single threaded) and 'aarv3' (multi threaded). The default is 'aarv2'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset to be replicated.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: A specific version defined by the specied label. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: use-original-name
element.description: Should assets be archived with their original name or the name they currently have after auto-rename due to collection. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-components
element.description: Should we archive the definitions of an assets components (Document Types, Models, Lables, etc). Defaults to true.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Should assets which have been soft deleted be archived? Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-exploded-assets
element.description: Should asset versions with content referencing an entry in another assets archive content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-external-content
element.description: Should external (URL) content be included. Defaults to 'true'. Should be set to 'false' if there are relative URLs.

element.name: include-licences
element.description: If set to true, visible licences covering this asset will be included in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-remote-content
element.description: Should remotely referenced content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: keepacls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: localize-content
element.description: If set to true any local asset with remotely referenced content will localize the content data found in the archive. If set to false the restore will not localize the content or add it to the content cache. This allows for an asset archive containing content to be restored in scenarios were the local server only wishes to participate in federated content retrieval. Defaults to true.

element.name: locally-modified-only
element.description: By default replication includes only locally modified assets. If all assets that have been modified including versions created upstream of this server should be replicated, then set to false.

element.name: nb-threads
element.description: Specifies the number of threads to use when transmitting more than one asset. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: max-content-size
attribute.description: The maximum size of assets per batch before transmitting. Defaults to 10GB.

attribute.name: max-nb-assets
attribute.description: The maximum number of assets per batch before transmitting. Defaults to 100.

element.name: onerror
element.description: Behaviour if there is an error. 'fail' means stop and throw the exception. 'report' means simply report the error in the response. Defaults to 'fail'.

element.name: overwrite
element.description: If set to true, will overwrite an existing asset with the same namespace and name. When false and an asset with a different identifier, but with the same path exists, will generate an error unless 'auto-name' is set to true. Defaults to false.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to replicate. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should a proxy be generated automatically on restoration.

element.name: preserve-rid
element.description: Indicates whether to set the replica ID (rid), which indicates the object is a replica. If the version already has a replica ID (from another system) then this is retained, otherwise it is set to the asset id of the source system. Defaults to true. Setting to false will exclude the replica id. Use false if restoring deleted assets from a replica system, that should become the primary asset.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be replicated. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-missing-relationships
element.description: If the destination asset exists and has existing relationships, should any that are missing from the source asset be removed. This includes the removal of all relationships is the source asset being restored has no relationships. This option defaults to 'false' which results in the replication of relationships being cumulative only and preserves any relationships added by the destination server and other sources. This option can be enabled in environments were synchronisation of relationships is required.

element.name: restore-from-same-peer
element.description: If the archive is being restored through a chain of peer service executions, and this server originated the reuqest, should the restore be allowed. Defaults to 'false' to stop distributed archive restores from propagating back to the caller.

element.name: restore-mismatched-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is invalid and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: If true, then re-validate the data at the receiving end. If false, the defaut then only compare the incoming length and checksum with the stored checksum.

element.name: restore-missing-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is missing and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, the target store for the replicated assets. If not specified, default to the configured store for the destination.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: If specified, the store policy for restored asset content. If not specified, default to the configured store or policy for the destination.

element.name: update-access-times
element.description: Indicates whether or not to update content access times. Defaults to false.

element.name: update-doc-types
element.description: If set to true any document types in the archive will update existing document types in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: update-models
element.description: If set to true any models in the archive will update existing models in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: validate-meta
element.description: Should metadata be validated against current document definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: validate-model
element.description: Should assets be validated against current model definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: versions
element.description: Replicate all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query - all assets matching this query will be replicated. If not specified, then must specify an asset (id).

service.name: asset.replicate.from.job.create
service.description: Schedules a job to replicate assets from one or more peer servers to this server. The job can then be managed using schedule services.

element.name: allow-incomplete-metadata
element.description: Should incomplete metadata be allowed. Defaults to true.

element.name: allow-move
element.description: If set to true, allows an replicated asset to be moved from its current namespace if the source namespace is different. Defaults to false.

element.name: auto-name
element.description: If set to true, and there is a name conflict (see 'overwrite'), will generate a unique name for the asset. Defaults to true.

element.name: check-if-required
element.description: If true, check with the receiving server to see whether the selected asset and version needs to be replicated. If true, this may save transmitting data that is not required, at the cost of a message exchange with the destination. Defaults to false.

element.name: clevel
element.description: Level of compression. 0 is uncompressed, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: cmode
element.description: Defines the mode of content replication. If 'pull', then the receiver will request the content when processing the replication request - the receiver requires access to this replicating server. If set to 'push' the content is included in the same message, which has greater preparation cost at the sender. If set to 'ref' the existence of the content is recorded against the asset, with the content data being retrieved by a user on demand. Defaults to 'pull'.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then replicate assets in specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

attribute.name: include
attribute.description: If true, then include the collection itself for replication. If false, only replicate the members. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: collection-assets
element.description: Configuration to determine which members of a collection asset (if any) are included by their RID in the Asset XML output for restoration on a destination server.

element.name: describe-queries
element.description: Should dynamic queries within the primary collection be described in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: Should dynamic members of a collection asset included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Any dynamic queries in the collection will be resolved and their resultant assets included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-static-members
element.description: Should static members of a collection asset be included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: Should members of any collection assets within the collection asset hierarchy be resolved and included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets listed in multiple collections are only returned once. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: missing-content-only
element.description: Should the collection only list members with missing remote reference content. This can be used to request content to fulfill assets with remote content references. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: uuid
element.description: If supplied only collection members with this server UUID will be included. Defaults to all members if no UUIDs included.

element.name: compatible-with
element.description: Determines the format version of the archive structure. Allows archives to be created that can be restored on older servers, by setting the compatibility to version '1'. Note that when set to a lower version some limitations are incurred on the data transfered. Defaults to '2', being the most recent version.

element.name: content-must-have-checksum
element.description: If true, then assets with content will only be replicated if the content has a check sum. If they don't then those assets without checksums will be skipped. Defaults to false.

element.name: content-restrictions
element.description: Content restrictions allow for archives, including asset replication process, to use rules to selectively determine if the contents full data should be included or if it is included by remote reference. Restrictions only apply to content delivery modes that would result in content being included in the archive (by value, the default) or pulled upon restore (by rid).

element.name: exclude-path
element.description: Assets within this path will have content excluded from the archive

element.name: exclude-tag
element.description: Assets with this tag will have their content excluded within the archive.

element.name: exclude-type
element.description: Asset content with this MIME type will be excluded from the archive.

element.name: include-path
element.description: Only assets within this path will have content included within the archive

element.name: include-tag
element.description: Only Assets with this tag will have their content included within the archive.

element.name: include-type
element.description: Only asset content with this MIME type will be included in the archive

element.name: maximum-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes of content data that will to be included for an asset within the archive. Size may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB. If the assets content exceeds this limit the asset will be added with content by reference. Defaults to 'infinity' to allow content of any size.

element.name: create-roles
element.description: If set to true, will automatically create authorization roles that do not exist, but have been placed on an asset ACL. Defaults to true. If false and roles do not exist, then the restoration will fail.

element.name: dst
element.description: The destination namespace to restore into. If not specified, restores into the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If set to true and the namespace does not exist, it will be created. Defaults to false.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of the container used to transmit the data. 'zip' is ZIP format (first implemented in PKZIP). 'tar' is TAR format (.tar) when no compression, or G-Zipped Tar (.tar.gz) when clevel>0. 'aar' is the latest Arcitecta archive format (.aar) with file size limit of 2^63 per file. There are two forms of 'aar': 'aarv2' (single threaded) and 'aarv3' (multi threaded). The default is 'aarv2'.

element.description: The path to the asset to be replicated.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: A specific version defined by the specied label. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: use-original-name
element.description: Should assets be archived with their original name or the name they currently have after auto-rename due to collection. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-components
element.description: Should we archive the definitions of an assets components (Document Types, Models, Lables, etc). Defaults to true.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Should assets which have been soft deleted be archived? Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-exploded-assets
element.description: Should asset versions with content referencing an entry in another assets archive content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-external-content
element.description: Should external (URL) content be included. Defaults to 'true'. Should be set to 'false' if there are relative URLs.

element.name: include-licences
element.description: If set to true, visible licences covering this asset will be included in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-remote-content
element.description: Should remotely referenced content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: keepacls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: localize-content
element.description: If set to true any local asset with remotely referenced content will localize the content data found in the archive. If set to false the restore will not localize the content or add it to the content cache. This allows for an asset archive containing content to be restored in scenarios were the local server only wishes to participate in federated content retrieval. Defaults to true.

element.name: locally-modified-only
element.description: By default replication includes only locally modified assets. If all assets that have been modified including versions created upstream of this server should be replicated, then set to false.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the schedule job.

element.name: nb-threads
element.description: Specifies the number of threads to use when transmitting more than one asset. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: max-content-size
attribute.description: The maximum size of assets per batch before transmitting. Defaults to 10GB.

attribute.name: max-nb-assets
attribute.description: The maximum number of assets per batch before transmitting. Defaults to 100.

element.name: not-after
element.description: The point in time that the job should not be started. If it is already running at this time however, it will continue to completion.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: onerror
element.description: Behaviour if there is an error. 'fail' means stop and throw the exception. 'report' means simply report the error in the response. Defaults to 'fail'.

element.name: overwrite
element.description: If set to true, will overwrite an existing asset with the same namespace and name. When false and an asset with a different identifier, but with the same path exists, will generate an error unless 'auto-name' is set to true. Defaults to false.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to replicate. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should a proxy be generated automatically on restoration.

element.name: preserve-rid
element.description: Indicates whether to set the replica ID (rid), which indicates the object is a replica. If the version already has a replica ID (from another system) then this is retained, otherwise it is set to the asset id of the source system. Defaults to true. Setting to false will exclude the replica id. Use false if restoring deleted assets from a replica system, that should become the primary asset.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be replicated. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-missing-relationships
element.description: If the destination asset exists and has existing relationships, should any that are missing from the source asset be removed. This includes the removal of all relationships is the source asset being restored has no relationships. This option defaults to 'false' which results in the replication of relationships being cumulative only and preserves any relationships added by the destination server and other sources. This option can be enabled in environments were synchronisation of relationships is required.

element.name: restore-from-same-peer
element.description: If the archive is being restored through a chain of peer service executions, and this server originated the reuqest, should the restore be allowed. Defaults to 'false' to stop distributed archive restores from propagating back to the caller.

element.name: restore-mismatched-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is invalid and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: If true, then re-validate the data at the receiving end. If false, the defaut then only compare the incoming length and checksum with the stored checksum.

element.name: restore-missing-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is missing and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, the target store for the replicated assets. If not specified, default to the configured store for the destination.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: If specified, the store policy for restored asset content. If not specified, default to the configured store or policy for the destination.

element.name: update-access-times
element.description: Indicates whether or not to update content access times. Defaults to false.

element.name: update-doc-types
element.description: If set to true any document types in the archive will update existing document types in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: update-models
element.description: If set to true any models in the archive will update existing models in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this job will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: validate-meta
element.description: Should metadata be validated against current document definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: validate-model
element.description: Should assets be validated against current model definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: versions
element.description: Replicate all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

element.name: when
element.description: The date/time when the job should be run.

element.name: date
element.description: An absolute date for execution. If the date is specified, then the job executes at that date and time. If there are no other time settings, then this is a one-off job, otherwise it will execute repeatedly after this date.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: every
element.description: Utility to conveniently populate minute or hour values. If the unit is 'minute' then the value must be a divisor of 60. If the unit is 'hour' then the value must be a divisor of 24.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of time.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: to
element.description: An absolute date after which no execute takes place.

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query - all assets matching this query will be replicated. If not specified, then must specify an asset (id).

service.name: asset.replicate.job.exists
service.description: Indicates whether a named replication job exists or not. A scheduled job may exist with that name, but not be a job.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the scheduled asset replication job.

service.name: asset.replicate.job.modify
service.description: Updates a given replication schedules existing options with those provided. Only the provided values are modified.
