element.description: Should remotely referenced content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: keepacls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: localize-content
element.description: If set to true any local asset with remotely referenced content will localize the content data found in the archive. If set to false the restore will not localize the content or add it to the content cache. This allows for an asset archive containing content to be restored in scenarios were the local server only wishes to participate in federated content retrieval. Defaults to true.

element.name: locally-modified-only
element.description: By default replication includes only locally modified assets. If all assets that have been modified including versions created upstream of this server should be replicated, then set to false.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the scheduled asset replication job.

element.name: not-after
element.description: The point in time that the job should not be started. If it is already running at this time however, it will continue to completion.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: overwrite
element.description: If set to true, will overwrite an existing asset with the same namespace and name. When false and an asset with a different identifier, but with the same path exists, will generate an error. Defaults to false.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to replicate. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

element.name: preserve-rid
element.description: Indicates whether to set the replica ID (rid), which indicates the object is a replica. If the version already has a replica ID (from another system) then this is retained, otherwise it is set to the asset id of the source system. Defaults to true. Setting to false will exclude the replica id. Use false if restoring deleted assets from a replica system, that should become the primary asset.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be replicated. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-missing-relationships
element.description: If the destination asset exists and has existing relationships, should any that are missing from the source asset be removed. This includes the removal of all relationships is the source asset being restored has no relationships. This option defaults to 'false' which results in the replication of relationships being cumulative only and preserves any relationships added by the destination server and other sources. This option can be enabled in environments were synchronisation of relationships is required.

element.name: restore-mismatched-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is invalid and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: If true, then re-validate the data at the receiving end. If false, the defaut then only compare the incoming length and checksum with the stored checksum.

element.name: restore-missing-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is missing and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: update-access-times
element.description: Indicates whether or not to update content access times. Defaults to false.

element.name: update-doc-types
element.description: If set to true any document types in the archive will update existing document types in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: update-models
element.description: If set to true any models in the archive will update existing models in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this job will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: validate-meta
element.description: Should metadata be validated against current document definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: validate-model
element.description: Should assets be validated against current model definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: versions
element.description: Replicate all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

element.name: when
element.description: The date/time when the job should be run.

element.name: date
element.description: An absolute date for execution. If the date is specified, then the job executes at that date and time. If there are no other time settings, then this is a one-off job, otherwise it will execute repeatedly after this date.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: every
element.description: Utility to conveniently populate minute or hour values. If the unit is 'minute' then the value must be a divisor of 60. If the unit is 'hour' then the value must be a divisor of 24.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of time.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: to
element.description: An absolute date after which no execute takes place.

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query - all assets matching this query will be replicated. If not specified, then must specify an asset (id).

service.name: asset.replicate.job.reset
service.description: Resets the min-stime (server time) to trigger replication for a specified server. This might be required to recover the destination after a crash etc.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the scheduled asset replication job.

element.name: stime
element.description: The minimum server time to trigger replication. Defaults to zero.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The server uuid.

service.name: asset.replicate.profile.offline.reset
service.description: Resets the min-stime (server time) to trigger replication for a specified server. This might be required to recover the destination after a crash etc.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the online replication profile which you would like to reset.

element.name: stime
element.description: The minimum server time to trigger replication. Defaults to zero.

service.name: asset.replicate.profile.online.reset
service.description: Resets the min-stime (server time) to trigger replication for a specified server. This might be required to recover the destination after a crash etc.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the online replication profile which you would like to reset.

element.name: stime
element.description: The minimum server time to trigger replication. Defaults to zero.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The server uuid.

service.name: asset.replicate.soft.destroy.to
service.description: Replicates soft destruction of a local asset to another system.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset to be destroyed.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

service.name: asset.replicate.soft.undestroy.to
service.description: Replicates soft un-destruction of a local asset to another system.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset to be destroyed.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

service.name: asset.replicate.to
service.label: Replicate
service.description: Immediately replicates assets to one or more peer servers.

element.name: allow-incomplete-metadata
element.description: Should incomplete metadata be allowed. Defaults to true.

element.name: allow-move
element.description: If set to true, allows an replicated asset to be moved from its current namespace if the source namespace is different. Defaults to false.

element.name: auto-name
element.description: If set to true, and there is a name conflict (see 'overwrite'), will generate a unique name for the asset. Defaults to true.

element.name: check-if-required
element.description: If true, check with the receiving server to see whether the selected asset and version needs to be replicated. If true, this may save transmitting data that is not required, at the cost of a message exchange with the destination. Defaults to false.

element.name: clevel
element.description: Level of compression. 0 is uncompressed, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: cmode
element.description: Defines the mode of content replication. If 'pull', then the receiver will request the content when processing the replication request - the receiver requires access to this replicating server. If set to 'push' the content is included in the same message, which has greater preparation cost at the sender. If set to 'ref' the existence of the content is recorded against the asset, with the content data being retrieved by a user on demand. Defaults to 'pull'.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then replicate assets in specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

attribute.name: include
attribute.description: If true, then include the collection itself for replication. If false, only replicate the members. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: collection-assets
element.description: Configuration to determine which members of a collection asset (if any) are included by their RID in the Asset XML output for restoration on a destination server.

element.name: describe-queries
element.description: Should dynamic queries within the primary collection be described in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-dynamic-members
element.description: Should dynamic members of a collection asset included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Any dynamic queries in the collection will be resolved and their resultant assets included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-static-members
element.description: Should static members of a collection asset be included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: include-subcollections
element.description: Should members of any collection assets within the collection asset hierarchy be resolved and included in the Asset XML when included in the archive. Member assets listed in multiple collections are only returned once. Member assets are listed by RID. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: missing-content-only
element.description: Should the collection only list members with missing remote reference content. This can be used to request content to fulfill assets with remote content references. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: uuid
element.description: If supplied only collection members with this server UUID will be included. Defaults to all members if no UUIDs included.

element.name: compatible-with
element.description: Determines the format version of the archive structure. Allows archives to be created that can be restored on older servers, by setting the compatibility to version '1'. Note that when set to a lower version some limitations are incurred on the data transfered. Defaults to '2', being the most recent version.

element.name: content-must-have-checksum
element.description: If true, then assets with content will only be replicated if the content has a check sum. If they don't then those assets without checksums will be skipped. Defaults to false.

element.name: content-restrictions
element.description: Content restrictions allow for archives, including asset replication process, to use rules to selectively determine if the contents full data should be included or if it is included by remote reference. Restrictions only apply to content delivery modes that would result in content being included in the archive (by value, the default) or pulled upon restore (by rid).

element.name: exclude-path
element.description: Assets within this path will have content excluded from the archive

element.name: exclude-tag
element.description: Assets with this tag will have their content excluded within the archive.

element.name: exclude-type
element.description: Asset content with this MIME type will be excluded from the archive.

element.name: include-path
element.description: Only assets within this path will have content included within the archive

element.name: include-tag
element.description: Only Assets with this tag will have their content included within the archive.

element.name: include-type
element.description: Only asset content with this MIME type will be included in the archive

element.name: maximum-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes of content data that will to be included for an asset within the archive. Size may be specified with units KB, MB, GB, TB or EB. If the assets content exceeds this limit the asset will be added with content by reference. Defaults to 'infinity' to allow content of any size.

element.name: create-roles
element.description: If set to true, will automatically create authorization roles that do not exist, but have been placed on an asset ACL. Defaults to true. If false and roles do not exist, then the restoration will fail.

element.name: dst
element.description: The destination namespace to restore into. If not specified, restores into the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If set to true and the namespace does not exist, it will be created. Defaults to false.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of the container used to transmit the data. 'zip' is ZIP format (first implemented in PKZIP). 'tar' is TAR format (.tar) when no compression, or G-Zipped Tar (.tar.gz) when clevel>0. 'aar' is the latest Arcitecta archive format (.aar) with file size limit of 2^63 per file. There are two forms of 'aar': 'aarv2' (single threaded) and 'aarv3' (multi threaded). The default is 'aarv2'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset to be replicated.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: A specific version defined by the specied label. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: A specific version. If not specified, then applied to latest version.

element.name: use-original-name
element.description: Should assets be archived with their original name or the name they currently have after auto-rename due to collection. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-components
element.description: Should we archive the definitions of an assets components (Document Types, Models, Lables, etc). Defaults to true.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Should assets which have been soft deleted be archived? Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-exploded-assets
element.description: Should asset versions with content referencing an entry in another assets archive content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-external-content
element.description: Should external (URL) content be included. Defaults to 'true'. Should be set to 'false' if there are relative URLs.

element.name: include-licences
element.description: If set to true, visible licences covering this asset will be included in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-remote-content
element.description: Should remotely referenced content be included. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: keepacls
element.description: If set to true, will maintain the original ACL entries on the assets. If false, ACLs will be removed. Defaults to true. Requires ADMINISTER access to this service if set to false.

element.name: localize-content
element.description: If set to true any local asset with remotely referenced content will localize the content data found in the archive. If set to false the restore will not localize the content or add it to the content cache. This allows for an asset archive containing content to be restored in scenarios were the local server only wishes to participate in federated content retrieval. Defaults to true.

element.name: locally-modified-only
element.description: By default replication includes only locally modified assets. If all assets that have been modified including versions created upstream of this server should be replicated, then set to false.

element.name: nb-threads
element.description: Specifies the number of threads to use when transmitting more than one asset. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: max-content-size
attribute.description: The maximum size of assets per batch before transmitting. Defaults to 10GB.

attribute.name: max-nb-assets
attribute.description: The maximum number of assets per batch before transmitting. Defaults to 100.

element.name: onerror
element.description: Behaviour if there is an error. 'fail' means stop and throw the exception. 'report' means simply report the error in the response. Defaults to 'fail'.

element.name: overwrite
element.description: If set to true, will overwrite an existing asset with the same namespace and name. When false and an asset with a different identifier, but with the same path exists, will generate an error unless 'auto-name' is set to true. Defaults to false.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to replicate. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should a proxy be generated automatically on restoration.

element.name: preserve-rid
element.description: Indicates whether to set the replica ID (rid), which indicates the object is a replica. If the version already has a replica ID (from another system) then this is retained, otherwise it is set to the asset id of the source system. Defaults to true. Setting to false will exclude the replica id. Use false if restoring deleted assets from a replica system, that should become the primary asset.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be replicated. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-missing-relationships
element.description: If the destination asset exists and has existing relationships, should any that are missing from the source asset be removed. This includes the removal of all relationships is the source asset being restored has no relationships. This option defaults to 'false' which results in the replication of relationships being cumulative only and preserves any relationships added by the destination server and other sources. This option can be enabled in environments were synchronisation of relationships is required.

element.name: restore-from-same-peer
element.description: If the archive is being restored through a chain of peer service executions, and this server originated the reuqest, should the restore be allowed. Defaults to 'false' to stop distributed archive restores from propagating back to the caller.

element.name: restore-mismatched-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is invalid and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: If true, then re-validate the data at the receiving end. If false, the defaut then only compare the incoming length and checksum with the stored checksum.

element.name: restore-missing-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is missing and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, the target store for the replicated assets. If not specified, default to the configured store for the destination.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: If specified, the store policy for restored asset content. If not specified, default to the configured store or policy for the destination.

element.name: update-access-times
element.description: Indicates whether or not to update content access times. Defaults to false.

element.name: update-doc-types
element.description: If set to true any document types in the archive will update existing document types in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: update-models
element.description: If set to true any models in the archive will update existing models in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: validate-meta
element.description: Should metadata be validated against current document definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: validate-model
element.description: Should assets be validated against current model definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: versions
element.description: Replicate all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query - all assets matching this query will be replicated. If not specified, then must specify an asset (id).

service.name: asset.replicate.to.job.create
service.description: Schedules a job to replicate assets from this server to one or more peer servers. The job can then be managed using schedule services.

element.name: allow-incomplete-metadata
element.description: Should incomplete metadata be allowed. Defaults to true.

element.name: allow-move
element.description: If set to true, allows an replicated asset to be moved from its current namespace if the source namespace is different. Defaults to false.

element.name: auto-name
element.description: If set to true, and there is a name conflict (see 'overwrite'), will generate a unique name for the asset. Defaults to true.

element.name: check-if-required
element.description: If true, check with the receiving server to see whether the selected asset and version needs to be replicated. If true, this may save transmitting data that is not required, at the cost of a message exchange with the destination. Defaults to false.

element.name: clevel
element.description: Level of compression. 0 is uncompressed, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

If 'pull', then the receiver will request the content when processing the replication request - the receiver requires access to this replicating server. If set to 'push' the content is included in the same message, which has greater preparation cost at the sender. If set to 'ref' the existence of the content is recorded against the asset, with the content data being retrieved by a user on demand. Defaults to 'pull'.

element.description: Behaviour if there is an error. 'fail' means stop and throw the exception. 'report' means simply report the error in the response. Defaults to 'fail'.

element.name: overwrite
element.description: If set to true, will overwrite an existing asset with the same namespace and name. When false and an asset with a different identifier, but with the same path exists, will generate an error unless 'auto-name' is set to true. Defaults to false.

element.name: parts
element.description: Specifies which parts of the assets to replicate. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: peer
element.description: Peer selection. If unspecified, replicates to all peers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers used, unless there is a tag filter set.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer. If 'name' is specified, then 'tag' is ignored.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should a proxy be generated automatically on restoration.

element.name: preserve-rid
element.description: Indicates whether to set the replica ID (rid), which indicates the object is a replica. If the version already has a replica ID (from another system) then this is retained, otherwise it is set to the asset id of the source system. Defaults to true. Setting to false will exclude the replica id. Use false if restoring deleted assets from a replica system, that should become the primary asset.

element.name: related
element.description: Specifies the number of levels of related assets (primary relationship) to be replicated. Defaults to 1. Specify infinity to traverse all relationships.

element.name: remove-missing-relationships
element.description: If the destination asset exists and has existing relationships, should any that are missing from the source asset be removed. This includes the removal of all relationships is the source asset being restored has no relationships. This option defaults to 'false' which results in the replication of relationships being cumulative only and preserves any relationships added by the destination server and other sources. This option can be enabled in environments were synchronisation of relationships is required.

element.name: restore-from-same-peer
element.description: If the archive is being restored through a chain of peer service executions, and this server originated the reuqest, should the restore be allowed. Defaults to 'false' to stop distributed archive restores from propagating back to the caller.

element.name: restore-mismatched-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is invalid and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: If true, then re-validate the data at the receiving end. If false, the defaut then only compare the incoming length and checksum with the stored checksum.

element.name: restore-missing-content
element.description: If set to true then further comparison is made to determine if existing content is missing and needs to be recovered. Defaults to false.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, the target store for the replicated assets. If not specified, default to the configured store for the destination.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: If specified, the store policy for restored asset content. If not specified, default to the configured store or policy for the destination.

element.name: update-access-times
element.description: Indicates whether or not to update content access times. Defaults to false.

element.name: update-doc-types
element.description: If set to true any document types in the archive will update existing document types in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: update-models
element.description: If set to true any models in the archive will update existing models in the destination server, keeping them synchronized. Defaults to true.

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this job will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: validate-meta
element.description: Should metadata be validated against current document definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: validate-model
element.description: Should assets be validated against current model definitions. Defaults to false.

element.name: versions
element.description: Replicate all versions, or just the version matched by the query? Defaults to 'match'

element.name: when
element.description: The date/time when the job should be run.

element.name: date
element.description: An absolute date for execution. If the date is specified, then the job executes at that date and time. If there are no other time settings, then this is a one-off job, otherwise it will execute repeatedly after this date.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: every
element.description: Utility to conveniently populate minute or hour values. If the unit is 'minute' then the value must be a divisor of 60. If the unit is 'hour' then the value must be a divisor of 24.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of time.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: to
element.description: An absolute date after which no execute takes place.

element.name: where
element.description: The selection query - all assets matching this query will be replicated. If not specified, then must specify an asset (id).

service.name: asset.resolve
service.description: Resolves the value of an asset or attribute using an arbirary expression of the form "asset(query)[related(query)].document.attribute" There may be any number of related indexing (including none). For example, "asset(department.name=accounting)[manager][manager].contact.email".

element.name: expression
element.description: An asset resolver expression.

service.name: asset.retype
service.description: Regenerates the MIME type for an asset and content - perhaps after creating a new type in the system.

element.name: asset
element.description: If true, then re-type the asset MIME types. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: content
element.description: If true, then re-type the content MIME types. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: logical-content
element.description: If true, then re-type the logical content MIME type to that of the asset if the content type differs. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: only-if-unknown
element.description: If true, then only re-type if the MIME types are unknown (or invalid because they have been destroyed). Defaults to 'true'. Set to 'false' to regenerate types if the mapping has changed.

service.name: asset.script.execute
service.description: Immediately executes a script which is stored as an asset. The script may execute for a specified asset (if sid/scid set and id/cid set). This serviced is marked as being able to be aborted and suspended, but entirely depends on the service(s) being executed by the script.

element.name: arg
element.description: An argument to pass through to the script.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: enclose-output-in-xml
element.description: If true, then output is enclosed in XML for each line. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified. If either 'sid' or 'scid' are specified then 'id' or 'cid' are assumed to reference the asset that the script will execute upon. In that case, only one asset must be specified and the variables 'id' and 'version' will be set for the asset identifier and version.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: output-format
element.description: The format of the output. If XML, the output is parsed to XML which can processed downstream. Otherwise the output of the script is returned as string. The default is string.

element.name: scid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the script asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'sid' must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: sid
element.description: The path to a script asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier 'scid' should be specified. If neither 'sid' or 'scid' are specified then 'id' or 'cid' are assumed to contain the script to execute.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: standard-output-to
element.description: Indicates where any output should be generated by the script. Defaults to 'server-log'.

element.name: verbose
element.description: If true, then display the output of all service calls. Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.server.time
service.description: Returns the current server clock time for the specified asset. The clock time is updated every time there is a modification to an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: ifgt
attribute.description: If specified, then only return the server clock time if greater than this time.

service.name: asset.service.describe
service.description: Returns information on services that can be executed for the given asset(s) by the caller.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable ID of the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of the description. Defaults to 'summary'.

element.name: id
element.description: The path or id of the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: sort-arguments
element.description: If set to true, service arguments are sorted aphabetically when described. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: usage
element.description: Filter by specified usage.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query. If specified, then find the common services for all assets in the query.

service.name: asset.service.list
service.description: Returns the services that can be executed for the given asset(s) by the caller.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable ID of the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path or id of the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: usage
element.description: Filter by specified usage.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query. If specified, then find the common services for all assets in the query.

service.name: asset.session.lock
service.description: Creates an exclusive and transient lock that belongs to the caller's session for the given asset.

element.name: action
element.description: Specifies the lock action. 'wait' will wait until released by others. 'status' will attempt to lock and indicate whether or not the lock was obtained. 'exception' will throw an exception if the lock cannot be gained. Defaults to 'wait'.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: comment
element.description: Reason for acquiring lock.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: timeout
element.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds the lock should be held before automatic release. If not specified, defaults to infinite.

service.name: asset.session.relock
service.description: Updates an existing exclusive and transient lock (with a new timeout) that belongs to the caller's session for the given asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: timeout
element.description: Specifies the length of time in seconds the lock should be held before automatic release. If not specified, defaults to infinite.

service.name: asset.session.unlock
service.description: Removes the exclusive and transient lock held by the caller's session on the given asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: if-not-locked
element.description: What should happen if the asset is not locked by the caller. Defaults to 'exception'.

service.name: asset.set
service.description: Modifies an asset. Metadata, content and/or ACLs be updated. If ACLs are specified, then they replace the existing ACLs.

element.name: acl
element.description: Access control list for an asset. Only checked in views that require asset level access control.

element.name: access
element.description: The type of access to grant to both metadata and content. If not specified, must specify one or both of 'metadata' and/or 'content'.

element.name: actor
element.description: The actor to grant access.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the actor.

element.name: asset
element.description: The type of access to grant to the asset itself.

element.name: content
element.description: The type of access to grant to content. Ignored if 'access' specified.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The type of access to grant to metadata. Ignored if 'access' specified.

element.name: propagate
element.description: Should this ACL be propagated to related assets. Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-incomplete-meta
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if incomplete? Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-invalid-meta
element.description: Should the metadata be accepted if invalid? Defaults to false. Use with caution.

element.name: alternate-id
element.description: An alternate identifier of the asset.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The alternate identifier type

element.name: analyze
element.description: Controls whether or not to examine the content and automatically extract metadata, provided there is an appropriate content analyzer. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.analyze.default' has been set.

element.name: archive
element.description: Provides options for the treatment of content which is ingested as an archive.

element.name: destroy-existing
element.description: Should any existing children expanded for this source asset be destroyed prior to creating these children. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: expand
element.description: If true and the created asset has an archive as its content the archive will be expanded into assets who's content references individual filess in the archive. Defaults to false.

element.name: filter-expression
element.description: If the archive is to be expanded on creation an entry will be extracted if its path within the archive matches the supplied regular-expression.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: An optional Mime Type to associate with assets created from this match.

element.name: filter-suffix
element.description: If the archive is to be expanded on creation an entry will be extracted if its suffix matches the supplied value. The matching is case-insensitive.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: An optional Mime Type to associate with assets created from this match.

element.name: inherit-licences
element.description: Specifies whether created assets inherit licence relationships of the parent asset. Defaults to false.

element.name: namespace
element.description: Which namespace should the expanded assets be created in. Defaults to a namespace with the assets name.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the namespace if it doesn't exist? Defaults to false.

element.name: propagate-metadata
element.description: Controls how propagable metadata can be added to the newly created child assets. One of either 'exclude-metadata', 'exclude-metadata-tag', 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' must be supplied. Any resulting document types must be tagged as The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be able to be added.

element.name: exclude-metadata
element.description: If 'include-metadata' or 'include-metadata-tag' or is not supplied what documents should not be propagated to the newly created assets. Any other document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be added.

element.name: exclude-metadata-tag
element.description: If 'include-metadata' or 'include-metadata-tag' is not supplied document types with the supplied tag should not be propagated to the newly created assets. Any other document types must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE' to be added.

element.name: include-metadata
element.description: If 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' is not supplied what document types shoud be propagate to the newly created assets. The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE'

element.name: include-metadata-tag
element.description: If 'exclude-metadata' or 'exclude-metadata-tag' is not supplied document types with the supplied tag shoud be propagate to the newly created assets. The document type must be tagged as 'PROPAGABLE'

element.name: template
element.description: Specifies trasform template for exploding assets which determines the namespace layout structure for exploded assets. Template will be ignored if its target mime type doesn't match archive's mime type.

element.name: caetime
element.description: End time of the content acquisition

element.name: castime
element.description: Start time of the content acquisition

element.name: cext
element.description: The content extension for the content. If supplied, may be used to ascertain content MIME type.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: clone
element.description: The asset may be created from another asset as a template.

attribute.name: acl
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the Asset's ACLs. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone content. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: meta
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone metadata. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the asset model. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: related
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone related. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: templates
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone associated templates. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: clone-from-cid
element.description: The asset may be created from another asset as a template.

attribute.name: acl
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the Asset's ACLs. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone content. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: meta
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone metadata. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: model
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone the asset model. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: related
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone related. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: templates
attribute.description: Indicates whether to clone associated templates. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: copy-tag
element.description: The name of an asset tag type to add to the created content copy, if any.

element.name: create
element.description: Create the asset if not found. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: collection
attribute.description: Should the asset, if created, be a collection? Defaults to false.

attribute.name: in
attribute.description: Should the asset parent, if created, be a namespace or a collection asset? Defaults to namespace.

attribute.name: licence
attribute.description: Should the asset, if created, be a licence? Defaults to false.

element.name: ctype
element.description: Encapsulation MIME type of the content, if there is content. If not specified, then auto-typed from the content extension, and/or analyzers. If no 'lctype' is specified, then this is also the logical/interpreted type of for the content.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the asset.

element.name: force-content-to-storage
element.description: If true, then any content associated with the asset will be forced to backing storage. This is slower, but guarnatees the content is saved in the event of a (power) failure. Defaults to false.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate a check-sum. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.check.sum.default' has been set.

element.name: geo-action
element.description: Specifies an action when dealing with geoshapes. If 'add' or 'replace-all-user' or 'replace-all-analyzer' or 'replace-all' specified then add to or replace (user, analyzer or all) other geoshape with the supplied. If not shapes provided, then simply remove. Defaults to unset of no shapes specified, or 'replace-all-user' if one or more shapes are specified.

element.name: geoshape
element.description: An optional geographic shape for the asset. If there are multiple shapes, the shape of the asset is deemed to be compound.

attribute.name: datum
attribute.description: The mathematical model for the points. Defaults to WGS84.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Should the geomtery be considered the default. Defaults to 'false'. If default, this geometry will be placed at the head of the list of geometries - the head is always the default.

attribute.name: generated-by
attribute.description: What generated the geometry. Defaults to 'user'.

attribute.name: geoid
attribute.description: If the elevation is measured with respect to a geoid rather than the datum, then the geiod name must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: An abitrarry label for this geometry

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of the shape. Defaults to 'point'. If the number of points is one, then the shape will be automatically coerced to type 'point'. A 'compound' shape can contain other shapes.

element.name: holes
element.description: Zero or more geohape elements that are holes within the outer shape. Only rectangle and polygon geoshape types support holes.

element.name: point
element.description: One or more points in the shape. Compound geo shapes must contain other geoshape elements, not points.

element.name: elevation
element.description: The elevation specified in metres.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The latitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: longitude
element.description: The longitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: wkt
element.description: A geometry in WGS84 Well-Known-Text (WKT) format, e.g. 'POINT(10.2 30.5)', 'POLYGON Z((-77.04 38.89 10,-77.03 38.9 12,-77.03 38.89 12,-77.03 38.89 10,-77.04 38.89 10))'. If supplied all points are ignored and the geometry is derived from the WKT geometry definition.

element.name: http-password
element.description: Password to be used for http authentication

element.name: http-username
element.description: Username to be used for http authentication

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: if
element.description: If set, will only update asset (metadata or content) if set/exists, or if changed (the default). There is a performance overhead for 'content' - if the sizes are the same an octet comparison is made - the overhead will depend on the size of data being compared.

attribute.name: part
attribute.description: Specifies the part that the conditional set applies.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created asset.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: lctype
element.description: Logical MIME type of the content, if there is content. If not specified, then auto-typed from the content extension/analyzers. The logical can be different from the encapulation type, and determines how the content is interpreted. For instance, a logical 'application/abc' type may be encapsulated in an 'application/zip' format.

element.name: licences
element.description: If licence assets exist which cover this asset they can be associated here. Non-existent licences and non-licences will be ignored.

attribute.name: replace
attribute.description: If true, then the licences supplied will replace any that have been assigned. Defaults to false.

element.name: licence
element.description: A licence asset which covers to this asset. If the licence can not be found or the asset is not a licence it will be ignored.

element.name: link
element.description: The asset is a link to something

element.name: posix-symlink
element.description: Indicates the asset is a POSIX symlink and this is the value for the link.

element.name: max-versions
element.description: The maximum number of asset versions to maintain (if the asset is versioned). Defaults to unlimited. Labelled versions will not be removed.

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing meta information documents for the asset. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Action to perform when modifying meta information. Defaults to 'merge'. 'add' means append, 'merge' means combine, 'replace' means to replace matching, 'remove' means to remove the specified document elements.

element.name: model
element.description: A model for the structure and capabilities of this asset.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace or collection) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset is not named.

attribute.name: auto-rename-if-clash
attribute.description: If true, then automatically rename the asset to avoid name collisions. Defaults to false.

element.name: new-alternate-id
element.description: Create an alternate id of this type for the asset.

element.name: owner
element.description: Options

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The identity of the user.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Controls automatic proxy generation. Defaults to true, unless the server property 'asset.proxy.generation.default' has been set, in which case that will prevail.

element.name: related
element.description: An asset relationship.

element.name: from
element.description: Related asset identifier. A relationship will be established from this specified asset to the new asset.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The relationship operation. Defaults to 'add'

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: from-cid
element.description: Related asset citeable identifier. A relationship will be established from this specified asset to the new asset.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The relationship operation. Defaults to 'add'

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: to
element.description: Related asset identifier. A relationship will be established from this new asset to this specified asset.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The relationship operation. Defaults to 'add'

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: to-cid
element.description: Related asset citeable identifier. A relationship will be established from this new asset to this specified asset.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: The relationship operation. Defaults to 'add'

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Update inverse relationships, if any. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The type of relationship.

element.name: replace-all-meta
element.description: If set to true, then all of the metadata that can be published by the caller will be replaced by the supplied metadata. Defaults to 'false'. Only one qualifier may be set.

attribute.name: name-match
attribute.description: Only replace documents with qualified name(s) that match this Java regular expression. If not supplied, then performs literal match.

attribute.name: only-if-same-name
attribute.description: Only replace documents with the same name(s) as those supplied - leave metadata in other documents alone. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: only-if-same-namespace
attribute.description: Only replace documents in the same XML namespace - leave documents in other namespaces alone. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: only-if-stime
attribute.description: Only attempt to replace if the server clock time for the asset is equal to the supplied value. Will generate an error indicating modified by other, if they do not match.

element.name: set-owner
element.description: If true, and creating an asset, the owner of the asset will also be set. Defaults to false. The owner can change permissions with actor.grant and actor.revoke. If the 'owner' argument is specified, then owner is set independently of set-owner.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of the store. If set, this will override the default namespace store. Ignored if there is no content.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of the data store policy to employ which will automatically select a data store for the content. If set, this will override the default namespace store. Ignored if there is no content.

element.name: sub-asset-content
element.description: Indicates the content for this asset is contained withing another asset.

element.name: end
element.description: The end (byte) offset. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the referenced asset

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: The version of the asset. Defaults to zero (latest).

element.name: start
element.description: The start (byte) offset. Defaults to zero.

element.name: type
element.description: MIME type of the asset.

element.name: unlock
element.description: If set to true, removes any lock on the asset after updating. By default, is false.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Controls whether locks should also be released for all descendants. The default is set to true.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Indicates the type of lock to release. 'persistent' locks are associated with the user and last beyond server restarts. 'transient' locks are associated with the session and are released by session termination. The default is set to 'persistent'.

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to the content for the asset. If the URL is specified, then no content may be passed with the request. Of course, the given URL must be accessible by the server. The URL may specify the location of a file or directory. If a directory, then the directory will be automatically compressed with compress-level set to 0.

attribute.name: by
attribute.description: Whether the content is stored by value (that is, a copy within the server - either copied or moved) or by reference (that is, a link to external content). 'value' is means 'copy', but exists for backwards compatibility. 'move' will delete the source if possible (must be a file). 'move' is only possible on the same file systems, if not possible then 'move' is converted to 'copy-and-delete'. 'managed-reference' means leave the data in place, but take over (if possible), so that deleting the asset will also delete the referenced (file). Defaults to 'value'.

attribute.name: compress-level
attribute.description: If by 'value', then the data may be compressed by specifying a compression level. The archive format will be AAR. By default no compression applied.

attribute.name: ignore-missing-if-exists
attribute.description: If the source is missing, then abort the asset set if the target exists. Defaults if false.

attribute.name: include-root-dir
attribute.description: If URL points to a directory, this specifies whether or not that directory should be included in the archive file system. Defaults to 'true' indicating that the root directory must be included.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.description: Identifies this input as a 'resource' which may then be used for clustered I/O and queue management.

element.name: xml-content
element.description: Content set as XML. This will be stored in the content for the asset.

service.name: asset.set.readonly
service.description: Change the read-only status of an asset. Neither the metadata nor content can be changed for a read-only asset. The asset can still be destroyed.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: readonly
element.description: Indicates whether the asset is read only (true) or can be modified (false).

service.name: asset.shareable.describe
service.description: Describes a shareable.

element.name: generate-url
element.description: Whether or not the URL that can be used for accessing the shareable in a web browser should be generated. Defaults to false.

element.name: get-token
element.description: If set to true the token of the shareable will be displayed. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.name: idx
element.description: The index of the result list to start at. Defaults to 1.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of results to return. Defaults to 100.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

element.name: type
element.description: If specified, then restrict to the specified type.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

service.name: asset.shareable.download.collection.list
service.description: Lists the collections in a download shareable's manifest.

element.name: after
element.description: If specified, then list entries after this 'id'. If not specified then defaults to 0.

element.name: cid
element.description: The id of the collection to list entries for. If not specified the entries in the root collection will be returned.

element.name: deep
element.description: If set to true, then return all entries, including entries in sub-collections. Defaults to false (shallow).

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to return. Default to 100.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

service.name: asset.shareable.download.collection.root.describe

element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

service.name: asset.shareable.download.create
service.description: Creates a shareable that will allow assets to be downloaded from the server.

element.name: assets
element.description: A set of one or more individual assets to include in the download manifest. Ignored if 'namespace', 'collection' or 'where' specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of an asset to be included.

element.name: collection
element.description: The id of a collection to include the download. Cannot be used if namespace is specified

element.name: completion-service
element.description: A service to execute when completion is indicated for the shareable. The specified service must accept an argument 'shareable-id' which will be passed the identity of the shareable that completed. Any other parameters specified in this document will also be passed as arguments to the service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: contact
element.description: A document specifying the contact details for the creator of the shareable.

element.name: email
element.description: The email address of the contact.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the contact.

element.name: phone
element.description: The phone number of the contact.

element.name: description
element.description: A description for the shareable.

element.name: enable-selection
element.description: Whether or not the recipient should be able to select subsets of the assets being shared. Defaults to true.

element.name: flatten
element.description: Whether or not the hierarchy of assets will be flattened to a single directory when downloaded. Defaults to false, however a flat list will automatically be generated if no namespace or parent collection is specified.

element.name: invitation
element.description: An invitation to access the shareable.

element.name: email
element.description: The email address of the party to invite.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the party to invite.

element.name: phone
element.description: A phone number that can be used for two factor authentication.

element.name: licence
element.description: A licence that the invitee must accept before the data transfer can begin.

element.name: matched-set
element.description: Allows a client to determine how they behave if assets that were part of the manifest at the time of preparation no longer exist when an attempt is made to download them. If true the client should consider all assets in the manifest as required and should consider it an error if an asset is unavailable. Defaults to false.

element.name: name
element.description: A name for the shareable.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace under which assets assets are eligible for download. Cannot be used if pid is specified.

element.name: password
element.description: A password for the shareable.

element.name: prepare-manifest
element.description: Whether or not the manifest of assets to download should be prepared. Defaults to true.

element.name: property
element.description: An arbitrary application defined property that can by used by applications to control workflows, etc.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the property.

element.name: target-dir-name
element.description: The name of the target directory under which files will be downloaded.

element.name: terms-of-use
element.description: The terms under which the shareable can be used.

element.name: valid-from
element.description: The date and time at which the is valid. If not specified then this will be the date and time at which the shareable was created.

element.name: valid-to
element.description: The date and time after which the shareable is no longer valid. If not specified the shareable will remain valid indefinitely, or for the period specified by server property asset.shareable.validity.default.

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If 'namespace' or 'collection' are specified, then this is an additional filter. If there is more than one where clause, then the second and subsequent clauses are evaluated (linearly) against the result set of the first where clause (a post filter).

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

service.name: asset.shareable.download.entry.list

element.name: after

element.name: cid

element.name: deep
element.description: If set to true, then return all entries, including entries in sub-collections. Defaults to false (shallow).

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.name: include
element.description: Indicates the entries to include. Defaults to 'all'

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to return. Default to 100.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.after.set
service.description: Sets the current position of the shareable processing queue, i.e. its 'after' value. When set, only entries with IDs larger than this new value will be processed. This service will not affect queue statistics, i.e. existing statistics will be preserved.

element.name: after
element.description: Specifies the 'after' value for the processing queue. Only entries with IDs larger than this value will be processed. Defaults to '0'.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.describe
service.description: Returns a information on the shareable processing queue.

element.name: display-full-stack-trace
element.description: If true and displaying failures, then display the full exception stack trace. Defaults to false - just the first part of the message will be shown.

element.name: max-nb-active
element.description: The number of active to show, if any. Defaults to zero.

element.name: max-nb-failures
element.description: The number of failures to show, if any. Defaults to zero. Will display in order of most recent to oldest.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.entry.count
service.description: Returns the number of entries in the shareable processing queue.

element.name: after
element.description: Entry index to start at. Defaults to zero.

element.name: before
element.description: Entry index to stop at. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: before-current-after
element.description: If true, then count the number of oentries up to the current / active position.

element.name: shareable-id
element.description: The identity of one or more shareables.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.entry.describe

element.name: after

element.name: before
element.description: Entry index to stop at. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: before-current-after
element.description: If true, then count the number of entries up to the current / active position.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of one or more queue entries.

element.name: shareable-id
element.description: The identity of one or more shareables.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to retrieve. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.entry.reexecute
service.description: Re-execute (and wait to complete or error) one or more entries in the shareable processing queue. This is only allowable for failed entries.

element.name: fail-on-error
element.description: If true, then fail if an error is encountered. Defaults to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a queue entry.

element.name: shareable-id
element.description: The identity of one or more shareables.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.entry.remove
service.description: Remove one or more entries from the shareable processing queue.

element.name: before-current
element.description: If true, then remove the entries up to the current / active position.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a queue entry.

element.name: shareable-id
element.description: The identity of one or more shareables.

element.name: nb
element.description: The number of processors.

service.name: asset.shareable.processing.queue.reset
service.description: Resets the shareable processing queue. All jobs will be requeued including failed ones, and all current statistics on the queue will be reset.

element.description: The date and time at which the file(s) to be uploaded were orininally acquired. If creation of a parent is enabled on the shareable then this value will be used in the construction of the name. If not provded then the current date and time will be used instead.

element.name: path-context
element.description: Contextual information about the paths that client will provide when creating entries in the upload. Typically this will be the parent path of a directory or file being uploaded from the client, or some part thereof.

element.name: args

element.name: definition

element.name: element
element.description: Document element.

attribute.name: case-sensitive
attribute.description: For enumeration types, indicates whether case is important. Default is case insensitive.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Default value for the argument.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: For strings, if set, requires the value(s) exist in the specified dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary-auto
attribute.description: For strings, if set, uses this dictionary to store (automatically populated) values found in the string.

attribute.name: display-length
attribute.description: For strings, a suggested length for widgets. Typically defaults to 10 but is client dependent.

attribute.name: enumerated-values
attribute.description: For enumeration types, is a comma separated list of valid values. Mandatory for enumeration types if 'dictionary' is not specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for the argument.

attribute.name: label-plural
attribute.description: Alternate (display) name for plural form of the the argument.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: For strings, is the maximum length of the string. If not specified, defaults to max. integer.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the maximum value. If not specified, defaults to max. integer or float.

attribute.name: max-occurs
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of occurences of the argument. If not specified, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: For numbers (integer or float) is the minimum value. If not specified, defaults to min. integer or float.

attribute.name: min-length
