element.name: value
element.description: Specified value for the attribute

attribute.name: as
attribute.description: Binding. Defaults to 'default'. Constants cannot be changed.

element.name: validation-service
element.description: A service to execute for server side validation of arguments. The specified service must accept the arguments 'shareable-id' which will be passed the identity of the shareable and an 'args' paremteter which expects a document containing all of the arguments to validate. Any parameters specified in this document will also be passed to the service. The service must return a 'valid' element for each argument passed in the 'args' document. Each 'valid' element must contain a true/false value and should have an 'arg' attribute specifying the name of the argument it relates to. A 'message' attribute must also be present if the value of the element is false (it can optionally be present if the value is true), which contains an explanation of the validation outcome for the argument. All elements can have an optional 'suggested-value' atribute that can be used by a client for autocompletion of the argument if the value submitted for validation could be resolved to that value without ambiguity. If the service does not return an element conforming to these rules for any given argument then that argument will be treated as valid.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: collection
element.description: The id of a collection asset under which assets will be created. Must be present if namespace is not specified.

element.name: completion-service
element.description: A service to execute when completion is indicated for the shareable. The specified service must accept an argument 'shareable-id' which will be passed the identity of the shareable that completed and 'upload-id' which will be passed the id of the specific upload being processed on the shareable and an optional 'args' parameter that will recieve a document containing the elements subimtted to the 'args' parameter of the asset.shareable.self.upload.end service when it is called. Any other parameters specified in this document will also be passed as arguments to the service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: contact
element.description: A document specifying the contact details for the creator of the shareable.

element.name: email
element.description: The email address of the contact.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the contact.

element.name: phone
element.description: The phone number of the contact.

element.name: create-parent
element.description: Whether or not a unique parent namespace or collection should be created under which new assets will be created. If set to false then naming conflicts may occur. Defaults to true.

element.name: description
element.description: A description for the shareable.

element.name: interaction-service
element.description: A service to execute when a post-completion user interaction has taken place. The specified service must accept an argument 'shareable-id' which will be passed the identity of the shareable that completed, an argument 'upload-id' which will be passed the id of the specific upload being processed on the shareable and an argument 'interaction-id' which will be passed the id of the user interaction associated with the upload and an optional 'args' parameter that will recieve a document containing the elements subimtted to the 'args' parameter of the asset.shareable.upload.interaction.complete service when it is called. Any other parameters specified in this document will also be passed as arguments to the service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: invitation
element.description: An invitation to access the shareable.

element.name: email
element.description: The email address of the party to invite.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the party to invite.

element.name: phone
element.description: A phone number that can be used for two factor authentication.

element.name: licence
element.description: A licence that the invitee must accept before the data transfer can begin.

element.name: max-size
element.description: The maximum size in bytes that can be stored by the uploader.

element.name: multi-use
element.description: Whether or not the shareable supports transactional uploads where assets for each transaction is stored separately from those in other transactions. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: limit
attribute.description: The maximum number of supported transactions. Defaults to no limit.

element.name: name
element.description: A name for the shareable.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace under which assets will be created. Must be present if pid is not specified.

element.name: parent-name
element.description: Controls how the name of the parent collection or namespace will be generated. Ignored if 'create-parent' is set to false.

attribute.name: date-format
attribute.description: A custom format definition for the date component of the parent name. Defaults to 'yyyy-MM-dd_HH.mm.ss'

attribute.name: file-safe
attribute.description: Whether or not the generated name should be santized to conform to filesystem naming conventions. Defaults to true.

element.name: var
element.description: The name of an variable to include when constructing the name of the parent under which assets will be created. The name of the parent will have the value of each specified argument (if it exists), prefixed by a hyphen, appended to it in the order they are specified here.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the variable. If set to 'property' then the value of the element must correspond to the name of a property on the shareable. If set to 'argument' the value of the element must correspond to the name of an 'arg' definition.

element.name: password
element.description: A password for the shareable.

element.name: property
element.description: An arbitrary application defined property that can by used by applications to control workflows, etc.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the property.

element.name: request-path-context
element.description: Whether the original path context for uploaded files should be requested from the client.

attribute.name: nb-parents
attribute.description: The number of parents to request. Defaults to none.

element.name: restriction
element.description: A restriction on what filenames or paths will be accepted. If any restriction is supplied, then all possible restrictions should be specified. Restriction priority is the order they are specified. That is, more explicit restrictions should be specified before more generalized ones.

element.name: action
element.description: Controls whether the restriction allows or rejects filenames or paths that match the restriction. Defaults to 'reject'.

element.name: description
element.description: Describes the intent of the restriction so that a client can display information about what has been restricted.

element.name: for
element.description: Controls whether the pattern applies to the name of the filenames or to the file's path. Defaults to 'name'.

element.name: pattern
element.description: A regular expression pattern specifying what the filenames or paths will be accepted. Whether the expression is applied to just the filename or the entire path is controlled by the 'for' property.

element.name: terms-of-use
element.description: The terms under which the shareable can be used.

element.name: valid-from
element.description: The date and time at which the is valid. If not specified then this will be the date and time at which the shareable was created.

element.name: valid-to
element.description: The date and time after which the shareable is no longer valid. If not specified the shareable will remain valid indefinitely, or for the period specified by server property asset.shareable.validity.default.

service.name: asset.shareable.upload.interaction.complete
service.description: Completes a user interaction with an upload by executing the interaction service specified on an upload shareable.

element.name: args
element.description: Arguments to be forwarded to the interaction service defined on the shareable.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable.

element.name: interaction-id
element.description: The id of the interaction.

element.name: upload-id
element.description: The id of the upload.

service.name: asset.shareable.upload.set
service.description: Sets values on an existing upload shareable.

element.description: Document element.

element.name: definition
element.description: Argument defintions that can be used for capturing information about the shareable.

element.name: element
element.description: Document element.

element.description: A restriction on what filenames or paths will be accepted. If any restriction is supplied, then all possible restrictions should be specified. Restriction priority is the order they are specified. That is, more explicit restrictions should be specified before more generalized ones.

element.name: action
element.description: Controls whether the restriction allows or rejects filenames or paths that match the restriction. Defaults to 'reject'.

element.name: description
element.description: Describes the intent of the restriction so that a client can display information about what has been restricted.

element.name: for
element.description: Controls whether the pattern applies to the name of the filenames or to the file's path. Defaults to 'name'.

element.name: pattern
element.description: A regular expression pattern specifying what the filenames or paths will be accepted. Whether the expression is applied to just the filename or the entire path is controlled by the 'for' property.

element.name: terms-of-use
element.description: The terms under which the shareable can be used.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

element.name: valid-from
element.description: The date and time at which the is valid. If not specified then this will be the date and time at which the shareable was created.

element.name: valid-to
element.description: The date and time after which the shareable is no longer valid. If not specified the shareable will remain valid indefinitely, or for the period specified by server property asset.shareable.validity.default.

service.name: asset.shareable.upload.unset
service.description: Un-sets values on an existing upload shareable.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of the shareable. If not specified then a token must be specified instead.

element.name: item
element.description: The name of the property to unset.

element.name: token
element.description: The token of the shareable. If not specified then an id must be specified instead.

service.name: asset.sink.send
service.description: Sends one or more assets to a sink.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier or an alterate identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: A specific path for the asset. If not set, then the namespace path is used.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: root-path
element.description: A specific path for all assets to be place under in the sink

element.name: sink
element.description: Indicates the the data (requested) should be sent to a data sink.

element.name: arg
element.description: An optional argument for the sink when it consumes data. Arguments are sink type dependent. These values may augment or override default parameters already configured for the named sink.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument - depends on the sink type

element.name: mtype
element.description: The application MIME type - defaults to the content type.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the sink.

element.name: where
element.description: An query for selecting assets to send to the sink.

service.name: asset.snapshot.create
service.description: Creates a snapshot of a specified directory (and subdirectories) and loads into the system.

element.name: action
element.description: The action to perform when a file has been modified. Defaults to 'reference'

element.name: at
element.description: Root location to snapshot. If not specified, snapshots all available file systems.

element.name: directory
element.description: Location of a server accessible directory to be indexed. Will include all sub-directories. If not specified, snapshots all available file systems with the options specified.

element.name: cache
element.description: Should the snapshot be cached before loading. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: cslen
element.description: The number of bytes to use when caculating a check sum. Set to zero to disable check-sum. Defaults to 'infinity'.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the snapshot to use. Will be automatically created if not found. Defaults to 'default'

element.name: namespace
element.description: The root namespace of the snapshot. Defaults to the root namespace (/).

element.name: since
element.description: Include files modified (or accessed) since this time. Defaults to the epoch.

service.name: asset.snapshot.describe
service.description: Describes the details of one or more snapshots.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a snapshot

service.name: asset.snapshot.list
service.description: Returns the known snapshots.

service.name: asset.snapshot.load
service.description: Loads a pre-created snapshot into the system.

element.name: action
element.description: The action to perform when a file has been modified. Defaults to 'reference'

element.name: cslen
element.description: The number of bytes to use when caculating a check sum. Set to zero to disable check-sum. Defaults to 'infinity'. This is ignored if the loaded data already has a check-sum.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the snapshot to use. Will be automatically created if not found. Defaults to 'default'

element.name: namespace
element.description: The root namespace of the snapshot. Defaults to the root namespace (/).

service.name: asset.soft.destroy
service.description: Marks the asset as destroyed. The asset will actually be destroyed at some time in the future.

element.name: atomic
element.description: Should destroying the asset (and related assets) be an atomic operation? Defaults to false.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: destroy-time
element.description: Specify the date that will be used as a value that is set for the asset destroy time. Defaults to current time if no value is specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions are destroyed.

element.name: members
element.description: When an asset has a citeable identifier or is a collection, should members of that collection also be destroyed if all versions of the asset are destroyed? Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.soft.destroyed
service.description: Indicates whether or not the specified asset has been soft-destroyed or not.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset.

service.name: asset.soft.undestroy
service.description: Removes any existing request for the asset to be destroyed.

element.name: atomic
element.description: Should un-destroying the asset (and related assets) be an atomic operation? Defaults to false.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identity of an asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions soft destroy undone.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. If not specified, all versions have soft destroy undone.

element.name: members
element.description: When an asset has a citeable identifier or is a collection, should members of that collection also be un-destroyed if all versions of the asset are un-destroyed? Defaults to false.

service.name: asset.statistics
service.description: Provide summary data for a number of assets.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the statistics for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This is faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree.

element.name: compute
element.description: This is FAQL that is executed once per datum

element.name: exclude-if-result
element.description: Exclude groups and categories that only have results matching this value.

element.name: finalise
element.description: Variables to be reported and steps to be performed after all data have been processed. This is called once per category

element.name: label
element.description: A label to apply to this output.

element.name: value
element.description: FAQL to perform the final calculation step

element.name: granularity
element.description: The granularity in which data are presented to FAQL fragments. The default is asset and data are presented in the same format as asset.get. If document is selected each document is presented in the FAQL fragments and it is the responsibility of the caller to handle all documents in an appropriate manner.

element.name: group
element.description: Specification of a partition of the data, e.g. by sex.

element.name: category
element.description: The specification of a category within a group, e.g. male or female

element.name: if
element.description: This label is used when the FAQL in this elements evaluates to true.

element.name: label
element.description: A string literal to label this category or FAQL to generate labels dynamically.

attribute.name: dynamic
attribute.description: Should the type be determined dynamically by executing the argument as FAQL (defaults to true).

attribute.name: ignore-missing
attribute.description: If true, data for which this expression evaluates to null are ignored (defaults to false).

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the group

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Include assets that have been marked as destroyed? Defaults to false.

element.name: initialise
element.description: This is FAQL that is executed once per category to perform variable initialisation. Variables are automatically scoped by category.

element.name: output-format
element.description: If the statistics is to generate the output to a data output, then controls the format of the output.

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: Character encoding. Must be one of the encodings returned by the service 'system.character.encoding.list'.

element.name: pdist
element.description: Specifies the peer distance for distributed search. Defaults to zero (local only). Specify one for nearest neighbour, or larger for longer hops.

element.name: peer-broadcast
element.description: When performing federated statistics, these are the variables to be returned from a peer to the originating server.

element.name: peer-reduce
element.description: When performing federated statistics, this step is executed on the originating server for every peer. Access peer variables using the 'peer' function, e.g. peer(sum).

element.name: ptag
element.description: Arbitrary server peer tag for distributed query. If unspecified, will distributed to all known peers.

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' for AQL and namespace()>='/' for FAQL - that is, all assets.

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

service.name: asset.store.default.get
service.description: Returns the name of the default data store, if set.

service.name: asset.store.describe
service.description: Returns configuration and space information on one or more data stores.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the store.

element.name: mount
element.description: If true, then display information about the mounted store. If false don't attempt to mount and don't display mount information. Defaults to true.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: namespaces
element.description: If true, then display the namespaces that use this store. Defaults to false.

element.name: number-of-retrieve-cache-objects
element.description: The number of retrieve cache objects to describe. Defaults to zero.

element.name: policies
element.description: If true, then display the policies that use this store. Defaults to false.

element.name: prefix
element.description: Filter by prefix on the store name.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by tag. If more than one tag specified, then all tags must exist. Ignored if 'name' specified.

element.name: type
element.description: Store type to use as a filter.

service.name: asset.store.dmf.asset.bfid.status
service.description: Returns the state of the BFID for the given asset content.

element.name: check-for-missing
element.description: If true, check to see whether the file exists or not

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: store
element.description: If specified, then only show copies from this store.

service.name: asset.store.dmf.bfid.to.asset
service.description: Attempt to resolve the given BFID to an asset that has content in a DMF data store with the given BFID.

element.name: bfid
element.description: A DMF BFID

service.name: asset.store.dmf.operator.alerts
service.description: Returns operator alerts in the DMF server.

service.name: asset.store.dmf.version
service.description: Returns the version reported by the DMF server.

service.name: asset.store.exists
service.description: Returns a boolean value indicating the existence or otherwise of the specified data store.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

service.name: asset.store.find.asset.from.id
service.description: Lookup an asset identifier from a data store and object identifier within that store - that is, map the content identifier to asset, if possible

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier within a store.

attribute.name: store
attribute.description: The name of the data store.

element.name: idx
element.description: The starting ordinal. Defaults to 1.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of assets to display. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.store.io.statistics.describe
service.description: Describes I/O statistics for the data store. This does not include statistics via a cluster node, only statistics for data written through the controller.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the store.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

service.name: asset.store.io.statistics.reset
service.description: Reset I/O statistics for the data store. This does not include statistics via a cluster node, only statistics for data written through the controller.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the store.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

service.name: asset.store.is.reserved
service.description: Determines whether the store is (or not) reserved, including for some optionally specified purpose.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the store.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: purpose
element.description: The specific purpose for the reservation. If specified, will check if the reservation is for that purpose.

service.name: asset.store.list
service.description: Returns a list of names of the configured data stores.

element.name: encrypted
element.description: If specified, then only show stores that are or not encrypted.

element.name: prefix
element.description: Filter by prefix on the store name.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by tag. If more than one tag specified, then all tags must exist.

element.name: type
element.description: Store type to use as a filter.

service.name: asset.store.local.root.get
service.description: Returns the root directory path for locally managed stores.

service.name: asset.store.open.describe
service.description: Returns a list of the open stream for a data store. This can be used to detect stream leaks.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

service.name: asset.store.policy.asset.create
service.description: Converts the (new) file to an asset. Will automatically release the file handle.

element.name: fid
element.description: The unique identifier of the file handle.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the asset.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace in which to create the asset.

service.name: asset.store.policy.create
service.description: Creates a named storage policy using the specified stores. If both 'store' and 'tag' are specified, then the policy will use specified set of stores and any store with the given tags; that is, both will apply.

element.name: args
element.description: Policy specific arguments. To see the possible arguments, use the service asset.store.policy.describe.

element.name: description
element.description: The optional description of the policy.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name of the policy.

element.name: space-margin
element.description: The space margin before a store is considered full in bytes. Defaults to zero.

element.name: store
element.description: The set of stores.

element.name: tag
element.description: The set of store tags.

element.name: type
element.description: One of the available policy types. See (asset.store.policy.type.list).

service.name: asset.store.policy.describe
service.description: Describes the specified policies.

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of the policy.

service.name: asset.store.policy.exists
service.description: Returns a boolean value indicating the existence or otherwise of the specified data store policy.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the data store policy.

service.name: asset.store.policy.file.open.describe
service.description: Returns a description of all open file handles.

service.name: asset.store.policy.file.open.read
service.description: Obtains to url for a file for the given asset. Caller must invoke asset.store.policy.file.release with the file handle (token) when finished.

element.name: id
element.description: An asset id or path.

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of a policy to use.

element.name: timeout
element.description: Timeout in seconds after which the file is automatically released. Defaults to 1800 seconds.

service.name: asset.store.policy.file.open.write
service.description: Obtains to url for a file which is reference counted for performance management along with an access token. Caller must invoke asset.store.policy.file.release with the access token when finished.

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of a policy to use.

element.name: size
element.description: The amount of data that is expected to be written to the file (for space reservation).

element.name: timeout
element.description: Timeout in seconds after which the file is automatically released. Defaults to 1800 seconds.

service.name: asset.store.policy.file.release
service.description: Indicates the file is no longer in use.

element.name: fid
element.description: The unique identifier of the file handle.

service.name: asset.store.policy.list
service.description: Returns a list of the known policies.

service.name: asset.store.policy.remove
service.description: Removes the specified policies.

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of the policy.

service.name: asset.store.policy.replace
service.description: Replaces a named storage policy.

element.name: args
element.description: Store specific arguments.

element.name: description
element.description: The optional description of the policy.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name of the policy.

element.name: space-margin
element.description: The space margin before a store is considered full in bytes. Defaults to zero.

element.name: store
element.description: The set of stores.

element.name: tag
element.description: The set of store tags.

element.name: type
element.description: One of the available policy types. See (asset.store.policy.type.list).

service.name: asset.store.policy.type.describe
service.description: Describes the known policy types.

element.name: policy
element.description: The name of a policy.

service.name: asset.store.policy.type.list
service.description: Returns a list of the known policy types.

service.name: asset.store.priority.queue.describe
service.description: Returns a list of the configured data stores.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by tag. If more than one tag specified, then all tags must exist. Ignored if 'name' specified.

service.name: asset.store.reservation.describe
service.description: Returns information on the reservation on a data store, if any.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the store.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: prefix
element.description: Filter by prefix on the store name.

element.name: reservation-prefix
element.description: Filter by prefix on any reservations.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by tag. If more than one tag specified, then all tags must exist. Ignored if 'name' specified.

element.name: type
element.description: Store type to use as a filter.

service.name: asset.store.reserve
service.description: An agreed convention by the caller to reserve one store for a specific purpose. If this service is called multiple times with the same purpose, then the same store with the reservation for the same purpose will be returned. That is, only one store may be reserved for a given purpose at a time.

element.name: error-if-none
element.description: If true, then generate an exception if no stores are available. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of on or more stores to make a reservation from.

element.name: purpose
element.description: The specific purpose for the reservation.

element.name: tag
element.description: A store tag to select stores to make a reservation from. If more than on 'tag' is specified, then all tags must match. One of 'name' or 'tag' must be specified.

service.name: asset.store.service.list
service.description: Provides a list of services on a data store.

element.name: all
element.description: If set to true, returns all services otherwise only returns services to which the caller has access. Defaults to false. Ignored if one or more 'service' arguments specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the store. One of 'name' or 'id' must be supplied.

element.name: inputs
element.description: If specified, list services that do or do not support inputs. If unspecified, then no input filter applies.

element.name: outputs
element.description: If specified, list services that do or do not support outputs. If not specified, then no output filter applies.

element.name: prefix
element.description: Arbitrary service prefix, if any. '.' will be automatically appended.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of the store. One of 'name' or 'id' must be supplied.

element.name: text
element.description: Text filter - find services named, or containing the specified text - may include wildcards. Text tokens may be space separated, which will be AND'd together.

element.name: usage
element.description: Usage filter. If more than one filter, then will be AND'd together.

service.name: asset.store.space.usage
service.description: Returns information on the space utilisation for the specified store(s).

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by tag. If more than one tag specified, then all tags must exist. Ignored if 'name' specified.

element.name: type
element.description: Store type to use as a filter.

service.name: asset.store.tmp.file.create
service.description: Returns the path to a temporary file in an appropriate data store.

element.name: size
element.description: The size of the content being written, if known. This aids in the selection of a content store by a policy.

element.name: store
element.description: The name of the store to return the file path from.

element.name: store-policy
element.description: The name of the store policy to return the file path from.

element.name: suffix
element.description: An optional suffix to apply the temporary file path.

element.name: tag
element.description: The name of the store tag to return the file path from.

service.name: asset.store.transaction.describe
service.description: Returns the active object transactions for a data store.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the store.

element.name: idx
element.description: The starting position to list entries. Defaults to 1

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to retrieve. If not specified, defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.store.type.describe
service.description: Returns a description of the valid types of data stores.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of store (see asset.store.type.list).

service.name: asset.store.type.list
service.description: Returns a list of the valid types of data stores.

service.name: asset.store.unreserve
service.description: Remove a reservation for a specific purpose from a store.

element.name: error-if-none
element.description: If true, then generate an exception if is not reserved. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the store.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: purpose
element.description: The specific purpose for the reservation.

service.name: asset.tag.add
service.label: Tag.Add
service.description: Adds a tag or keyword to an asset. Tags apply to all versions.

element.name: cid
element.description: Citeable asset identifier. Ignored if 'id' specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag on an asset.

element.name: description
element.description: An optional description to associate with this tag.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a term from a dictionary. The tag must exist as a term in the dictionary.

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: The dictionary containing the term. If unspecified, then uses the default dictionary.

service.name: asset.tag.remove
service.label: Tag.Remove

element.name: cid
element.description: Citeable asset identifier. Ignored if 'id' specified.

element.name: id

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a tag to remove

attribute.name: dictionary
attribute.description: The dictionary containing the term. If unspecified, then removes any tag with this name.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identity of the tag to remove.

service.name: asset.tag.remove.all
service.label: Tag.Remove.All
service.description: Removes all tags and keywords from an asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: Citeable asset identifier. Ignored if 'id' specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.tag.type.describe
service.description: Returns information on asset tag types.

element.name: after
element.description: Include types with an identifier greater than this specified value. Defaults to zero.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, the identity of the type of tag to describe.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If true, then include types that have been (soft) destroyed. Defaults to false.

element.name: name
element.description: If specified, the describe this tag type.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, then filter types by this filter.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of tag types to return. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.tag.type.exists

element.name: name
element.description: If specified, the describe this tag type.

service.name: asset.tag.type.list
service.description: Returns the known asset tag types.

element.name: after
element.description: Include types with an identifier greater than this specified value. Defaults to zero.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: If true, then include types that have been (soft) destroyed. Defaults to false.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, then filter types by this filter.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of tag types to return. Defaults to 100.

service.name: asset.template.remove
service.description: Removes any template associated with an asset.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.template.set
service.description: Sets the template associated with an asset. Completely replaces any existing template(s).

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: template
element.description: A template to define the expected structure for metadata for the asset. This allows an application to construct interfaces, etc. that have all of the required document fragments, even though the data may not be fully populated.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: An arbitrary application defined namespace qualification of the template. If specified, then should be added to the any populated documents. Can be used to group templates for specific purposes. Required if there are multiple templates.

element.name: metadata
element.description: The definition of a metadata template.

element.name: definition
element.description: The name of the document type with the definition of the metadata.

attribute.name: ns
attribute.description: Application defined namespace qualification for this document. If specified, will be added to the metadata fragment. If specified, overrides any template tag qualification.

attribute.name: ns-format
attribute.description: A format to generate an ns attributed from a unique ID. If this and ns-id are specified, the ns attribute will be generated from the format string where \%d will be replaced with the unique id.

attribute.name: ns-id
attribute.description: A unique ID generator name for the application namespace qualification.

attribute.name: requirement
attribute.description: Defines whether the metadata is mandatory or optional. Defaults to mandatory.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of fragments of the definition. These are sub-elements that would be supplied to the document fragment when creating an asset. Constant values are specified by enclosing the value in the function 'constant()'. E.g. 'constant(123)'. Where 'constant' is not specified, the value is considered the default.

attribute.name: binding
attribute.description: If set to 'constant' then values will be made constant and cannot be changed. If 'default', then suggested value and individual values may be made constant. Defaults to 'default'.

service.name: asset.template.text.process
service.description: Processes a textual template from an assets xml content or from arbitrary xml provided in the service call.

element.name: id
element.description: The id or path to an asset containing XML content for the template.

element.name: token
element.description: The value of a token which will be replaced in the content of the assets XML. Must conform to the format ${token-name}$.

attribute.name: mandatory
attribute.description: Is the token mandatory, if true and the token is not found in the template an exception will be rasied. Defaults to false

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the token

element.name: xml
element.description: Optional xml template containing tokens to be replaced. Either id ot xml must be supplied

service.name: asset.test.check
service.description: Checks that the given asset is accessible and if it has content, that the content (created by asset.test.create) is valid.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the asset to check.

element.name: pattern
element.description: A data pattern (repeated) to check in the content in UTF-8 encoding. If unspecified defaults to the value of the note in the attached metadata.

service.name: asset.test.import
service.description: Imports one or more assets for load stress testing.

element.name: atomic
element.description: Should the creation of the assets be atomic. If true, then blocks all other database access until complete. Defaults to 'false', unless 'commit' > 1.

element.name: commit
element.description: Commit every N created. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace to populate with random assets.

element.name: order
element.description: The order of asset creation. By 'name' means same order as file names, by 'time' orders creation by last modification time, and 'random' means to randomize the list.

element.name: url
element.description: The location to import.

attribute.name: by
attribute.description: Asset creation by reference or by value. Defaults to 'value' - the asset will be fully ingested.

service.name: asset.text.query
service.description: Free text asset query.

element.name: action
element.description: Action to apply to query. Defaults to 'get-text'.

element.name: count
element.description: Should the total number of possible matches be counted. Defaults to false.

element.name: filter
element.description: One or more pre-defined filters.

element.name: arg
element.description: An argument for the filter. Some filters require arguments. The arguments required depends on the filter definition.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the filter. The name is of the form <namespace>:<filter>. The namespace is optional - if not specified, then a personal filter.

element.name: idx
element.description: The cursor position for paging.

element.name: part
element.description: Parts to query. Defaults to all, unless xpaths are specified.

element.name: seek-to
element.description: An asset to seek to from the given position. This is used for cursors to position to a page containing a specific asset. If using a cursor, specify either 'idx' or 'seek-to', but not both.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of suggestions (at most) to make. Defaults to 10.

element.name: sort
element.description: Sort keys

element.name: key
element.description: XPath of an document element or attribute to sort by. If not specified, the sort order applies to the asset modification times.

attribute.name: order
attribute.description: Sort ascending or descending. Default is the global order.

element.name: nulls
element.description: When sorting should paths with null values be included or excluded from the result set.

element.name: order
element.description: Sort ascending or descending. Default is ascending.

element.name: text
element.description: The search text. It will be tokenized into words. If not specified, then becomes a regular asset search.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query.

element.name: xpath
element.description: Document XPath to query. Defaults to all.

service.name: asset.text.query.suggest
service.description: Dynamic suggestions for completing words based on the available text for an asset query.

element.name: count
element.description: Should the total number of possible matches be counted. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: each
attribute.description: Total the number of matches for each suggestion. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The maximum number to count before giving up. Only used if 'count' is true. Defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: max-each
attribute.description: The maximum number to count for each before giving up. Only used if 'each' is true. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: filter
element.description: One or more pre-defined filters.

element.name: arg
element.description: An argument for the filter. Some filters require arguments. The arguments required depends on the filter definition.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the filter. The name is of the form <namespace>:<filter>. The namespace is optional - if not specified, then a personal filter.

element.name: idx
element.description: The cursor position for paging.

element.name: include-destroyed
element.description: Include assets that have been marked as destroyed? Defaults to false.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of suggestions (at most) to make. Defaults to 10.

element.name: text
element.description: A sequence of words, where last work may or may not be partially complete. If no text is supplied, then will retrieve the 'first' text.

element.name: type
element.description: The non-document indexes to use. If not specified, and no document index specified, then defaults to all of the allowable types.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query.

element.name: xpath
element.description: The name of a document index - an xpath may specify a root node, which matches all indexes below that node.

service.name: asset.time.series.create

element.name: series

element.name: type

element.name: name

element.name: nano-time

element.name: time-base

element.name: value

service.name: asset.time.series.point.add
service.description: Adds a time point to a time series. The time is specified as 'date-time' or 'time' - if neither are specified, then the time defaults to the current time.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the series for the asset. If not supplied, defaults to the type.

element.name: point
element.description: A time point.

element.name: date-time
element.description: The date/time of the point (as a date).

element.name: geoshape
element.description: An optional geographic shape for the asset. If there are multiple shapes, the shape of the asset is deemed to be compound.

attribute.name: datum
attribute.description: The mathematical model for the points. Defaults to WGS84.

attribute.name: geoid
attribute.description: If the elevation is measured with respect to a geoid rather than the datum, then the geiod name must be specified.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of the shape. Defaults to 'point'. If the number of points is one, then the shape will be automatically coerced to type 'point'. A 'compound' shape can contain other shapes.

element.name: holes
element.description: Zero or more geohape elements that are holes within the outer shape. Only rectangle and polygon geoshape types support holes.

element.name: point
element.description: One or more points in the shape. Compound geo shapes must contain other geoshape elements, not points.

element.name: elevation
element.description: The elevation specified in metres.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The latitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: longitude
element.description: The longitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: wkt
element.description: A geometry in WGS84 Well-Known-Text (WKT) format, e.g. 'POINT(10.2 30.5)', 'POLYGON Z((-77.04 38.89 10,-77.03 38.9 12,-77.03 38.89 12,-77.03 38.89 10,-77.04 38.89 10))'. If supplied all points are ignored and the geometry is derived from the WKT geometry definition.

element.name: nanos
element.description: The nanosecond component of time for the point, if the 'time' argument is to the millisecond level and microsecond or above reolution is required.

element.name: time
element.description: The time of the point.

element.name: value
element.description: The a value for the time point

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the value.

element.name: transaction-control
element.description: Specifies / controls he transaction semantics for the points. Defaults to immediate-stable.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the series for the asset.

service.description: Counnts the resulting time points or ranges from a time series on an asset.

element.description: An geometry to filter by.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of the shape. Defaults to 'point'. If the number of points is one, then the shape will be automatically coerced to type 'point'.

element.name: margin
element.description: A margin in metric meters to apply to the geometry.5)', 'POLYGON Z((-77.04 38.89 10,-77.03 38.9 12,-77.03 38.89 12,-77.03 38.89 10,-77.04 38.89 10))'. If supplied all points are ignored and the geometry is derived from the WKT geometry definition.

element.name: group-by
element.description: Controls the way the results are displayed. By 'point' shows each point. By 'range' displays start and end of matching ranges (not the individual point).

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset.

element.name: max-date-time
element.description: The maximum date/time of the points to include.

attribute.name: include
attribute.description: Include this time. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: timezone
attribute.description: An optional timezone for the supplied date/time. This is used to translate the supplied value into UTC. For example, 'Australia/Melbourne', 'Europe/London', 'US/Eastern', 'GMT+5', 'UTC-10'. Defaults to local server time converted to UTC.

element.name: max-time
element.description: The maximum time of the points to include.

attribute.name: include
attribute.description: Include this time. Defaults to false.

element.name: min-date-time

attribute.name: include

element.name: exclude-default-values
element.description: If true, then remove values that are equal to the specified default for that type, if any. Defaults to false.

element.name: geometry-conform
element.description: An optional conform on any geometry recorded for a time point. If 'point' is selected the center of the bounding box of any gemoetry will be returned. If 'bounding' is selected then the bounding extents any geometry will be returned. Defaults to 'none'.

element.name: geometry-format
element.description: The format for any geometry recorded for a time point. 'detailed' returns fully populated xml response with decimal latitude an longitude in addition to the coordinates in degrees, minutes and seconds. 'simple' returns the coordinates in a simplified xml response that includes only decimal latitude and longitude. 'geojson' returns the geometryin geojson format. 'esrijson' returns the geometryin esri json format. 'esrijsonwm' returns the geometry in esri json web mercator format. 'wkt' returns the geometry in Well-Known-Text geomoetry format. If not supplied defaults to 'simple'

service.name: asset.time.series.point.import.csv
service.description: Imports a CSV into a specified assets time series allowing for custom column mapping and data transformation. If the time series does not exist it will be created.

element.name: batch-size
element.description: The number of time points to add in each batched operation. Defaults to 1000.

element.name: columns
element.description: The mapping semantics column.

element.name: field
element.description: A column to time point data field mapping. Specifies a field within the time point definition, the column the source data should be derived from and an optional function to transform the source value.

attribute.name: column
attribute.description: The zero-based index of the column number to map to this data field. The first column in the CSV is 0.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function that is to be applied to the value of the data field. Commonly used for formatting custom dates and mapping data values.

element.name: geometry
element.description: Column number containing any textual geometry definition in a supported format.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The coordinate reference system for the latitude and longitude. Defaults to 'wkt' in WGS84

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Column number containing decimal latitude.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Column number containing decimal longitude.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: nano-time
element.description: Column number containing any nano-time component.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: time
element.description: Column number containing the time value.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: utm-hemisphere
element.description: If the documents defined coordinate system is UTM, then the column number containing hemisphere, if any.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: utm-zone
element.description: If the documents defined coordinate system is UTM, then the column number containing the UTM zone, if any.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: A function expression used to transform the column value.

element.name: crs
element.description: The coordinate reference system for the latitude and longitude. Defaults to 'geographic' in WGS84

element.name: crs-utm
element.description: The coordinate reference system is UTM. The zone and hemisphere may be specified, rather than retrieved from a column.

element.name: hemisphere
element.description: The UTM hemisphere: North or South. One of hemisphere or hemisphere-column must be specified.

element.name: zone
element.description: The UTM zone. One of zone or zone-column must be specified.

element.name: definition
element.description: The time series definition to employ.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset which will contain the time series.

element.name: max-rows
element.description: The maximum number of rows to import. Defaults to all.

element.name: nb-header-rows
element.description: The number of header rows to ignore. Defaults to zero.

element.name: seperator
element.description: The field seperator the file uses. Defaults to ',' for CSV.

element.name: series
element.description: The name of the series for the asset. If not supplied defaults to the name of the time series definition.

element.name: skip
element.description: The number of leading rows to ignore. If supplied, then total number of rows skipped will be nb-header-rows + skip.

element.name: source-id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset which contains the CSV data.

element.name: transaction-control
element.description: Specifies / controls he transaction semantics for the points. Defaults to 'when-ready'.

element.name: url
element.description: A path to the source dataset to import.
