element.description: The identifier or path to the asset.

element.name: series
element.description: The name of the series to merge the points into.

element.name: source-series
element.description: The name of the series in the selected assets from which to read points. if it differs from the series name being written.

element.name: transaction-control
element.description: Specifies / controls he transaction semantics for the points. Defaults to immediate-stable.

element.name: update
element.description: If the destination time series already exists, should the merger operation be allowed. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: where
element.description: An AQL query selecting assets containing time series to merge.

service.name: asset.time.series.test.create
service.description: Creates a sample time series.

element.name: batch-size
element.description: The number of points to add at once. Defaults to 1000.

element.name: date-time
element.description: A start date time. Defaults to now.

element.name: destroy-existing
element.description: Should any existing time series of this name be destroyed. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: geoshape
element.description: A geoshape point defining the starting point, if not supplied no geometry is added.

element.name: bearing-deviation
element.description: The maximum deviation from previous bearing (-180 to 180). Defaults to 10.

element.name: distance-deviation
element.description: The maximum deviation from previous distance. defaults to

element.name: distance-max
element.description: The maximum distance in meters between points. Defaults to '50000'.

element.name: distance-min
element.description: The minimum distance in meters between points. Defaults to '500'.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The latitude specifed in WGS84 decimal degree.

element.name: longitude
element.description: The longitude specifed in WGS84 decimal degree.

element.name: wkt
element.description: A geometry in WGS84 Well-Known-Text (WKT) format, e.g. 'POINT(10.2 30.5)', 'POLYGON Z((-77.04 38.89 10,-77.03 38.9 12,-77.03 38.89 12,-77.03 38.89 10,-77.04 38.89 10))'. If supplied all points are ignored and the geometry is derived from the WKT geometry definition.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier or path to the asset within which to create the time series.

element.name: interval
element.description: An interval in miliseconds between each point. Defaults to 1000.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique (within the namespace) name for the asset. If not supplied, asset is not named.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace of the asset. Default is the root namespace.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to true.

element.name: series
element.description: The name of the series for the asset. If not supplied, defaults to the type.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of points to create. Defaults to 1000.

element.name: transaction-control
element.description: Specifies / controls he transaction semantics for the points. Defaults to immediate-stable.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of a time series definition to use. If the time series does not exist one will be created with this name from the supplied field properties

element.name: value
element.description: The a value for the time point

element.name: deviation
element.description: The maximum deviation from previous value. Defaults to '10'

element.name: max
element.description: The maximum value for the field. Defaults to '100'

element.name: min
element.description: The minimum value for the field. Defaults to '0'

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the value.

element.name: type
element.description: Data type of the time point, constrainted to numeric values. Defaults to 'integer'

service.name: asset.transcode
service.description: Retrieves asset data for the specified assets, optionally transcodes them, and optionally sends to specified data sinks. All operations are performed transiently - that is, if the server stops, operations will not complete. However, all trancoding is undertaken before dispatching to any sinks - which may guarantee delivery (sink dependent). All data is packed into a single archive file for transmission.

element.name: allow-same-mime
element.description: Allow transcoding if the source and destination MIME types are the same. Defaults to false.

element.name: atype
element.description: The type of archive to produce. The default is 'zip'. If 'none' is selected, then the transcode must produce a single file.

element.name: clevel
element.description: The level of compression for the resultant file. Zero is no compression, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity or path to an asset.

attribute.name: apath
attribute.description: Base path for the this asset in the resultant archive, if archived.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: output-as-xml
element.description: If the transcoded output is one of text/xml, application/xml or text/xhtml, then return the result inline as XML. Defaults to false.

element.name: sink
element.description: Indicates the the data (requested) should be sent to a data sink.

element.name: arg
element.description: An optional argument for the sink when it consumes data. Arguments are sink type dependent. These values may augment or override default parameters already configured for the named sink.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument - depends on the sink type

element.name: atype
element.description: The type of archive to produce. The default is defined by the global setting of 'atype'.

element.name: clevel
element.description: The level of compression for the resultant file. Defaults to the global setting for 'clevel'.

element.name: mtype
element.description: The application MIME type - defaults to the content type.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the sink.

element.name: transcode
element.description: Indicates the the data (requested) should be transcoded on the to some other format.

element.name: apath
element.description: A root path component for the generated archive, if any.

element.name: from
element.description: The MIME type of this asset - to trigger the transcode. If not specified, defaults to the type of the content, and then the asset if no transcode for the content.

element.name: param
element.description: Optional parameters for the transcoder. The actual parameters depend on the transcoder itself.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.

element.name: to
element.description: The MIME type of the required format.

service.name: asset.transcode.describe
service.description: Describes the registered transcodes that are available for assets (same as service transcode.describe) or for specified assets.

element.name: common-params
element.description: If true then only the parmeters that are common to the specified assets will be returned, otherwise the union of all parameters will be returned.

element.name: common-transcoders
element.description: If true then only the transcoders that are common to the specified assets will be returned, otherwise the union of all transcoders will be returned.

element.name: from
element.description: The MIME type of the input. If not specified, asset types used.

element.name: id
element.description: An asset to query for available transcodes. If specified, will look for cached (proxy) relationships. Cannot be specified with 'where'

element.name: to
element.description: The MIME type of the output. If not specified, constrained to those supported by the types of the specified assets.

element.name: where
element.description: An optional qualifying query. If specified, then find the common transcoders and trancode options for all assets in the query. Cannot be specified with 'id'

service.name: asset.transcode.to.asset
service.description: Generates one or more (related) assets for this asset that have been translated to some other format. If the pair (relationship, MIME type) already exist, then the related asset may be updated. If an output is supplied, then the transcoded data will be returned. If no output is supplied, then the transcode will simply be executed.

element.name: allow-same-mime
element.description: Allow transcoding if the source and destination MIME types are the same. Defaults to false.

element.name: atype
element.description: The type of archive to produce. The default is 'none'. If 'none' is selected, then the transcode must produce a single file.

element.name: clevel
element.description: The level of compression for the resultant file. Zero is no compression, 9 is the highest level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity or path to an asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: transcode
element.description: Indicates the the data (requested) should be transcoded on the to some other format.

element.name: from
element.description: The MIME type of this asset - to trigger the transcode. If not specified, defaults to the type of the content, and then the asset if no transcode for the content.

element.name: name
element.description: If specified, then the output will be saved to an asset of this name.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace for the generated asset. If not specified, then will be generated in the same namespace as this asset.

element.name: param
element.description: Optional parameters for the transcoder. The actual parameters depend on the transcoder itself.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.

element.name: relationship
element.description: The relationship type. If not specified, and namespace or name are not specified, then defaults to 'proxy'

element.name: to
element.description: The MIME type of the required format.

service.name: asset.trigger.destroy
service.description: Removes one or more specified triggers.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The owning asset of the trigger. If not specified and a trigger name is not be supplied, then all triggers will be removed.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger to remove. If not specified and a trigger id is not be supplied, then all triggers will be removed.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The owning namespace, if any to remove the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identifier of the trigger.

service.name: asset.trigger.disable
service.description: Disables one or more specified triggers.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The owning asset of the trigger. If not specified and a trigger name is not be supplied, then all triggers will be disabled.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger to disable. If not specified and a trigger id is not be supplied, then all triggers will be disabled.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The owning namespace, if any to disable the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identifier of the trigger.

service.name: asset.trigger.enable
service.description: Enables one or more specified triggers.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The owning asset of the trigger. If not specified and a trigger name is not be supplied, then all triggers will be enabled.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger to enable. If not specified and a trigger id is not be supplied, then all triggers will be enabled.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The owning namespace, if any to enable the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

element.name: tid
element.description: The identifier of the trigger.

service.name: asset.trigger.on.describe
service.description: Returns the triggers (including the script) on one or more assets.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the asset. If not specified, returns non-asset specific triggers.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace, if any to attach the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Recurse down the namespace tree looking for all triggers. Defaults to false - just describe triggers on the specified namespace.

service.name: asset.trigger.on.exists
service.description: Determines if a named trigger exixts on one or more namespaces or assets.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the asset. If not specified, returns non-asset specific triggers.

element.name: name
element.description: An name for the trigger.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace, if any to attach the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

service.name: asset.trigger.on.list
service.description: Returns the identity of triggers on one or more namespaces or assets.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the asset. If not specified, returns non-asset specific triggers.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace, if any to attach the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Recurse down the namespace tree looking for all triggers. Defaults to false - just describe triggers on the specified namespace.

service.name: asset.trigger.post.create
service.description: Adds a postcondition for the given event. The given script will be executed after the given event happens.

element.name: async
element.description: If set to true, the trigger will execute outside of a transaction. Asynchronous triggers may give faster response when accessing an asset, but if the system crashes before the trigger completes, it will be lost. Defaults to false - the trigger is executed inside the transaction that generated the event.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset that will own the trigger. If not specified, then added for all assets.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace, if any to attach the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Should the trigger apply to all namespaces below this one? Defaults to true.

element.name: oneoff
element.description: If set to true, the trigger will be destroyed after execution. Defaults to false.

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute. The script will be passed the variables namespace, id and version.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the script value. 'value' means the script element contains the script. A value of 'ref' indicates it is a reference to an asset (an asset path). Defaults to 'value'

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this trigger will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

service.name: asset.trigger.post.status
service.description: Returns information on the queued, executing and completed post-condition triggers.

service.name: asset.trigger.pre.create
service.description: Adds a precondition for the given event. The given script will be executed prior to the given event happening.

element.name: event
element.description: The event that generates the trigger.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then added for all assets.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional name for the trigger.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace, if any to attach the trigger. If specified, then the asset (id) is ignored.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Should the trigger apply to all namespaces below this one? Defaults to true.

element.name: oneoff
element.description: If set to true, the trigger will be destroyed after execution. Defaults to false.

element.name: script
element.description: The script to execute. The script will be passed the variables namespace, id and version.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the script value. 'value' means the script element contains the script. A value of 'ref' indicates it is a reference to an asset (an asset path). Defaults to 'value'

service.name: asset.type.icon.get
service.description: Returns a default asset icon for a specified type or file extension. Either the type or extension must be specified.

element.name: ext
element.description: File extension for the type.

element.name: height
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the the target width. If not specified, then 'size' will be used. If 'width' or 'height' are specified, then both should be specified.

element.name: size
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the largest dimension (width or height). The icon will only be resized if it is larger than this size. If not specified, size defaults to 32.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the type.

element.name: width
element.description: The size (in pixels) of the the target width. If not specified, then 'size' will be used. If 'width' or 'height' are specified, then both should be specified.

service.name: asset.unlock
service.description: Unlocks an asset provided you are the owner, or have permission to unlock locks held by others.

element.name: descend
element.description: Controls whether locks should be released for all descendants. The default is set to true.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The univerally unique identifier for the lock.

service.name: asset.values.get
service.description: Retrieves values specified by XPath for the specified asset.

element.name: all
element.description: Retrieve all values, or just a single value per xpath. Defaults to false.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset. If not specified, then a citeable identifier must be specified.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: only-if-exists
attribute.description: If true, then only get the asset if it exists (and don't throw an exception). Defaults to false.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: xpath
element.description: If specified, then only the specified XPath participates in the action.

attribute.name: ekey
attribute.description: Arbitrary, application defined key. If defined, this key will be added to the element as an attribute.

attribute.name: ename
attribute.description: Element name for result. If not specified, defaults to 'value'.

service.name: asset.version.count
service.description: Returns the number of versions for the asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.version.policy.apply
service.description: Applies a policy to one or more asset versions.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: policy
element.description: The policy to apply to each version.

element.name: action
element.description: The action to perform.

element.name: content-copy
element.description: Copy content to from one store to another.

element.name: from-store
element.description: The source store name. If not specified, then will select a source store.

element.name: to-store
element.description: The destination store name.

element.name: content-move
element.description: Move content to from one store to another.

element.name: from-store
element.description: The source store name.

element.name: to-store
element.description: The destination store name.

element.name: content-remove
element.description: Remove content from the specified store.

element.name: from-store
element.description: The name of the store.

element.name: destroy
element.description: If true, destroy the version.

element.name: constraint
element.description: A constraint for this policy to apply.

element.name: content-age
element.description: A content constraint.

element.name: applies-to
element.description: Which time the constraint applies to. 'effective-mtime' is the 'mtime' (if set) or 'ctime' (if not set).

element.name: max
element.description: The maximum age of the content. If not set, defaults to infinity.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit for the age.

element.name: min
element.description: The minimum age of the content.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit for the age.

element.name: max-versions-from-latest
element.description: The maximum number of versions that must exist before this version policy applies. Defaults to 1 (skipping the latest).

element.name: min-versions-from-latest
element.description: The minimum number of versions that must exist before this version policy applies. Defaults to 1 (skipping the latest).

service.name: asset.version.statistics
service.description: Generates statistics about the number of versions for a set of assets.

element.name: where
element.description: The assets for which version statistics should be generated. If note specified, then generated for all assets.

service.name: asset.versions
service.description: Returns each of the version (numbers) associated with an asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: labels
element.description: If set, returns the labels on each version. Defaults to false.

element.name: sort
element.description: Determines the sort order of the returned versions. Defaults to (desc)ending.

service.name: asset.versions.get
service.description: Returns the full metadtaa for selected versions for the asset.

element.name: format
element.description: If set to extended, then the meta information is returned in a format that describes the elements and attributes. If the mode is 'template', then the full document definition is utilized, with values taken from the asset. Default is 'terse'.

element.name: geo-shape
element.description: The the action is get-geo-shape, then shape parameters may be specified.

element.name: clip
element.description: Clipping rectangle. If specified, then shapes will be clipped to this rectangle.

element.name: east
element.description: Eastern longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: north
element.description: Northern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: south
element.description: Southern latitude for the rectangle.

element.name: west
element.description: Western longitude for the rectangle.

element.name: format
element.description: The format of any geometry returned. 'detailed' returns a full xml response with decimal latitude an longitude and the coordinates in degrees, minutes and seconds. 'simple' returns a simplified xml response with only decimal latitude and longitude. 'geojson' returns the geometry in geojson format. 'esrijson' returns the geometry in esri json format. 'esrijsonwm' returns the geometry in esri json web mercator format. 'wkt' returns the geometry in Well-Known-Text geomoetry format. If not supplied defaults to 'detailed'

element.name: resolution
element.description: Display resolution for generating shapes. If unspecified, no sub-sampling occurs.

element.name: latitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for latitude.

element.name: longitude
element.description: Minimum displayable difference in/resolution for longitude.

element.name: min-points
element.description: Minimum points within geometry before point reduction occurs. This can be used to restrict point reduction to shapes with a point count above a certain size. Defaults to 20 points.

element.name: get-attributes
element.description: If set will display any configured attributes.

element.name: get-content-status
element.description: If set will determine the status of the content as well.

attribute.name: show-errors
attribute.description: Should any content status exceptions be displayed as well. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: get-content-store-information
element.description: If true, then get additional / extended content information. The extended information depends on the data store type. For some stores, this may be relatively costly. Defaults to false.

element.name: get-full-geo-shape
element.description: If set to true, then the full geo shape information will be returned. If false (the default), then only the bounding box will be returned for non-point shapes.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The format of the geometry to be returned. 'detailed' returns fully populated xml response with decimal latitude an longitude in addition to the coordinates in degrees, minutes and seconds. 'simple' returns the coordinates in a simplified xml response that includes only decimal latitude and longitude. 'geojson' returns the geometryin geojson format. 'esrijson' returns the geometryin esri json format. 'esrijsonwm' returns the geometry in esri json web mercator format. 'wkt' returns the geometry in Well-Known-Text geomoetry format. Any supplied value is overridden if a format is supplied in 'geo-shape'. If not supplied defaults to 'detailed'

element.name: get-name-history
element.description: If set will display any previous names if the name changed.

element.name: get-related-meta
element.description: If set and there are related assets, then the metadata for the related assets will also be returned.

attribute.name: inverse
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve inverse relationship types. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: Specifies the number of levels out to go retrieving related metadata. Defaults to 1.

attribute.name: primary
attribute.description: Specifies whether to retrieve primary relationship types. Defaults to true.

element.name: get-user-meta
element.description: If set and there is a 'user' (created with the service 'user.create') for the given revision history, the user metadata will also be returned.

element.name: get-versions
element.description: If set to true, returns information about the versions of this asset.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: idx
element.description: Taking the sort order into account, the version offset to start from. Defaults to '1'.

element.name: labels
element.description: If set, returns the labels on each version. Defaults to false.

element.name: related-type
element.description: If specified and 'get-related-meta' is specified, then only relationships of this type will be returned. If not specified, then all relationships are returned.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of versions to return. Defaults to '100'.

element.name: sort
element.description: Determines the sort order of the returned versions. Defaults to (desc)ending.

element.name: template-exclude
element.description: Document type names to exclude from templated formating. These documents will tersely formatted.

element.name: template-if-generated-by
element.description: Controls which metadata is converted to a template when the specified format is 'template'. Defaults to 'user'.

element.name: template-if-namespace
element.description: Restrict templating to only those templates in this namespace.

element.name: template-include
element.description: Document type names to include for templated formating. If specified, then only those documents will be templated.

element.name: template-language
element.description: If format template is specified, attempt to translate document decorations into this language. This option can be specified multiple times in which case translations are sought in the order specified. If not translation is found, the document definition text decorations are used.

service.name: asset.vid.get
service.description: Retrieves the version and version value identifier for the latest, or the specified labelled version of one or more assets. The value identifier (vid) can be used to determine whether the value of the asset has changed.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

element.name: variable
element.description: Variables to supply to derived asset.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

service.name: asset.video.udp.transmit
service.description: Transmits asset (video) to a UDP end-point, which could be a video player or receiver.

element.name: address
element.description: The destination address to transmit to.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The port number to receive the stream.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to zero.

service.name: asset.view.actor.set

element.name: actor
element.description: If set to true, then the view will be the actor (define the permissions) and if false, the actor will be the user, with permissions of the user and view combined.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.associate
service.description: Sets the view associated with a domain or user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.associate.list
service.description: Returns the list of associates for a given view.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.create
service.description: Creates an asset view, which can be attached to a domain or user, to subset the asset space.

element.name: actor
element.description: Controls whether the view is the authorization actor. If not, the user permissions will be aggregated with the view permissions. Defaults to false.

element.name: app
element.description: Application that created the view. Can be used for selection in other services.

element.name: assetacl
element.description: Controls whether assets in the view should be controlled using asset level access control. Defaults to false.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the view.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the view (must be unique).

element.name: rule
element.description: A rule for the view.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: The path the rule applies.

element.name: assetacl
element.description: Controls whether assets matching this rule should be controlled using asset level access control. Asset level access can be specified for the entire view, or on a rule-by-rule basis. Defaults to false. If set to true, the view level setting overrides this value.

element.name: label
element.description: Label, if assets restricted to specific label. If more than one label specified, then all labels must exist to match.

element.name: namespace
element.description: Base namespace. if not set, defaults to the root namespace.

element.name: proxy
element.description: Defines whether this (namespace) rule is a proxy for another user/view. 'proxy' is ignored if the view is the actor. Defaults to false.

element.name: query
element.description: Arbitrary asset query. The namespace and/or label cannot be specified if a query is specified. Query type rules are forced to be read-only.

element.name: queryable
element.description: Defines whether this (namespace) rule is queryable. Defaults to true.

element.name: read-only
element.description: Defines whether namespaces and assets matching this rule can be updated or not. Defaults to false. Forced to true if the view is not the actor, and this rule is not a proxy.

element.name: visible
element.description: Defines whether this (namespace) rule is visible when listing namespaces. There may be more visible namespaces than queryable. A namespace that is queryable is always deemed as visible. Defaults to true. Forced to false if the view is not the actor, and this rule is not a proxy.

service.name: asset.view.describe
service.description: Returns a information about one or more views.

element.name: app
element.description: Views created by the given application.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.destroy
service.description: Destroys a type, including all sub-types.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.disassociate
service.description: Removes the view associated with a domain or user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

service.name: asset.view.exists
service.description: Returns true if the view exists and false if not.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.for
service.description: Returns the view, if any, associated with a domain or user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

service.name: asset.view.list
service.description: Returns a list of the known asset views.

service.name: asset.view.name
service.description: Returns the current view, or nothing if there is no view set.

service.name: asset.view.rule.add
service.description: Adds one or more rules to a view.

element.name: rule
element.description: A rule for the view.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: The path the rule applies.

element.name: assetacl
element.description: Controls whether assets matching this rule should be controlled using asset level access control. Asset level access can be specified for the entire view, or on a rule-by-rule basis. Defaults to false. If set to true, the view level setting overrides this value.

element.name: label
element.description: Label, if assets restricted to specific label. If more than one label specified, then all labels must exist to match.

element.name: namespace
element.description: Base namespace. if not set, defaults to the root namespace.

element.name: proxy
element.description: Defines whether this (namespace) rule is a proxy for another user/view. 'proxy' is ignored if the view is the actor. Defaults to false.

element.name: query
element.description: Arbitrary asset query. The namespace and/or label cannot be specified if a query is specified. Query type rules are forced to be read-only.

element.name: queryable
element.description: Defines whether this (namespace) rule is queryable. Defaults to true. Forced to false if the view is not the actor, and this rule is not a proxy.

element.name: read-only
element.description: Defines whether namespaces and assets matching this rule can be updated or not. Defaults to false. Forced to false if the view is not the actor, and this rule is not a proxy.

element.name: visible
element.description: Defines whether this (namespace) rule is visible when listing namespaces. There may be more visible namespaces than queryable. A namespace that is queryable is always deemed as visible. Defaults to true. Forced to false if the view is not the actor, and this rule is not a proxy.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view (must be unique).

service.name: asset.view.rule.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not the specified rule (paths) exist.

element.name: path
element.description: The path the rule applies.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view (must be unique).

service.name: asset.view.rule.remove
service.description: Removes one or more rules from a view.

element.name: path
element.description: The path the rule applies.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view (must be unique).

service.name: asset.view.set
service.description: Sets the current view. The caller must have access to the target view.

element.name: view
element.description: The name of the view.

service.name: asset.view.unset
service.description: Unsets the view for the current user, reverting to the default view.

service.name: asset.visibility.filter.clear
service.description: Removes the filter on visibility of assets for the caller's session.

service.name: asset.visibility.filter.describe
service.description: Displays information about any asset filter that has been set for the caller's session.

service.name: asset.visibility.filter.set
service.description: Sets the visibility of assets for the caller's session. Only assets satisfying the given predicate will be shown.

element.name: max-time
element.description: Only show assets existeed at or before this time. Unrestricted by default.

element.name: min-time
element.description: Only show assets that existed at or after this time. Unrestricted by default.

element.name: state
element.description: The state of existence. Defaults to any

service.name: asset.work.queue.create
service.description: Creates a work queue for external processing of assets. Membership is based on a query.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description.

element.name: lease-duration
element.description: The duration (in seconds) for the lease on entries in the queue. If leases are not renewed within this interval, then the acquisition is lost.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

element.name: where
element.description: The asset query clause for selecting members.

service.name: asset.work.queue.describe
service.description: Destroys and existing work queue.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.work.queue.destroy
service.description: Destroys and existing work queue.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.work.queue.exists
service.description: Indicates whether the specified work queue exists.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.work.queue.next
service.description: Retrieves the next item off the queue, if any, and assigns to the caller. The caller must process within the lease time, and/or renew the lease periodicially to retain the item.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.work.queue.release
service.description: Explicilty release an item from the queue. If not released it will expire after the lease has expired. Calling this service removes as soon as possible and will keep the queue smaller.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset within the queue.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.work.queue.renew
service.description: Renews the lease on the given asset. This must be done periodically, otherwise the lease will be lost and the asset may be assigned to some other caller.

element.name: id
element.description: The asset within the queue.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.work.queue.size
service.description: Returns the number of entries on specified or all queues.

element.name: name
element.description: The (unique) name for the queue.

service.name: asset.worm.expiry.set
service.description: Change the WORM expiry date/time for an asset. Must have appropriate authority to do so.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: expiry
element.description: The new expiry date. The expiry can be later than the current date/time. It can only be set to an earlier time, if the caller is an administrator and the WORM status permits that change (and force is set to true)

element.name: force
element.description: Must be set to true to force an earlier expiry date/time, Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.worm.policy.apply.if.unset
service.description: If there is a WORM policy on a parent collection for this asset and the asset is not already in the WORM state, then apply that policy now.

element.name: check-predicates
element.description: If true, then check the policy predicates to see if this policy should apply. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

service.name: asset.worm.set
service.description: Explicitly sets the WORM state for an asset. The state may be 'upgraded' (stronger and longer) but never diminished.

element.name: applies-to
element.description: Indicates what parts of the asset the WORM state applies to. Defaults to 'all'

element.name: can-add-versions
element.description: Indicates whether new versions of metadata and content are allowed when in the WORM state. Defaults to false.

element.name: can-alter-if
element.description: Indicates when/who can modify the WORM state. Defaults to 'system-manager'

element.name: can-move
element.description: Indicates whether the collection, or asset(s) can be moved. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier of the asset. If not specified, then a non-citeable 'id' must be specified.

element.name: destroy-on-expiry
element.description: Indicates whether assets are destroyed once the WORM state ceases (retention period expires). Defaults to fault.

element.name: expiry
element.description: The expiry time of the WORM state. If not set, then no expiry.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset.

element.name: min-content-copies
element.description: Specifies the minimum number of content copies allowed. Defaults to 1.

service.name: asset.xpath.definition
service.description: Returns the definition of the specified XPath (e.g. retrieved by a query).

element.name: xpath
element.description: An xpath to to return definition information.

service.name: asset.xpath.describe
service.description: Describes the accepted XODB Value (xpath) paths for asset properties used within 'asset.get' and 'asset.query'.

element.name: xpath
element.description: An xpath to to return definition information.

service.name: asset.xpath.list
service.description: Lists the accepted XODB Value (xpath) paths for asset properties used within 'asset.get' and 'asset.query'.

service.name: audit.event.create
service.description: Creates a custom audit event record of the supplied type. If no custom audit event types have been declared, with audit.type.create, this service can not be used.

element.name: field
element.description: The value of an additional field defined by the custom audit event type. The format of the string value supplied by conform to the event types field data type

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the field defined by the custom audit event type

element.name: object-id
element.description: An optional object identifier for the audit event record, for example the asset id the event relates to.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the custom audit event type to create. If no custom audit events have been defined, this service can not be used.

service.name: audit.type.describe
service.description: Describes audit records types.

element.name: prefix
element.description: A prefix to select types of audit objects.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the object.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the event type.

service.description: List audit records types.

element.name: prefix
element.description: A prefix to select types of audit objects.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the object.

service.description: Describes specified login methods.

element.name: always-show-certificate-methods
element.description: If true it will show certificate methods no matter what. If false it will only show them on HTTPS connections with provided peer certifiacte chain. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: method
element.description: Name of the login method.

service.name: authentication.login.method.list
service.description: Lists login methods.

service.name: authentication.password.check
service.description: Checks the given password against the constraints for the associated domain etc. The 'id' is the identity of a previously issued request to reset a password.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a password reset request.

element.name: password
element.description: The new password to set.

service.name: authentication.password.generate
service.description: Generates a password based on the requirements supplied.

element.name: allow-special
element.description: Are special characters allowed in the password. Defaults to 'false' unless 'min-pass-num-special' is set.

element.name: allow-whitespace
element.description: Is whitespace allowed in the password. Defaults to 'false' unless 'min-pass-num-special' is set.

element.name: length
element.description: The length the password. Defaults to 12 or 'min-pass-length' if greater.

element.name: max-pass-sequential-numeric
element.description: The maximum number of consecutive squential numeric characters to allow, if the domain supports password assginment. Defaults to 'infinity'.

element.name: min-pass-length
element.description: The minimum length for a password, if the domain supports password assginment. Defaults to 6

element.name: min-pass-num-lower
element.description: The minimum number of lowercase characters in a password. Defaults to 0

element.name: min-pass-num-numeric
element.description: The minimum number of numeric characters in a password. Defaults to 0

element.name: min-pass-num-special
element.description: The minimum number of special characters in a password. Defaults to 0

element.name: min-pass-num-upper
element.description: The minimum number of uppercase characters in a password. Defaults to 0

element.name: min-pass-strength
element.description: The minimum strength for passwords. Setting to '0' disables strength evaluation. Defaults to 0

service.name: authentication.password.reset
service.description: Resets the password for the given user. The 'id' is the identity of a previously issued request to reset a password.

element.name: id

element.name: password
element.description: The new password to set.

service.name: authentication.password.reset.request.describe
service.description: Provides details of the domain and user for a password reset request.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a password reset request.

service.name: authentication.password.strength
service.description: Returns the calculated strength of the supplied password.

element.name: password
element.description: The password to be tested.

service.name: authentication.user.count
service.description: Returns the number of users within the specified domain, perhaps subject to some prefix filter.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain

element.name: prefix
element.description: User name prefix if any. If specified, then only user names starting with the prefix will be returned.

service.name: authentication.user.create
service.description: Creates a user within a domain. The user name must be unique within the domain.

element.name: add-role
element.description: A role to be assigned to the user.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the user; e.g. for the purpose.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: email
element.description: E-mail address for contact (and for password recovery if allowed).

element.name: generate-password
element.description: If true and no password is specified, then automatically generate a password satisfying the domain constraints. If the user is to be notified, then password sent to them. If not notifying, then password will be returned. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: The password length. A length less than the minimum length for the domain will be ignored. If not specified, defaults to the minimum length for the domain.

element.name: home
element.description: The path, to the 'home' for the user - this may be some collection. It may be interpreted by different applications.

element.name: home-folder
element.description: The path to a server accessible directory that can be considered 'home' for the user. This may be a local directory or a directory on a network accessible file-system. The folder will be presented as writeable to the user when accessing their accessible server folders.

element.name: ifexists
element.description: The behaviour if the role already exists. Defaults to 'error'.

element.name: name
element.description: The full name of the user/person.

element.name: notify
element.description: If true, and the user has an e-mail address then notify them of account creation. If generate-password is true, then e-mail the generated password to the user.

element.name: notify-body
element.description: The template body text for the notification e-mail. If not specified, then standard text will be generated. If provided, the message must contain the tokens, $${domain}$$ and $${user}$$, which will be replaced with the user's domain and username. If the password has been supplied and notification of password is disabled then it will not be included, otherwise the body template must include a $${password}$$ token. If a $${fullanme}$$ token is provided and the users full name has been supplied this will be injected into the body as well.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The MIME type for the body. Defaults to 'text/plain'.

element.name: notify-subject
element.description: The subject for notification e-mail. If not specified, then a subject will be generated.

element.name: password
element.description: The password for the user. If not specified, then the user cannot connect - this is then a placeholder/system user.

attribute.name: notify
attribute.description: If notification has been requested for account creation, and this attribute it true, then the password will be included in the notification. Defaults to false.

element.name: password-expiry
element.description: The period before passwords expire. If supplied without units, then defaults to 'day'. Defaults to no expiry. Set to zero for immediate expiry.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of expiry. If not provided defaults to 'day'.

element.name: restrict
element.description: Access restrictions, if any.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Arbitrary description for the purpose of the restriction.

element.name: network
element.description: Network access restrictions, if any.

element.name: address

element.name: user

service.name: authentication.user.password.reset.request.create
service.description: Requests a reset of the password for the given user. This service is only valid for domains that are not using password encryption and for user's that have a configured e-mail address. The password reset request will be mailed to that address.

element.name: body
element.description: A message to be sent to the user. The message must contain the token $${link}$$ for the URL link for the password reset. It may optionally contains the following tokens: $${origin}$$,$${domain}$$,$${user}$$,$${server.uuid}$$,$${server.name}$$,$${server.organisation}$$, which will be replaced with the user's IP address, domain name, user name, and server identity, server name and server organisation (from server identity). If no message is specified, then one will be generated.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Message type. If not specified, defaults to text/plain.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain. If not specified, defaults to domain of caller.

element.name: email
element.description: The e-mail of the user. Can specify either user name or email.

element.name: end-point
element.description: The URL end-point to handle the password change. If not specified, then the default one (__password_reset__) will be used - note: a password processor must be created with the service http.password.reset.processor.create. The end-point will be passed a single variable 'id' which is the identity of the password reset request. The end-point should obtain a new password from the end-user, and then call the service 'authentication.password.reset'.

element.name: from
element.description: The mail sender. If not specified, defaults to the property for the given domain.

element.name: password-expiry
element.description: The period before passwords expire. If supplied without units, then defaults to 'day'. Defaults to no expiry. Set to zero for immediate expiry.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of expiry. If not provided defaults to 'day'.

element.name: subject
element.description: The mail subject. If not specified, defaults to 'Password Recovery'.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user. If not specified and email not specified, then defaults to caller.

element.description: . If not supplied defaults to '#D63F20'

element.name: table-of-contents
element.description: Should a table of contents page be generated in the output document. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: title
element.description: A title for the document. If no title is supplied the title of the Markdown document is used. If more than one title is supplied they are used for the primary and secondary title on the front page.

service.name: book.install
service.description: Creates, or updates, a book. The input must be a file with an extension .abook, that was created with the application abook. If the book already exists, it will be replaced.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace into which to install the book. If not specified, goes into /system/Books

element.name: prune
element.description: If true, then assets that are not part of the book will be removed and existing assets pruned. Defaults to true.

service.name: citeable.id.create
service.description: Creates a citeable (externally referenceable) identifier within some scope.

element.name: pdist
element.description: If greater than zero will try to find the server that can create this identifier. The pdist specifies the maximum number of hops to other servers. Set to 'infinity' to search the entire federation.

element.name: pid
element.description: The parent citeable identifier. If not supplied, then created in global scope.

service.name: citeable.id.creator.find
service.description: This distributed service will find the server that is designated to allocate identifiers based in the supplied identifier.

element.name: cid
element.description: The (parent) identitier that will be used for allocation.

service.name: citeable.id.destroy
service.description: Destroys a citeable (externally referenceable) identifier and all sub-identifiers.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier.

service.name: citeable.id.exists
service.description: Checks to see whether the given identifier has been created.

element.name: cid
element.description: The identifier to check for existence in the local server.

service.name: citeable.id.import
service.description: Imports a citeable into this identifier allocator. Every parent identifier will be created, if necessary. For every level, the identifiers will be allocated (if necessary) up to the specified number.

element.name: cid
element.description: The citeable identifier to import.

element.name: root-depth
element.description: The depth of the root identifier in the system from which this identifier is being imported.

service.name: citeable.name.destroy
service.description: Destroys a name used for a root citeable identifier.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the root identifier.

service.name: citeable.name.list
service.description: Returns the known names for identifiers.

service.name: citeable.name.set
service.description: Creates a name for an existing citeable identifier. The name must be unique. The name may be changed for a given identifier.

element.name: cid
element.description: The identifier to name.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the root identifier.

service.name: citeable.named.id.create
service.description: Creates a named root citeable identifier.

element.name: id
element.description: The leaf-identifier for this node, if not already allocated.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the root identifier.

service.name: citeable.named.id.describe
service.description: Returns the known names (and their values) for identifiers.

service.name: citeable.root.get
service.description: Returns the root of all (new) citeable identifiers if set.

service.name: cluster.node.asset.import
service.description: Performs an importation of one or more files / objects from a source accessible to a cluster node.

element.name: analyze
element.description: Should imported assets be analyzed for metadata. Defaults to true.

element.name: compression-level
element.description: The level of compression. Defaults to 0.

element.name: filter
element.description: A file filter in the form of a regular expression pattern. If any filter is supplied, then all possible filters should be specified. If no filter is supplied, then defaults to .* Filter priority is the order of supply. That is, more explicit filters should be specified before more generalized ones. Only applies when importing files from a directory.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Controls whether these file names/types are included or excluded. Defaults to 'include'.

attribute.name: for
attribute.description: Controls whether the pattern applies the name of the file or the path. Defaults to 'name'.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: Should check sums be generated. Defaults to true.

element.name: identity-map
element.description: If specified, then map file permissions to asset ACL's using the specified identity map.

element.name: import-file-permissions
element.description: If true, then import file system identity and permissions (gid, uid and permission bits). Defaults to false.

element.name: log
element.description: If true, enable import logging at remote site. Defaults to false.

element.name: max-size
element.description: Only include files less than this size. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: min-size
element.description: Only include files of this size or larger. Defaults to zero.

element.name: mtime
element.description: Indicates what modification time is set on the asset. If 'file' then the modification time of the external file will be used (requires ADMINISTER permission). If 'now' (the default) then the import time will be used. Only applies when importing files.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the remote / satellite node to import from. One of 'uuid' or 'name' must be specified.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination namespace to import to. If not specified, imports into root namespace. Ignored if the parent asset is specified.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: parent
element.description: The destination collection asset to import to.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: If true, and the pid is specified as path=<path>, then create all parent paths. Defaults to false.

element.name: pgen
element.description: Should proxies be automatically generated. Defaults to true.

element.name: scan-threads
element.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use for the scanner. Defaults to 1.

element.name: since
element.description: Include files modified since this time. If not specified, all files imported.

element.name: transmit-threads
element.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use for transmitting. Defaults to 1.

element.name: url
element.description: The location(s) to import.

attribute.name: parent
attribute.description: The destination collection asset to import into. If not specified, defaults to the value of 'parent' element.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The UUID of the remote / satellite node to import from.

service.name: cluster.node.asset.pre.import.check
service.description: Performs an pre-import check for one or more files / objects from a source accessible to a cluster node and returns a synopsis.

element.name: filter
element.description: A file filter in the form of a regular expression pattern. If any filter is supplied, then all possible filters should be specified. If no filter is supplied, then defaults to .* Filter priority is the order of supply. That is, more explicit filters should be specified before more generalized ones. Only applies when importing files from a directory.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Controls whether these file names/types are included or excluded. Defaults to 'include'.

attribute.name: for
attribute.description: Controls whether the pattern applies the name of the file or the path. Defaults to 'name'.

element.name: log
element.description: If true, enable import logging at remote site. Defaults to false.

element.name: max-size
element.description: Only include files less than this size. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: min-size
element.description: Only include files of this size or larger. Defaults to zero.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the remote / satellite node to import from. One of 'uuid' or 'name' must be specified.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The destination namespace to import to. If not specified, imports into root namespace. Ignored if the parent asset is specified.

element.name: parent
element.description: The destination collection asset to import to.

element.name: scan-threads
element.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use for the scanner. Defaults to 1.

element.name: since
element.description: Include files modified since this time. If not specified, all files imported.

element.name: url
element.description: The location(s) to import.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The UUID of the remote / satellite node to import from.

service.name: data.transmit.receive.session.count

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the transmission.

element.name: dst
element.description: A destination end-point of the form: protocol:path

element.name: force-to-stable-storage
element.description: If true, data will be forced to stable storage before being deemed completed. May be set to false for greater speed, but probability of data loss. Defaults to true.

element.name: gen-csum
element.description: If true, then received objects will be checksummed. Defaults to true.

element.name: max-nb-connections
element.description: The maximum number of connections the caller would like to request.

element.name: name

element.name: total-number-to-transmit
element.description: The total number of objects to be transitted, if known.

element.name: total-size-to-transmit

element.name: has-failures

element.name: has-failures

element.name: max-atime

element.name: directory
element.description: Location of a server accessible file system containing a DICOM dataset.

attribute.name: frame
attribute.description: This specifies the frame ordinal. Can only be greater than zero for multi-frame data - that is, (0028,0008) set and greater than 1. Defaults to zero.

attribute.name: idx
attribute.description: This specifies the idx'th file to extract. Defaults to zero.

element.name: id
element.description: A (DICOM) asset from which to extract an image. If not supplied, then an input must be provided.

attribute.name: frame
attribute.description: This specifies the frame ordinal. Can only be greater than zero for multi-frame data - that is, (0028,0008) set and greater than 1. Defaults to zero.

attribute.name: idx
attribute.description: This specifies the idx'th file in an archive asset. Defaults to zero.

element.name: lossless
element.description: Lossless image encoding (PNG) or lossy (JPEG). Defaults to false - lossy.

element.name: quality
element.description: Lossy encoding quality. Defaults to 0.8

element.name: size
element.description: Relative or absolute size. Defaults to relative size of 1.0

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Is the size relative or absolute. The default is relative.

service.name: dicom.ingest

element.name: anonymize
element.description: Indicates whether patient names etc. should be anonymized. Defaults to true.

element.name: anonymize-elements
element.description: Indicates the DICOM elements to anonymize. If specified, should be a string of the form (G,E)+(G,E), where G is a group, and E is an element. For example, (0010,0010)+(0010,0030)+(0010,0040). If set, then anonymization will be enabled from this set.

element.name: arg

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: engine
element.description: The type of storage engine to use to process the data.

element.name: service
element.description: The name of a service to be called for each study that is created/updated. The service will be passed the study's asset identifier. The output, if any, for the service will be returned.

element.name: type
element.description: The MIME type of the input. If not specified, defined from the input stream itself.

element.name: wait
element.description: Indicates whether the caller of this service should block until the data is fully ingested. Defaults to true.

service.name: dicom.metadata.get

element.name: defn
element.description: If set to true, the metadata will include the definition of each element if known. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: idx

element.description: Path hierarchy to match if an XML document is supplied. The match is a node hierarchy of the form /a/b, /a/b*, /a/b/* or /a/b/**. * is a wild-card match. ** matches all nodes below. If not specified, then all node match (the same as '**').

element.name: channel
element.description: The name of the channel.

service.name: event.channel.destroy
service.description: Destroys an event channel.

element.name: channel
element.description: The name of the channel.

service.name: event.channel.list
service.description: Returns a list of known event channels.

service.name: event.next
service.description: Reads the next event for the specified subscriber.

element.name: channel
element.description: The name of the channel.

element.name: wait
element.description: The time (in milliseconds to wait). If not specified, then waits indefinitely.

service.name: event.publish
service.description: Publishes an event on a specified event channel.

element.name: channel
element.description: The name of the channel.

element.name: payload
element.description: The event's payload.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the event.

service.name: event.subscribe
service.description: Subscribes to a channel. A session must subscribe before it can publish or receive events.

element.name: channel
element.description: The name of the channel.

element.name: notify
element.description: If set to true, other subscribers will be notified about this subscription, and subsequent unsubscribe. Defaults to true. The system will send an event of type event:subscribe on subscription and event:unsubscribe on unsubscribe or disconnect.

element.name: payload
element.description: An event payload to be published on subscription. This will cause event:subscribe to be generated.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of subscriber.

service.name: event.unsubscribe
service.description: Removes a subscriber from a channel.

element.name: channel
element.description: The name of the channel.

service.name: forum.create
service.description: Creates a named discussion forum.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the forum.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the forum.

element.name: namespace
element.description: The namespace of the asset. [default is the root namespace]

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Create namespace if not found. Defaults to false.

element.name: participant
element.description: A forum participant, if any. If using a moderator, topics and comments must be approved by the moderator before they are published.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description of the participant's role, expertise, etc.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: role
element.description: The classification of the participant.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

service.name: forum.describe
service.description: Returns details on one or more forums.

element.name: activeif
element.description: If specified, controls the inactivity time (in seconds) after which a participant is conidered inactive. If not specified uses a system property, forum.active.timeout

element.name: forum
element.description: The identifier of the forum.

element.name: label
element.description: The version of the topics to returns.

service.name: forum.destroy

element.name: forum
element.description: The identifier of the forum.

element.description: The expression to execute. Example: add(2,4)

service.description: Checks if geocoding framework debugging mode is enabled.

service.description: Checks if the geocoding framework is enabled.

service.description: Describes configured geocoding providers.

element.description: The name of the geocoding provider to describe.

element.name: get-full-geoshape
element.description: If the feature contains a complete geometry in addition to the location points, should the full geometry be returned or just its extents. If not specified, defaults to 'false'

element.name: location
element.description: The bounding extent to search within. Not supported by all suppliers.

element.name: geoshape
element.description: An optional geographic shape for the asset. If there are multiple shapes, the shape of the asset is deemed to be compound.

attribute.name: datum
attribute.description: The mathematical model for the points. Defaults to WGS84.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Should the geomtery be considered the default. Defaults to 'false'. If default, this geometry will be placed at the head of the list of geometries - the head is always the default.

attribute.name: generated-by
attribute.description: What generated the geometry. Defaults to 'user'.

attribute.name: geoid
attribute.description: If the elevation is measured with respect to a geoid rather than the datum, then the geiod name must be specified.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: An abitrarry label for this geometry

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of the shape. Defaults to 'point'. If the number of points is one, then the shape will be automatically coerced to type 'point'. A 'compound' shape can contain other shapes.

element.name: holes
element.description: Zero or more geohape elements that are holes within the outer shape. Only rectangle and polygon geoshape types support holes.

element.name: point
element.description: One or more points in the shape. Compound geo shapes must contain other geoshape elements, not points.

element.name: elevation
element.description: The elevation specified in metres.

element.name: latitude
element.description: The latitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: longitude
element.description: The longitude specifed in D.D format (degrees,fraction of degree).

element.name: wkt
element.description: A geometry in WGS84 Well-Known-Text (WKT) format, e.g. 'POINT(10.2 30.5)', 'POLYGON Z((-77.04 38.89 10,-77.03 38.9 12,-77.03 38.89 12,-77.03 38.89 10,-77.04 38.89 10))'. If supplied all points are ignored and the geometry is derived from the WKT geometry definition.

element.name: margin
element.description: The number of meters to buffer the geoshape by. If not specified, defaults to zero.

element.name: provider
element.description: The name of a configured geocoding provider.

element.name: zoom
element.description: The zoom level. Defaults to 10

service.name: geo.coding.search
service.description: Searches the geocoding provider for the supplied query.

element.name: bounds
element.description: The bounding extent to search within. Not supported by all suppliers.

service.name: geo.feature.import
service.description: Import geo features

element.name: batch-size
element.description: The maximum number of entries to import per transaction. Import will be faster with a higher number, but will require more memory for the JVM (e.g. 10000 will require the server to be running with at least 3GB of memory). Defaults to 1000.

element.name: classifier
element.description: The feature classifier.

element.name: nb
element.description: The maximum number of entries to import. Defaults to infinity (all).

element.name: skip
element.description: The number of entries to skip before importing. Defaults to zero.

element.name: url
element.description: Location of the import set accessible to the server.

element.description: If specified, then filter to include processors that do, or do not, require encryption.

element.name: host

element.name: type

element.description: The url to map to a processor.

element.name: provider
element.description: The name of the provider. If not specified, all providers described.

service.name: ldap.search
service.description: Performs a search of a specified LDAP repository.

element.name: anonymous
element.description: Anonymous bind for searching? If not, then uses current session context, which must have been authenticated against the provider.

element.name: attribute
element.description: An LDAP attribute to return. If not defined, then all attributes returned.

element.name: count
element.description: Count the possible number of entries that might be returned.

element.name: filter
element.description: An LDAP filter with syntax defined by RFC 2254.

element.name: idx
element.description: The starting position to list entries. Defaults to 1.

element.name: path
element.description: The base distinguished name (DN) to search from.

element.name: provider
element.description: The name of the repository/provider. If not specified, set to 'default'

element.name: scope
element.description: Scope of the LDAP search. Defaults to 'SUBTREE'.

element.name: search-group-provider
element.description: Specifies if we should search for group memberships with group providers too if configured, instead of just searching for them within the same domain. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: search-group-provider-nested-groups
element.description: If set to 'true', we will search for nested groups with group providers too if configured, instead of just searching for nested groups within the same domain. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: search-nested-groups
element.description: Specifies if we should search for group memberships that objects inherit through their group memberships within the same domain. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: searchSizeLimit
element.description: The maximum number or entries to retrieve/count. This is different to the "size" argument since if "count" is enabled, the call can still take a very long time to return. This argument ensures the call returns once the searchSizeLimit is reached. Defaults to the maximum.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to retrieve. If not specified, defaults to 100.

service.description: Returns statistics on LDAP search requests.
