service.name: posix.fs.node.attributes.compare
service.description: Compares supplied POSIX attributes with those attributes on the local collection/namespace/asset. The response will indiate whether there has, or has not been a state change. The set of possible state changes are: [changed:data,changed:metadata,changed:symlink,changed:type,not-found,unchanged]

element.name: attributes-from-meta
element.description: Should the attributes be extracted from metadata, or inferred from the asset. Defaults to true.

element.name: node
element.description: A node in the file system to compare.

element.name: gid
element.description: If supplied, then compare the group id.

element.name: mode
element.description: If supplied, then compare mode bits.

element.name: mtime
element.description: If supplied, then compare the modification time (milliseconds since epoch).

element.name: path
element.description: The path to the node.

attribute.name: pid
attribute.description: The parent asset (if the type is 'asset' or 'any'). If specified, then path is relative to this asset.

element.name: size
element.description: If supplied, then compare size in bytes.

element.name: symlink
element.description: If supplied, and this is a symbolic link, then compare the symbolic link.

element.name: type
element.description: If supplied, then compare the file type.

element.name: uid
element.description: If supplied, then compare the user id.

element.name: type
element.description: Indicates what type of object the node will be, to improve lookup performance. Defaults to 'any'

service.name: remote.asset.data.transmit.send.to
service.description: Connect to a remote server and transmit a null data source to the specified destination(s). This is a performance test for the network and receiving storage.

element.name: check-sum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate checksums on network packets. If not set, controlled by overall session.

element.name: collection
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified collection, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the collection - it will simply walk down the collection tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the transmission.

element.name: destination
element.description: The end-point for the transmission.

element.name: address
element.description: A server.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: An arbitrary name for the address

element.name: allow-untrusted
element.description: Set to false if encryption is enabled, and the server need not be trusted. Defaults to true.

element.name: encrypt
element.description: Set to true if the specified port expects encrypted communications.

element.name: host
element.description: The FQDN or IP address of the destination server.

element.name: ip-version
element.description: IP version. Defaults to 'any'.

element.name: port
element.description: The port number.

element.name: protocol
element.description: The communication protocol. Defaults to 'http'.

element.name: as
element.description: The credentials to use. If not specified, uses default credentials for this server.

attribute.name: uuid
attribute.description: The unique identifier of the server for the credentials.

element.name: check-sum
element.description: Controls whether or not to generate checksums on network packets. Defaults to true.

element.name: dst
element.description: A destination end-point of the form: protocol:path

element.name: force-to-stable-storage
element.description: Can be set to override outer setting on a per-destination basis.

element.name: local-bind-address
element.description: The IP address to bind to locally. If unspecified, system chooses an interface.

element.name: local-bind-port
element.description: A port number to bind to. If unspecified, system chooses a port.

element.name: max-nb-connections
element.description: The number of network connections to this destination. Defaults to 4.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a predefined server configuration.

element.name: send-buffer-size
element.description: The size in bytes of the network receive buffer size (value of SO_SNDBUF). If unset, defaults to operating system and TCP/IP value which is typically 64KB.

element.name: token
element.description: A secure token for use with the destination server.

attribute.name: app
attribute.description: The application that generated the token, if any.

element.name: user

element.name: force-to-stable-storage
element.description: Controls whether or not to force data to stable storage at the receiving end. If not set, controlled by overall session.

element.name: name
element.description: Arbitrary name for the transmission.

element.name: namespace
element.description: If specified, then generate the results for the specified namespace, possibly augmented with a where clause. This may faster than using a where clause for the namespace - it will simply walk down the namespace tree. The results are not ordered.

element.name: object-processing-threads
element.description: The number of object processing threads (open, read, transmit). Defaults to 1.

element.name: source
element.description: The source server for the transmission.

element.description: Set to false if encryption is enabled, and the server need not be trusted. Defaults to true.

element.name: port

element.name: where
element.description: Selection query. If not specified, defaults to 'namespace>=/' for AQL and namespace()>='/' for FAQL - that is, all assets. If there is more than one where clause, then the second and subsequent clauses are evaluated (linearly) against the result set of the first where clause (a post filter).

attribute.name: lang
attribute.description: The query language. 'aql' is Asset Query Language, and 'faql' is Functional Asset Query Language. Defaults to 'aql'.

element.name: filter
element.description: A file filter in the form of a regular expression pattern. If any filter is supplied, then all possible filters should be specified. Only applies when importing files from a directory.

service.name: rest.delete
service.description: Executes a RESTful DELETE interface call to an external system.

element.name: authentication
element.description: If authentication is required these credentials will be applied using the authentication mechanism selected.

element.name: password
element.description: The password.

element.name: realm
element.description: The authentication realm. Commonly employed with NTLM authentication.

element.name: type
element.description: The authentication mechanism to employ.

element.name: username
element.description: The username.

element.name: header
element.description: An argument to add to the HTTP(S) header

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The argument name.

element.name: on-error-action
element.description: Action on return of a non-success status code: "status" returns the status code and the content of the error stream; "exception" causes an exception to be thrown. (Defaults to "exception".)

element.name: response
element.description: The format the payload returned by the host. If 'raw' then the response will be returned without conversion within an xml wrapper. Defaults to 'xml'.

attribute.name: json-array-element
attribute.description: An name for xml element resulting from a JSON array formatted response when converting to XML. Defaults to 'object'

attribute.name: json-response-element
attribute.description: An name for the root xml element for the JSON response when converting to XML. Defaults to 'response'

element.name: server-certificates
element.description: When an HTTPS (SSL) URL is used, should the client present server installed certificates to the destination host. Defaults to 'false' which accepts all certificates presented from the remote host without requiring a corresponding certificate to be installed on the local server. This is often called 'insecure' or 'permissive' mode.

element.name: show-status
element.description: Should the HTTP response code be shown. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: url
element.description: The HTTP/S url to call.

element.name: wallet
element.description: The name of a secure wallet that can supply 'connection', 'username' or 'password' properties. Parameters supplied by the wallet will be overriden any directly supplied settings

attribute.name: token
attribute.description: A sign-on token to use for the wallet if not logged in.

service.name: rest.patch
service.description: Executes a RESTful PATCH call to an external system. Note that PATCH is implemented as a POST request with an X-HTTP-Method-Override header configured for PATCH.

element.name: authentication
element.description: If authentication is required these credentials will be applied using the authentication mechanism selected.

element.name: password
element.description: The password.

element.name: realm
element.description: The authentication realm. Commonly employed with NTLM authentication.

element.name: type
element.description: The authentication mechanism to employ.

element.name: username
element.description: The username.

element.name: filename
element.description: An optional filename to use when sending data. This will override any filename derived from an asset if one is provided.

element.name: header
element.description: An argument to add to the HTTP(S) header

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The argument name.

element.name: id
element.description: The id of an asset to send.

element.name: on-error-action
element.description: Action on return of a non-success status code: "status" returns the status code and the content of the error stream; "exception" causes an exception to be thrown. (Defaults to "exception".)

element.name: payload
element.description: The payload of the call.

element.name: payload-value
element.description: A string representing the payload of the call when a send format of 'raw' is selected.

element.name: response
element.description: The format the payload returned by the host. If 'raw' then the response will be returned without conversion within an xml wrapper. Defaults to 'xml'.

attribute.name: json-array-element
attribute.description: An name for xml element resulting from a JSON array formatted response when converting to XML. Defaults to 'object'

attribute.name: json-response-element
attribute.description: An name for the root xml element for the JSON response when converting to XML. Defaults to 'response'

element.name: send
element.description: The format of the message being sent. If 'xml' then the root XML element within payload will be transmitted as XML via POST. If 'json' then the payload will be converted into Json. If 'form' then the payload sub-elements and file data (from input or asset id supplied) will be converted into a 'multipart/form-data' parts and submitted. If 'xform' is selected then the payload sub-elements will converted into url encoded strings and submitted as an 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' encoded POST, not this format does not currently support transmission of binary files. Defaults to 'xml'.

element.name: server-certificates
element.description: When an HTTPS (SSL) URL is used, should the client present server installed certificates to the destination host. Defaults to 'false' which accepts all certificates presented from the remote host without requiring a corresponding certificate to be installed on the local server. This is often called 'insecure' or 'permissive' mode.

element.name: show-status
element.description: Should the HTTP response code be shown. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: url
element.description: The HTTP/S url to call.

element.name: wallet
element.description: The name of a secure wallet that can supply 'connection', 'username' or 'password' properties. Parameters supplied by the wallet will be overriden any directly supplied settings

attribute.name: token
attribute.description: A sign-on token to use for the wallet if not logged in.

element.description: A string representing the payload of the call when a send format of 'raw' is selected.

element.name: response
element.description: The format the payload returned by the host. If 'raw' then the response will be returned without conversion within an xml wrapper. Defaults to 'xml'.

attribute.name: json-array-element
attribute.description: An name for xml element resulting from a JSON array formatted response when converting to XML. Defaults to 'object'

attribute.name: json-response-element
attribute.description: An name for the root xml element for the JSON response when converting to XML. Defaults to 'response'

element.name: send
element.description: The format of the message being sent. If 'xml' then the root XML element within payload will be transmitted as XML via POST. If 'json' then the payload will be converted into Json. If 'form' then the payload sub-elements and file data (from input or asset id supplied) will be converted into a 'multipart/form-data' parts and submitted. If 'xform' is selected then the payload sub-elements will converted into url encoded strings and submitted as an 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' encoded POST, not this format does not currently support transmission of binary files. Defaults to 'xml'.

element.name: server-certificates
element.description: When an HTTPS (SSL) URL is used, should the client present server installed certificates to the destination host. Defaults to 'false' which accepts all certificates presented from the remote host without requiring a corresponding certificate to be installed on the local server. This is often called 'insecure' or 'permissive' mode.

element.name: show-status
element.description: Should the HTTP response code be shown. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: url
element.description: The HTTP/S url to call.

element.name: wallet
element.description: The name of a secure wallet that can supply 'connection', 'username' or 'password' properties. Parameters supplied by the wallet will be overriden any directly supplied settings

attribute.name: token
attribute.description: A sign-on token to use for the wallet if not logged in.

service.name: s3.client.bucket.describe
service.description: Describes the buckets available for the configured host.

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

service.name: s3.client.folder.create
service.description: Creates a folder within the specified S3 host.

element.name: folder
element.description: The full path to the folder to be created. All intermediate folders will also be created if they do not already exist.

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: meta
element.description: A metadata value to apply to the folder.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the metadata field. This nmetadata key name will be appended to 'x-amz-meta-' when submitting the object to AWS. Only alpha-numberic lowercase characters and hyphens are accepted.

service.name: s3.client.folder.destroy
service.description: Destroys a folder within the specified S3 host.

element.name: destroy-content
element.description: Should the folder be destroyed even if it contains objects. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: folder
element.description: The full path to the folder to be destroyed. All contained objects will be deleted. Any empty parent folders will also be removed.

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

service.name: s3.client.host.describe
service.description: Describes the configured S3 hosts.

element.name: check-bucket-exists
element.description: If true, then check the bucket exists. Defaults to false.

element.name: host
element.description: The host name used by the client.

service.name: s3.client.host.exists
service.description: Tests if the supplied S3 host name has been configured

element.name: host
element.description: The logical name used by the client for the host part of an S3 URI; e.g. s3://<host>/folder/object.ext

service.name: s3.client.host.list
service.description: Lists the configured S3 hosts.

service.name: s3.client.host.statistics.describe
service.description: Describes the execution statistics for one or more S3 hosts. Will display nothing if there have been no executions for the given host.

element.name: host
element.description: The host name used by the client.

element.name: show-last
element.description: If set, then show the last N execution operations. Defaults to zero.

element.name: show-ops
element.description: If true, then show stastics for individual S3 operations. Defaults to false.

service.name: s3.client.object.copy
service.description: Copies an S3 object from a source bucket to a path in a destination bucket with the ability to set the storage classe. The destination bucket may be the same as the source bucket. The destination path may be the same as the source path.

element.name: destination-host
element.description: The name of the S3 client host configuration for the destination bucket. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service. If not provided, the source s3 client host is used.

element.name: destination-path
element.description: The full path to the new object in the destination host bucket. If not provided, the source path is used.

element.name: host
element.description: The name of the S3 client host configuration for the source bucket. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: path
element.description: The full path to the source object to copy

element.name: storage-class
element.description: The storage closs of the destination. If not supplied, defaults to 'STANDARD'

service.name: s3.client.object.count
service.description: Counts all objects from the specified S3 host.

element.name: depth
element.description: If specified, then count objects to the specified depth. Defaults to 0.

element.name: folder
element.description: The optional path to a folder to start at. Defaults to the root folder '/'

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: include-folders
element.description: If specified, then include sub-folders in the count. Defaults to false.

service.name: s3.client.object.describe
service.description: Describes a specific objects from the specified S3 host.

element.name: folder

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the S3 object to return. If not supplied the full 'path' to the object must be supplied

element.name: path
element.description: An option full path to the object. If supplied 'folder' and 'name' will be ignore. If not supplied a 'name' and optional 'folder' must be supplied

element.name: folder
element.description: The full path to the folder containing the object to be destroyed. Defaults to the root folder '/'

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the S3 object to destroy

element.name: path
element.description: An option full path to the object. If supplied 'folder' and 'name' will be ignore. If not supplied a 'name' and optional 'folder' must be supplied

element.name: host

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the S3 object to return. If not supplied the full 'path' to the object must be supplied

element.name: path
element.description: An option full path to the object. If supplied 'folder' and 'name' will be ignore. If not supplied a 'name' and optional 'folder' must be supplied

element.description: An optional folder path containing the object. Defaults to the root folder '/'

element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the S3 object to return

element.name: path
element.description: An option full path to the object. If supplied 'folder' and 'name' will be ignore. If not supplied a 'name' and optional 'folder' must be supplied

element.name: url

service.name: s3.client.object.list
service.description: Lists all objects from the specified S3 host.

element.description: An optional path to the folder to list. Defaults to the rppt folder '/'

element.name: host

element.name: idx
element.description: The cursor position to retrieve when retrieving objects. Defaults to 1.

element.name: include-etag
element.description: Should the object etag be displayed. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-files
element.description: Should files be returned un the output. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-folders
element.description: Should folders be returned un the output. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: include-storage-class
element.description: Should the object storage-class be displayed. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: max-object-size
element.description: An optional maximum object size filter. If supplied only objects where the size less than or equal to this number will be returned.

element.name: min-object-size
element.description: An optional minimum object size filter. If supplied only objects where the size greater that or equal to this number will be returned.

element.name: name-contains
element.description: An optional string to filter on. If supplied only objects where the name contains the string will be returned.

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: An optional regular expression to filter on. If supplied only objects where the name matches the supplied expression will be returned.

element.name: size
element.description: Indicates the maximum number of objects to list at a time. Defaults to 100.

service.name: s3.client.object.put

element.name: folder
element.description: An optional path to the folder to create the object within. Defaults to the root folder '/'

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: meta
element.description: A metadata value to apply to the object.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the metadata field. This nmetadata key name will be appended to 'x-amz-meta-' when submitting the object to AWS. Only alpha-numberic lowercase characters and hyphens are accepted.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the S3 object to create

element.name: path
element.description: An option full path to the object. If supplied 'folder' and 'name' will be ignore. If not supplied a 'name' and optional 'folder' must be supplied

element.name: url
element.description: The url to the content to upload.

service.name: s3.client.object.statistics
service.description: Return statistics for all objects from the specified S3 host and folder.

element.name: folder
element.description: An optional path to the folder to list. Defaults to the rppt folder '/'

element.name: host
element.description: Name of the S3 client host that will be used. The client host definition must exist and is defined using s3.client.host.set service.

element.name: expires
element.description: The number of seconds that the generated URL will be valid for. The duration can be between 1 second and 1 week; if not specified 60 seconds will be used.

element.name: url
element.description: The arcitecta S3 url to generate a pre-signed HTTP(S) URL from.

service.name: s3.service.describe

element.name: name
element.description: The service name.

service.name: schedule.event.count
service.description: Returns the number of events in some time range, or the total number of scheduled events.

element.name: creator-id
element.description: The unique identity for the creator of the event. This is the actor id.

element.name: from
element.description: Count events from this date (inclusive). If not specified, then no lower bound.

element.name: state
element.description: The state of if the event. Defaults to 'any'.

element.name: to
element.description: Count events to this date (exclusive). If not specified, then no upper bound.

service.name: schedule.event.create
service.description: Creates an event to occur at a specified time

element.name: args
element.description: Event type arguments.

element.name: at
element.description: The date and time the event should occur

element.name: max-nb-retries
element.description: The maximum number of addition attempts to dispatch the event if the first attempt fails. Defaults to 0.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.description: The period (in seconds) between subsequent retries.

element.name: name
element.description: An operational name/label for the event. Might name the purpose.

element.name: retain-for
element.description: Number of milliseconds for which event must be retained once dispatched/executed.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of event

service.name: schedule.event.describe
service.description: Returns events in some time range.

element.name: creator-id
element.description: The unique identity for the creator of the event. This is the actor id.

element.name: from
element.description: Count events from this date (inclusive). If not specified, then no lower bound.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an event - if specified, then 'at' must also be specified.

attribute.name: at
attribute.description: The UTC time of an event.

element.name: idx
element.description: Cursor position. Defaults to 1.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number to return. Defaults to 100.

element.name: state
element.description: The state of if the event. Defaults to 'any'.

element.name: to
element.description: Count events to this date (exclusive). If not specified, then no upper bound.

service.name: schedule.event.destroy
service.description: Cancel and remove an event from executing.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of an event - if specified, then 'at' must also be specified.

attribute.name: at
attribute.description: The UTC time of an event.

service.name: schedule.event.dispatch.now
service.description: Immediately dispatch and execute the given event. If successful, it will be removed from future execution.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identity of the event.

attribute.name: at
attribute.description: The UTC time of an event.

service.name: schedule.event.failed.destroy
service.description: Cancel and remove all failed events.

element.name: creator-id
element.description: The unique identity for the creator of the event. This is the actor id.

element.name: from
element.description: Count events from this date (inclusive). If not specified, then no lower bound.

element.name: to
element.description: Count events to this date (exclusive). If not specified, then no upper bound.

service.name: schedule.event.failed.dispatch.now
service.description: Try dispatching all failed events immediately. Optionally, destroy all those that do not execute.

element.name: creator-id
element.description: The unique identity for the creator of the event. This is the actor id.

element.name: destroy-on-fail
element.description: If true, then any failed events will be destroyed. Defaults to false.

element.name: from
element.description: Count events from this date (inclusive). If not specified, then no lower bound.

element.name: stop-on-fail
element.description: If true, then stop immediately on failure (unless destroy on fail is set). Defaults to true.

element.name: to
element.description: Count events to this date (exclusive). If not specified, then no upper bound.

service.name: schedule.event.reschedule
service.description: Re-schedules an event to occur at another time.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identity of the event.

attribute.name: at
attribute.description: The UTC time of an event.

element.name: to
element.description: The date and time the event should now occur.

service.description: Returns information on the types, and argument definintions, for the types of events that can be scheduled to occur at a specific time.

element.name: type
element.description: An event type. If not supplied, then all described.

service.name: schedule.event.type.list
service.description: List the types of events that can be scheduled to execute at some time.

service.name: schedule.job.create
service.description: Schedules a job for one-off or periodic execution. The job may be either a script (in a specified asset), or a service. Note: to execute at the precise end of a month, then set the 'dom' to 1 -- the job will run just after midnight on the last day of the month.

element.name: app
element.description: An optional application for the job (for application based filtering).

element.name: arg
element.description: A input argument/variable to pass into the script.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the variable.

element.name: id
element.description: The script to execute.

element.name: name
element.description: An optional unique name of the job.

element.name: not-after
element.description: The point in time that the job should not be started. If it is already running at this time however, it will continue to completion.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: service
element.description: A service to execute.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this job will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: view
element.description: The asset view in which this job should execute. If not specified, set to the current view for this user.

element.name: when
element.description: The date/time when the job should be run.

element.name: date
element.description: An absolute date for execution. If the date is specified, then the job executes at that date and time. If there are no other time settings, then this is a one-off job, otherwise it will execute repeatedly after this date.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: every
element.description: Utility to conveniently populate minute or hour values. If the unit is 'minute' then the value must be a divisor of 60. If the unit is 'hour' then the value must be a divisor of 24.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of time.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: to
element.description: An absolute date after which no execute takes place.

attribute.description: The name of the argument

element.name: enclose-output-in-xml
element.description: If true, then output is enclosed in XML for each line. Defaults to false.

element.description: The format of the output. If XML, the output is parsed to XML which can processed downstream. Otherwise the output of the script is returned as string. The default is string.

service.name: secure.identity.token.actor.get

element.name: token
element.description: The Identity token.

service.name: secure.identity.token.all.destroy
service.description: Destroys all existing identity tokens.

element.name: all-users
element.description: If true, then destroys tokens for all users. Can only be executed by people with system administrator role. Defaults to false.

element.name: created-after
element.description: If specified, only show tokens created after this time.

element.name: created-before
element.description: If specified, only show tokens created before this time.

element.name: from
element.description: A time, before which the token is not valid. If not supplied token is valid immediately.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, then describe a token matching this id.

element.name: identity
element.description: Specifies the user that is recorded in operations executed by this token. Defaults to the caller. Must have system administration rights to create for another user. If created for another user, then the token will not have access to the secure wallet.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user. If not specified, all users described.

element.name: lifetime
element.description: The lifetime of the token. If not specified, defaults to 'all'.

element.name: tag
element.description: An arbitrary tag supplied when the token was created.

element.name: to
element.description: A time, after which the token is no longer valid. If not supplied token will not expire.

element.description: Does this token allow service parameter substitution?

element.name: app
element.description: If specified, then only this application can use the token.

element.name: conditional-service
element.description: A specific service to execute, if the required condition is selected. If specified, then the token executes this service only. Add service arguments as sub-elements. If a service is specified, then permission to this service is automatically granted.

element.name: label
element.description: The label to use when describing the action to a user

element.name: value
element.description: A string that is used to uniquely identify this condition.

element.name: then
element.description: description

element.name: description
element.description: Detailed information to show when describing the action to a user.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service.

element.name: service
element.description: A specific service to execute. If specified, then the token executes this service only. Add service arguments as sub-elements. If a service is specified, then permission to this service is automatically granted.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service.

element.name: create-auth-key
element.description: Create another key that can be used for authentication. The precise method depends on the application. Defaults to false

attribute.name: max-key-length
attribute.description: The maximum length of the token. Defaults to 128.

attribute.name: min-key-length
attribute.description: The minimum length of the token. Smaller is less secure. Defaults to 96.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the token.

element.name: destroy-on-service-call
element.description: One or more services that, if called, will automatically destroy the token. To destroy after any initial service call supply a wildcard '*' character.

element.name: from
element.description: A time, before which the token is not valid. If not supplied token is valid immediately.

element.name: grant-caller-transient-roles
element.description: Grant the caller's transient roles, such as roles acquired through LDAP and the domain role. Defaults to false.

element.name: identity
element.description: Specifies the user that will be recorded in operations executed by this token. Defaults to the caller. Must have system administration rights to create for another user. If created for another user, then the token will not have access to the secure wallet.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: grant-user-roles
element.description: If true, then lookup and grant roles held by that user. Defaults to false.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user. If not specified, all users described.

element.name: max-token-length
element.description: The maximum length of the token. Defaults to 128.

element.name: min-token-length
element.description: The minimum length of the token. Smaller is less secure. Defaults to 96.

element.name: perm
element.description: Permission to grant.

element.name: access
element.description: Access type.

element.name: resource
element.description: Pattern for resource.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Resource type.

element.name: persistent
element.description: If true (the default), then the identity will remain after server restart. If false, then identity will be gone after a server restart.

element.name: restrict
element.description: Access restrictions, if any.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Arbitrary description for the purpose of the restriction.

element.name: network
element.description: Network access restrictions, if any.

element.name: address
element.description: IP network address (IPv4 or IPv6) to restrict user access.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Arbitrary description for this address.

attribute.name: mask
attribute.description: The netmask for the corresponding network address. Defaults to 255.255.255.255

element.name: encrypted
element.description: Indicates whether encrypted only network transports will be accepted. Defaults to false.

element.name: role
element.description: Role (name) to grant.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Role type.

element.name: service
element.description: A specific service to execute. If specified, then the token executes this service only. Add service arguments as sub-elements. If a service is specified, then permission to this service is automatically granted.

attribute.name: destroy
attribute.description: If true, the token is automatically destroyed on execution. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service.

element.name: tag
element.description: An arbitrary tag for later filtering.

element.name: to
element.description: A time, after which the token is no longer valid. If not supplied token will not expire.

element.name: use-count
element.description: The number of times the token may be used.

element.name: wallet
element.description: If true, then the identity will have access the the users wallet. Defaults to false.

service.name: secure.identity.token.describe
service.description: Describe identity tokens.

element.name: all-users
element.description: If true, then describes tokens for all users. Can only be executed by people with system administrator role. Defaults to false.

element.name: created-after
element.description: If specified, only show tokens created after this time.

element.name: created-before
element.description: If specified, only show tokens created before this time.

element.name: from
element.description: A time, before which the token is not valid. If not supplied token is valid immediately.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, then describe a token matching this id.

element.name: identity
element.description: Specifies the user that is recorded in operations executed by this token. Defaults to the caller. Must have system administration rights to create for another user. If created for another user, then the token will not have access to the secure wallet.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user. If not specified, all users described.

element.name: idx
element.description: If specified, then show tokens from this index. Defaults to 1.

element.name: lifetime
element.description: The lifetime of the token. If not specified, defaults to 'all'.

element.name: permissions
element.description: If set to true, then show permissions for that token. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: The depth of permissions to show. Defaults to 1.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of tokens to describe. Defaults to 100.

element.name: tag
element.description: An arbitrary tag supplied when the token was created.

element.name: to
element.description: A time, after which the token is no longer valid. If not supplied token will not expire.

service.name: secure.identity.token.destroy
service.description: Destroys an identity token that represents the caller for a specific set of uses.

element.name: id
element.description: The public identity for a token.

attribute.name: lifetime
attribute.description: The type of identifier.

element.name: token
element.description: Identity token that was created with secure.identity.token.create. If not supplied, then the public 'id' must be specified. Only an administrator can destroy tokens they did not create.

service.name: secure.shell.copy.from
service.description: Copy files or directories to or from a remote host

element.name: host
element.description: The host where the command will be executed

attribute.name: md5
attribute.description: The host key for the remote host. If not specified the host key is not validated.

element.name: input-file-name
element.description: The input file or directory name on the remote host.

element.name: kerberos
element.description: Provide kerberos configuration and execute in a kerberos context.

element.name: password
element.description: The password for this principal.

element.name: password-key
element.description: The secure wallet key for the entry that contains the password.

element.name: principal
element.description: The Kerberos principal to authenticate as.

element.name: port
element.description: The port to connect to (defaults to 22)

element.name: private-key
element.description: Specify private key credentials

element.name: key
element.description: The SSH private key.

element.name: key-key
element.description: The secure wallet key for the entry that contains the SSH private key.

element.name: name
element.description: The user name

element.name: passphrase
element.description: The passphrase for this private key.

element.name: passphrase-key
element.description: The secure wallet key for the entry that contains the passphrase.

element.name: suppress-output
element.description: Suppress the file list (useful when transferring lasrge directories in aterm, defaults to false).

element.name: timeout
element.description: Timeout in seconds after which the session is terminated (defaults to no timeout)

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to receive the content for the remote file or directory. If the URL is specified, then no other output may be specified. The given URL must be accessible by the server. The only supported output URLs are file paths.

element.name: use-kerberos-context
element.description: Use the Kerberos context associated with this session (default is false).

element.name: use-wallet-entry
element.description: If true, look for a wallet entry with a key of host-credentials:ssh://host and an XML value specifying "user" and either "password" or "private-key" (default is false).

element.name: user
element.description: user credentials

element.name: name
element.description: The user name

element.name: password
element.description: The password for this principal.

element.name: password-key
element.description: The secure wallet key for the entry that contains the password.

element.name: private-key

element.description: Timeout in seconds after which the session is terminated (defaults to no timeout)

element.name: url
element.description: A URL to the content to be copied. The URL must be accessible by the server. The URL may refer a single file or a filesystem directory.

element.name: use-kerberos-context
