service.name: secure.shell.keygen
service.description: Generate public/private key pair for use with secure shell (or SSH) services.

element.name: comment
element.description: An optional comment.

element.name: passphrase
element.description: An optional passphrase.

element.name: size
element.description: Key size (defaults to

element.name: type
element.description: Encryption to use (defaults to rsa).

service.name: secure.wallet.all.remove
service.description: Removes all entries from the user's wallet.

service.name: secure.wallet.can.be.used
service.description: Indicates whether the wallet is accessible and can be used. It will not be accessible if the passwords are mismatched and the wallet needs to be recreated or have the password updated.

service.name: secure.wallet.contains
service.description: Indicates whether or not the specified key has a value in the wallet.

element.name: key
element.description: A unique key for the entry.

service.name: secure.wallet.destroy
service.description: Completely destroy the user wallet. User will need to log in again to re-create.

service.name: secure.wallet.entry.list
service.description: Returns the list of entries in the secure wallet for the given user.

service.name: secure.wallet.get
service.description: Retrieves the value of a key in the wallet as a stream, or by XML. The method of retrieval should match the method used for 'secure.wallet.set' - if not, a conversion will be attempted.

element.name: key
element.description: A unique key for the entry.

service.name: secure.wallet.password.set
service.description: Recrypts the password with old/new password. The wallet encryption is permuted by the user's login password. The old password is the previous password used when last successfully logged in. This is only required when passwords are stored external to the server, or if someone else changes the user's password. If passwords are changed using services like authentication.user.self.password.set, then user wallet will be automatically recrypted. If either password is unknown, the wallet will need to be destroyed and recreated by logging in again.

element.name: old-password
element.description: User's previous login password.

element.name: password
element.description: User's current logon password.

service.name: secure.wallet.recreate
service.description: Destroys the existing wallet and creates a new one.

element.name: password
element.description: User's current logon password.

service.name: secure.wallet.remove
service.description: Removes an entry from the user's wallet.

element.name: key
element.description: A unique key for the entry.

service.name: secure.wallet.set
service.description: Stores a key value pair in the wallet. The value may be supplied as an arbitrary XML document using the 'value' argument, or as an input stream.

element.name: key
element.description: A unique key for the entry.

element.name: usage
element.description: If a usage is specified, then can only be used from that context.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Type of security context. If system, then must be one of the known system contexts (see service secure.wallet.system.context.list for a list of the available system contexts).

element.name: value
element.description: The value. If not specified, then value should be supplied via input

element.name: xvalue
element.description: The value as an XML document If not specified, then value should be supplied via input

service.name: secure.wallet.system.can.be.used
service.description: Indicates whether the wallet is accessible and can be used. It will not be accessible if the passwords are mismatched and the wallet needs to be recreated or have the password updated.

service.name: secure.wallet.system.context.list
service.description: Returns a list of the available system security contexts for wallet entries.

service.name: server.background.activity.describe
service.description: Describes background activities.

element.name: idx
element.description: The ordinal to describe. Defaults to one.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number to return. Ignored if 'id' specified. Defaults to 100.

service.name: server.background.activity.error.describe
service.description: Returns information on errors with background activity execution. Errors are returned from youngest to oldest.

element.name: idx
element.description: The starting position. Defaults to 1.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of errors to show. Defaults to 10. The maximum number recorded is 100

service.name: server.background.activity.executor.describe
service.description: Returns information on the execution etc. of background activities.

element.name: show-activities
element.description: If true, show each activity. Defaults to false

service.name: server.certificate.identity.describe
service.description: Returns information on the installed X.509 digital certificates used for identifying the server.

element.name: id
element.description: Id of the identity to describe.

service.name: server.certificate.identity.export
service.description: Exports a public X.509 digital certificate to an output. The certificate will be converted to DER format.

element.name: format
element.description: The encoding for the data.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the identity to export.

service.name: server.certificate.identity.get
service.description: Returns a public X.509 digital certificate. The certificate will be converted to base 64 encoded DER format.

element.name: id
element.description: The unique identifier for the identity to export.

service.name: server.certificate.identity.list
service.description: Returns the known X.509 digital certificates used for identifying the server.

service.name: server.certificate.trust.describe
service.description: Returns information on the installed X.509 digital certificates used to establish trust with some other party.

element.name: id
element.description: Id of the identity to describe.

service.name: server.certificate.trust.list
service.description: Lists the X.509 digital certificates used to establish trust with some other party.

service.name: server.clock.time
service.description: Returns the current time of the server's logical clock. The logical clock may be updated on specific events.

service.name: server.database.backup.scheduled.create
service.description: Schedules a database backup job.

element.name: action
element.description: Specifies the action to occur when a transaction attempts to modify the database while restoring. If 'abort' then the transaction will be terminated with the optional message.

element.name: compress
element.description: Should the output be compressed using DEFLATE (RFC 1951) compression. Defaults to compressed.

attribute.name: level
attribute.description: The compression level. Defaults to 6.

element.name: database
element.description: If specified, then backup the given named replica database. If not specified, then backup the main database.

element.name: email
element.description: An email addresses to send notification to. Notification is sent on error or succesful completion of backup.

element.name: logging
element.description: Does the backup generate basic log events. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: message
element.description: If the action is 'abort' then this message will be included in the generated exception. Ignored if action is 'wait'. Defaults to 'The database is being backed up.' or 'The database is being backed up and restored.'

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the schedule job. If not supplied defaults to 'database-backup'

element.name: notification-body
element.description: An optional text value to prepend or append to the Notification message body

attribute.name: insert
attribute.description: Where the value is inserted.

element.name: notification-subject
element.description: An optional text value to prepend or append to the Notification message subject

attribute.name: insert
attribute.description: Where the value is inserted.

element.name: retain
element.description: How many backup files do we maintain in the backup folder. If specified then that number of recent files will be maintained. If 0 is specified only the most recent backup is retained. Defaults to infinite.

element.name: schema
element.description: The name of a schema to backup. If not specified, then all schemas are backed up. To backup all schemas, specify '*'.

element.name: skip-errors
element.description: If set to true, the dump will skip over objects with errors and continue. This option should be used with extreme care because missing objects could render the database inoperable. However, there are cases where partial dumping can be used to recover faults. Defaults to 'false'

element.name: url
element.description: A url of the directory to output the backup file to - must be accessible to the server

element.name: user
element.description: The user under which this job will be run. If not specified, then will run using the calling user. Must have ADMINISTER permission on the user domain to run as another user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: name
element.description: The authentication user name.

element.name: when
element.description: The date/time when the job should be run.

element.name: date
element.description: An absolute date for execution. If the date is specified, then the job executes at that date and time. If there are no other time settings, then this is a one-off job, otherwise it will execute repeatedly after this date.

element.name: dom
element.description: Day of the month. If set, overrides day of the week. If a month does not have this number of days, then will move to the next month/year. For example, set to month=2 and dom=29 to execute every leap year day in February.

element.name: dow
element.description: Day of the week. Sunday being 1.

element.name: every
element.description: Utility to conveniently populate minute or hour values. If the unit is 'minute' then the value must be a divisor of 60. If the unit is 'hour' then the value must be a divisor of 24.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of time.

element.name: hour
element.description: The hour of the day.

element.name: minute
element.description: The minute of the hour.

element.name: month
element.description: Month of the year.

element.name: to
element.description: An absolute date after which no execute takes place.

service.name: server.database.backup.scheduled.exists
service.description: Indicates whether a named job exists or not and if it is a backup job. A scheduled job may exist with that name, but not be a database backup job.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the schedule job. If not supplied defaults to 'database-backup'

service.name: server.database.backup.scheduled.list
service.description: Returns a list of the scheduled database backup job names.

service.name: server.database.describe
service.description: Returns information about the database engine being used.

service.name: server.date
service.description: Returns current date on the system.

service.name: server.dns.cache.describe
service.description: Returns information about the current internal DNS cache.

element.name: check
element.description: Check to see whether there is a change in the address resolution. Defaults to false.

service.name: server.dns.lookup
service.description: Performs a DNS lookup.

element.name: dns-server
element.description: IP address or addresses of DNS servers that will be used to do a lookup against. If more than one is specified we will try one after another until a successful reply or until all DNS servers are tried. If not specified, we will use whatever DNS servers are currently used by the host system.

element.name: search-domain
element.description: Search domain(s) that will be used as a suffix to short name hostname. If more than one is specified we will try one after another until a successful reply or until all search domains are tried.

element.name: show-additional-records
element.description: If 'true' it will show additional records that may be returned with the DNS lookup result. These additional records are related to the query, but are not strictly answers to it. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: show-authoritative-nameservers
element.description: If 'true' it will show authoritative nameserver records that may be returned with the DNS lookup result. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: show-query
element.description: If 'true' it will describe the query that was sent to the DNS server. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: target
element.description: Lookup target, for example IP address if doing a PTR lookup

element.name: type
element.description: DNS record type that are currently supported

service.name: server.federation.reachable.describe
service.description: Returns all servers that are currently reachable in the federation.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag to filter by

service.name: server.file.system.describe
service.description: Returns information on the registered file systems.

element.name: path
element.description: A path to match specific file systems.

service.name: server.folder.describe
service.description: Describes server accessible folders.

element.name: count
element.description: Should we count the number and size of the files within the folder. Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: deep
attribute.description: Should the search for files operated on all files within the directory and its sub-directories. Defaults to 'true'

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a folder to describe.

element.name: path
element.description: An optional path within the server folder.

service.name: server.folder.directory.list
service.description: Lists the path and sub-directories in a server folder.

element.name: idx
element.description: The index offset to start listing sub-directories, defaults to '1'.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the server accessible folder. If no folder is provided the accessible root folders are returned.

element.name: path
element.description: The path within the server folder. Defaults to '/' if not provided.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of sub-directories to return starting at offset 'idx'. Defaults to '100'

service.name: server.folder.enabled
service.description: Returns the enabled state of the named server folder.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the server accessible folder.

service.name: server.folder.exists
service.description: Checks for the existance of a previously configured server folder by name and path or by folder url. Only tests for the existence of server folders you have permissions to access. It is possible that the folder may exist but you may not have permissions to list or describe the folder.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the server accessible folder.

element.name: path
element.description: The relative path within the named folder. Requires 'name' to be supplied.

element.name: url
element.description: The server accessible directory URL.

service.name: server.folder.file.list
service.description: Lists the path and files in a server folder.

element.name: contains
element.description: An optional string to filter on. If supplied only files where the filename contains the exact string will be returned.

element.name: idx
element.description: The index offset to start listing sub-directories, defaults to '1'.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the server accessible folder.

element.name: path
element.description: The path within the server folder.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximum number of sub-directories to return starting at offset 'idx'. Defaults to '100'

element.name: sort
element.description: The file property used to sort any files returned. Defaults to 'name'

attribute.name: order
attribute.description: The sort order for any files returned. Defaults to 'desc'

service.name: server.folder.list
service.description: Lists server accessible folders.

service.name: server.folder.resolve.url
service.description: Returns an absolute file path for a valid and accessible server folder.

element.name: access
element.description: The type of access required. If not supplied defaults to 'write'.

element.name: target
element.description: The target of the URL. If 'folder' then the full path has to be an existing accesible server folder. If 'file' and the target does not exist then the parent directory within the folder must exist to be considered valid. If not supplied defaults to 'folder'.

element.name: url
element.description: A url to a server folder path.

service.name: server.folder.roots
service.description: Returns root server accessible folders.

service.name: server.gc.statistics
service.description: Returns information on garbage collector events.

element.name: nb-events
element.description: The number of events (from most recent to oldest) to display.

element.name: show-changed-memory-only
element.description: If true, then only show memory pools (when showing events) where there was a change after garbage collection. Defaults to true.

service.name: server.gc.times
service.description: Returns information on the recent times at which the garbage collector has run. The times are returned oldest to yougest.

element.name: after
element.description: Only include events after this time inclusive.

element.name: before
element.description: Only include events before this time exclusive.

service.name: server.identity
service.description: Returns the universally unique identifier (UUID) for the server, name and other details if available.

element.name: uuid
element.description: The unique identifier of a server. If unspecified, then the identity of the local server returned.

service.name: server.image.reader.type.list
service.description: Returns the MIME types for which the server supports image readers.

service.name: server.image.writer.type.list
service.description: Returns the MIME types for which the server supports image readers.

service.name: server.io.chunking.describe
service.description: Describes the state of the global IO chunk writing queue.

service.name: server.io.job.count
service.description: Return the number of jobs that belong to the owner.

service.name: server.io.job.create
service.description: Creates an asynchronous or clustered I/O job for writing. A job ticket will be returned which can then be used for subsequent writing of chunks to the job.

element.name: cache-type
element.description: Sets the cache type preference for the file being uploaded. Defaults to the implementation in the data store.

element.name: cluster
element.description: If true, then the client supports clustered I/O. Defaults to false. If clustered, then I/O may be redirected.

attribute.name: create-if-self
attribute.description: If true, then create a job if this node is chosen from the cluster, otherwise do not create a job. Default is false (do not create a job), for this specific node.

element.name: ext
element.description: The file type extension of the file, if known - this will be used to type the data in the server, if 'type' is not specified.

element.name: size
element.description: The size, if known, of the data to be sent.

element.name: store
element.description: The destination data store if known.

element.name: timeout
element.description: The maximum time (in seconds) for inactivity before the job will be automatically removed. Defaults to 1800 for non-clustered, and 300 (unless overridden by server property) for clustered jobs

element.name: type
element.description: The MIME type of the data if known.

service.name: server.io.job.describe
service.description: Describes the status of the jobs that belong to the caller (owner).

element.name: ticket
element.description: The ticket for the I/O job that was created by this user. If not specified, then all jobs that belong to the user described.

service.name: server.io.job.discard
service.description: Discard a job without completing.

element.name: ticket
element.description: The ticket for the I/O job that was created by this user.

service.name: server.io.write
service.description: Writes data to a specific offset in the data object given by the ticket. Writing may occur in any order and in parallel, allowing for differences in network transmission latency.

element.name: complete
element.description: If true, then this is the complete set of data. The job will be marked as finished writing. Defaults to false.

element.name: ext
element.description: The file type extension of the file, if known - this will be used to type the data in the server, if 'type' is not specified.

element.name: offset
element.description: The offset (in bytes) within the data that is being written. The length is defined by the attached data packet. If not specified, defaults to 0.

element.name: store
element.description: Used if creating a new ticket. Specifies the destination data store if known.

element.name: ticket
element.description: The ticket for the I/O job that was created by this user. If the ticket is not supplied, then one will be created.

element.name: type
element.description: Used if creating a new ticket. Specifies the MIME type of the data if known.

service.name: server.io.write.finish
service.description: Used to mark the end of writing, etc. Must be called when all writes completed. This means the consumer of the data may complete their operation. Can only be called by the owner of the job.

element.name: size
element.description: The amount of transmitted data.

element.name: ticket
element.description: The ticket for the I/O job that was created by this user.

service.name: server.locktable.describe
service.description: Details the outstanding locks in the global lock table.

service.name: server.locktable.dump
service.description: Send all lock tables to the server log.

service.name: server.log
service.description: Logs a message to the server log files.

element.name: app
element.description: The application.

element.name: event
element.description: The type of log event. Defaults to info.

element.name: filter
element.description: If set to ignore, then the entry will be added regardless of whether logging for the given type is enabled or not. Defaults to ignore.

element.name: msg
element.description: An arbitrary message.

service.name: server.module.list
service.description: Returns the list of extended server modules that have been installed.

service.name: server.peer.describe
service.description: Returns details about the configured peered servers.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then all peers described.

element.name: only-if-reachable
element.description: If true, then only describe servers that are reachable. Defaults to false.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag to filter by

service.name: server.peer.exists
service.description: Are there any peers, or has the named peer been registered?

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. The name must be unique. If not specified, indicates whether there are any peers at all.

service.name: server.peer.list
service.description: Returns a list of the known peered servers.

element.name: tag
element.description: A tag to filter by

service.name: server.peer.status
service.description: Indicates the connection status of each peer.

element.name: check-peer-is-reachable
element.description: If true, then force a reachability check now. The default is false.

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. If unspecified, then the status for all peers is returned.

element.name: tag
element.description: Filter by classification tag. If more than one tag is specified, then all tags must exist for a given peer.

service.name: server.peer.tag.list
service.description: Are there any peers, or has the named peer been registered?

element.name: name
element.description: A local name for the remote server. The name must be unique. If not specified, returns all known tags.

service.name: server.ping
service.description: Used to test the performance of the current connection.

service.name: server.property.get
service.description: Returns the value of the property.

element.name: help
element.description: If set to true, then returns help for each property. Defaults to false.

element.name: include-unset
element.description: If set to true, then returns properties that have not been explicity set. Defaults to false.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the property

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: Value to use if not set.

element.name: prefix
element.description: The property starts with the supplied prefix

service.name: server.property.help
service.description: Returns information on the available properties.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the property

service.name: server.recovery.archive.scheduled.exists
service.description: Indicates whether a named job exists or not and if it is a recovery archive job. A scheduled job may exist with that name, but not be a recovery archive job.

element.name: name
element.description: The unique name of the schedule job. If not supplied defaults to 'scheduled-recovery-archive'

service.name: server.recovery.archive.scheduled.list
service.description: Returns a list of the scheduled recovery archive job names.

service.name: server.remote.authentication.destroy
service.description: Sets authentication for the specified named server, or server with uuid.

element.name: as
element.description: A unique name for the credential.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the target server.

element.name: uuid
element.description: Unique identifier of the target server. Defaults to zero if 'name' not specified.

service.name: server.remote.authentication.exists
service.description: Indicates whether or not authentication exists for a given server and principal.

element.name: as
element.description: A unique name for the credential.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the target server.

element.name: uuid
element.description: Unique identifier of the target server. Defaults to zero if 'name' not specified.

service.name: server.remote.authentication.principal.list
service.description: Returns a list of principals / credentials that have been stored by the calling user.

service.name: server.remote.authentication.set
service.description: Sets authentication for the specified named server, or server with uuid.

element.name: as
element.description: A unique name for the credential.

element.name: as
element.description: The credentials to use. If not specified, uses default credentials for this server.

attribute.name: uuid
attribute.description: The unique identifier of the server for the credentials.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the target server.

element.name: token
element.description: A secure token for use with the destination server.

attribute.name: app
attribute.description: The application that generated the token, if any.

element.name: user
element.description: User credentials.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: password
element.description: The authentication password.

element.name: user
element.description: The authentication user.

element.name: uuid
element.description: Unique identifier of the target server. Defaults to zero if 'name' not specified.

service.name: server.remote.exists
service.description: Identifies whether a remote server exists or not.

element.name: name
element.description: A unique name for the server.

service.name: server.remote.service.execute
service.description: Execute an arbitrary service at one or more servers.

element.name: at
element.description: The name of a configured server.

attribute.name: as
attribute.description: The credentials to use.

element.name: concurrently
element.description: If true, execute the requests concurrently if there is more than one target server. Defaults to true

element.name: server
element.description: A target server.

element.name: address
element.description: A server.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: An arbitrary name for the address

element.name: allow-untrusted
element.description: Set to false if encryption is enabled, and the server need not be trusted. Defaults to true.

element.name: encrypt
element.description: Set to true if the specified port expects encrypted communications.

element.name: host
element.description: The FQDN or IP address of the destination server.

element.name: ip-version
element.description: IP version. Defaults to 'any'.

element.name: port
element.description: The port number.

element.name: protocol
element.description: The communication protocol. Defaults to 'http'.

element.name: as
element.description: The credentials to use. If not specified, uses default credentials for this server.

attribute.name: uuid
attribute.description: The unique identifier of the server for the credentials.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of a predefined server configuration.

element.name: token
element.description: A secure token for use with the destination server.

attribute.name: app
attribute.description: The application that generated the token, if any.

element.name: user
element.description: User credentials.

element.name: domain
element.description: The authentication domain.

element.name: password
element.description: The authentication password.

element.name: user
element.description: The authentication user.

element.name: service
element.description: The service to execute.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service.

service.name: server.run.time
service.description: Returns the number of times the server has been run.

service.name: server.status
service.description: Returns statistics on the system execution including CPUs, memory and the executing tasks.

element.name: nb-failures-to-show
element.description: The number of failures (if any) to show stack traces for. Defaults to 0.

element.name: show-memory-pools
element.description: Should detailed information be shown on each memory pool and pool garbage collectors. Defaults to false.

element.name: show-tasks
element.description: Should tasking information be shown. Defaults to false.

element.name: task
element.description: The level of detail for tasks. The default is 'summary'.

service.name: server.task.abort
service.description: Aborts (interrupts) a task that executes sub-tasks. The task will abort when the current sub-task completes. Must own the task, or have administration rights to terminate some other task.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a task to abort.

service.name: server.task.describe
service.description: Returns the list of tasks executing within the system.

element.name: all
element.description: Describe all tasks, or own tasks only. Defaults to false (own tasks).

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of a task to describe. If not supplied, describes all tasks.

element.name: idx
element.description: The start offset to retrieve.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of tasks to describe. Defaults to 100.

element.name: type
element.description: Only show tasks of the given type.

service.name: server.task.named.abort
service.description: Aborts callers named tasks that match the given name, or all users named task if name is not provided.

element.name: all-sessions
element.description: Indicates if it should include tasks from all user sessions. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to suspend

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the task. If not specified all named tasks will be included.

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: A Java regular expression to match the name.

element.name: name-prefix
element.description: A prefix for the name.

element.name: name-suffix
element.description: A suffix for the name.

service.name: server.task.named.begin
service.description: Begins a user named task which can be used to track progress of a task that launched it.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the task to begin

element.name: nb
element.description: Number of work units this task will have, e.g. importing 100 files would have this set to 100. Defaults to 0.

element.name: remove-after
element.description: Automtatically destroy after this time (in hours) once completed, or aborted, or when the session expires. Defaults to 0, meaning immediate destruction.

element.name: units-of-work
element.description: This is a named 'unit of work'. Multiple can be specified which allows tracking task progress using different indicators. For example, file transfers can be tracked on both file count and total bytes transferred.

attribute.name: nb
attribute.description: Total number of work units if known. Defaults to 0.

service.name: server.task.named.complete
service.description: Complete a number of task units belonging to a named user task.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task.

element.name: nb
element.description: Number of units completed. Defaults to 1.

element.name: units-of-work
element.description: This is a named 'unit of work'. Multiple can be specified which allows tracking task progress using different indicators. For example, file transfers can be tracked on both file count and total bytes transferred.

attribute.name: nb
attribute.description: Number of completed work units for this 'unit of work' indicator. Defaults to 1.

service.name: server.task.named.count
service.description: Counts user named tasks. If name argument is provided it will only count tasks that match the argument.

element.name: all-sessions
element.description: Indicates if it should include tasks from all user sessions. Defaults to false.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the task. If not specified all named tasks will be included.

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: A Java regular expression to match the name.

element.name: name-prefix
element.description: A prefix for the name.

element.name: name-suffix
element.description: A suffix for the name.

service.name: server.task.named.describe
service.description: Describes all user's named tasks. If all-sessions argument is set to true it will describe all named tasks, otherwise only tasks that belong to the current session.

element.name: all-sessions
element.description: Indicates if it should include tasks from all user sessions. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to describe

element.name: idx
element.description: The index of the first task to describe. If unspecified, then defaults to 1.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the task. If not specified all named tasks will be included.

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: A Java regular expression to match the name.

element.name: name-prefix
element.description: A prefix for the name.

element.name: name-suffix
element.description: A suffix for the name.

element.name: size
element.description: The maximim number to return. Defaults to 100.

service.name: server.task.named.end
service.description: Ends a user named task which can be used to track progress of a task that launched it.

element.name: all-sessions
element.description: Indicates if it should include tasks from all user sessions. Defaults to false.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to end

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the task. If not specified all named tasks will be included.

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: A Java regular expression to match the name.

element.name: name-prefix
element.description: A prefix for the name.

element.name: name-suffix
element.description: A suffix for the name.

element.name: nb
element.description: If non-zero, then then number of items that were completed. Ignored if 'id' has not been specified.

element.name: units-of-work
element.description: This is a named 'unit of work'. Multiple can be specified which allows tracking task progress using different indicators. For example, file transfers can be tracked on both file count and total bytes transferred.

attribute.name: nb
attribute.description: Number of completed work units for this 'unit of work' indicator. Defaults to 0.

service.name: server.task.named.progress.set
service.description: Explicitly sets the progress for the named task.

element.name: completed
element.description: Number of units completed.

element.name: details
element.description: Optional, and arbitrary task information.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task.

element.name: total
element.description: Total number of units if known.

element.name: units-of-work
element.description: This is a named 'unit of work'. Multiple can be specified which allows tracking task progress using different indicators. For example, file transfers can be tracked on both file count and total bytes transferred.

attribute.name: completed
attribute.description: Number of completed work units for this 'unit of work' indicator

attribute.name: total
attribute.description: Total number of units if known.

element.name: name

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: A Java regular expression to match the name.

element.name: name-prefix

element.name: name-suffix
element.description: A suffix for the name.

service.name: server.task.named.suspend

element.description: Indicates if it should include tasks from all user sessions. Defaults to false.

element.name: id

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the task. If not specified all named tasks will be included.

element.name: name-pattern
element.description: A Java regular expression to match the name.

element.name: name-prefix

element.name: name-suffix

service.name: server.task.named.wait.to.resume

service.name: server.task.statistics
service.description: Returns statistics on the tasks and garbage collection etc.

service.name: server.time.series.custom.sample.source.describe
service.description: Describes a named custom time series sample source.

element.name: type
element.description: The unique type for the source.

service.name: server.time.series.custom.sample.source.list
service.description: Lists the custom time series sample sources.

service.name: server.time.series.sampler.describe
service.description: Describes the time series samplers that have been created.

element.name: name
element.description: The name to describe. If not specified, all are described, unless there is a prefix filter.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, then limit to types starting with this prefix.

service.name: server.time.series.sampler.list
service.description: Returns the available time series types that can be configured.

service.name: server.time.series.sampler.sample.describe
service.description: Describes the time series samplers that have been created.

element.name: forecasting-model
element.description: Indicates the model of prediction. Only applicable if 'include-prediction' is set to true. Defaults to Seasonal Exponential Smoothing.

element.name: forecasting-period
element.description: If specified, the output would include a given period of forecast data. Defaults to 60.

element.name: include-forecasting
element.description: If specified, the output would include a set of prediction data.

element.name: last
element.description: If specified, the display the last number of samples.

element.name: mode
element.description: Indicates the mode of reporting. If not specified, defaults to the recommended mode of the source.

element.name: name
element.description: The name to describe. If not specified, all are described, unless there is a prefix filter.

attribute.name: after
attribute.description: Samples after 'id' will be retrieved. Defaults to zero.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, then limit to types starting with this prefix.

element.name: remove-repeats
element.description: If set to true, then don't display successive times with the same value. Defaults to false.

element.name: resolution
element.description: The resolution of the samples in milliseconds. If the resolution is less than the resolution of the sampler, then the samples will be at the resolution of the sampler. Increase the resolution for fewer samples.

element.name: sampling-period
element.description: If specified, the forecast would be based on a given period of sampling data. Only applicable to Seasonal Exponential Smoothing. Defaults to 60.

element.name: since
element.description: If specified, then grab samples generated since this time (inclusive).

element.name: until
element.description: If specified, then grab samples generated prior to this time (exclusive).

service.name: server.time.series.sampler.sample.generate
service.description: Explicity generates a sample from the given sampler (without requiring the creation of a sampler) and returns the result.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of sampler.

service.name: server.time.series.type.describe
service.description: Describes the available time series types that can be configured.

element.name: prefix
element.description: If specified, then limit to types starting with this prefix.

element.name: type
element.description: The type to describe. If not specified, all types described, unless there is a prefix filter.

service.name: server.time.series.type.list
service.description: Returns the available time series types that can be configured.

service.name: server.time.zone.list
service.description: Returns the known timezone (identifiers) that can be used when specifying a timezone.

service.name: server.tmp.directory.create

service.name: service.can.execute
service.description: Indicates whether the caller has permission to execute the given service(s).

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the service.

service.name: service.execute
service.description: Executes one or more services in a potentially atomic operation.

element.name: atomic
element.description: Indicates whether any database updates be atomic. Only use this option if you can guarantee the operation is short, because it will lock the database. Defaults to false.

element.name: background
element.description: Should the job be run in the background. Defaults to false (meaning foreground).

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: Application specific key that is associated with the task. May be used for any purpose.

attribute.name: persistent
attribute.description: If true, then the service will be saved and re-executed on server restarted. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: queue
attribute.description: Named queue into which the task will be placed. If not specified, submitted to a (single) system queue.

attribute.name: resource
attribute.description: A resource name for load balancing on balanced queues. If not specified, derived from services being executed.

attribute.name: retain
attribute.description: The duration in hours that the results and any associated output should retained after completion before the service is automatically destroyed/reaped. Defaults to 24 hours. If set to zero, then immediately reaped.

attribute.name: split
attribute.description: If true, then each service will be submitted separately. If false, each service will be executed sequentially. Defaults to false.

element.name: cluster-ticket
element.description: If this is a cluster service execution, then this ticket specifies the session ticket.

element.name: database
element.description: If set, then run the operation against the specified (replica) database.

element.name: description
element.description: Description for the service if executed in the background. Ignored for non-background execution.

element.name: discard-response-xml
element.description: If set to true, then no response XML will be generated. Default so 'false'.

element.name: input-ticket
element.description: Input data, if any, that has been pre-loaded ahead of the service call. If the ticket is zero, then the data will be sent in the input.

attribute.name: csum
attribute.description: A precomputed check sum (unsing the CRC-32 algorithm) in base 10 format. If supplied, then services may use that check sum, where required, instead of generating in the server.

element.name: notify
element.description: Should the session's user be notified when the background service has completed. The user's e-mail address, if configured, will be used to notify the caller.

attribute.name: method
attribute.description: The method of notification (must be one of the valid notification types). If unspecified, defaults to 'email' (in which case user must be configured with an e-mail address). The user must be configured with an address that corresponds to the given notification method.

element.name: on-fail
element.description: How to handle failure of background service execution.

element.name: nb-before-notify
element.description: The number attempts before notifying of a failure. Defaults to infinity. If set, then a notification of type 'error' will generated for the 'background.service' notification event.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.description: Specifies the number failures before a generating a repeat notification. Defaults to zero (every failure will generate a notification).

element.name: nb-retry-attempts
element.description: The number of retry attempts to make if the service fails. Defaults to zero.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.description: The number seconds before re-attempting failed service execution. Defaults to 30.

element.name: on-state-change
element.description: How to handle success or failure of background service execution.

element.name: service
element.description: A service to execute if the service enters the failed (will not retry) state. This service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service. It must also accept the following argument: 'background-service-id' - the identity of the background service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

element.name: output-as-text
element.description: If the transcoded output is a text type, then return the result inline text in a result element, output-text. Defaults to false. Should only be used for relatively small output.

attribute.name: base64
attribute.description: If true, and the source type is not text, then Base64 encode the output.

element.name: outputs-via
element.description: Indicates how data output(s), if any, should be returned. If part of the message 'response' then the outputs will be returned immediately. If using a 'session', then an output job ticket will be generated and associated with the calling session that must be separately retrieved - a separate ticket will be generated for each output. Defaults to 'response'.

element.name: priority
element.description: Service execution priority. Will be clamped to the maximum priority allowed for the session. If unset defaults to session priority

element.name: reply
element.description: Controls whether all services generate reply data, or only the last service in the chain does. Defaults to 'all'.

element.name: service
element.description: The service to execute. The service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service.

attribute.name: if-not-exists
attribute.description: What to do if the service does not exist. Defaults to error (an exception). If ignore, then does nothing if not found.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

attribute.name: outputs
attribute.description: The number of outputs associated with this service, if any. If not specified, defaults to 0. Must be specified if the outputs for the service are optional and outputs are required.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Specific service execution priority. Defaults to outer priority.

element.name: time
element.description: Return the execution time. Defaults to false.

element.name: token
element.description: An identity token to use for service execution

attribute.name: app
attribute.description: Application using the token

element.name: txn-sync
element.description: Indicates whether or not transaction updates will be forced to stable storage during service execution. Defaults to the setting for the calling session.

attribute.name: end-with-sync
attribute.description: Should service execution complete with a transaction sync. Defaults to true.

service.name: service.schedule.execute
service.description: Schedules a service for execution at a specified time (in the future). The service executes in the context of the user that scheduled it. The user may no longer exist. However, the corresponding actor will still exist and must have the required permissions to execute.

element.name: at
element.description: The date and time the event should occur.

element.name: max-nb-retries
element.description: The maximum number of addition attempts to dispatch the event if the first attempt fails. Defaults to 0.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.description: The period (in seconds) between subsequent retries.

element.name: name
element.description: An operational name/label for the event. Might name the purpose.

element.name: retain-for
element.description: Number of milliseconds for which event must be retained once dispatched/executed.

element.name: service
element.description: A service to execute. The service element should contain argument (elements) for the specified service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the service

A secure delivery arg can be set, but not retrieved and will be stored securely. Will not be changed unless the delivery method is specified.

attribute.name: name

element.name: idx

element.name: list-all

service.name: shopping.cart.modify
service.description: Service to modify cart specifications such as data transformation, packaging, output data layout and output metadata formats

element.name: data-transformation
element.description: Modify the data transformations that will be applied to the cart's contents

element.name: transform
element.description: Specification for the transformation from one mime type to another mime type. A corresponding transcoder must exist in the system for this transformation

element.name: from
element.description: The mimetype to convert from

element.name: to
element.description: The mimetype to convert to

element.name: decompress-archive
element.description: Whether or not to decompress the archived content of assets (if any) in a shopping cart prior to its output. Defaults to the shopping cart template setting.

element.name: delivery
element.description: The delivery method for the output. Defaults to 'download'

element.name: delivery-arg
element.description: Arguments to be supplied to the delivery destination. These only apply for certain types of destinations, such sinks when the delivery method is 'deposit'. Will not be changed unless the delivery method is specified.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: delivery-destination
element.description: The delivery destination. The destination can have a protocol of file:, or sink:. If sink:, then the path will specify the name of a data sink. If the destination has no protocol, then assumed to be a file destination which is an absolute URL for the For files (which must be a sub-directory of the cart's template "delivery-destination" directory) or a string representing the sub-directory of the cart's template "delivery-destination". Applicable only for "deposit" delivery method. Ignored if no delivery method specified.

element.name: description
element.description: Update the description for the cart

element.name: layout
element.description: The layout to use when producing the cart output content. "Flat" means all contents will be in the root directory and "preserved" means the asset's path is preserved. The "custom" layout is specified by the argument "layout-pattern". Defaults to "preserved".

element.name: layout-pattern
element.description: An Asset Path Language (APL) expression. Only applicable if the layout type is "custom". Consult the APL technical note for more information on the syntax. The shopping cart defines the following variables: tx-from-type, tx-to-type and tx-encapsulation-type that can be referred to in the APL.

element.name: metadata-output
element.description: The metadata output methods. Defaults to none

element.name: name
element.description: Update the human readable (but not unique) name for the cart

element.name: packaging
element.description: Modify the packaging specification for the cart

element.name: package-method
element.description: The available packaging formats. 'None' means the files will not be packaged inside an archive and is only applicable if the delivery method is deposit. AAR format can be generated on the fly but other formats such as ISO or ZIP will require a local archive to be assemabled before transmission to the end user.

element.name: parameter
element.description: Additional parameters for the packaging method. For a list of available parameters for a given package-method, see shopping.cart.packaging.available.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Parameter name

element.name: secure-delivery-arg
element.description: Arguments to be supplied to the delivery destination. These only apply for certain types of destinations, such sinks when the delivery method is 'deposit'. A secure delivery arg can be set, but not retrieved and will be stored securely. Will not be changed unless the delivery method is specified.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument.

element.name: secure-wallet-delivery-arg
element.description: The name of a secure wallet entry that will be extracted and converted to a secure (encrypted) delivery argument from the calling user.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the argument to be passed to the sink. If not specified, then passes the name of the wallet entry.

element.description: The ID of the cart

service.name: smb.session.describe
service.description: Describe active SMB server sessions for specified user or all users if no user is specified. Users without administrator privileges can only describe their own sessions.

element.name: domain
element.description: Only used if 'user' argument is also provided. It specifies the user's domain. It must be provided if 'user' argument is specified.

element.name: user
element.description: Only used if 'domain' argument is also provided and must be provided in that case. If specified service will only display SMB sessions that were created by that user. It must be provided if 'domain' argument is specified.

element.name: without-user-context
element.description: It specifies whether the service should describe SMB sessions that do not have user context associated with it. Defaults to 'false'

service.name: smb.session.list
service.description: Lists all active SMB server sessions. Users without administrator privileges will see their own sessions.

service.name: system.aar.get

service.name: system.adti.get

service.name: system.antivirus.enabled

service.name: system.antivirus.length.max.get
service.description: Returns the maximum length (in bytes) for scanning - files larger than this will not be scanned.

service.name: system.aterm.get

service.name: system.cache.describe

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the LRU cache.

service.name: system.character.encoding.list

service.name: system.events.next
service.description: Returns the set of system events that have not already been consumed by this session.

element.name: keep-alive
element.description: If set to true, then keep the calling session alive by updating the access time. Defaults to true (preserving previous behaviour).

element.name: select
element.description: A selection criteria for events. Only those events matching the selection criteria will be returned.

element.name: object
element.description: An abstract specification of the object/path to match on the event. Interpretation depends on the type.

attribute.name: descend
attribute.description: Match descendants (assumes type supports descendants).

element.name: type
element.description: An event type.

service.name: system.events.subscribe
service.description: Subscribes this session to the system event queue.

service.name: system.events.unsubscribe
service.description: Unsubscribes this session to the system event queue.

service.name: system.logoff
service.description: Terminates the session.

service.name: system.logon
service.description: Creates a logon session for the client.

element.name: app
element.description: Application name.

element.name: domain
element.description: Logon domain.

element.name: host
element.description: The target (virtual) host, if any.

element.name: licence
element.description: Name of the licence to use.

element.name: login-identity
element.description: A login identity, for example this could be a certificate, or regular username/password credentials. Must specify the login method to be used to validate the provided identity.

element.name: identity
element.description: Document containing identity information for the specified login identity type (if any). Run 'authentication.identity.type.describe :type <type>' to see what the identity requirements are for the specified type.

element.name: method
element.description: Login method that can validate the specified login identity type. This must be defined in the system.

element.name: mfa-sid
element.description: Multi-factor session id. This should be supplied only after user has successfully authenticated with MFA.

element.name: mfa-wait-time
element.description: The number of milliseconds to wait for any multi-factor authentication to occur. If not specified, defaults to the setting for the domain. Set to zero to return immediately. Cannot be set to more than 5 minutes (300000 miliseconds). Unset by default.

element.name: password
element.description: User password.

element.name: schema
element.description: The name of the schema, if any.

element.name: sid
element.description: Session id. If supplied, and the session still exists for this user, then will reconnect to that session after authenticating.

element.name: token
element.description: Identity token that was created with secure.identity.token.create, or if 'type' is specified then some other form of token. If supplied, then this token is used to create a session for the user.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the token. If not specified, the token will be a secure identity token

element.name: user
element.description: User name.

element.name: title

element.name: token
element.description: The push notification token associated with the mobile device.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of message is sent to the device

element.name: user
element.description: If the notification to related to a specific account with the user, include the domain and user in the form of 'domain:user'.

service.name: system.modules.describe

element.name: module
element.description: The name of the module(s). If not specified, retrieves information on all modules.

service.name: system.modules.list

element.name: code

element.name: device

element.name: all
element.description: If set to true, returns all services otherwise only returns services to which the caller has access and visibility. Defaults to false. Ignored if one or more 'service' arguments specified.

element.name: has-object-type
element.description: If specified, the filter by the existence of an object-type or not. If not specified, then no such filtering occurs.

element.name: inputs
element.description: If specified, describe services that do or do not support inputs. If unspecified, then no input filter applies.

element.name: object-type
element.description: Object type filter. Will return any service that is specifically for this object type (or sub-type of).

element.name: outputs
element.description: If specified, describe services that do or do not support outputs. If not specified, then no output filter applies.

element.name: prefix
element.description: Arbitrary service prefix, if any. '.' will be automatically appended.

element.name: reload
element.description: If set to true, causes the session to reload plugin service definitions. Defaults to false

element.name: text
element.description: Text filter - find services named, or containing the specified text - may include wildcards. Text tokens may be space separated, which will be AND'd together.

element.name: type
element.description: Object type filter. Will return any service that is specifically for this object type (or sub-type of).

element.name: usage
element.description: Usage filter. If more than one filter, then will be AND'd together.

service.name: system.session.count
service.description: Returns the number of sessions for caller.

element.name: active
element.description: Filter by sessions that are active, inactive, or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: app
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for this application.

element.name: group-by
element.description: Group counts by the given attribute

element.name: licence
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for type of licence.

element.name: origin
element.description: Filter by origin of connection that created the session. This will be the IP address of the host where the client is running.

element.name: scope
element.description: Filter by sessions were created by external processes, internal or both. The default is 'both'

service.name: system.session.date
service.description: Returns current date on the system in the timezone of the session.

service.name: system.session.describe
service.description: Returns information about caller's session(s). Filters/arguments will determine how many sessions are described.

element.name: active
element.description: Filter by sessions that are active, inactive, or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: app
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for this application.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, the public identifier for the session.

element.name: idx
element.description: The ordinal of the first session to describe

element.name: licence
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for type of licence.

element.name: origin
element.description: Filter by origin of connection that created the session. This will be the IP address of the host where the client is running.

element.name: permissions
element.description: Describe the permissions held by this session. Defaults to false.

element.name: scope
element.description: Filter by sessions were created by external processes, internal or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: self

element.name: size
element.description: The number of sessions to describe. Defaults to 100.

service.name: system.session.destroy

element.name: active

service.name: system.session.federate

element.name: name

element.name: pdist
element.description: The federation distance. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: ptag
element.description: A tag of a peer with which to federate.

service.name: system.session.last.error.get
service.description: Returns the full stack trace for the last service error encountered by the session.

element.name: clear
element.description: If true, clear the error. Defaults to false.

service.name: system.session.locale.reset
service.description: Resets the session locale to the server's default locale

service.description: Sets or changes locale for this session.

element.name: locale
element.description: The name of the locale.

service.name: system.session.map.clear
service.description: Removes all entries from the session map.

service.name: system.session.map.describe
service.description: Returns all entries from the session map.

service.description: Retrieves a value for a specified key associated with the session's (transient) data map.

element.description: The identity of the session to be destroyed.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: An optional default value if the key has no associated value.

service.name: system.session.map.put
service.description: Sets a value for a specified key associated with the session's (transient) data map.

element.name: value
element.description: A value to be associated with the session.

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: A unique key for the value. Key is used for retrieval.

service.name: system.session.map.remove
service.description: Removes an entry from the session map.

element.name: key
element.description: A unique key for the value.

service.name: system.session.output.get
service.description: Retrieves output data that was generated using a job 'ticket' in a previous service call.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the output to retrieve.

service.name: system.session.point.in.time.set
service.description: Sets or changes point in time for a session or sessions. If 'id' argument is not provided then 'domain' and 'user' arguments will be used to filter sessions for specific 'domain' and a user within that domain. If those are not specified as well, then caller's sessions are the only sessions that will have their point in time set. When set, this means that the session will have a view of the system as it was at the specified point in time. If set, all operations will be read only.

element.name: active
element.description: Filter by sessions that are active, inactive, or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: app
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for this application.

element.name: domain
element.description: Sessions within the specified domain.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, the public identifier for the session. Multiple identifiers can be provided. If not provided all sessions that satisfy the filter options will have thier point in time set.

element.name: licence
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for type of licence.

element.name: origin
element.description: Filter by origin of connection that created the session. This will be the IP address of the host where the client is running.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: Sets the point in time for the session as a date/time. One of 'point-in-time' or 'point-in-time-millisec' must be set.

element.name: point-in-time-millisec
element.description: Sets the point in time for the session as milliseconds. One of 'point-in-time' or 'point-in-time-millisec' must be set.

element.name: scope
element.description: Filter by sessions were created by external processes, internal or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: user
element.description: Sessions for the specified user.

service.name: system.session.point.in.time.unset
service.description: Unsets the point in time for the session. If 'id' argument is not provided then 'domain' and 'user' arguments will be used to filter sessions for specific 'domain' and a user within that domain. If those are not specified as well, then caller's sessions are the only sessions that will have their point in time value unset.

element.name: active
element.description: Filter by sessions that are active, inactive, or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: app
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for this application.

element.name: domain
element.description: Sessions within the specified domain.

element.name: id
element.description: If specified, the public identifier for the session. Multiple identifiers can be provided. If not provided all sessions that satisfy the filter options will have thier point in time unset

element.name: licence
element.description: If specified limits to sessions for type of licence.

element.name: origin
element.description: Filter by origin of connection that created the session. This will be the IP address of the host where the client is running.

element.name: scope
element.description: Filter by sessions were created by external processes, internal or both. The default is 'both'

element.name: user
element.description: Sessions for the specified user.

service.name: system.session.progress.describe
service.description: Returns data transfer details for the caller's session.

element.name: seq
element.description: The client defined sequence identifier for the request that is transferring data.

service.name: system.session.response.output.get
service.description: Retrieves output data that was generated using a job 'ticket' in a previous service call. This will be the response XML for the service call.

element.name: id
element.description: The identity of the output to retrieve.

service.name: system.session.self.describe
service.description: Returns details of the caller's session.

element.name: permissions
element.description: Describe the permissions held by this session. Defaults to false.

service.name: system.session.self.point.in.time.set
service.description: Sets or changes the point in time for the caller's session.

element.name: point-in-time
element.description: Sets the point in time for the session. This means that the session will have a view of the system as it was at the specified point in time. If set, all operations will be read only.

service.name: system.session.self.point.in.time.unset
service.description: Clear the point in time for the caller's session.

service.name: system.session.self.priority.pop
service.description: Pops the current session priority. Care must be taken not to pop more times than pushed, otherwise an error will occur.

service.name: system.session.self.priority.push
service.description: Sets the current session priority, which can be later popped.

element.name: priority
element.description: Session/service execution priority.

service.name: system.session.self.priority.set
service.description: Sets the current session priority.

element.name: priority
element.description: Session/service execution priority.

service.name: system.session.task.abort
service.description: Returns the number of (heavyweight) tasks being executed by the caller's session.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to abort

attribute.name: gen
attribute.description: The unique generator that generated the id. Defaults to zero.

element.name: if-possible
element.description: If set to true, will attempt to abort the task if possible. If false (the default) will report whether abort was possible.

attribute.name: service
attribute.description: The name of the service that is being aborted. If set, then will check whether or not that service can be aborted.

service.name: system.session.task.count
service.description: Returns the number of (heavyweight) tasks being executed by the caller's session.

service.name: system.session.task.describe
service.description: Describes the tasks executing as part of the callers session.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to describe

attribute.name: gen
attribute.description: The unique generator that generated the id. Defaults to zero.

element.name: if-possible
element.description: If set to true, will attempt to retrieve the task if possible. If false (the default) will fail if the task is not found.

service.name: system.session.task.pause
service.description: Pauses, if possible, the specified task associated with the caller's session.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to suspend

attribute.name: gen
attribute.description: The unique generator that generated the id. Defaults to zero.

service.name: system.session.task.resume
service.description: Resumes the specified task associated with the caller's session.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier of the task to resume

attribute.name: gen
attribute.description: The unique generator that generated the id. Defaults to zero.

service.name: system.session.timezone
service.description: Returns the current timezone for the calling session. Most dates, and queries etc. are relative to this time zone.

service.name: system.session.timezone.reset
service.description: Resets the session timezone to the server's time zone.

service.name: system.session.timezone.set
service.description: Sets or changes the timezone of the this session.

element.name: gmt-offset
element.description: Offset from GMT in hours. Must be specified if 'id' not specified.

element.name: id
element.description: The identifier for the time zone. This may be a partial identifier, such as a city (e.g. Melbourne). If not supplied, then one will be chosen based on the 'gmt-offset'.

service.name: system.session.transaction.sync.disable
service.description: Disables forcing transaction commits immediately to storage. By default they are forced to storage immediately. By disabling, performance will be increased, but with the potential loss of data if there is a crash before synchronization is re-enabled. This is useful for bulk operations. Synchronization must be re-enabled to guarantee data is fully written to storage.

service.name: system.session.transaction.sync.enable
service.description: Re-enables forcing transaction commits to storage rather than waiting until some arbitrary time when the storage media forces data to the media. Will immediatly force any outstanding transactions to storage.

service.name: system.vfs.type.describe
service.description: Returns the supported virtual file system types.

element.name: param
element.description: A parameter that is supported by the transcoder that will be employed.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.

element.name: to
element.description: The MIME type of the output.

element.description: The MIME type of the output. If not specified 'from' used.

service.name: transform.xml.profile
service.description: Returns the transformed output of the supplied XML using the selected transform provider. The format of the output and the provider used is dependent on the output mime type and the profile employed. if no input stream is supplied a doc argument must be provided with the XML to convert. If no output stream is provided then the resultant XML is returned in the result.

element.name: doc
element.description: If an XML InputStream is not supplied then the XML content of this argument is used as the source.

element.name: output-type
element.description: The output mime type. Used to select the relevant transform engine. Defaults to 'text/xml'.

element.description: A transform parameter value. Parameter name/value pairs are passed to the transform profile.

attribute.name: name

element.description: The name of XSLT Profile within the server. Must be supplied if an XSLT file is not provided as input

service.description: Returns the transformed output based on the supplied XML and XSLT input sources. The XSLT input must have a type attribute of 'text/xslt'.

element.name: doc
element.description: If the XML is not supplied as an input argument, then the XML content of this argument is used as the source.

element.name: id

element.name: param
element.description: A transform parameter value. Parameter name/value pairs are passed to the transform profile.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the parameter.
