element.name: stype
element.description: A super type. Lists all sub-types of this type.

service.name: type.synonym.create
service.description: Creates a synonym of another type. When an asset is created using the synonym, then the underlying type will be associated with the asset instead.

element.name: description
element.description: Arbitrary description for the type.

element.name: for
element.description: The type that this is a synonym of.

element.name: type
element.description: The name of the type.

service.name: uniqueid.describe
service.description: Describes the named identifiers.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the identifier.

service.name: uniqueid.increment
service.description: Increments a named unique identifier.

element.name: by
element.description: The number of increments.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the identifier.

element.name: to
element.description: The number to set the identifier to.

service.name: uniqueid.list
service.description: Returns a list of the allocated unique identifiers.

service.name: uniqueid.next
service.description: Allocates a unique identifier based on the named sequence.

element.name: cnt
element.description: The number of ids to return (defaults to 1).

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the identifier.

service.name: url.decode
service.description: URL decodes the supplied string.

element.name: value
element.description: The value to URL decode.

service.name: url.encode
service.description: URL encodes the supplied string.

element.name: value
element.description: The value to URL encode.

service.name: user.create
service.description: Creates a user within a domain. In addition to creating an authentication user, this service creates a user asset in the namespace system/users/<domain> which allows metadata and content to be associated with the user. The user may have content (e.g. an image or other).

element.name: add-role
element.description: A role to be assigned to the user when created.

element.name: collection
element.description: Indicates whether this asset is, or represents, a collection of assets (defaults to false).

attribute.name: anonymous
attribute.description: Is this ann anonymous collection where the child assets have no reference to their parents. Defaults to 'false'.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the user; e.g. for the purpose.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: email
element.description: E-mail address for contact (and for password recovery if allowed).

element.name: generate-password
element.description: If true and no password is specified, then automatically generate a password satisfying the domain constraints. If the user is to be notified, then password sent to them. If not notifying, then password will be returned. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: The password length. A length less than the minimum length for the domain will be ignored. If not specified, defaults to the minimum length for the domain.

element.name: home
element.description: The path, to the 'home' for the user - this may be some collection. It may be interpreted by different applications.

element.name: home-folder
element.description: The path to a server accessible directory that can be considered 'home' for the user. This may be a local directory or a directory on a network accessible file-system. The folder will be presented as writeable to the user when accessing their accessible server folders.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created user.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing meta information documents for the user. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

element.name: model
element.description: The name of the asset model if the user asset is to be created as part of a model.

element.name: name
element.description: The full name of the user/person.

element.name: notify
element.description: If true, and the user has an e-mail address then notify them of account creation. If generate-password is true, then e-mail the generated password to the user.

element.name: notify-body
element.description: The template body text for the notification e-mail. If not specified, then standard text will be generated. If provided, the message must contain the tokens, $${domain}$$ and $${user}$$, which will be replaced with the user's domain and username. If the password has been supplied and notification of password is disabled then it will not be included, otherwise the body template must include a $${password}$$ token. If a $${fullanme}$$ token is provided and the users full name has been supplied this will be injected into the body as well.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The MIME type for the body. Defaults to 'text/plain'.

element.name: notify-subject
element.description: The subject for notification e-mail. If not specified, then a subject will be generated.

element.name: password
element.description: The password for the user. If not specified, then the user cannot connect - this is then a placeholder/system user.

attribute.name: notify
attribute.description: If notification has been requested for account creation, and this attribute it true, then the password will be included in the notification. Defaults to false.

element.name: password-expiry
element.description: The period before passwords expire. If supplied without units, then defaults to 'day'. Defaults to no expiry. Set to zero for immediate expiry.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of expiry. If not provided defaults to 'day'.

element.name: pcid
element.description: The parent cid if the user asset is to be created in a citeable ID type model

element.name: pid
element.description: The parent id if the user asset is to be created in a collection based model

element.name: restrict
element.description: Access restrictions, if any.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Arbitrary description for the purpose of the restriction.

element.name: network
element.description: Network access restrictions, if any.

element.name: address
element.description: IP network address (IPv4 or IPv6) to restrict user access.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Arbitrary description for this address.

attribute.name: mask
attribute.description: The netmask for the corresponding network address. Defaults to 255.255.255.255

element.name: encrypted
element.description: Indicates whether encrypted only network transports will be accepted. Defaults to false.

element.name: user
element.description: The identity of the user.

service.name: user.describe
service.description: Returns details for the given user, including user asset details. Either domain and/or role must be specified. Cannot describe users for all domains.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: count
element.description: Count the possible number of entries that might be returned. Ignored if 'size' not specified or 'user' is specified.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: email
element.description: The email belonging to a user

element.name: idx
element.description: The starting position to list entries. Defaults to 1. Ignored if 'user' is specified

element.name: permissions
element.description: Should permissions be displayed. Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: The number of levels of permissions to describe. Defaults to 1.

element.name: prefix
element.description: User name prefix if any. If specified, then only user names starting with the prefix will be returned.

element.name: role
element.description: If specified, only users holding this role will be described.

attribute.name: relationship
attribute.description: The relationship of the role. 'direct' means directly granted. 'indirect' means directly granted or granted via some other role. Defaults to 'either'.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Role type.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to retrieve. If not specified, defaults to 100. Ignored if 'user' is specified

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of a user attribute in a form of a key/value pair.

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: The key for the specified value.

service.name: user.destroy
service.description: Destroys a user (and associated asset).

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

service.name: user.exists
service.description: Indicates whether the specified user exists in the given domain.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: email
element.description: The email belonging to a user

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of a user attribute in a form of a key/value pair

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: The key for the specified value.

service.name: user.externally.renamed
service.description: Rename user in MF domain, the associated actor and user asset if any, when an user (from external domain) has been renamed externally.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: new-name
element.description: The new name of the user.

element.name: old-name
element.description: The old name of the user.

service.name: user.get
service.description: Returns metadata for the given user and associated content if requested.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

service.name: user.list
service.description: Returns a list of the users within the specified domain.

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: count
element.description: Count the possible number of entries that might be returned. Ignored if 'size' not specified or 'user' is specified.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: email
element.description: The email belonging to a user

element.name: idx
element.description: The starting position to list entries. Defaults to 1. Ignored if 'user' is specified

element.name: prefix
element.description: User name prefix if any. If specified, then only user names starting with the prefix will be returned.

element.name: size
element.description: The number of entries to retrieve. If not specified, defaults to 100. Ignored if 'user' is specified

element.name: value
element.description: The value of a user attribute in a form of a key/value pair.

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: The key for the specified value.

service.name: user.password.request.reset
service.description: Resets the password for the given user. The 'id' is the identity of a previously issued request to reset a password.

element.name: bid
element.description: Reference to an asset that contains the body template.

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: Character encoding for the asset content. Defaults to UTF-8.

attribute.name: mime-type
attribute.description: MIME type. Defaults to text/plain

element.name: body
element.description: A message to be sent to the user. The message must contain the token $${link}$$ for the URL link for the password reset. It may optionally contains the following tokens: $${origin}$$,$${domain}$$,$${user}$$,$${server.uuid}$$,$${server.name}$$,$${server.organisation}$$, which will be replaced with the user's IP address, domain name, user name, and server identity, server name and server organisation (from server identity). If no message is specified, then one will be generated.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Message type. If not specified, defaults to text/plain.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain. If not specified, defaults to domain of caller.

element.name: email
element.description: The e-mail of the user. Can specify either user name or email.

element.name: from
element.description: The mail sender. If not specified, defaults to the property for the given domain.

element.name: subject
element.description: The mail subject. If not specified, defaults to 'Password Recovery'.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user. If not specified and email not specified, then defaults to caller.

service.name: user.password.set
service.description: Changes the password for a specified user.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: old-password
element.description: The password for the user. Must be supplied if not domain manager.

element.name: password
element.description: The password for the user.

element.name: password-expiry
element.description: The period before passwords expire. If supplied without units, then defaults to 'day'. Defaults to no expiry. Set to zero for immediate expiry.

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit of expiry. If not provided defaults to 'day'.

element.name: user
element.description: The name of the user.

service.name: user.rename
service.description: Renames a user within a domain.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: domain
element.description: The name of the domain.

element.name: new-name
element.description: The new name of the user.

element.name: old-name
element.description: The old name of the user.

service.name: user.self.describe
service.description: Returns details for the calling user, including user asset details.

element.name: permissions
element.description: Should permissions be displayed. Defaults to 'false'.

attribute.name: levels
attribute.description: The number of levels of permissions to describe. Defaults to 1.

service.name: user.self.get
service.description: Returns metadata for the calling user along with associated content if requested.

service.name: user.self.password.set
service.description: Changes the password for the calling user session.

element.name: old-password
element.description: The password for the user. Must be supplied if not domain manager.

element.name: password
element.description: The password for the user.

service.name: user.self.set
service.description: Updates user metadata and/or content for calling user. The user may have content (e.g. an image or other).

element.name: allow-incomplete-meta
element.description: If true, then allow the application of incomplete metadata facets. Defaults to false.

element.name: allow-invalid-meta
element.description: If true, then allow the application of invalid metadata facets. Defaults to false.

element.name: comment
element.description: Revision history comment.

element.name: description
element.description: An arbitrary description for the user; e.g. for the purpose.

element.name: email
element.description: E-mail address for contact (and for password recovery if allowed).

element.name: home
element.description: The path, to the 'home' for the user - this may be some collection. It may be interpreted by different applications.

element.name: home-folder
element.description: The path to a server accessible directory that can be considered 'home' for the user. This may be a local directory or a directory on a network accessible file-system. The folder will be presented as writeable to the user when accessing their accessible server folders.

element.name: keep-existing-user-attributes
element.description: If 'true', existing user attributes that are not being modified by this service will be left as they are. If set to 'false', they will be cleared. Defaults to 'true'.

element.name: label
element.description: A label to be applied to the created user.

attribute.name: create
attribute.description: Auto create the label. Defaults to false (label must exist).

element.name: meta
element.description: Document containing meta information documents for the user. The elements must correspond to valid asset document types.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Action to perform when modifying meta information. Defaults to 'merge'

element.name: name
element.description: The full name of the user/person.

element.name: retain
element.description: The number of user asset versions to maintain. Defaults to infinity

service.name: user.self.settings.get
service.description: Retrieves settings for a specific application associated with the user.

element.name: app
element.description: A (unique) and application defined identifier.

service.name: user.self.settings.list
service.description: Lists users settings with an option prefix filter for the application identifier.

element.name: prefix
element.description: A prefix filter for the application defined identifier.

service.name: user.self.settings.remove
service.description: Clears all application setting for a specified user.

element.name: app
element.description: A (unique) and application defined identifier.

service.name: user.self.settings.set
service.description: Sets or changes settings for a specific application associated with the user.

element.name: app
element.description: A (unique) and application defined identifier.

element.name: settings
element.description: An application defined associated document.

element.name: domain

element.name: user

element.name: authority
element.description: The identity of the authority/repository where the user identity originates. If unspecified, then refers to a user in this repository.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The protocol of the identity authority. If unspecified, defaults to federated user within the same type of repository.

element.name: domain

element.name: path

element.description: If 'true', existing user attributes that are not being modified by this service will be left as they are. If set to 'false', they will be cleared. Defaults to 'true'.

service.name: xodb.live.config.describe
service.description: Returns the configurable settings for a live database, if any.

service.name: xodb.query.cache.largest.objects
service.description: Returns information on the largest objects in the query object cache.

element.name: cid
element.description: The identity of a cluster to limit the search.

element.name: max-size
element.description: Maximum size (in bytes) to include. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: min-size
element.description: Minimum size (in bytes) to include. Defaults to zero.

element.name: nb
element.description: Maximum number to return. Defaults to 10.

service.name: xodb.query.cache.size
service.description: Reports on the current maximum number of objects that may be cached in the query cache.

service.name: xodb.status
service.description: Generates status information on the database.

element.name: classes
element.description: If set to true, will return information on the resident classes.

element.name: database
element.description: If specified, then get the status of the given named replica database. If not specified, then backup the main database.

element.name: histogram-buckets
element.description: Number of histogram buckets for query cache analysis. Defaults to zero

element.name: histogram-show-empty-buckets
element.description: If true, then the histogram shows empty buckets. Defaults to false.

element.name: histogram-width
element.description: The width (in bytes) of a given histogram bucket. Defaults to 100.

element.name: max-object-size
element.description: When showing space information, then limit to objects smaller than or equal to this size. Defaults to infinity.

element.name: min-object-size
element.description: When showing space information, then limit to objects larger than or equal to this size. Defaults to zero.

element.name: show-cache-statistics
element.description: If set to true, shows information/statistics about the XODB caches. Defaults to true.

element.name: show-current-stack
element.description: If set to true, will shows the stack trace for the current transaction. Defaults to false.

element.name: show-longest-context
element.description: If set to true, will show the execution context for the longest transaction (if recorded). Defaults to true.

element.name: show-longest-objects
element.description: If set to true, will show the objects (and sizes) that were updated in the longest transaction (if recorded). Defaults to false.

element.name: show-longest-stack
element.description: If set to true, will show the stack trace for the longest transaction (if recorded). Defaults to false.

element.name: space
element.description: If set to true, will return information on the space utilization. Defaults to false.

service.description: A service to transform XML to PDF using an XSL-FO document.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the asset being converted.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.description: The path to the asset containing the XSL-FO.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

service.description: A service to transform XML to PDF using an a Report Archive.

element.name: id
element.description: The path to the Report Package.

attribute.name: adata
attribute.description: Application specific data that is to be passed through as an attribute in this asset.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Selects the version given by the label. The overrides the 'version' argument.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the asset. A value of zero means the latest version. Defaults to latest.

element.description: The XML source to use for the conversion.
